Solution on-sentence summary: A cultivation technology allowing industrial-scale use of residual CO2, heat and water for microalgae production
Identification: Our solution overcomes the technical challenges that slow down the industrialization of microalgae cultivation, in particular in the feed, fuels, and plastics sectors. Indeed, raceway ponds are exposed to contaminations and poorly optimized, whereas more advanced PBRs are expensive and limited to small volumes. Our technology allows to cultivate large volumes of microalgae in a controlled environment at a competitive price, which cannot be done with the current available technologies. Our solution draws its advantage from the following features: - SunOleo photobioreactors are simple microalgae cultivation tanks with immersed inflatable light wells, which bring sunlight up to 6m deep in the tanks. Hence, deeper reactors can be made, allowing mass cultivation of microalgae. - As a closed cultivation system, it ensures a better product quality than Open ponds. - The simple design and cheap light wells material allow economies of scale and production costs reduction.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: New clients, Funding, Network, Visibility, Partners
Tags: Algae, Carbon emissions waste
The environmental benefits: 1 ton of microalgae biomass produced is capable of retaining 2 tons of CO2;Our PBRs take 5 to 20 times less space than the conventional crops and thus leave more space for the agricultural fields;Our microalgae cultivation tech allows to: capture 40 % to 100 % of industrial CO2 and capture particles and fumes emissions;PBRs SunOleo use 90 % less water than crops to produce food (65 m3/ ton, vs. 1000 to 1500m3/ton for cereals), as well as 90 % less land than crops;SunOleo technology uses 90 % less water than raceways, its main competitor (1400 m3/ton);
The Financial benefits: The payback time for the client is 1.9-6.2 years, whereas emitting CO2 without taking action generates no profit;Our technology is cheaper than Raceway, if we take into account CAPEX and OPEX per T of biomass;
Complementary solutions: NEXUS: An alternative for sustainable development of smallholder farmers and fisheries communities (Food & Agriculture);AgRho® S-Boost: An innovative solution for the treatment of seeds (Food & Agriculture);AQUA4D: Water-Smart Irrigation: Precision irrigation for water efficiency and land restoration (Food & Agriculture,Water);Living Farming Tree: A sustainable mini-indoor farm for urban farming (Food & Agriculture);
Organization short description: SunOleo develops an innovative photobioreactor for the production of biomass from the large scale culture of microalgae
About: Ongoing research on the production of third generation biomass is trying to meet the challenges of renewable energy and for cutting GHG emissions (including CO2). To this end, SunOleo develops an innovative device of photobioreactor (PBR) for the production of biomass from the industrial culture of microalgae. The internationally patented concept has been specially devised for high volume production on less of soil surfaces, and entirely redesigned in order to lower investment and operating costs. The SunOleo’s concept disrupts the state of the art of closed PBRs, whose yield potential are revised upwards under our geographical latitudes.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure

Solution on-sentence summary: A high-value PV recycling technology recovering high-purity materials, turning waste into resources for key industries
Identification:
ROSI's high-value photovoltaic recycling technology revalorizes high-quality materials within solar panels. The solution is aiming to create a circular economy for the PV industry and beyond, we expect to reintegrate the highly pure recycled silicon to PV, battery, and semiconductor industries. 

Wastes are misplaced resources, thanks to ROSI's recycling technology, high-energy-embedded materials such as highly pure silicon and pure silver can substitute conventionally produced products. The recycled materials are supplied as local resources that strengthen the autonomy and resilience of European supply chain. (PV-silicon is categorized as a critical raw material by European Commission)

Moreover, the REPowerEU plan by European Commission aims to accelerate the green energy deployment, EU has an ambition to relocalize the PV industry in Europe. ROSI's solution will play a central role of the European Critical Raw Material strategy and the relocalization of PV industries in Europe.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility, Funding
Tags: Recycled, Silicon & solar panels waste, Solar photovoltaic, Recycle waste
Sectors: Energy, Waste/Pollution, Power and fuel generation, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: The economic value recovery rate increases from 35% (by traditional shredding method) to up to 95% by ROSI's high-value recycling technology;A fully functional recycling plant can have treatment capacity up to 10,000 tons/year;1.2 ton of CO2-eq are saved per 1 ton PV modules being recycled (by replacing the conventionally produced raw materials by the recycled materials by ROSI) - By 2050, 77 million tons of CO2 can be saved if the panels are being recycled by ROSI's technology;Compared to conventionally produced metallurgical grade 2N-3N silicon (99% - 99.9%), the 5N silicon (99.999%) recovered by ROSI has 75% less CO2 emission;300,000 tons of highly pure silicon can be recovered from PV waste by 2050, these locally recovered materials can serve as new sources for the industries taking them as feedstocks;
The Financial benefits: The value recovery of materials increased from 35% (by shredding methods) to 95% (by ROSI technology) thanks to its high-value recovery property;By 2027 ROSI will recycle 70 tons of silver;
Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description:
ROSI recover waste from photovoltaic industry. 

Towards a truly circular economy for the PV Industry and beyond.
About:
ROSI is a company offering innovative solutions for recycling and revalorization of raw materials in the photovoltaic (PV) industry. The technologies allow to recover ultra-pure silicon and other metals currently lost during the production of photovoltaic cells and at the end-of-life of photovoltaic panels.

Our technologies RECOVER the high purity materials from PV waste, and REINTEGRATE them back to several European key industries.

Solution on-sentence summary: A concrete additive to make recyclable waste light concrete by replacing 100% sand/gravel with solid waste
Identification:
MASUKO additive creates an endlessly reusable path to all otherwise non-reusable solid waste materials that can be shredded to small pieces and mixed into a novel Waste Light Concrete (see Wiki). Potential raw materials: polystyrene, rubber, IBA, polyfoam, motherboards, car parts, crops, sawdust. MASUKO complies with EU's Green Agreement!

We use the traditional concrete mixing process, so MASUKO's scalability is very high, clients already have the equipment to mix WLC. 

We replace 100% of sand/gravel in the concrete mix with otherwise non-recyclable mixed solid waste. MASUKO helps save environmental damages of mining sites and decreases the volume of permanent environment damaging landfill load beyond any other known technology. 

The final WLC product is soft enough to be shredded again and again, it creates a sustainable recycling path that decreases future need for mining new natural resources, by being locally reusable it decreases the costs and environment damage of transportation.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Credibility
Tags: Concrete, Waste-to-materials, Municipal Solid Waste, Concrete alternatives, Construction materials, Green building
Sectors: Buildings, Infrastructures, Waste/Pollution, Materials and chemicals, Manufacturing and construction processes, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Waste light concrete is endlessly reusable and can have a compressive strength of 3-12 MPa, block fire and heat and weigh between 400-1400 kg/m3;1 km of 2x2 highway supporting layer of 30cm can recycle 4.000t of otherwise non-recyclable solid (plastic...) waste, by using existing construction technologies, the highest volume-to-result ratio;Can handle waste types that always go (and will go) to landfill and have no other way of processing, which amounts to 30-40% of total solid waste;100% use of otherwise non-recyclable solid mixed waste and preventing ecological damages from mining operations for the same volume;
The Financial benefits: 100% reusable by shredding and re-mixing, no need to buy and transport large volumes of natural resources;Can cost 10% less than conventional light concrete and durability is expected to be 20% higher;Cheapest method of recycling for end-users, 0 investment is needed;
Complementary solutions: SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);Low-cost substructure system: Bottom-fixed offshore turbine prototype that can be installed safely, simply and without cranes (Energy,Infrastructures);RT7000: A machine to chemically recycle plastic waste back into oil (Industry & Consumer Goods,Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: Innovation management: MASUKO is a concrete additive technology to make solid waste-based light, recyclable concrete.
About: We are developing Hungarian innovations, patented products and bring them to international markets. We work with MASUKO technology for 5 years by now. It eliminates most of the unhandled solid waste and turns them into a recyclable raw material for infrastructure developments.

About: VunaNexus uses a patented technology to transform human and livestock urine into two valuable products: a fertiliser free of all dangerous pollutants and water that can be reused, this while drastically reducing ammonia emissions and water pollution. The main product is a turn-key solution for onsite urine treatment and recovery replicating biological processes. This is the only technology on the market allowing for efficient treatment and recovery of high quantities of separated urine. Secondly we provide support with the planning and maintenance of the system. Our process allows the direct production of a hygienically safe, certified and marketable fertiliser called Aurin without the need of any chemical input. It is the world's first officially approved urine-derived fertiliser.

The founder, Jesper, is a trained carpenter and constructing architect.

Personally he is concerned about the growing imprint of

the construction industry on our planet. 

His concern triggered the establishment of the REXCON system in 2016.

Thus REXCON arose as a response to the stagnant and liniar construction methodologies used by the industry.

Methodologies that affect our planet's environment and eco-system.

 

REXCON’s vision is to reduce the CO2 emissions and waste streams of the construction industry.

 

REXCON’s mission is to be a leader in the development of more sustainable and circular construction products, that

make multiple use cycles possible and leaves a minimal imprint.



REXCON’s expertise and focus lie within future residential housing solutions.

Solution on-sentence summary: A collaborative business model leveraging pyrolysis to end plastic pollution and regenerate nature in high-impact areas
Identification:
The Solution aims at ending plastic pollution while regenerating nature in the most threatened biodiversity hotspots. We created a Model creating resilience within ecosystems through the collaboration of local communities, businesses, environmentalists by leveraging plastic pyrolysis. Transforming low-value plastics into fuel such as diesel and gasoline is the only economically viable solution and best alternative in those remote areas, enabling as such necessary incentives for communities to collect plastic waste, generate a profit through its transformation, creating traction by fueling local businesses such as tourism and enabling profit allocation into nature conservation and regeneration. Research continues to enable a transition to more sober solutions and find better alternatives than pyrolysis. In any case the action starts now.

End Plastic Pollution, Regenerate Nature!

Organization short description: Developing collaborative solutions to end plastic pollution and regenerate nature in high-impact areas
About:
End Plastic Pollution, Regenerate Nature.



Nomad Plastic is a social business developing collaborative and regenerative solutions to end plastic pollution in the most threatened biodiversity hotspots. 

We created a unique transitional model leveraging plastic waste transformation into fuel to bring resilience into local ecosystems and communities, businesses as well as allocate profits to regenerate nature.



Our first pilot of Regenerative Cruises in Indonesia is transforming low-value plastics collected from remote coastal areas and islands in Flores into fuel, powering cruising boats visiting marine parks and protected areas, bringing revenue for local communities as well as for the protection of these pristine waters.



We are extending our model to other areas and other business cases with different stakeholders such as liveaboards, resorts, corporates, conservation NGOs and other conglomerates with the help of strong partners (Plastic Odyssey, Geo Trash Management, ENEA Consulting, Blue Finance and many others).



Join us and let's grow our impact!

Solution on-sentence summary: A battery fleet monitoring platform to ensure a circular logistics management of mobility batteries, based on data
Identification:
Batteries are a solution for decarbonizing our transport. But their production has a high environmental cost, approximately 100kg of CO2 for 1 kWh of lithium battery produced. 



At Bib,  mobility fleet operators are helped to manage their battery fleet. Thanks to advanced data analysis, they are given visibility on the state of health of their batteries and ensure optimal operational management of the fleet. With the ecosystem of partners provided, operators are enabled to repair and anticipate the most sustainable end of life for batteries (second life, recycling) to limit their environmental footprint. 



Bib Batteries offer a battery monitoring platform with a macro view (overall view, economic monitoring), and a view per battery, with the delivery of a passport to guarantee the residual value of each battery. They also offer optimal operational monitoring to take concrete actions thanks to the collected data and a European network of partners: local repairers, second-life actors, and recyclers.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Recycled, Batteries - energy storage, Algorithms & AI, Software, Electric vehicles
Sectors: Mobility, Energy storage, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Not monitoring the battery fleet prevents good battery management: unpredictable battery failures, difficulty to provide consumers with batteries in good condition, impossible to anticipate recycling, bad use and storage conditions...;Monitoring batteries double their lifespan thanks to management optimization, repairment and second life;The production of 1kWh of lithium batteries (i.e. a large bicycle battery) results in the emission of 100kg of eCO2;Giving batteries a second life can reduce their environmental footprint by up to 50%;
The Financial benefits: Reduction of Total Cost of Ownership of batteries by 35% (because of longer lifespan, reduction of failures, and diagnostic time);Reduction of Cost of Recycling by 60%, because of anticipation of the end of life, and reuse in adapted second-life applications;
Complementary solutions: EP Tender: A range extending service for electric vehicles (Mobility);AEROPAK G: Ultralight fuel cells and hydrogen energy storage for electric-powered aircraft (Industry & Consumer Goods,Mobility);Atawheel: Zero emission mobility based on hydrogen energy storage and water electrolysis technology (Infrastructures,Mobility);Stor-H: Connected and innovative hydrogen cartridge for light urban mobility (Mobility,Energy);
Organization short description: Bib monitors battery fleets through data analysis, and ensures circular logistics management: repair, reuse, recycling.
About:
Batteries are a solution for decarbonising our modes of transport. But their production has a high environmental cost, i.e. approximately 100kg of CO2 for 1 kWh of lithium battery produced. Turning to batteries was therefore relevant in view of the expertise of the co-founders and the challenges linked to the massive arrival of batteries for mobility in Europe.



Moreover, the battery is a chemical element, which prevents electric vehicle fleet operators from having direct visibility on the batteries, so they treat them as consumables. On average, they experience a +20% to +40% increase in operating costs due to poor battery decisions. By monitoring and managing batteries, Bib helps operators make informed decisions about charging, repairing and replacing batteries in their fleet.



At Bib, we want to extend the life cycle of batteries to limit their environmental footprint. Bib makes the remaining potential transparent and issues a passport for each monitored battery to ensure the best possible end of life for the battery: repair, reuse in second life, or recycling.

Solution on-sentence summary: A plasma catalysis system dedicated to zero carbon industry and green chemistry synthesis
Identification: The technology developed by Energo implements a new way of doing chemistry, plasma catalysis, which allows complex chemical transformations to be carried out in a single step under very mild operating conditions, permitting the production of green molecules at a more cost-effective price compared to traditional fossil or green alternatives (with a reduction of 40% in production costs (CAPEX + OPEX) compared to conventional technologies). The deployment of Energo's technology contributes to the construction of a circular economy applied to the management/upgrading of CO2 emissions by converting these harmful species into value-added products (methane, green chemistry, hydrogen...) and thus helping the transition to a sustainable future. Over the next 6 years, ENERGO plans to neutralize CO2 emissions from industrial sites by avoiding more than 350 kTCO2 and converting them into more than 50kT of green chemical molecules.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessManufacturingChemicals & Pharmaceuticals, BusinessEnergy Utility
Tags: Biogas & biomethane, Chemicals, Biofuel, Industrial materials
Sectors: Energy, Power and fuel generationMaterials and chemicals
The environmental benefits: Low energy consumption and conversion rates ranging from 90 to 100% for the main reactions;Very compact process (catalyst volume at least 50 times inferior to conventional technologies);Neutralize CO2 emissions from industrial sites and avoid the emission of more than 350 kTCO2 over the next 6 years;Reduce the production costs of molecules of interest by at least 40%  ; Create more than 216 jobs by 2028;
The Financial benefits: Over 40% cheaper than alternatives/conventional technologies;
Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);PowerCorner: Mini-grids for affordable, reliable, sustainable energy-services for rural and off-grid populations (Energy);
Organization short description: A technology development company that designs and builds a new generation of chemical reactor to produce green chemistry
About:
ENERGO is a technology development company, which designs and builds a new generation of chemical reactor to produce green chemistry and meet future demand for zero carbon. Its patented technology emerged from PSL research laboratories, involves the combination of a non-thermal DBD cold plasma, and a heterogeneous catalyst, providing plasma-catalysis conversion of molecular products in gaseous form into gaseous or liquid molecular products with high added value.

ENERGO's technology has achieved a TRL 7 for CO2 methanation with a semi-industrial demonstrator in operation since August 2021, which is a world first. It is worth noting that ENERGO was the first company in France to inject syngas into the grid in July 2022. After the successful scale-up of ENERGO’s technology, it is clear nowadays that plasma catalysis is an emerging way to do green chemistry.

This innovative technology has a wide range of applications and can produce several molecules of interest (hydrogen, methanol, ammonia, liquid fuels, and fine chemicals (olefins, oxygenates, alcohols, ketones, acids...) offering several advantages over conventional technologies, whilst maintaining the same catalytic reactor structure. These molecules are mainly produced from CO2 stemming from local sources such as biogas and would not only result in a negative carbon footprint but also could solve the long-distance supply chain problem.

In addition, it not only increases the catalytic and energy performance of each application, but also meets the current challenges of decarbonization by reducing the environmental impact, costs (CAPEX and OPEX) and risks of industrial units, thanks to the following advantages

Operation at atmospheric pressure and moderate temperature.

Catalyst volume at least 50 times smaller than that used in conventional reactors.

Resistance to most pollutants, such as oxygen, moisture, or VOCs (volatile organic compounds), thus reducing the need for pre-treatment.

Rapid cold start in seconds.

Production of high-value molecules in a single pass.

Very low reactor volume required (compact process + low catalyst cost)

Very high efficiency (an energy consumption of less than 1% compared to that produced).

 

Facing climate and geopolitical challenges, ENERGO aims to contribute its expertise and technological know-how to develop innovative solutions for the future that are simultaneously more affordable and more responsible. At the beginning of next year, ENERGO will build other demonstrators to prove the validity and relevance of its technology for the synthesis of all these new molecules of interest. The first one will be dedicated to the conversion of CO2 into methane (300kW capacity) and the second one, will be our own chemical plant that can produce 20t/month of green chemicals from a biogas plant.

From a market perspective, we are targeting 3 main markets where our technology can offer major advantages over conventional or green technologies in terms of carbon footprint (SCOPE 1/2/3) and molecule production cost. These latter are as follows:

 

- Methane production from waste: ENERGO's methanation process can be used to valorize plastic or wood waste by combining its technology with gasification, which produces syngas, a mixture of carbon monoxide and hydrogen, from which methane can then be produced.

- Green H2 production from ammonia synthesized by photovoltaic energy in sunny regions of the world such as the Sahara and then transported by ship to Europe. ENERGO's technology provides compact units that facilitate transportation and decentralization of consumption.

- Green chemistry production: local synthesis of chemical platform molecules from biogas plant required by the chemical industry at low cost.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Organization short description: BCM allows to produce on demand, at the right time and as close as possible to the place of use from digital twins.
About:
BCM is the global production system that allows a manufacturer to create and store the digital twin of a part, then produce it on demand using in-house and/or outsourced additive manufacturing facilities.



For outsourced production facilities, BCM connects a community of manufacturers whose business is producing parts in industrial 3D printing.



BCM is used for the production of :

- Mass-produced parts whose vocation is to be put on the market.

- Parts intended for restocking to meet the needs of after-sales service, for example. 

- Industrial parts for maintenance or tooling.



BCM reduces tied-up inventory and overproduction, offers unlimited replenishment over time, promotes repairability and reduces the carbon footprint, all in a cost-effective manner.



On average, BCM users reduce parts TCO by 70% compared to "traditional" procurement.

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution to clean, store and use rainwater in urban areas for the benefit of nature and biodiversity
Identification:
Source Urbaine's goal is to provide a simple and autonomous solution that will re-introduce Nature and its benefits in our cities. By collecting and storing rainwater from roofs and roadsides, we can ensure a system that doesn't neeed watering, even during extended heat waves.



All the vegetation and plants that are on our installations are regularly watered thanks to the source below it which ensures their proper development. This aspect is very important, especially during hot weather, as we noticed that the plant have the natural capacity to evapotranspirate ("sweat the water they drink") a lot more when they have access to a large quantity of water. The direct impact on the surrounding environment is to cool it down thus reducing the effect of Urban Heat Islands.



Our systems are flexible and can be adapted to any configuration as public real estate can be very difficult to cope with, especially in crowded cities. The dimensioning of our solutions can fit any of your needs.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Domestic & municipal wastewater, Cooling, Filtration & purification, Gardening, Green roofs & vegetalisation, Water & Wastewater treatment

Solution on-sentence summary: A digital solution to detect electrical consumption of individual appliances and provide related advice to save energy
Identification:
"Mes Equipements" is a digital service, that gives the power back to the energy consumer. It helps citizens to understand and control their electricity consumption. 



Since electrical energy is intangible, invisible, our customers have a hard time realizing how much energy they consume, and don't know how to take concrete actions to reduce their consumption. 



Thanks to this service, our customers can understand which devices are the most consuming in their homes, and thus focus their efforts. The aim for them is to reduce their consumption, so their bill and environmental impact. 



How it works? Mes Equipements offers our customers a detailed monthly consumption report directly in their phones. They access their consumption history and can compare them from one period to another, or to their peer, appliance by appliance, in € and in kWh. Advice is provided for each appliance to support customers and explain how to reduce consumption in a simple and effective way.

Solution on-sentence summary: Transparency-One Network is a global supply chain network to create a more sustainable world for consumers
Identification: Consumers want products that are safe, sustainable, and responsibly sourced. When making a purchase, consumers want to know where it was made, how it was made, and its impact on people and the planet. Modern businesses must ensure their supply chains are transparent, connected, and compliant with consumer values. Responsible sourcing requires collaboration with suppliers and among internal teams. It requires collecting and monitoring vast amounts of data to identify risks and assess compliance. In-depth and comprehensive supply chain knowledge is crucial to ensure products are safe, sustainable, and responsibly-sourced—from raw material to finished good. Transparency-One is an agile software platform enabling multi-tier supply chain management to achieve responsible sourcing. We help companies track their products, assure their standards are being met throughout the supply chain, and minimizing their social and environmental risks.

Organization short description: Transparency-One connects global supply chain networks to create a healthier, safer, and more sustainable world for consumers.
About:
Our team is passionate about solving big problems that have a meaningful impact on consumers and business. All industries are impacted by the need for greater transparency and responsible sourcing. The retail and consumer goods industry are at the forefront. Increased consumer demand for a larger, more diverse set of products has resulted in a complex and globally dispersed supply chain with increased environmental and social risks. 

Consumers in the meantime have become more concerned with health, wellness, and social responsibility – and are demanding more information and accountability from brands. Governments have responded with more stringent regulations forcing more disclosure of product and supplier information. The combination of factors has created a “perfect storm” – resulting in the urgent need for a transformative approach to managing supply chain transparency. 

Our customers include marquis, global brands in the apparel, luxury cosmetics, food and consumer goods, including J. Crew, Chanel, Macy’s, Estee Lauder, Danone, P&G, Versace, Hill House Home, and L’Oréal.  These brands are connected with over 50,000 suppliers – from large factories to smallholder farms.

Solution on-sentence summary: Dracula Technologies has created LAYER to power the next generation of indoor devices
Identification: Billion of IoTs will be installed in the coming years and more than half of them will be inside buildings. But with traditional solutions to power these new products, such as batteries, we are faced with many challenges associated: Over 15 Billon of Batteries are thrown away in nature every year. Also, replacing a battery in Smart buildings is a problem, because this basic maintenance must be done by an authorized and qualified person. This means a much higher cost than the battery itself. LAYER presents high profitability for the customers with a low TCO (Total Cost of Ownership) thanks to a significant reduction of the maintenance costs of about 80%. Finally, using batteries requires dedicated space to house them in connected objects. All this leads to larger and less discreet products. LAYER was developed, which means Light As Your Energetic Response in order to become a sustainable alternative to batteries.

our inkjet printing technologies offer us many advantages , especially for the realization of small devices  with free shapes allowing better integration in IoT Products

Organization short description: Zeelo is the smart bus platform for organisations. We design, manage and optimise transport programs to help our clients
About: Zeelo is a smart bus platform for organisations. The global tech company is modernising daily bus commutes for frontline workers and students so that they can get to work and school in a faster, smarter, and much greener way. Zeelo serves large businesses and independent schools and moves nearly 150,000 riders each month across the world. Zeelo’s tech-optimised bus routes not only reduce carbon emissions by 78% by replacing 30 cars for every bus journey, but also offset 100% of each Zeelo bus journey. Its innovative transport management software system comprises a SaaS platform, proprietary routing algorithms, mobile apps for riders and drivers, and 24/7 customer service support (4.9 TrustPilot rating) that ensure people located in transport deserts have a regular, subsidised and sustainable bus service for their daily commute, wherever they are based. Headquartered in London with over 160 employees, an R&D team in Spain and live operations in the UK, South Africa and the US, Zeelo was founded in 2016 by Sam Ryan, Barney Williams and Dani Ruiz. It closed its Series A in 2018 and has raised over US$ 30 million in funding, including VC-backed investment from ETF Partners, InMotion Ventures and Dynamo. The co-founders previously sold their pioneering ride-sharing app JumpIn to Addison Lee in 2014. For additional information, please visit www.zeelo.co

Solution on-sentence summary: A technological machine and software to produce potable water from air and solar energy in a sustainable and economic way
Identification:
Kumulus machines produce drinking water from solar energy and air. The phenomenon of dew is imitated in the process of creating water. To this technology are added several integrated systems that improve the capacity of the systems, as well as predictive algorithms to allow the machines to be "smarter" and controllable remotely from anywhere in the world. The idea is to allow companies, factories, hotels and offices to have their own source of clean and sustainable water (reducing the use of plastic bottles as well as the pollution and logistics associated with it) .



It also allows a large part of the population to have access to a source of safe drinking water and to have the autonomy to produce their own drinking water.



Our main region of intervention includes the MENA region, Southern Europe and Sub-Saharan Africa.

Tags: Off-grid, Developing countries, Drinking-water, Solar photovoltaic

The Financial benefits: ROI for customers in 5 years for a life time of 15 years;30% cheaper than bottled mineral water;

Organization short description: Kumulus aims to solve the problem of lack of drinking water in the MENA region in a sustainable and economical manner
About:
Kumulus aims to solve the problem of lack of drinking water in the Middle East and Africa by providing drinking water in an economical and sustainable way. The Mediterranean region is home to some of the driest countries on earth. Sub-Saharan Africa on its end, is less dry but counts more than 320 million who do not have access to safe drinking water. 

Kumulus machines have the size of a small fridge and produce 30 liters of water per day, using as sole resources solar power and humidity in the air (both very abundant in our region).

Kumulus is digitally connected (IoT technology) and can be controlled and monitored remotely.

Identification: The solution is an electric space heater with an integrated battery 1) heating: natural rock slabs combined with an infrared radiant panel provide an instantaneous warmth feeling while ensuring a stable temperature and optimal comfort. 2) storing: in order to reduce the electricity bill, battery charges during off peak hours (paired with photovoltaic panels) and reinjects its energy to the grid during peak demand to power the heater, leveling its client's power consumption to make additional savings. 3) embedded intelligence: sensors, native connectivity with the cloud and smart meters enable the device to learn from consumer's habits to optimize power consumption without reducing comfort

Organization short description: Energy Storage. Everywhere for Everyone !
About:
Lancey Energy Storage offers a breakthrough innovation for energy storage: an electric radiator with a lithium-ion battery inside.



Batteries are the future of home energy consumption. But they are still very expensive and we never know where to put them. Lancey smartly puts them inside radiators, so that there is no installation cost and remain very discrete. Lancey’s vision is to democratize energy storage in every home by integrating it into an everyday home appliances (heaters today, air conditioning and heat pumps tomorrow). This multi-patented technology enables Lancey to provide enery storage for free to its end-users. In addition, this unique architecture allows to re-use batteries from electric bikes in second life (world premiere disclosed in 2019 with Groupe La Poste).



This solution also come with connectivity (4G/wifi/Zigbee) and sensors to gather data from every room of the building. An EMS (Energy Management System) then analyses PV production, devices consumption, data from the sensors to optimise the consumption of energy and reduce the electricity bills. Lancey's solution goes a step further to make smart home and smart building real.



Lancey application can control remotely every single battery to provide new and innovative services to the grids. Distributed storage is indispensable to balance the grid and to integrate more renewable energy through self-consumption and grid services. Lancey’s innovation is finally a keystone to smartgrid.



Lancey is a 3 years old company and rely on a young and enthusiastic team of 15 people. The solution has already been deployed in BtoB in a hundred of dwellings in France and has proved significant energy bill reductions, with quick return on investment.



Lancey is now entering the scale-up phase and is building commercial collaborations in Europe and in North America and prepare a series B fundraising.

Crewdle develops extensible distributed technologies that transform how businesses and individuals collaborate and meet remotely, offering secure, green, and easy to use video communication tools. Founded in 2020 in Montreal, Canada, Crewdle proves that peer-to-peer (P2P) communication technology offers a secure environment by removing servers between users while meeting online. The result is a sustainable digital ecosystem that is more private and respectful of the environment.



Green

By connecting us directly to each other, Crewdle eliminates the need for servers and allows streams to travel the shortest distance possible while using the least amount of energy.



Private

Because our technology doesn't rely on servers, your streams are truly encrypted from end-to-end between every participant in a virtual meeting. Your streams are truly encrypted at all times and between all people participating in a virtual meeting.



Simple

Solution name: Demand Response Platform - Mon Chauffage Electrique Connecté
Solution on-sentence summary: A residential demand response solution which is hardware-agnostic, based on a profit-sharing business model
Identification:
A residential demand response solution which is hardware-agnostic, based on a profit sharing business model, allowing our customers to participate to the grid balancing while valorizing their residential flexible equipments.



Our service "Mon Chauffage Electrique Connecté" proposes to our customers to participate to electric grid stability by valorizing their heating system with smart thermostats on the electricity markets, via our demand response platform.



Customers connect their thermostats to our platform and, when periods of tension are declared by the TSO, TotalEnergies reduces heating consumption. For the availability of their heating system, customers earn in average 30€/year. 



Our service promotes digitalization of the electric consumption and helps the grid to be more flexible.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Thermostats, Sensors & monitoring, Building heating
Sectors: Buildings, Energy, Heating, cooling and ventilation
The environmental benefits: One radiator provides in average 250W demand response capacity;A modulation of 30 min on the heating system reduce less than 1°C the temperature of the room;Our demand response solution is operated in real time;Demand response brings flexibility on the electric grid and so replace the actions of a fuel power plant;A reduction of CO2 emissions by 13% due to peak shaving;
The Financial benefits: Between 30% to 50% of profit sharing with customer (thermostats have an average cost of 500€ and can reduce consumption of 15%, it represents 225€ of savings each year (average bill of 1500€) ;ROI reduction of the bill for the customer between 10% and 20%.;
Complementary solutions:
Solar space heating: Solar-powered air heaters and rock bed thermal storage to heat homes 

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);Recovering heat : Standardized, ready-to-install solution for supermarkets to heat buildings or water using waste heat (Buildings & Shelters);

Our 100,000 employees are committed to making energy more affordable, cleaner, more reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Present in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies places sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of populations.

Solution on-sentence summary: A functional ingredient made from upcycled biomass lignin to replace harmful chemicals in consumer products
Identification: LignoGuard is a bio-based multifunctional ingredient derived from upcycled biomass lignin. LignoGuard unlocks the protective functions of lignin for many consumer products such as cosmetics, coatings, and packaging. For example, it can be used in cosmetics to protect the skin from the damaging influences of sunlight, oxidation, and other stressors. At Lignovations, we believe that natural resources are precious and should be used to their best potential. LignoGuard is sourced from wood waste and produced without any harmful chemicals to unlock lignin’s natural functions for cosmetic products. Our ingredients have passed a regulatory safety assessment and have been awarded the eco-label “COSMOS Certified” confirming its sustainability.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: New clients, Partners, Network
Tags: Consumer-goods, Chemicals, Reuse waste, Waste-to-materials, Chemicals alternatives, Green waste, Solid biomass, Recycle waste
The environmental benefits: Reducing the amount of UV filters by 50% in cosmetics and even more in other applications;40% better antioxidant performance than Vitamin C/E;50% reduction in harmful UV filters;100% upcycled material;
The Financial benefits: Reduction of problematic chemicals by 50%;Reduction of formulation cost by 10%;
Complementary solutions: WOODOO: A bio-based translucent wood material for sustainable construction applications (Industry & Consumer Goods);LACTIPS: A 100% biobased material for a sustainable packaging alternative (Industry & Consumer Goods);RT7000: A machine to chemically recycle plastic waste back into oil (Industry & Consumer Goods,Waste & Pollution);BIO DISPERSIS LC: Recycle vinasse, a polluting residue from the alcohol industry, into organic additives for concrete (Waste & Pollution,Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description: Lignovations makes functional ingredients from upcycled biomass lignin to replace harmful chemicals in consumer products
About:
Lignovations is an industrial BioTech startup developing a material platform from biomass lignin to replace harmful ingredients in consumer products.



Many consumer products rely on functional ingredients like UV filters (sunscreen) and antioxidants (anti-aging cream) to give them their special properties. Currently available functional ingredients are mostly made from fossil resources using dirty production processes that produce toxic byproducts, waste, and high CO2 emissions resulting in a hazardous contamination of the environment as well as adverse effects on human health



Lignovations has developed a patented process to produce a natural alternative to these harmful synthetic ingredients. By transforming upcycled biomass lignin into colloidal particles, Lignovations makes the lignin’s protective properties useable in consumer products.



Lignovations’ material is already used by multiple customers to develop more sustainable products using lignin as a functional ingredient.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Turns ocean plastic into wealth by capturing it in rivers and extracting the highest value from it
Identification:
The Blue Barriers are an award-winning solution to solve Ocean plastic pollution, by collecting it from rivers BEFORE it even gets to the Ocean. They use the water flow to accompany plastic litter towards a collection basin on a side of the river, where it can be easily removed and directed to recycle. They allow boat navigation and guarantee no impact on river life. Designed to resist any river condition thanks to stainless-steel cable structure, they represent a permanent solution to dramatically reduce the quantity of plastic reaching the Oceans. As recent studies prove, about 80% of plastic gets to the Ocean from rivers. The Blue Barriers collect about 100% of that plastic in std conditions, improving the quality of life of the local population, reducing the risk of flooding due to waste mismanagement and protecting important industries like tourism and fishing.

Selected among The Economist's Top10 OceanChangeMakers.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Marine & Oceans, Rivers, Waste collection, Low-grade plastic waste, Packaging & plastics waste, Water & Wastewater treatment
The environmental benefits: Stops about 100% of riverine plastic;Zero impact on river life and boat navigation;Can be repaid in as little as 2 years by selling the collected waste as wood pellets and premium Ocean Plastic;Stops about 100% of macroplastic in rivers in standards conditions, as measured by the University of Florence Hydrodynamic Lab and during tests on Lamone and Tiber rivers ;Stops microplastics too, as the large quantities of organic materials collected act as a sponge and absorb extremely dangerous meso and microplastics;
The Financial benefits: Research from the University of Modena shows that installing the BlueBarriers in the most polluted rivers is repaid in 2to15 years by selling the collected plastic and pellets made from wood ;Protects relevant industries like Tourism and Fishing (2019 Deloitte research estimate the Economic Value Loss to be above $1.2B in Asia alone);Creates 2 to 10 direct and indirect jobs for each installation;

Organization short description: We TURN OCEAN PLASTIC INTO WEALTH by collecting in rivers, creating jobs and protecting our environment.
About:
SEADS offer a complete service to design, produce and install river barriers able to collect up to 100% of plastic waste and re-direct it towards recycling. 



Our BlueBarriers not only collect 100% of riverine plastic waste but also guide the administrations to extract the highest value from the collected waste. Research by the University of Bologna already showed that once our BlueBarriers are installed, selling the pellets made from the collected wood covers all the costs of waste management and disposal, generating a self-funding process that creates jobs while protecting the environment. 

The collected high-quality plastic can also be sold at a premium as Marine Litter (www.oceanworks.co). We are currently working on a pilot to transform 100% of the collected plastic into raw plastic material. This will offer the public administrations a scalable self-funding blueprint to turn Ocean Plastic into Wealth. 

The benefits are holistic: cities get improved recycling rates, less waste ends up in landfill or the environment, more jobs are created, we create a fair and equitable circular economy for all, and standards of living improve as a consequence – all of which tie in to achieve UN SDGs.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Positive facade architectural solution to better integrate building projects into their environment
Identification:
Ultraçade Power is a composite aluminum ventilated facade system to solarize facades and make photovoltaics accessible. This system provides an architectural solution for integrating solar panels vertically.



The ventilated facade system improves the energy coefficients of buildings through the air gap that is created in the construction system. The energy coefficient of the building is improved by about 30% by this air space which creates a chimney effect that will limit the impact of heat in summer and cold in winter.



It is an architectural solution because the solar panel is framed. There are 13 shapes in total that allow you to adjust to all project lengths, and all project heights, with only standard pieces. It's like a game box, the architect can use the pieces, adapt them to his project, and have, with 13 different shapes, a completely unique project.



The product is Made in France, with varied mounting brackets and a 25-year warranty. Also, it complies with CSTB 3194 specifications.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Visibility, Credibility
Tags: Thermal insulation, Construction, Solar photovoltaic, Green building, Smart-buildings
The environmental benefits: Up to 90% self-consumption of the energy produced by the facade;Up to 30% improvement in the energy coefficients of the building by the system of implementation of ventilated facade of our solution;Aesthetic architectural solution allowing architects and project leaders to have a solution that easily integrates into the environment of their projects; Today only 10% of old buildings can receive photovoltaics on the roof, while more than 60% can receive them on the facade;100% recyclable product and construction system. (excluding photovoltaic module);Makes it possible to give access to industrialists, shops, public buildings to photovoltaic energy for their electrical self-consumption and to save money while participating in the energy transition;
The Financial benefits: The additional cost linked to the "positive" part of the product is only 20%. this allows a return on investment close to 5 years;No additional cost linked to a reinforcement of the roof structure;Possibility of solarising 100% of the facades in the snow zone, which is more difficult on the roof;

Solution on-sentence summary: A decentralized domestic water filtration system that filters rainwater to 100% microbiologically safe drinking water
Identification: The Drop2Drink Unit is a decentralized water filtration system primarily used domestically (but also suitable for SME's). The Unit is designed to combat the increasing global water scarcity. The Drop2Drink unit has been certified by the World Health Organisation and has been tested by local and international drinking water companies. The unit delivers water on demand. Rainwater is collected in a rainwater storage tank or sack. Whenever a user opens a tap point the water is pumped through the Drop2Drink Unit. The water first passes a microfilter, an activated carbon filter, an ultrafilter and as a backup a UVC-Unit. The system can be monitored constantly (highly recommended option). We guarantee 100% microbiologically safe drinking water and aim to provide access to safe water for everyone. The Drop2Drink unit is flexible, plug&play, durable, economical and consistent. As D2D Water Solutions, we are committed to giving back to society and providing a solution to water scarcity.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility
Tags: Drinking-water, Water-networks, Filtration & purification, Water quality, Water & Wastewater treatment
The environmental benefits: Guarantees 100% microbiologically safe drinking water;Save up to 100% on central water supply, effectively becoming "Water-neutral";Also removes microplastics and asbestos up to 0.01 micron;In 2025 1,8 billion people will be living in countries or regions with absolute water scarcity (WWAP, 2012) and two-thirds of the worlds population could be living under water stressed conditions;23,52% relative CO2eq savings and reduce our collective dependence on freshwater sources as rainwater fulfills your water need;
The Financial benefits: Save between €489,16 (1 p. household) and €1.330,64 annually (4 p. household) on water, gas, electricity, maintenance, soaps and cleaning products;Companies who have to pay for a rainwater charge can save 100% of their rainwater charge if they store and use the rainwater via the Drop2Drink unit. For example MEG-Gruppe (Bottler) can save €343K/yr;Save between 71% and 100% on your waterbill. ;

Organization short description: D2D Water Solutions B.V. is the developer and producer of the Drop2Drink unit, a company based in the Netherlands.
About:
D2D Water Solutions is a Dutch organisation that uses more than 25 years of

experience in water management and filtration to produce quality products

which protect and serve their users. We develop, produce and deliver smart

water purification systems. These systems are especially suitable for (off-grid)

homes, apartment complexes, offices, organisation in agricultural- & food

sectors and manufacturing.



Mission

D2D Water Solutions aims to offer everyone the possibility to have direct

access to clean drinking water and to become self-sufficient in their own

purified water supply. Furthermore, D2D Water Solutions wants to reduce the

enormous water waste by facilitating in decentralized water reuse. By

applying this we can achieve water-neutral or even water-positive homes.



Vision

D2D Water Solutions aims to be the global provider of quality rainwater filtration

and circular water filtration solutions. We strive to create durable, economical,

social and eco-friendly value and relieve water stress worldwide.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation

Solution on-sentence summary: A combustion-free process to produce metals from ore and residuals for a more circular world
Identification: GreenIron has a process to address a global market and efforts to lower the GHG output of metal production from Q3 2023. The outputs of the GreenIron process are valuable commodities extracted from magnetite, hematite, other metal oxides, minerals, waste, and residual products from the steel, mining, foundry, and manufacturing industries. The process is completely CO2 free, the only emissions from the process are water and metals. The solution can make a difference in the industry today as it works in batches, which enables modular and scalable operations close to the sources and our customers.

Tags: Metal, Reuse waste, Waste-to-materials, Scrap metal waste, Waste treatment, Industrial Waste
The environmental benefits: To reduce one ton iron ore only consumes 37 kg hydrogen as the residual gas is used in the next batch;The total energy consumption for GreenIrons' furnace is less than 2/3 compared with a blast furnace;Usage of batch processes run 24/7; every batch can be different, which adds flexibility in handling materials;Every furnace can reduce CO2 emissions by at least 54 000-90 000 tons CO2eq per year;If GreenIron's technique was used to recycle annual flow of oxidized scales and filter dust, all iron mines in Europe and North America could be closed;
The Financial benefits: The tolling fee for the customer is 30-80% of the value from the recycled material;The payback time for the customer is close to zero years;Low capital investment and low supply chain cost;

Solution on-sentence summary: A material-efficient concrete reinforcement solution for flooring, tunneling and precast applications
Identification: Dramix® steel fiber reinforced concrete offers a solution that is both effective, cost-efficient and environmentally conscious. By using steel fibers instead of traditional concrete reinforcement methods such as mesh or rebar, you can reduce the CO2 emissions by up to 35% for the construction of, for example, an automated warehouse, a production plant, tunnels, precast elements, etc. This is because steel fibers reinforce concrete homogeneously, requiring less material for the same level of performance. Additionally, advanced design optimization allows for the creation of thinner, yet durable concrete elements that use less concrete, steel, and water compared to traditional reinforcement methods.

Solution on-sentence summary: One-stop solution leveraging advanced stochastic mathematical models to devise optimal energy strategies for industry
Identification: j4energy provides a one-stop solution to support industrial decision-makers toward a sustainable future. Thanks to its user-friendly web-based platform, j4energy quickly builds a digital twin of your industrial plant starting from readily available data, maps its current energy situation and identifies optimal roadmaps to meet cost, emissions and energy security targets. Its advanced mathematical models deriving from scientific research guarantee optimal and risk-robust solutions by considering all types of energy technologies, optimizing their interactions and accounting for future uncertainties. Thanks to its proprietary technology library and seamless integration with suppliers, j4energy dramatically cuts lead times from analysis to strategy to implementation - from months to weeks - compared to business-as-usual spreadsheet-based energy analysis and traditional consulting services.

Solution on-sentence summary: The new approach to waste disposal offers substantial energy savings of 80% due to local compaction and electric
Identification:
The solution enables a waste collection which is significantly more efficient, quieter and cleaner. The new approach based on local waste compaction not only reduces the number of transports, but also requires much less space in public areas. Full compactors are simply replaced and no longer emptied on site, which reduces noise emissions to a minimum and allows disposal at any time of day or night.

The clever combination of small compactors and the all-electric vehicle offers municipalities a new perspective and scores particularly well in the area of sustainability. "Wasteloop" is the alternative for municipalities looking for energy-efficient, low-emission waste disposal to achieve sustainability goals.

Solution on-sentence summary: Holding connected electronic payloads in maneuverable state of suspension against gravity at lowest energy consumption
Identification:
The purpose of Hybrid-Airplane Technologies GmbH (HAT) is the R&D activity, production and distribution of sustainable flight systems and communication platforms, in the field of airborne autonomous robotics and cybernetics. The company invented a new way to fly that is completely safe and nearly silent. The flight systems can be powered by renewable energy sources and serve as carrier systems for a variety of sensors for different applications, from live event broadcasting to earth observation. The h-aero® flight systems are used in many fields, such as human and nature protection, public and industrial, infrastructure, as well as environmental.



We solved the physical challenge to keep electronic payloads in a maneuverable hovering and suspending state against gravity and with ultra low energy consumption. We solve issues with UAV endurance, safety, acceptance, payload capacity and noise in industrial inspections, earth observation and surveillance.

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable and feasible materials based on colloid and surface chemistry to restore works of art
Identification:
Our solution provides time-effective and safe materials to restore works of art. The time-effectiveness and safety of our approach enables the feasible restoration of large collections worldwide, which are common issues with traditional materials, allowing their transfer to future generations. In other words, our solution is a safe and time-effective way to guarantee the preservation of our Cultural Heritage, with high socio-economic benefits and improved resilience of our society.

Our solution uses non-toxic gels or biopolymers, aqueous-based cleaning fluids and biodegradable surfactants, as opposed to traditional petroleum-based cleaning solvents (hexane, mineral spirits). Therefore, our products have enhanced eco-friendliness vs. mainstream alternatives, and easily used by end-users in restoration SMEs/museums/collections. We provide continuous guidance service and training to familiarize stakeholders with these innovative solutions.
By: CSGI (Consorzio Interuniversitario per lo sviluppo dei Sistemi a Grande Interfase Center for Colloid and Surface Science)
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding
Tags: Detergents & soaps, Chemicals, Cleaning, Chemicals alternatives
The environmental benefits: High time-effectiveness (gains result in minutes/hours vs. weeks/months of traditional materials) ;No direct CO2 emission;E-factors close to zero ;
The Financial benefits: Saves up to 50% of overall restoration costs;Only 1-3% reduction of useful exhibition time (e.g. over 1 month) of an artifact in need of restoration;

Organization name: CSGI (Consorzio Interuniversitario per lo sviluppo dei Sistemi a Grande Interfase Center for Colloid and Surface Science)
Organization short description: CSGI is a public research institution which gathers several Italian academic groups of Soft Matter and Surface Science
Headquarters: 50019 Sesto Fiorentino, Metropolitan City of Florence, Italy
About:
CSGI was founded in December 1993 and since then it is under the supervision and control of the Italian Ministry for University and Scientific Research (MIUR).

Since 1994 CSGI has been promoting and coordinating scientific, training, and technology transfer activities in the chemistry of colloidal systems and more generally systems with a high interfacial area. To accomplish this goal, CSGI brings together the most prestigious Italian academic schools in the field of Soft Matter and functional surfaces, providing an infrastructure for the academic network operating in this thematic area in Italy. CSGI has top-level synthetic and experimental expertise for the physico-chemical characterization of soft and hard matter and functional surfaces.

Piero Baglioni, the CSGI founder, is internationally recognized as the most influential Italian soft matter scientist and, throughout his career, pioneered the application of nanostructured materials to conservation of cultural heritage. For this activity, he has received numerous awards, such as the Bonino Medal of the Italian Chemical Society and the "Lectureship Award" of the Chemical Society of Japan "(2017).

CSGI is an internationally recognized network of excellence; our position in the Italian scientific landscape is validated by the VQR 2011-2014, where CSGI is the consortium with the highest number of employees in chemistry (60), with over 94% of the products rated as Excellent.

With this exceptionally robust scientific background, CSGI implements actions that make basic and applied research and technology transfer available for companies, facilitating their access to the activity of national, international, or "large scale infrastructures" laboratories.

Over the years, CSGI has become an international network of reference for technology transfer, involving Italian, European, and international research bodies and private companies (ENI, Procter & Gamble, Biomeuriex, L'Oreal, pharmaceutical IDI, Dompé, Rottapharm, etc ... ).

This scientific excellence and proactive capacity result in a remarkable success rate in European competitive funding, often with CSGI as the coordinator team.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A carsharing service based on small nestable EVs for last-mile access to remote destinations in complement to public transport
Identification:
Kiwee mobility solution aims to reduce the need/use of private cars by complementing public transport or carpooling, including the lastmile. 



For the user, Kiwee carsharing consists of small individual electric vehicles available to users on a self-service basis, 24/7, station-based or free floating, available without a driving license. Kiwee cars can carry 2 passengers and are designed for everyday use (child booster, storage space), robust and easy to clean. Their design protects users from poor and cold weather.



For the operator, KIWEE cars can nest into a 10-unit roadtrain, drastically improving the efficiency of redistribution, charging and parking - 1 driver / 1 charging station for 10 units. Efficient redistribution ensures a high quality of service, including for the user finding a car at the right place in the right time.



Kiwee will be proposed for proximity mobiliyt, in city centers and suburban areas to cover the first/last miles of a journey using individual vehicles.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Financement, Crédibilité
Tags: Electric, Cars, Vehicles, Carpooling & carsharing, EV charging, Public transport, Electric vehicles
The environmental benefits: 1 single-driver to redistribute up to 10 Kiwee cars as a roadtrain.;1 single standard charging point (7 kWh) for 10 nested Kiwee cars.;When driven in groups, the towed Kiwee vehicles follow the same trajectory as the first one;Commuting by Public Transport and Kiwee (rather than one's own private car) reduces CO2 emissions by 70% in average in Europe;Commuting by Public Transport and Kiwee (rather than one's own private car) reduces energy consumption by 90%;Kiwee cars only weigh 400Kg: they use 3 times less resources than a conventional car;
The Financial benefits: Commuting by Public Transport + Kiwee (rather than one's own private car) will cut commuting budget at least by a factor 2, at most by 7;Using Public Transport + Kiwee (rather than one's own private car) redirects the initial travel budget, on average 6000€/year, to local community economy towards local consumption and employment;Do not waste your time in your car trapped in congestion, use public transport + Kiwee! Roughly 40 minutes gained every day !;

Founder 1 - Last name: Deheunynck - Valéry Cervantès - Jérôme Larborde - Xavier Leblanc
About:
Current shared transport solutions do not fulfil users' needs: providing the service at the right time + in the right place. And prove too costly (operation/infrastructure), especially in periurban areas.



METACAR develops KIWEE, a disruptive micro-mobility solution for people and goods (last mile). KIWEE electric quadricycles can nest into a 10-unit roadtrain, drastically improving the efficiency of redistribution, charging and parking - 1 driver / 1 charging station for 10 units.



Currently, the company is made of its 4 co-founders (individuals). For this 1st roundtable, they are currently fundraising 3M€ equity (27% shares) - of which 2M€ are secured as of today (mainly business angels), still looking for an institutionnal partner to close the round end of 2022 / early 2023.

Our project offers a leverage effect of x4 as the project is benefiting from +9M€ French Governement subsidies and industrial partners investment (within our partners' diversification strategy in the field of mobility as a service).



This roundtable aims at finalizing R&D work on the solution (starting from functional prototypes) to go thru homologation and production of a pilot fleet in order to test Kiwee in real-life conditions. 2 pilot sites are already secured aiming at 2 use cases : close-by trips within an industrial zone in the Greater Lyon (France), in complement to public transport, and the Geneva area for trans-borders mobility issues, in complement to both public transpoort and private car usage as a complement to park&ride services.

Solution on-sentence summary: An engine that uses sound-waves to create a temperature difference and that replaces the cold circuit in a heat pump.
Identification:
Heating and cooling represent 50% of the EU’s final energy consumption and 80% of the installed systems, such as gas boilers, use fossil fuels. EU’s regulations to reduce Greenhouse Gas (‘GHG’) emissions are pushing sustainable solutions in the market. In that context, heat pumps are the most efficient systems and are expected to become the preferred solution in the future.



However, they are complex to install and have performance limitations. As a result, the current generation of heat pumps is expensive and not suited for application in existing houses. 



Blue heart heat pumps tackle these issues by generating acoustic sound waves that replace the cold circuit of a regular HP. Noises are reduced while the toxic refrigerants are no longer needed. The price is lowered and finally, the implementation in existing houses is facilitated thanks to the size reduction.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Electric, Heat-pump, Building heating
Sectors: Buildings, Energy, Heating, cooling and ventilation
The environmental benefits: A 1-6kW modulating output with superior seasonal coefficient of performance (SCOP) to reduce the energy consumption;Blue Heart has almost no moving parts and does not require maintenance. Its lifetime is more than 15 years;A standardized system suitable for every type of building that ensures a simplified and fail-proof installation;Uses Helium, an inert gas, as a medium - It doesn’t require any refrigerants and is compliant (today) with 2050 environmental targets;Decrease by 70% CO2 emissions per kWh provided;
The Financial benefits: Blue Heart enables a reduction in the purchase and installation cost of the heat pump, as well as that of its operation;Not dependant on the natural gas price fluctuation;
Complementary solutions:
Solar space heating: Solar-powered air heaters and rock bed thermal storage to heat homes 

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);Recovering heat : Standardized, ready-to-install solution for supermarkets to heat buildings or water using waste heat (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: Dutch Startup with global ambitions | Unique Next Gen Heat Pump technology based on thermoacoustics | Our goal: to become the 'Intel Inside' for Heat Pumps
Founder 1 - Last name: Hartman / Haico Halbesma / Roelof Schuitema / David Rodés
About:
Blue Heart Energy is a deep tech company that has developed a new sustainable technology to radically improve the performance of heat pumps, enabling them to evolve from being the best solution in the market to becoming the perfect solution.



Blue Heart uses thermo acoustics, a technique that consists in creating sound waves in a closed circuit to generate heat and cold. This technology, that had been tried for industrial purposes, will be used for the first time to power heat pumps in residential buildings. 



Blue Heart has been conceived to replace the core component of heat pumps and designed to be easily integrated by original equipment manufacturers , that are Blue Heart Energy’s customers. With Blue Heart inside, heat pumps turn into affordable, silent and flexible devices, capable of working with wide temperature ranges suitable for both new and existing houses. Importantly, Blue Heart doesn’t require any refrigerants and doesn’t generate any CO2e emissions.

Solution on-sentence summary: Simple and low-tech water filtration technology that does not require electricity nor the use of chemicals
Identification: The Solution is a simple and low-tech water filtration technology that does not require electricity or the use of chemicals for the production of safe drinking water in remote locations. The solution emits less CO2 than commonly used alternatives for water treatment and preserves the environment using recyclable materials and no electricity. It is engineered and conceived as a self-inclusive system, delivered in a high quality and ready-to-use PEHD-chamber. The kls filter technology does not require electricity or the use of chemicals, which reduces CO2 emissions (compared with mainstream alternative for water treatment) and prevents environmental contamination from air, water and soil. The water treatment process is also completely silent and uses only natural filter media: the kls filter is entirely prefabricated from polyethylene, a lightweight and fully recyclable material.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility
Target client profile: Public Authorities, Local NGO, BusinessWater Utility
Tags: Developing countries, Drinking-water, Domestic & municipal wastewater, Water quality, Water & Wastewater treatment
The environmental benefits: The results of the tests carried out to date and the data from the scientific literature show a reduction in microorganisms (bacteria, viruses, etc.) by 3-4-log (99.9 - 99.99%);Turbidity (suspended solid content) removal far below 1.0 FTU in treated water (with turbidities in the raw water of 100 FTU) and the production of microbial safe drinking water without the use of chemicals and electricity.;In more recently conducted R&D work using bauxite instead of quartz sand in one of the slow sand filter compartments, the solution showed reductions of E.Coli and Enterococcus up to 4 logs (99.99%);The low weight of the filter (about 1'500 kg) allows, if necessary, its transport by helicopter in inaccessible areas;
The Financial benefits: More than 4 times cheaper than the mainstream alternative for a lifetime of 50 years without degrading water quality thanks to the use of a low-tech technology;Refunded after 12 years of mainstream alternative (UV-lamp) use thanks to a robust and low-maintenance technology;Almost 4'000$ saved per year using KLS-filters technology compared with the use of the mainstream alternative;

Solution on-sentence summary: A universal innovative eco-packaging adaptable for multiple industries and different products
Identification: Sempack is a new eco-friendly universal packaging. It is a flexible pouch which stand up or down. This flexible conical pouch is made of a 100% recyclable monomaterial film and was created in order to offer an alternative to existing packagings but also to provide an eco-responsible solution to the worldwide plastic pollution issue. Sempack has a very high restitution rate and is very light (more than bottles or Doypack). Consequently, we need less material to create Sempack than other packagings. It has a low carbon footprint and is ultra-compressible. The company is conscious about the planet’s pollution and cares about the bad impact of plastics on the environment, that is why we partnered up to create an eco designed packaging. We worked the project upstream with film suppliers and sorting & recycling organizations to ensure that our innovation is well integrated into the sorting stream when a Sempack is thrown away, and not ending its lifecycle in the oceans.
