Solution name: REDA Thermal Geothermal Electric Submersible Pump
Solution on-sentence summary: A high-temperature electric pump enables profitable geothermal electricity from wells that were previously uneconomical
Identification: REDA Thermal pumps are intended for use by operators of geothermal power plants. The technology gives access to more geothermal resources than would not be possible with a surface-driven pump configuration used in most high-temperature projects to date. Placing the electric pump motor at the bottom of a geothermal well reduces mechanical complexity and creates an opportunity to develop projects with deviated wells, allowing access to more energy resources. Traditional electric submersible pumps are not suited to the high flow rates and temperatures required by geothermal electricity generators.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility
Tags: Underground, Heat-pump, Geothermal power
Sectors: Energy, Power and fuel generation, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: REDA Thermal can operate in wells up to 225C°;REDA Thermal maximum flow rate is 908 cubic meters of geothermal water per hour;Some REDA Thermal installations have helped to supply 1.4 MW of carbon free geothermal electricity per installation;REDA Thermal pumps can be refurbished or recycled at a Schlumberger Artificial Lift Renovation Center;
The Financial benefits: New geothermal generating capacity can be at least as cost effective as other alternatives, including fossil fuels, nuclear and solar-thermal with battery storage;REDA Thermal electric submersible pumps can be serviced in a fraction of the time required for traditional surface driven pumps at existing geothermal projects;

Solution on-sentence summary: A Local biomass valorization solution
Identification:
This solution maximizes the value of biowaste at the source through the production of high value marketable products.



Increasingly restrictive regulations require primary producers and processors in the food supply chain to find new sources of value for their bio-waste. Upcyclean is an in situ biomass recovery solution that exponentially increases the recycling rate of a wide variety of residues. The solution maximizes their value by treating them at the source, before they become waste.

Logistics are facilitated by a modular and compact processing unit, and technologies are adapted to the needs and target markets. Using green technologies, the solution recovers high added value products for a wide range of application : food, feed, aquafeed, biofertilizers, nutraceutics, cosmetics,... for a zero waste valorization. With the Solution, waste becomes a resource.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility
Target client profile: BusinessServicesHotels & Resorts, BusinessServicesRestaurants & Canteens, BusinessServicesRetailerFood & Supermaket, BusinessServicesWaste & Remediation
Tags: Food waste, Reuse waste, Waste-to-energy & fuels
Sectors: Food/Agri, Waste/Pollution, Ingredients and food, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Capacity : 5 Tons / Day / module;100% green bioraffinery technologies;GHG reduction : 0,146 tons of CO2 / ton of human food;100% byproducts valorized;
The Financial benefits: Pay back time : from 2 to 3 years;Value creation : yield X 3;
Complementary solutions: Cycle Feed: Insect-based feed for West African tilapia farmers (Food & Agriculture);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);Agolin® Ruminant: A plant-based feed additive to reduce enteric methane emissions from ruminants (Food & Agriculture);
Organization short description: Upcyclink develops innovative turnkey solutions for the recovery of biowaste at the source and maximize their value.
About:
At Upcyclink, we realized that co-products are poorly valorized and that logistics are often an obstacle. Upcyclink was created in July 2021 to open up new ways of recovery with high added value. 



Upcyclink relocates the processing of bio-waste directly on site and maximizes its value by targeting human, animal and plant food with a zero waste perspective. 



Our solution takes the form of a high-performance treatment unit capable of transforming in situ, through an innovative biorefinery process, a wide range of agri-residues (crops, waste and food losses, of animal and plant origin...) into marketable products with high added value. Thanks to an efficient cascade of unitary processing steps and standardized, plug-and-play production modules, it enables complete zero waste recovery and guarantees quality and efficiency. Compact, it can be integrated close to the deposits.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Organization short description: BAT'IPAC is a French company whose vision through its solutions is to promote sustainable building and eco-construction, by integrating a social and solidarity-based economic system through the integration of vulnerable or disabled people, the preservation of the environment and the support of territorial economies.
About:
Our company is committed to a sustainable development approach by developing a range of innovative products for the construction industry, IPAC®, made from recycled and recyclable cardboard. IPAC® allows a significant reduction in the energy consumption of buildings, while supporting an innovative societal approach by providing a work integration solution to thousands of people with physical, mental and/or social disabilities. IPAC® is a product with exceptional thermal, acoustic, solidity and mechanical resistance performances. IPAC® is a product with a low environmental impact because it requires very little grey energy for its implementation, reduced transport costs thanks to the territorial network around the final users, very little water consumption in its manufacturing cycle, no sand consumption, and very little consumption of electrical and fossil energy.  IPAC® is therefore a low-carbon, bio-sourced material, with sustainable resources, since the raw material, derived from cardboard recycling, is sufficient to meet the world's needs because it can be recycled without limit (up to 9 times without adding new material).

Finally, IPAC® is safe to use and not harmful to health (no known allergies to cardboard), which makes it a unique product on the market!

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution to eliminate the use of chemical pesticides in agriculture, seeking to produce them on farm
Identification: SoluBio allows farmers to eliminate the usage of chemical pesticides in agriculture by producing their own biopesticide on-farm. They are able to considerably reduce costs, increase yield and create biopesticides by the time they need. Today farmers depend on a model based on chemical crop control in which they harvest each time less with an increasing cost for such chemicals. This type of control destroys natural defenses, creates an unbalanced situation in the ecosystem, and pollutes soils and groundwater affecting fauna, and flor. Turning this concept into an economically viable and scalable industrial business implies mastery of agricultural technologies, production of specified microorganisms, closed bio fabrication systems, "on-farm" biological inputs quality control, and systematic monitoring throughout the cycle, from production to application in the field, and finally confirmation of the cost-benefit ratio with the post-harvest results.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Biobased, Biodegradable, Organic, Pest control, Fertilizing, Agricultural equipment & machinery
The environmental benefits: Target customers are grain producers (technified farmers), agricultural groups, horticulturists who use a chemical pesticide cultivation system that have failed to control insect problems, leaf and soil diseases ;Increases the sustainability of agricultural crops, prevents pollution from chemical residues, helps in soil recovery and increases responsible agricultural practices;Can completely avoid the use of pesticides;Can reduce the use of fongicides by a quarter;
The Financial benefits: An estimated payback time 6 months for the customers thanks to the  elimination of the usage of chemical pesticides in agriculture (less diseases, less water contamination, less biodiversity harming);Reduces maintenance costs by up to 70% while preventing chemical contamination of soils;

Solution on-sentence summary: Conductive and semiconductive nanoinks to make flexible electronics by additive manufacturing
Identification: The Solution uses additive manufacturing for electronic circuits production using special nanoinks and avoiding waste and unnecessary material losses compared to conventional techniques. Genesink has developed 3 ranges of high-performance nanoinks: SMARTINK (silver-based nanoinks for conductive interconnects, busbars, and antennas functionalities), TRANDUCTIVE – silver nanowires-based nanoinks to replace ITO (Indium Tin Oxide) for flexible OPV or flexible displays, HELIOSINK – metal oxides-based nanoinks (zinc oxide (ZnO), aluminum doped zinc oxide (AZO), and tungsten oxide (WO3)) to be used as a charge transport layer in photovoltaics cells/OLED lightings. The company is autonomous for nanoinks characterization, development and testing on all types of printing processes. The solution's nanoinks are composed of the active material (metallic/semi-metallic nanoparticles and/or nanowires) and the vehicle (solvent, binder, additives). The selection of the active material is determined by the required physical properties of the printed device (conductivity, optical transparency, stability of the printed pattern to bending and twisting, crucial for nowadays consumer electronics needs).

Solution on-sentence summary: A process that turns sand into fully operational solar panels in an on-site mini-factory
Identification:
For developers of large-scale solar parks and industrial operators at remote locations, who are dissatisfied with the issues with current solar panels (no flexibility on prices, expensive logistics and non-environmental friendly production), Maana Electric transforms sand (from deserts or recycled from other materials) into fully operational solar panels in an on-site mini-factory which fits into shipping containers. That provides cheap, clean and locally produced solar production unlike any other solution on the market today.



First, we purify the sand with several proprietary technologies.  Then, with the purified quartz (up to 95%), we extract the silicon and purify it to solar-grade form (99.99999%).  This silicon is then transformed into wafers and solar cells.  The bulk of purified sand is used to produce 2 panes of glass.  Finally, we assemble the solar modules which are bi-facial frameless ones.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: Public Authorities, Local NGO, BusinessEnergy Utility
Tags: Off-grid, Silicon & solar panels waste, Solar photovoltaic
The environmental benefits: Min 10MW of solar panels produced each year with one TerraBox;200 panels produced each day;CO2 reduction 100,000 tons/year for a production of about 70,000 solar panels;Waste reduction 1,000 tons/year for a production of about 70,000 solar panels;Water consumption reduction 100,000 m3/year for a production of about 70,000 solar panels;
The Financial benefits: Less than 3 years payback time;30% cheaper than mainstream alternative;10 millions euro savings on a solar park of 100MW;

Solution on-sentence summary: An omnichannel collaboration solution between users, devices or systems to accelerate digital projects
Identification: Agora Software transforms data streams into real-time actions to accelerate and increase the impact of digital projects for cities and medium/large enterprises. By simply and quickly associating all data sources (connected devices, applications, web services, etc.) and people (employees, partners, citizens, etc.), Agora makes it possible to optimize many business processes: watering, air quality control, energy management, home support for the elderly, e-tourism and e-formalities, etc. An integrated no-code studio allows customers to simply define their own processes while multilingual and omnichannel communication in natural language is ensured with the end users of these digital projects.

Tags: Smart-metering, Software, Green building, Building heating, Smart-buildings
The environmental benefits: Communication with users in their everyday language can take place in more than 15 languages on most existing collaboration applications ;Digital projects that use existing infrastructure can be deployed in just 5-10 days ;Smart energy control in most buildings can reduce energy consumption by 15% to 30% ;Smart irrigation control in many situations can save up to 20% of water consumption ;The combination of solutions already in place can extend their lifespan by 3 to 10 years ;
The Financial benefits: 3-year ROI on energy savings up to 200% - 500%;Up to 80% cheaper than mainstream chatbot solutions ;

Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);animeo Connect : Facade shading management solution for increased energy savings in buildings (Buildings & Shelters);Recovering heat : Standardized, ready-to-install solution for supermarkets to heat buildings or water using waste heat (Buildings & Shelters);LightFi: Continuously measure building occupancy to optimize energy use for HVAC and lighting



 (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: Agora software turns data flows into real-time actions to accelerate and increase the impact of digital projects.
About:
Agora Software: turning data into actions



The vision

Agora Software was founded in 2019 in France, with the vision that a fragmented IT environment is a major obstacle preventing IT from delivering the promised benefits. To solve this problem, a strong statement was made: natural language, as people use it, can be an effective convergence layer in most cases if some technical challenges can be solved.



To implement this vision, Agora has developped a solution and a specialized NLP (natural language processing) in order to build bridges across the two main divides that digital projects faces:

	- Data sources are highly fragmented: IoT, business applications, web services, industrial devices, etc… Being able to bring them together in a simple and universal manner will deliver a huge value to businesses, people and society as a whole;

	- We (users, employees, citizens, families,etc.) are not HTML or API oriented: we are very social and communicative organisms, using our own language (aka natural language) to exchange information; we must be able to use digital services the same way: throughout our own language.



The Agora solution

The Agora Software solution is delivered from a resilient cloud platform that connects a large set of applications, web services, IoT platforms, etc. in a secure and private workspace. Two main services are available for each workspace:

	1. Define and activate scenarios from a no-code interface; these customer-defined scenarios make it possible to combine real-time data streams, identify trigger situations, generate in real-time commands to computing devices, applications, and more, as well as to send messages to people.

	2. Communicate with users in natural language: multi-intents, two-way flows, rich notifications, etc. Omnichannel, exchanges are delivered in a multilingual manner, on all business collaboration applications (MS Teams, Slack, Google, etc.) and social networks (Messenger, WhatsApp, Line, etc.).



The impact

The Agora solution can be used in many concrete situations: energy, smart cities, agriculture, industry, e-tourism, home support for the elderly, etc.: wherever the combination of multiple information flows is a source of value, innovation and well-being.

For example, in the sector of energy reduction for buildings, the combination of occupancy calendars, weather forecasts, power grid situation and occupancy sensor can reduce the energy consumption of the building by 20 % to 30% without costly modifications and without impact on the comfort of the users of these buildings.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

The environmental benefits: Reduce by 45% the energy consumption for heating an outdoor pool ;Easy to install - Very little structural work is needed to install so in just 4 weeks;Easy to use: no team needed to operate the Poolover CTS. Just one person is enough, with no heavy lifting nor handling required;Recyclability: 100% of PVC and Stainless steel will be reused or recycled and PVC and stainless steel account for 97% of the total weight;Reduce the need for chemical products: no light comes inside once the cover is up which reduces the development of organisms and therefore the need for chemical treatment;

Solar space heating: Solar-powered air heaters and rock bed thermal storage to heat homes 

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);District Cooling Systems: An energy-efficient approach to address urban heat island effect (Infrastructures);
Organization short description: AQUAPROTEC has designed and patented the "Poolover CTS" Cover for public pools to reduce energy consumption.
About:
AQUAPROTEC has designed and patented the "Poolover CTS" Cover for public pools to reduce energy consumption up to 45% on a yearly basis. 

Poolover CTS principle:

-     During the opening hours the CTS cover lies at the bottom of the pool. 

-	When it is time to close the pool, air is injected into the cover, making it buoyant and float to the surface of the water thereby covering the entire surface of the pool.

-	In the morning, to open the pool, you release the air trapped in the cover, which lets water into the cover causing it to sink to the bottom of the pool.

The benefits:

-	Sobriety: quick to install with minimum structural works, which is a major benefit for existing pools compared to other options. Long life span of 15 years with minimum maintenance as it operates with air to go up and water to go down.

-	Efficiency: operates under all weather conditions, Poolover CTS is insensitive to wind and operates with lane dividers in place. Those two unique characteristic for a pool cover ensure it will be operated every day 

-	Renewable: when it’s time for a change the infrastructure is kept and what is replaced by new elements will be recycled

-	Safety: when in place no one can get inside the pool tank. Should a person accidentally fall onto the cover, the cover will stay firmly in place to prevent drowning.

-	Easy operation: one person only with no heavy lifting nor handling required. Surface cleaning or leaves removing in autumn can be performed by walking on it
SDG’s of application: SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Complementary solutions: OSMOSUN: A sustainable, flexible energy source for affordable and renewable water for all (Water);Kelda Technology: Halve the amount of water used by your shower without diminishing the experience (Buildings & Shelters,Water);WATA™ technology: Devices to enable local treatment and disinfection of water (Water);Purifaaya: Locally-produced water filters for the production of safe drinking water in uganda (Water);
Organization short description: ION ENTERPRISES manufactures ScaleBuster® water conditioners. Over 300,000 units have been sold since 1990!
About:
ION Enterprises Limited has been trading since 1990, manufactures a range of environmental physical water treatment devices under the trademark of ScaleBuster®. Over the years this technology has been installed by many well-known global companies with excellent results. Our products have been applied into more than 300,000 applications to date. The company is also marketing EnviroTower (based on ScaleBuster technology) which is a unique cooling tower water treatment system which eliminates scale and corrosion as well as biological contamination, saving energy, water and chemicals. *How does it work? ScaleBuster is a Physical Water Conditioning technology, based on Electro-Static principles. Once the ScaleBuster is installed into the system the calcium and magnesium are precipitated into suspension. These particles remain within the flow of the water. When these particles reach the hot parts of the system the tendency to adhere to the hot surfaces is dramatically reduced. Therefore the ScaleBuster protects the equipment from potential limestone damage. The ScaleBuster is conceived to make the particles formed non-adherent. After installation of the ScaleBuster, limestone is mainly present in the form of aragonite, which is a non-adherent crystalline structure contrary to the untreated calcite that can cause deterioration and damage in unprotected systems. EnviroTower - cooling tower water treatment that really saves you money (and the environment). The patented EnviroTower - the Cooling Tower Water Treatment solution is designed around the ScaleBuster conditioner which precipitates the hardness (typically, Ca++ and Mg++ ions) in the cooling water, causing those ions to build clusters which grow larger as the water is recirculating through the ScaleBuster conditioner of the EnviroTower system, until they are removed from the water by the filtration or separation process. Scale-free chiller doesn’t waste energy as to lack of heat transfer (caused by the scale build up in the chiller tubes). 

Just as a reference, 3mm (1/8”) of scale causes the usage of 25% extra energy, resulting in higher head pressure (more wear-and-tear, shorten the life expectancy of the chiller) and also might cause down-time when least expected – in the middle of the summer…

The EnviroTower system is monitoring the cooling system’s water conductivity and controls the blow-down (so the operator can cycle up, saving water, while keeping the system scale-free). 

It also doses biocide (Bromine – as solid tablets – is recommended) as required, shocking the open circuit of the cooling tower once daily, as well as optional other chemicals (as Tri-Toly-Azole, to protect the copper tubes of the chillers). All chemicals are dosed as required, usually once daily only. The blown-down water is considered clean water and may be used for irrigation or be disposed in the storm system (vs. sewage).

In a period of 30 minutes after dosing any chemical – the EnviroTower system avoids any blow down (to eliminate drainage of the chemicals before they have actually performed in the water). 

The separator removes the precipitated hardness with some water (calculated as part of the blown down water). The EnviroTower controller is equipped with a light tower (green/amber/red) so the operator can simply and easily learn the status of the system. For more water conditioning, every make-up pipe is also equipped with a smaller ScaleBuster conditioner treating the water coming into the cooling tower.

Typical ROI is less than 3 years, OpEx (Operation Expenditure) with EnviroTower is usually 10-15% less vs. traditional water treatment, as water saving is 10-15%, chemical savings is 90-97%, maintenance is 30-50% less and energy savings is 9-16% vs. traditional chemical treatment (or 15-35% less vs. no treatment). Also, there is a huge positive impact on Health & Safety (as chiller "punching" using mechanical brushes and acid to remove scale deposits is hardly necessary vs. every year or two with traditional water treatment).
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: CIRCOULEUR manufactures and sells recycled paints, avoiding the incineration of unused paint thanks to Circular Economy.
Identification:
Anytime someone makes a paint job on walls, there is some leftover paint in the can. Adding them up, this represents millions of liters of unused waterborne paint which are incinerated each year, leading to high release of CO₂ in the atmosphere. At the same time, large quantities of raw materials are still getting extracted to manufacture new paints, participating in natural resource depletion.



CIRCOULEUR finally solves all these issues and stops all this waste by reusing this paint waste as a material to make new and more environmentally friendly paints. CIRCOULEUR manufactures and sells these recycled acrylic paints that contain more than 70% of recycled materials. 

Our paints meet high quality standards, and come in a range of beautiful trending colors. They emit almost no VOCs (volatile organic compounds), which guarantees a better indoor air quality. And adding to that, CIRCOULEUR paints are not more expensive than conventional paints, making them affordable for all.

CIRCOULEUR has created the first and unique paint recycling branch in France. The company manufactures and sells recycled acrylic paints, finally bringing Circular Economy in the paint manufacturing industry. 

	

Million liters of unused waterborne paint are incinerated each year (28 million in France alone), leading to high release of carbon in the atmosphere. Solution on-sentence summary: A process that converts crop residue into food-grade pulp for the packaging industry
Identification: Crop waste contains cellulose, lignin and hemicellulose which makes them ripe for manufacturing greener products. Using our circular fiber technology, we separate these core components. We use the cellulose fibers to create various kinds of paper and moulded pulp based packaging products. Lignin and hemicellulose can be used as a starting raw material for various chemical industries. Currently, we are using lignin as a binder for our second product to make formaldehyde-free engineered boards. Our technology enables a zero-waste circular economy process, which helps the farmers by helping them earn secondary income through crop waste, the market by providing tree-free and plastic-free sustainable ingredients and the environment by preventing crop burning and reducing deforestation.

Solution on-sentence summary: A textile-to-textile recycled material that replaces virgin oil, cotton and wood in production of textile fibers
Identification:
Circulose® is made from discarded textiles, like that worn-out pair of jeans at the back of your closet. Using a breakthrough recycling process powered by 100% renewable energy, we transform old clothes into a pristine natural material for fashion that needs no cotton fields, no oil, and no trees.



THIS IS HOW IT WORKS:



We take in garments that can’t be resold to people. Either they’re way too worn-out or hopelessly out of style. We prefer cotton clothes because they contain a lot of cellulose.



The clothes are shredded, de-buttoned, de-zipped, de-colored and turned into a slurry. Contaminants like plastic polyester are taken out. What remains is cellulose - the biodegradable organic polymer that cotton, trees and all green plants on earth are made out of. 



The slurry is dried to produce sheets of pure Circulose®. We package the sheets into bales and ship them to be made back into natural textile fibers.



A brand designs new virgin quality clothes using Circulose® fibers.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Credibility
Tags: Recycled, Textile & fiber products, Reuse waste, Waste-to-materials, Textile & fiber waste, Recycle waste
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Materials and chemicals, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Equal in quality to conventional virgin man-made cellulosic fiber pulp;100% textile-to-textile recycled;-2 kg CO2e per kg produces on net (SCS Global Services 2017 LCA report);100% biodegradable;
The Financial benefits: 30% cheaper than virgin organic cotton at large scale production;

Organization short description: We make fashion circular. Recycling clothes finally works.
About:
Founded by innovators from Stockholm’s KTH Royal Institute of Technology in 2012, Re:NewCell AB (publ) (‘Renewcell’) is a multi-award-winning sustaintech company based in Sweden. The company’s vision is to inspire an Industrial Evolution to a sustainable world by producing high quality materials from recycled textiles.



Through its patented process, Renewcell is able to upcycle cellulosic textile waste, such as cotton clothes, transforming it into a pristine new material called Circulose®. Fast Company named Renewcell one of the World’s Most Innovative Companies 2021. Circulose® was also included on TIME Magazine’s list of the 100 Best Inventions 2020.



Renewcell is a publicly listed company with shares traded on Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market with the ticker name RENEW and ISIN code SE0014960431.

Solution on-sentence summary: A maintenance-free engine oil filtration system that protects engines, limits oil change, and reduces waste
Identification:
The nitiFilter® is a permanent self-cleaning engine oil system that allows avoiding at least 2/3 of oil change while outlasting one's engine. It's a stainless steel mesh filter kept clean by a backflush flow, hence providing a constant and optimal filtration.

It increases engine uptime by reducing unnecessary maintenance while providing better engine protection than the usual engine oil filters. The solution aims at reducing oil change and the associated heap of useless waste while improving engine uptime. Filter replacement and oil change are made non-mandatory, reducing engine oil consumption by at least 3 and drastically limiting waste: no more used filters and much less used oil, all the while guaranteeing an optimal filtration. How does the solution work? instead of using a paper-based filter, whose filtration rating evolved with time and which becomes contaminated and deteriorates, the Solution uses a stainless steel mesh.

Solution on-sentence summary: A digital and connected electrical switchboard for energy efficient Smart Homes and Smart Cities
Identification:
Oghji is a smart electrical switchboard that aims at optimizing and saving on the electricity consumption at the scale of a household, business or institution building and a territory.

Oghji replaces the traditional circuit breakers with a digital technology that allows measuring in real-time, alerting in case of electrical default or unusual consumption, controlling, programming the consumption of each circuit via a touch screen or a mobile application, and automatically shedding low-priority circuits.

Thanks to its SmartGrid connectivity, Oghji also contributes to SmartCity programs by collecting consumption data and giving network operators the means to modulate electricity demand.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Electric, Electrical grid, Algorithms & AI, Smart-metering, IoT, Smart-grid, Smart-buildings

The Financial benefits: 500€ savings/year on the electricity bill for an average household with electrical heaters;3 to 5 years payback time on electricity savings;
Complementary solutions:
Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);animeo Connect : Facade shading management solution for increased energy savings in buildings (Buildings & Shelters);Recovering heat : Standardized, ready-to-install solution for supermarkets to heat buildings or water using waste heat (Buildings & Shelters);LightFi: Continuously measure building occupancy to optimize energy use for HVAC and lighting



 (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: The "all in one" digital electrical panel for energy efficiency [Smart Home] and flow optimization [Smart Grid].
About:
Located at the heart of the electrical installation of the building, the electrical panel has an enormous potential. However, it is based on a 50 years old technology of mechanical circuit breakers which limits its capacities. Yet technologies have evolved and habits as well. 



In search of efficient energy management, we have created oghji, the smart, digital and connected electrical protection panel. 

It replaces the traditional electrical panel with mechanical circuit breakers. 



Like it, it ensures the distribution of electrical circuits in a building and the protection of equipment and people. 

But oghji is much more than an electrical panel, it is an “all-in-one” energy management tool. 



It natively offers many features that allow optimized management of electricity consumption with a reduction that we estimate to be around 15 to 20%. 

• Alerts in the event of an electrical fault 

• Detailed analysis of consumption in real time circuit by circuit 

• Programming of routines according to tariff preferences, day/night and presence/absence 

• Automatic load shedding of low priority circuits in the event of high consumption 



These functionalities are available via a digital touch screen but also if the user wishes, via a simple and intuitive oghji mobile application allowing remote control and multi-board management. 



Thanks to its SmartGrid connectivity, oghji will also contribute to SmartCity programs by offering data aggregation and the possibility for network operators to modulate energy demand. On the consumption side, oghji will dynamically, punctually and painlessly erase low priority circuits in the event of network voltage. On the supply side, oghji will make it possible to favor green energies when they are available.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A showerdrain that reclaims up to 42% heat energy from used shower water by pre-warming the fresh cold water
Identification:
Reclaim valuable heat energy from used shower water by pre-warming the fresh water

before it arrives at the mixer. Up to 42% of thermal energy can be saved by each warm

shower. The showerdrain Joulia-Inline has to be connected to the freshwater. By means of a heat exchanger module, the heat energy of the used shower water is reused to warm the incoming cold water mains. In this way the cold water arrives at the mixing valve up to 15°C warmer than before (from 10°C up to 25°C). Therefore, substantially less hot water is needed. By this means, a 4-person household can save about 1000 kWh per year. Joulia-Inline is sold with either 3 or 5 heat exchanger tubes, which you can select depending on whether maximum efficiency or minimal installation height is more important.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Shower, Water-networks, Waste-heat valorisation, Fuel efficiency, Building heating
The environmental benefits: Thanks to the low building height the Soluition can be placed in every shower floor and will work without any moving parts nor electricity;Save as much energy as 8 m2 of solar panels would have to produce and this whilst showering;Certified for connection to drinking water in many European countries;The drain doesn't emit any CO2 in the atmosphere, doesn't use any electric energy, just works by water flow;Closing the last gap in the building envelop with Joulia-Inline shower drain channels with integrated heat exchangers;
The Financial benefits: Joulia-Inline saves up to 42% of thermal energy ;A 4-person household can recover arround 1'000 kWh per year;The Joulia-showerdrain has a short payback time between 3 - 6 years, depending on its usage and energy prices;

Solar space heating: Solar-powered air heaters and rock bed thermal storage to heat homes 

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);Recovering heat : Standardized, ready-to-install solution for supermarkets to heat buildings or water using waste heat (Buildings & Shelters);

About:
Joulia SA has been founded in 2010 to commercialize an innovation originally developed at the innovation house Creaholic. The Joulia SA operations team is comprised of an interesting mix of different professions and talents and cut no corners in turning a bold idea into a product with great market potential.



Joulia-Inline and Twinline, the shower drain with heat recovery offers all the comfort and soothes your guilty conscience. With “Joulia-inline” technology, heat recovery is very attractive. This scalable heat recovery module is invisibly integrated into a slim channel in the shower floor, and efficiently recovers heat energy from the warm shower water as it goes down the drain. In this way it provides more comfort while using less energy.

About:
Your wooden house is prefabricated  under the form of portable blocks already insulated and easy to install. 

The Blokiwood blocks, made out of OSB and filled with wood whool, a bio-sourced insulator, are a competitive, extremely efficient and flexible way of building. 

This industrial solutions opens low-carbon and recyclable construction to the mass market, overperforming by far the criterias of the latest environmental regulations such as RE2020 in France.

 Blokiwood construction system is certified CTB Composant, CSTB under process, to be integrated as a standard solution on complex projects up to 3 storeys high.

The form factor (60cm wide blocks, which can be carried by hand and don't need complex lifting devices or heavy trucks) makes it a particularly fexible solution for building on hard to access/operate terrains, like slopes, dense areas, far from the road building sites.

Building of a medium sized house up to the weather proof stage is as fast as 48 hours for a team of 3, and the practical details of the blocks will accelerate also the networks installation and the walls finishing. 

With a phase shift long enough to offer a real summer comfort, tremendous thermal performance, you'll enjoy the comfort of passive house, the warmth of the wood based constructions and lower your heating or cooling costs.

Modern designs and facade options allows the buildings to look like any other building, hiding if the client asks it their wooden hearts.

About:
Made up of the Rocersa, Azulev and Sanchis Hôme brands, the Rocersa Group has established itself as the Spanish benchmark in the manufacture of 20mm porcelain by number of formats and references, as well as the 6 and 7mm Slim product for both floor and wall tiles, inspired by trends in the world of interior and graphic design in interior and exterior environments.



The Group is among the 5 largest “Made in Spain” producers with a production capacity of 14M m2, spread over 2 production centers, one in Alcora and the other in Onda in the province of Castellón, which operate with their 2 respective logistics centers .



It has a commercial network of 3,000 distributors in 80 countries around the world. Rocersa Group is committed to the future and to people, betting on a responsible and sustainable activity, as well as on processes and products where innovation and new technologies form our business vision.



Sustainability, technology, society and the human being, as the clear protagonist of our work, are the values ​​on which Rocersa has been founded since its inception.



Continuing with this speech, Rocersa has only opted for the dry grinding process, eliminating the use of process water used in the cooling of the wheels.



We also invest resources in manufacturing products with an increasingly higher content of recycled material and a firm commitment to the circular economy, commitment to the environment and sustainability projects.



To reduce energy consumption, we are immersed in the process of implementing energy exchange systems, recovering the heat from the ovens and using it in the dryers for the raw product.



This is how we publicly disseminate it in our Quality and Environment Policies, supported by our ISO 9001 and ISO 14001 certificates, and type III eco-labelling product, Environmental Product Declaration (Global EPD) with its corresponding Life Cycle Analysis.

Solution on-sentence summary: A bio-based insulation batt made from grass, for positive impact and high energy efficiency in buildings
Identification: Gramitherm is a bio-based insulation batt, with a negative carbon footprint ( capturing 1.5kg of CO2eq per kg of product), made from an abundant raw material: grass. Energy efficiency of buildings is one of the main targets to make the world carbon neutral as soon as possible. We aim at delivering a solution to this problem by providing an insulating material at least as good as any other solution on the market for its insulating properties, but whose environmental impact is unrivalled. Indeed our primary component is grass, an element naturally abundant all over the world, with a short reconstitution cycle time. Furthermore, our product has an estimated lifetime of at least 50 years, and it is easily and fully recyclable afterward.( it’s mainly grass after all ! - the product has over 90% of natural fibres right now, and we expect to be 100% natural by the end of 2024).

Organization short description: Gramitherm is an insulation batt made from natural grass and with a negative carbon footprint.
About:
Gramitherm® is a patented Swiss technology that enables the production of natural insulation batts from meadow grass fibres .

Gramitherm® is a new insulation biomaterial with natural grass fibres that offers a double ecological performance : a negative carbon footprint ( 1kg of Gramitherm batt absorbs 1,5kg of CO2-eq) , the lowest grey energy performance in it’s category (the  liquid digestible components of the grass are collected and used for the production of biogas . Every component of grass is valorized in a top efficient waste management system).

Gramitherm® is delivering both insulation against cold of winter as well as summer heat . It’s fibrous structures absorb noise (recommended for wood buildings) and regulate humidity (recommended for long life cycle and confort in humid areas ).

Gramitherm®is easy to install , non irritating , non toxic and 100% recyclable .

Gramitherm® is a global concept : natural grass is nearly everywhere and doesn’t need to be planted.

Where there are grass valorization spots, there is an opportunity to manufacture and market Gramitherm®!

Gramitherm® belongs to the bioeconomy and is a perfect example of transforming "green waste" into added value materials.



Key Figures : The insulation materials market comprises of 50% mineral wool (glass+stone) , 45% synthetic plastic foams and 5% natural fibres ( mainly wood fibres made products).

Within this 5% niche of”alternative”products , the European market today for flexible batts is 2,0 M m3 per year or +/- 140M EUR annual sales . The European natural fibres insulation market is growing at 10-12% p.a on average . Same trend and metrics for insulation market in North America....

1 kg of Gramitherm® finished product absorbs 1,5 kg equivalent of CO2 (FDES - base Iniès NF EN 15804 ).

By taking 33% market share of the European natural fibres flexible batts , Gramitherm® wil generate a positive impact of 700000m3 x 40kg/m3 x1,405 kg eq CO2/kg of product = 39 340 000 kg of CO2  = +/- 39 000 TONS OF CO2 CAPTURED ! 



The Gramitherm® is currently produced by Gramitherm Europe SA, located in Sambreville (Belgium).



Gramitherm won the Bouygues Award for circular economy at Vivatech 2018 .

Solution on-sentence summary: A biobased thermoplastic made from 100% unsorted landfill-destined waste that can replace oil-based resins
Identification: UBQ Materials transforms unsorted household waste, including all organics such as food leftovers, cardboard packaging, and garden trimmings alongside mixed plastics and even dirty diapers, into the most climate-positive thermoplastic material on the market – the UBQ™ material. UBQ™ is a drop-in material that can be used by existing manufacturers to replace oil-based plastics to create products with a reduced or even negative carbon footprint, without compromising profitability. By using the UBQ™ material, manufacturers are diverting waste from landfills, preserving natural resources, and preventing methane emissions. Possible applications expand across many different industries, from logistics, furniture, and retail to automotive, construction, and even 3D printing. Every ton of UBQ™ prevents 11.7 tons of CO2eq from polluting the environment, leading LCA auditors Quantis to designate UBQ™ as ‘ The Most Climate Positive Thermoplastic Material on the Market’

In GWP100, the amount prevented is 4.4 tons of CO2eq;

Organization short description: Advanced Waste Conversion Technology & Sustainable Materials Company
Headquarters: Derech Menachem Begin 156, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel
About:
UBQ has developed an advanced waste conversion technology to produce sustainable bio-based materials as a substitute to conventional oil-based plastics. 



The breakthrough is within valorizing all food waste and organics, from banana peels to chicken bones, as well as other typically unrecycled materials, like dirty plastics or packaging, all present in the everyday waste we produce today – simply by living. 



Our closed-loop process effectively reduces this residual household waste into many of its more basic natural components. Where, at an almost molecular level, these natural components reconstitute themselves and bind together to form a new homogeneous composite with thermoplastic properties. 



UBQ Materials upcycles composites which are sustainable, recyclable, and competitively priced for the marketplace today. They can be used to substitute conventional plastics within existing manufacturing systems without additional adaptation costs to make everyday familiar products industry produces today – just more sustainably, with a reduced carbon footprint. From Injection to compression molding through to extrusion, the UBQ™ material has been tested and proven to be compatible with PP, PE, PLA, and PVC. 



UBQ strategically positions its solution towards the end of the waste hierarchy. By doing so, we ensure that all recyclable materials are, in fact, recycled appropriately to maintain their inherent resource value. UBQ then diverts the waste ‘no one wants’ from landfills, and possible illegal dumping, giving it value again. Our robust modular system can be adapted to virtually any scale addressing both micro / local needs through to state and even national levels depending on waste generation and material off take demand.



As an innovative materials company, we seek to be part of the coalition that provides the missing link between waste disposal and new product manufacturing. Converting “waste” into commercially viable, valuable, and safe materials will allow industry to source and re-use wasted materials already in circulation rather than continue extracting our finite natural resources.



UBQ does have the potential to address the grossly underestimated impact of waste and growing need/demand for sustainable bio-based materials.

Solution on-sentence summary: Recycled EV Lithium batteries used to manufacture certified energy stationary storage systems, at competitive prices
Identification: The solution, certified and guaranteed second-life batteries, is an innovative battery in the field of stationary storage. It uses the best rechargeable lithium technologies, chosen by OEMs for their technical characteristics, safety aspects and reliability. The solution is therefore perfectly suited to the stationary sector, where the stress constraints are generally lower than those of electric mobility, and at a systematically lower price than that of new lithium batteries, which allows the customer to make his project economically profitable. It can be used to provide energy to support the grid during high demand cycles or to store intermittently produced energy to release it during non-production phases. It can also be used to quickly recharge vehicles at the terminals, to optimise electricity consumption prices. Clients are energy service companies (integrators), who will use the Solution in their own products (e.g. self-consumption cabinets).

The environmental benefits: FNX MP14 and FNX MS 14 modules are configured to deliver 48 V outpu and each is available in 3 models: 2.5 KWh, 3 KWh and 3.5 KWh;Industrial size, 19" rack (4U);The systems are guaranteed for 3,650 cycles, i.e. 10 years of service at the rate of one cycle per day (depending on contractual conditions of use, consult us for specific use);Extending the life of a battery used in eco-mobility to 10 years;At the end of its second life, more than 69 % of the battery will be recycled by sister company SNAM; A global very low environmental footprint compared to a new lithium battery (e.g. limiting the mining of raw materials and their transport);

Organization short description: The Snam Group holding company is one of the European leaders in the recycling of batteries (NiCd, NIMH, Li-ion).
About:
The Snam Group holding company is a subsidiary of the Belgian group Floridienne (2,200 employees). It was created in 2018 to facilitate the capitalisation and development of its various subsidiaries :

   - Experienced companies, with high growth potential, such as SNAM, one of the European leaders in the recycling of batteries, SOPAVE and VCD (Vera Chimie Développement), all companies that have ambitious projects in the field of hydrometallurgy and chemistry; 

   - And the newly born subsidiary, Phenix Batteries, whose aim is to build a major European offer of 2nd life batteries for the market of stationary storage of intermittent renewable energies. 

  Today, Snam Group has 170 employees in France, spread over two sites : Decazeville / Aveyron and St Quentin-Fallavier / Isère. 

 

Now that electric mobility is expanding worldwide and appears to be a necessity in view of the global challenges of reducing carbon impact, now that many countries are developing voluntary programmes for the development of intermittent renewable energies and that therefore the question of their storage is arising, the activities of Snam Group, all devoted to batteries, are a perfect example of a circular economy, as well as a relevant and complete response to a crucial problem : the cost, management, life and recycling of the batteries involved in clean mobility (cars, buses, etc.) 



The development prospects of these markets will be very important, in Europe or worldwide, and the group is ready to face this challenge. Indeed, we have more than 40 years of experience in the battery recycling sector, and a large logistics power spread throughout the European continent - and beyond. For the past six years, we have developed, with the help of the CEA, measuring systems that allow us to accurately test the various components of the batteries we receive, and to select from them the modules we can reuse to store energy from IREC. We have also the confidence of many of the world’s leading car manufacturers with whom we have signed contracts for the recovery and recycling of their end-of-life batteries used in their hybrid or electric vehicles.



Nowadays, combining thermal and hydro-metallurgical processes, SNAM can recycle every battery chemistries (excluding lead). Its recycling rates are above 69% of the whole battery, a performance higher than the current European requirement for efficiency (50%). And as for the metals (Co, Ni, Li, Cu, Mn), the recycling rates are around 99%. Thus, SNAM produces 99% pure cobalt salts which can then be used for the manufacture of new lithium-ion batteries. 



For its part, the Phenix Batteries company manufactures 2nd life batteries, packaged in the form of standard modules packs that can be assembled, as needed, in cabinets or modular containers. The life extension of these batteries is around 7 or 9 years. The energy storage capacities of these new batteries can range from a few KWh to 2 MWh. These are new, tested, certified products that are guaranteed in contractual form, in terms of performance and service life, according to the conditions and characteristics of use required by the customer (number of charges and discharges, etc). 

The potential applications of these second-life batteries may be very varied : 

This can be a “stationary storage” type of use ; the batteries are then used to support the grid in cycles of high demand, or used to store energy produced intermittently in order to return it during the non-production phases (ex: return, at night, of solar energy; return, at day, of wind energy stored at night). 

Thanks to these batteries, it will also be easy for their users to optimise their electricity consumption rates, by storing it in low tariff periods and returning it in high tariff periods. 

Other possible applications : these batteries can be used in «inverter» function in order to avoid power cuts ; they can also be used to quickly recharge electric vehicles at terminals, etc. 

But whatever the function of these batteries, the activity deployed by Phenix Batteries will only take place within a B to B framework. The initial customers will be companies specialized in energy services (called integrators) and then, the energy companies, producers or distributors. 



All Snam Group’s activities are expected to create several hundred jobs in the 6 years to come.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A solvent-free surface functionalization technology reducing the need for dangerous chemicals
Identification: The Solution provides a new manufacturing technology for surface functionalization that enables a dramatic reduction of the amount of chemistry required compared to incumbent wet-chemical technologies.  It uses super-low energy cold atmospheric plasma as a tool to graft a nanometric layer of the desired functional chemistry onto the substrate. Typical applications include surface priming of inert materials prior to adhesive bonding, safe virucidal functionality on PPE and air filters using citric acid, bactericidal functionality on textiles, silicon-free and fluor-free release coatings, single-step immobilization of biomolecules such as antibodies and anti-biofouling coatings. The Solution is highly scalable and easily adaptable to many functionalities and production processes. The environmental impact of the solution is very low as it is almost emission-free, uses extremely low amounts of chemistry and very little energy.

Organization short description: Molecular Plasma Group is constantly developing its novel nano-coating technology using cold atmospheric plasma. We use the plasma as a vector to graft organic chemistry directly onto any substrate.
About:
Described by Dr. Alan Taylor from TWI (Cambridge) as the next giant leap in surface functionalization technology, our technology completely eliminates the need for any kind of solvent in a range of manufacturing processes. Solution on-sentence summary: A battery for the grid that stores electricity by heating refractory materials
Identification:
STOLECT Carnot battery offers a new electricity storage technology to support the development of renewable energies. Massive quantities of storage are needed on the electric grids in order to reduce the need for fossil backup production when renewables are not producing and to create 100% renewable systems in the future. STOLECT works thanks to the reversible conversion of electrical energy into thermal energy, using turbines and compressors that circulate air in a closed circuit. Energy, in the form of heat, is stored by heating readily available natural materials, such as basaltic rocks, or recycled ceramics.

By offering a technology that is not dependent on critical materials, that can be installed anywhere and that is totally environmentally friendly, STOLECT has the potential to greatly reduce the environmental impact of electric systems in all geographical zones, in particular for small networks, in islands for example.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Network, Credibility
Tags: Batteries - energy storage, Electrical grid, Smart-grid, TES (thermal energy storage)
The environmental benefits: The first system built have a power rating of 0,7 MW and a energy capacity of 3.5 MWh, other models, 10 times bigger in the next generation, could be developed quickly ;0% of critical materials used : the system only uses readily available, cheap and abundant materials;A single charging cycle of the system avoids the emission of more than 1 tonne of CO2 in the atmosphere when compared with diesel generators;Thanks to its conception, the expected lifespan is at least 30 years, which corresponds to more than 15 000 tonnes of CO2 avoided compared to the use of fossile fuels;This solution allows to build 100% renewable electric grids;
The Financial benefits: 3 times cheaper than lithium batteries in the long term;5 times cheaper than fossil fuel equivalent in the long term;
Complementary solutions: Storage GEM®: Smart energy management system in containerized storage units for rapid deployment (Energy);Smart Energy Hub: An innovative hydrogen-based energy storage solution for buildings (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Cool Green Energy Factory: An innovative energy concept to make cooling processes economically and ecologically sustainable (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);Solar GEM® (Green Energy in Motion): Smart energy management system for solar power plants (Energy);
Organization short description: STOLECT is a start-up developing an innovative and efficient electricity storage technology based on thermal conversion
About:
STOLECT is developing an innovative, safe and efficient technology of electricity storage. STOLECT's electricity storage technology enables the massive integration of renewable energies and the decarbonization of the energy mix by offering clean and controllable electricity. As a result, STOLECT offers an economically competitive solution in a rapidly growing market

STOLECT was founded in 2019 and the first developments started in 2014. The company already successfully led prototype phases and has now started the construction of the first complete full-scale system.

Its design and advantages make it a breakthrough technology adapted to market needs and constraints. 

STOLECT builds on a network of French and European industrial partners to accelerate the commercialization of the solution.

Solution on-sentence summary: The WAGABOX® solution allows to produce biomethane from landfill gas to substitute fossil-based natural gas
Identification: The result of ten years of R&D at Air Liquide and Waga Energy, the WAGABOX® is a breakthrough landfill gas upgrading technology. It combines two upgrading processes: membrane filtration and cryogenic distillation. Membrane filtration removes the carbon dioxide (CO2) and impurities from landfill gas. The gas is then cryogenically cooled to separate the methane (CH4) from the oxygen (O2) and nitrogen (N2). WAGABOX® technology guarantees grid compliant biomethane regardless of air concentration in landfill gas. It adapts to raw gas flow rates and composition variations and delivers three times more energy than CHP, the most approaching competing technology. Biomethane can be transported and stored using existing gas infrastructure. The solution is fully integrated and is protected worldwide by six patent families.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Network, Funding, Partners
Target client profile: BusinessFarming & AgricultureCrops, BusinessFarming & AgricultureLivestock & Dairy, BusinessEnergy Utility
Tags: Developing countries, Landfill, Electrical grid, Biogas & biomethane, Methane, Waste-to-energy & fuels, Natural gas
Sectors: Energy, Waste/Pollution, Power and fuel generation, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: Recovers 90% of the methane contained in landfill gas, allowing an energy yield up to three times higher than CHP;Once commissioned, the solution injects biomethane 24/7, around the year ;By April 2022, 13 WAGABOX® units were operating in France with 480 GWh of installed capacity;37,000 metric tons of CO2eq avoided by substituting fossil natural gas since the commissioning of the 1st WAGABOX® unit in 2017 (April 2022);145 GWh of renewable natural gas injected into the French gas grid to substitute fossil fuel in 2021 ;
The Financial benefits: On a large capacity landfill, production cost can be between 40-70 € /MWh;
Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: Developed by Waga Energy, the WAGABOX® technology produces Renewable Natural Gas (RNG), a renewable substitute for fossil-based natural gas, by upgrading the biogas emitted by the breaking down of organic matter on landfill sites.
About:
After 10 years of research and development within Air Liquide and Waga Energy, the WAGABOX® technology combines membrane filtration and cryogenic distillation to isolate the methane from the other components in the landfill gas (nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide and other impurities). It produces a high quality biomethane that can be injected in the gas grid to supply individuals, businesses or even fuel vehicles. The WAGABOX® technology has a double impact to help reduce greenhouse gas emissions : it reduces the amount of methane released in the atmosphere and provides a clean, local and renewable energy to substitute for fossil-based gas. 

Waga Energy operates ten WAGABOX® units in France, they supply approximately 35,000 households with clean, local and renewable gas, avoiding the release of 45,000 metric tons of CO2eq. Ten more units are currently under construction in France, Spain and Canada.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: An universal toilet tank ecological, economical and eco-responsible, which saves water and requires no maintenance
Identification:
The Waterflush toilet tank saves its users time and money. Its innovative mechanism does not involve any flushing mechanism involving a seal, this leads to no leaks no risk of scaling and no maintenance.

The Solution is economical since it enables important water savings, water bills are halved on average compared to conventional systems. The water savings also bring an important environmental advantage compared to conventional toilets, the user only consumes what is needed (1 to 5 liters of water).

Additionally, the tank is guaranteed for 10 years and is 100% recyclable. To do good for the planet, we must start by taking action in our daily lives. Clean water used in toilets represents 20% of household water consumption.

Waterflush was born from the desire to take care of the most precious asset on our planet: water.

This carrier can transport hydrogen in a liquid state at ambient temperature and pressure by using the existing infrastructures for conventional liquids. Thanks to HSL Solutions, three main issues of the energy transition can be solved: the safe and stable transportation of hydrogen, the reuse of the soon-to-be-obsolete liquid infrastructures of hydrocarbons and a circular hydrogen value chain with no waste. The first zero-carbon circular hydrogen value chain.

Solution on-sentence summary: The EV charging solution optimizing local & global energy profiles with a focus on each driver’s comfort
Identification: As electric mobility is on the rise, parking lots and public streets are increasingly equipped with charging infrastructures. Additional energy and power needs may become critical if not properly managed. SMATCH by ENGIE handles EV charging so to avoid electrical reinforcement while delivering the optimal charging experience to each EV driver. SMATCH manages the charging speed of each car so that the physical constraints and site-specific priority rules are respected, and each user’s needs are taken in consideration. In addition, SMATCH is capable to respond to specific needs of the grid operators by raising/reducing the charging speed, or even injecting energy on the grid (also called “V2G”) so to keep the equilibrium between consumption and production, with invisible impact on the driver's charging comfort.

Solution name: Ecological toilet designed as ceramics one
Solution on-sentence summary: An ecological toilet with the same look as a ceramic toilet for all homes,
Identification:
The Ziya toilet solution makes the use of a dry toilet in an ordinary home accessible.

Ziya looks like a flush toilet, Ziya has the same functionality as a flush toilet, so it is an ecological toilet that looks like an ordinary toilet.



To be noted: Human faeces, obtained from dry on-site sanitation systems, can successfully be turned into valuable input (fertilizer) to be re-used in the local agro-ecological systems (Kelova et al., 2021). Despite the technique has received acceptance in some rural regions of Europe and US (Aburto-Medina et al., 2020) , critical factors such as length of the treatment and temperature must be taken into account to ensure a final product that is hygienically safe (Werner et al., 2022).

 

Aburto-Medina, A., Shahsavari, E., Khudur, L. S., Brown, S., & Ball, A. S. (2020). A review of dry sanitation systems. In Sustainability (Switzerland) (Vol. 12, Issue 14, pp. 1–9). MDPI. https://doi.org/10.3390/su12145812

Kelova, M. E., Eich-Greatorex, S., & Krogstad, T. (2021). Human excreta as a resource in agriculture – Evaluating the fertilizer potential of different composting and fermentation-derived products. Resources, Conservation and Recycling, 175, 105748. https://doi.org/https://doi.org/10.1016/j.resconrec.2021.105748

Solution on-sentence summary: A system designed to capture the bath and shower water, process it, and reuse it to flush up to four toilets in the home
Identification: Aqua Gratis has been created to significantly reduce domestic water consumption. Capturing and reusing the bath and shower water to flush up to four toilets in the home gives at least a 30% saving on potable water needed to be supplied to the home. The use of greywater for flushing toilets saves around 200 litres a day for a family of 4. In times of drought, unlike rainwater harvesting, this solution has a regular supply of water. Aqua Gratis will reduce domestic sewage by 30%. This will reduce the energy used to process both water supplied and sewage treated by 30% and has a 13% greater Co2 savings than its mainstream competitor. This solution is low cost, low energy, easy to fit, use and maintain. Installing Aqua Gratis will benefit the water companies, developers, occupiers and the environment. Aqua Gratis is the missing element of zero-carbon homes. Today, water companies urgently depend on the cooperation of new home developers to work in partnership to achieve water neutrality.

Solution on-sentence summary: A feed additive certified to reduce enteric methane production in dairy cows and beef cattle
Identification:
AGOLIN RUMINANT is a natural feed supplement, based on carefully selected blend of plant extracts, certified to reduce enteric methane production in dairy cows and beef cattle. 

1 g of AGOLIN RUMINANT fed to a cow each day has shown in trials not only a positive effect on performance but also on enteric methane mitigation of about 500 kg CO2-equivalent per annum.  




Legal notice: Agolin SA produces premixtures of flavourings for animal feedstuffs. Scientific studies and publications about our products shall not be interpreted as claims. Regulations for product use are established country by country. Please consult your local Agolin distributor.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Credibility
Tags: Animal feedstock, Methane, Agricultural equipment & machinery, Carbon footprint
The environmental benefits: The CO2-eq. saving by feeding AGOLIN RUMIANT to dairy cows can be converted into carbon credits;10'000 kg milk produced with AGOLIN RUMINANT fed cows (1 g / day / animal), show a 9.2 % lower carbon footprint or a reduction of 500 kg CO2-equivalent per cow and year;Each ton of AGOLIN RUMINANT has the potential to reduce CO2-eq by 1500 tons (according to trials);
The Financial benefits: The economic benefit for a farmer involved in the VCS-Mooh project amounts to CHF 100 / ton of CO2-eq saved;Agolin Ruminant fed cows utilise better their feed due to improved digestion (+4% feed efficiency);
Complementary solutions: Cycle Feed: Insect-based feed for West African tilapia farmers (Food & Agriculture);Agolin® Ruminant: A plant-based feed additive to reduce enteric methane emissions from ruminants (Food & Agriculture);NEXUS: An alternative for sustainable development of smallholder farmers and fisheries communities (Food & Agriculture);3Bee Hive-Tech: Artificial intelligence iot monitoring and diagnostic system for agriculture (Food & Agriculture);
Organization short description: AGOLIN SA develops feed additives. Its flagship product is certified to reduce methane production in ruminants.
About:
According to the Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) beef cattle and dairy cows are responsible for about 10 % of global human-induced greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, which corresponds to 4600 million tonnes of CO2-equivalent per year. About 40 % or 2000 million tons of the sectors emissions are in the form of methane (CH4), which is produced by the animal’s digestive process and released to the environment mostly by burping. A cow produces about 500 litres of methane gas per day or about 3 tons of CO2-eq. per year (source IPCC). Furthermore, it is important to know that methane’s greenhouse effect is twenty-five times stronger than carbon dioxide.

AGOLIN® RUMINANT is the company’s flagship product. It is a blend of high quality plant extracts from herbs and spices, which is effective, easy to use and safe. Research trials demonstrate AGOLIN’s potential to influence the rumen microbiota positively. The feed additive produces rumen responses, both in vitro and in vivo, such as reduced methane production, which leads to better energy utilization and consequently improved productivity in the animals. The product research was partially supported by EU research projects, with the goal to demonstrate a reduction of methane production in ruminants by the use of AGOLIN®, coupled to increased productivity, feed utilisation and animal wellbeing. A Climate-KIC (part of European Institute of Technology) research project demonstrated AGOLIN’s efficacy. Under the conditions of the long-term trial with over 150 cows carried out by the University of Aberystwyth in the United Kingdom, the feed supplement reduced the enteric methane production significantly by 20 % per kg milk, while feed intake (+3%), efficiency (+5%) and milk production (+9%) was improved. 

A scientific paper published in ‘Animals’ Journal, was based on over twenty trials

carried out over the last number of years, across nine countries and nearly

four thousand cows in total. This study was carried out by the The Spanish National Research Council (CSIC) near Madrid. The results not only show a significant benefit in terms of methane reduction from the rumen of the cow, but also in terms of milk production and feed efficiency. Methane emissions can be lowered by around 10%, according to the study, while energy corrected milk output and feed efficiency can be improved by over 4 percent.



AGOLIN’s concept and scientific proofs are well accepted for its economic and environmental benefits by the feed industry and farmers in Europe, North America and Asia. Furthermore, the food and feed industry developed successful carbon in- and offsetting projects with AGOLIN RUMINANT in Europe and North America (read more on www.agolin.com).



Feeding the world cattle population with AGOLIN®RUMINANT and reducing the average enteric methane production by 10 % (validated by Carbon Trust, independent low carbon and sustainability experts), would result in a reduction of greenhouse gas emission of 200 million tons CO2-equivalent per year.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Achille is a local marketplace using a Saas Mobile Platform for retailers to sell sleeping inventory to local customers
Identification: Faced with the constraint of unsold stock and the need to commit to the circular economy, Achille is the first Saas platform that allows physical shops to put their offers online to optimise stock management. The offers are thus accessible to local consumers who are guaranteed the best price, immediate availability and the shops' service guarantees. Achille contributes to putting the human element back into the digital relationship between shops and their potential area. The whole ecosystem benefits from less destruction, extensions of the product life, allowing to increase the profitability of the shops while gaining traffic, because consumers are in hyper proximity, buy locally and thus limit their travels to look for a product as well as their online orders, generating consequent impacts on the whole ecosystem.

Identification:
The Natufia One is an innovative semi-automated smart indoor garden for every home, community space or office. The unit is a plug and play device. A single unit is composed of a water tank as a base and a growing pillar where you can grow up to 22 plants or herbs automatically with automated watering and lighting.

Powered by Natufia technology units can also be connected in series: from home use to the whole community greens production. Instead of bringing products from farms to consumers through a long and unsustainable global supply chain, imagine reinventing the consumer journey by allowing communities to control their food and have constant access to food without negatively impacting our environment. Natufia aims at disrupting the way people relate to their food by decentralizing food production by developing a semi-autonomous hydroponics system that provides a never-ending supply of fresh greens and plants, all year long.

Solution on-sentence summary: Sustainable alternative versus virgin oil-based binders for paints & coatings, flooring and other industries
Identification:
SharkDispersions diverts waste from landfills and provides a sustainable alternative to the need of using oil-based binders for paints & coatings. The resulting benefits lead to a better and greener world with significantly lower CO2, GHG emissions, and VOCs. 



Shark Dispersions are created from damaged laminate glass, which has been sent to landfills in many parts of the world. This upcycling of the interlayer from laminated glass means SharkDispersions are created without having to harvest new raw materials from the planet. 



The benefit to a paint or coating company also includes more sustainable final products that help meet customer expectation and compliance with CO2/GHG reduction goals.

About:
Shark Solutions is a Danish based cleantech global market leader focused on giving a new life to post-consumer PVB (PolyVinyl Butyral) from windshields and architectural/building glass (laminated glass). We are passionate about this superior raw material and eliminating the need for companies to dispose of it in landfills. In a world with limited resources we all have to take responsibility and action; and we make a difference in the laminated glass world of re- and upcycling.



Our PVB recycling factories in Europe and the USA transform this former waste material into advanced sustainable polymers that have use in many industrial applications worldwide. We have developed applications in many industries, including carpet backing, paint and coatings, sound dampening  – and we keep adding; all areas where the unique PVB polymer brings value over and above just replacing the existing virgin raw materials. Among others it helps our customers build Cradle-2-Cradle certified products and reduce their GHG/CO2 emissions.

Solution on-sentence summary: EP Tender is a battery service for extending the range of electric vehicles
Identification:
The solution aims at decarbonizing the transportation sector, one of the the main contributors to global warming, by enabling mass market adoption of electric vehicles (EVs). Our modular solution minimizes the environmental footprint of EVs while making them affordable, inclusive and convenient over long distances: traveling with peace of mind. 

A Tender is a powerbank, which is mounted on a small trailer, rented on demand and attached to EVs for long distance trips. From driver experience point of view, it is self-pairing with the car and self-steering when backing, providing a seamless user experience.

When not attached to vehicles, Tenders can be used as energy storage solutions, zero emission generators or mobile EV charger for roadside recovery. This leads to a very high utilisation rate of our batteries: above 90%.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Organization short description: EP Tender is a range extending service for electric vehicles.
About:
Our approach is to share batteries on demand through a smart powerbank trailer. 



Coumpond making better batteries with better using them, for an even much more sustainable future !  Battery progress squared !



Rented on demand at the occasion of long distance trips, self pairing (or swapping) in 2 minutes, self steering when backing, safety ensured, seamless to use. 



Result: affordable EV with moderate battery, 500 km motorway range, 1.8MW net charging power (attach or swap 60 kWh in 2'), tax sustainable, inclusive zero emission mobility, frugal use of natural resources, low carbon footprint. 



Our Tenders (battery trailer) also serve as zero emission generator, mobile charger and for grid services: utilisation rate = 90%, versus 0.5% of the to 60 kWh battery of a 100 kWh vehicle (10% long distance of a car used 5% of the time). With a utilisation rate 180 times higher than larger batteries stranded inside large EVs, and massive and fast growing market, we do have a unique business model.
