Solution on-sentence summary: Off-grid toilets with a sustainable technology of treating and recycling wastewater during flushes
Identification:
By combining the know-how developed with international research centers to the French design expertise, WeCo is offering the first ecological, off-grid and design flush toilets, solving the customer pains of wasting clean water for flushing and having yet no reliable nor sustainable water flush off-grid toilet. 

The toilet flushes operate in a closed circuit, treating and recycling the wastewater on-site, and require no connection to an external water network.

WeCo enables the ecological transition of urban sanitation systems, especially in emerging cities where the sanitation solutions linked with strong urbanization are major issues. WeCo toilets can be plugged everywhere to any kind of toilet's environment and enable the clients to move them from a place to another easily, depending on the various needs.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Credibility
Tags: Off-grid, Toilets, Water-networks, Domestic & municipal wastewater, Black water
The environmental benefits: WeCo is using 36 times less water than other toilets;6,000L instead of 219,000L per year with all the comfort and security of wired toilets (for 100 daily flushes for 1 year);The bacteria in the effluents are 99.99% removed within 2 hours, producing a drinkable water quality and ensuring that the water is bacteria and virus free, which is now essential with the pandemic risk;WRET Toilets are producing 10,950L of clean water (and 0L of wastewater) per year ;
The Financial benefits: 2 to 5 times cheaper than regular public toilets as they do not need to be connected to the water network, with an average cost of 270K€/km of sewerage;WeCo wastewater treating, reducing and recycling technology, designed for a long-term autonomy (minimum of 3 months), do not need to be often emptied like chemical/dry/train toilets require (up to 27K€/y);
Complementary solutions: Kelda Technology: Halve the amount of water used by your shower without diminishing the experience (Buildings & Shelters,Water);Water Widget: A simple and inexpensive device for reducing water usage in showering applications (Buildings & Shelters,Water);Hydraloop: A fully automatic stylish in-house greywater recycling system (Buildings & Shelters,Water,Waste & Pollution);AQUA4D: Water-Smart Irrigation: Precision irrigation for water efficiency and land restoration (Food & Agriculture,Water);
Organization short description: The First Off-grid Water Recycling Eco Toilets, treating and recycling the wastewater from the toilets, into flushes.
About:
The technology used by WeCo allows the transformation of the wastewater coming from the toilets, into treated water for flushing. The toilet flush is integrated in a closed water circuit and does not need connection to the sewerage.

WeCo toilets even produce a surplus of clean water, which could, for example, be used for watering the surrounding area. They also produced bio-treated sludge that can be reused for agriculture in a circular economy spirit.

The local treatment and recycling enable WeCo toilets to be off-grid and therefore mobile from a place to another. 

This innovative patented and internationally awarded technology is specifically adapted for emerging cities where there is no water, no sewerage, no sanitation plant and a strong growing urbanization leading to social, health and environmental problems. Our aim is to have a large positive environmental and social impact, by scaling with and industrial and international approach.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: A solar-powered pay-as-you-go technology that enables affordable and reliable access to cooling
Identification: In Sub-Saharan Africa, there are over 700 million people who do not have access to electricity and therefore lack access to refrigeration. This leads to food and vaccine wastage. Using the power of the sun and water, Koolboks created an affordable off-grid solution that is able to generate continuous refrigeration for up to 4 days, even in the absence of power and limited sunlight by storing energy in the form of ice, rather than in batteries. This technology brings down the cost of owning an off-grid solar refrigerator by close to 40%. Moreover, PAYGO technology is integrated in the freezers. This made them even more affordable and enables customers to pay in monthly, weekly, or daily instalments. Thanks to Koolboks, now individuals, pharmacies, or healthcare facilities can pay as low as 30$ to own a solar off-grid refrigerator.

Target client profile: Individual, Local NGO, BusinessServicesRetailerFood & Supermaket, BusinessServicesRestaurants & Canteens
Tags: Electric, Off-grid, Cooling, Solar photovoltaic

The Financial benefits: A customer owning a 210L Koolhome freezer spends $1630 over 2 years compared to the customer owning an AC freezer, who spends $2180 over the same period (34% savings);With the PAYGO technology, customer can pay over a period of 12, 18 or 24 months and this reduces the huge upfront cost;Storing energy in the form of ice brings down the cost of owning our product by around 40%.;

Solution on-sentence summary: Fast paint repair solution which maximizes aircraft availability.
Identification:
During operation and maintenance, aircraft coatings can be locally damaged by erosion, lightning strike, bird strike, or ground service equipment. In most cases, these impacts are a few centimeters in diameter. The structure is initially not impacted but can degrade over time if the paint is not repaired (for example, because of corrosion).



Local repair of a paint system is a lengthy process, requiring surface preparation, followed by the application of multiple paint layers: anticorrosion, primer and a topcoat. Such a process, including drying times, can take up to 10 hours. This leads to airlines leaving defects untreated, or making temporary repairs.



Corso Magenta proprietary technology answers this challenge by making dry films out of standard paints that are adhesived. It allows making repairs in a quick and clean manner.



The solution is a 10cm diameter adhesive patch of aeronautical grade paint, for carrying out permanent repairs in less than 40min: CorsoPatch Aircraft.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility
Target client profile: BusinessServicesInfrastructureAirports and Airbases, BusinessServicesTransportersAirlines & Airfreight, BusinessManufacturingAircrafts & Airplanes
Tags: Paints, Chemicals, Industrial coating, Maintenance and inspection, Reduce & prevent waste, Aviation
The environmental benefits: With liquid paint, workers are exposed to VOC (Volatile Organic Compound) and Chromates: Corso Magenta's solution is 100% dry (without VOC);Corso Magenta's solution is chromate free, and therefore REACH Compliant;For every paint repair, around 5 paint units are consumed when only 1 unit is used on the aircraft (80% is wasted): Corso Magenta's solution reduces paint waste by 95%;
The Financial benefits: Paint repairs are 25% cheaper than with liquid paint;All consumables linked to paint usage are saved;All disposable protective equipment linked to paint usage are saved;

(Freight,Mobility);

About:
Solfium is a Canadian corporation that was created to accelerate the transition towards sustainability, by giving people an easy way to adopt Solar energy to reduce their carbon footprint, while saving money. According to the International Energy Agency, to achieve CO2 NetZero by 2050, the largest solar park currently in service needs to be replicated, every day for the next 30 years! This is not feasible and is the reason we believe that installing distributed roof-top solar energy systems on every home and business is the best solution. Unfortunately, rapid adoption of distributed solutions is difficult in today’s market because it is complex, inefficient and lacks customer focus. Solfium removes these barriers by reinventing the customer experience through a simple and innovative platform, combined with amazing customer service.

Solfium currently operates in the Querétaro region of Mexico, but plans to expand into Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and India. In the Mexican market, Solfium is the only provider of an online platform for customers to manage the full life-cycle of solar power adoption. Solfium is dedicated to simplifying the customer experience: from offering an entirely online calculator for fixed, instant quotes based on monthly energy consumption, to providing real-time monitoring, support for maintenance, and additional services all from the app. With Solfium, the power of the sun is in the palm of your hand!

Solution on-sentence summary: A photovoltaic water (pre)heater to reduce household-heating bills by the on-site full use of solar energy
Identification: People would like to use renewable energy for their homes but they don’t because the investment is important, they are complex to install and maintain, and, even with subsidies, not cost effective, especially for small installation.  At Wanit, we thought it should be as simple and economical as plugging a few photovoltaic panels into its water heater that stores or uses all the free solar electricity every day. Families can reduce their hot water bill by up to 85% for decades. A buffer battery can be plugged for night heating & extra storage. The system guarantees their lifetime. A small sunny area can finally be enhanced. With no operating bearing, this PVheater follows the production curve without loss.  For larger PV fields, Wanit improves self-consumption and increase profitability. Thanks to its high compactness and the satellite boiler, the Wanit system allows the elimination of distribution pipes and water loops (less copper, energy and water losses)

Organization short description: Wanit system makes small photovoltaic fields profitable by dedicating electricity to daily sanitary hot water needs.
About:
Wanit wants renewable energy in every homes.



People would like to use renewable energy for their homes but they don’t because the investment is important, they are complex to install and maintain, and finally, even with subsidies, not cost effective, especially for small installation. Since it becomes mandatory, they are unhappy. 



Still, installing them should be as simple and cheap as plugging a few photovoltaic panels into its water heater that stores or uses all the free solar electricity, every day. This is what Wanit does, with the guarantee of a reduction in hot water bill by up to 85% for decades.



A small area exposed to the sun can finally be enhanced. Everyone can contribute on their own scale.



Wanit  also manage the charge and discharge of batteries, that increase storage capacity, and allows night heating while protecting them to ensure a lifespan of more than 10 years.



For larger photovoltaic fields, Wanit significantly improves self-consumption, reducing losses and increasing profitability. 



The Wanit system guarantees the thermal treatment of heated water to ensure its potability. 



Thanks to its high compactness that allows it to be installed close to the needs and the satellite boiler, the Wanit system allows the elimination of energy and water losses from the distribution pipes and remote storage, as well as the removal of hot water loops so energy-intensive. As a result, the need for copper in construction is reduced.

Solution on-sentence summary: A mercury-free ultraviolet water treatment to protect potable water from dangerous microorganisms
Identification: UV disinfection has been a mainstay in water treatment plants for over 20-years, used to protect potable water from dangerous microorganisms such as cryptosporidium. Typhon has developed a solution applying low power, solid-state UVC-LED light sources to high flow rate, water treatment applications. Typhon's innovative, sustainable, solutions bring unique operational advantages including environmentally friendly, mercury-free UV LED Disinfection to Municipal Water Treatment Plants and Industrial Process Water. The big technical challenge for the industry has been how to apply UVLEDs to a 24/7, high flowrate application as required for a municipal water treatment plant - Typhon has delivered that solution.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Water-networks, Domestic & municipal wastewater, Water quality, Water & Wastewater treatment
Sectors: Infrastructures, Waste/Pollution, Water, Water supply, Water efficiency, Wastewater management
The environmental benefits: No Mercury. Complying with the UN Minamata Convention and RoHs Compliant;Less than 50% power consumption over the systems operating life;Zero waste, with no requirement for the regulated disposal of mercury lamps;
The Financial benefits: Whole Life Cost Saving - reducing UV System cost of ownership by more than 25% ;Reducing UV System footprint requirement by more than 50% due to reduced infrastructure requirements;
Complementary solutions: OSMOSUN: A sustainable, flexible energy source for affordable and renewable water for all (Water);REM: A novel acid regeneration system for steel pickling (Waste & Pollution,Water,Industry & Consumer Goods);Kelda Technology: Halve the amount of water used by your shower without diminishing the experience (Buildings & Shelters,Water);WATA™ technology: Devices to enable local treatment and disinfection of water (Water);
Organization short description: Typhon Treatment Systems Ltd. is a UK registered water treatment equipment manufacturing company formed in 2014 to develop ultraviolet (UV) light emitting diode (LED) water treatment technology.
About:
In 2013 Typhons founders, Peter McNulty and Matt Simpson were consultants, working on a community water project in Nigeria.

They were looking for a simple to use, efficient and chemical free water treatment process and started to explore the concept of UV LED. 

UV disinfection has been a mainstay in water treatment plants for over 20 years, used to protect the public from harmful pathogens such as cryptosporidium.

Over that same timescale the world has seen a revolution in the white lighting industry with energy saving LEDs now the predominant light source everywhere from our homes and workplaces to our cars and bicycles.

However, by 2013 the only UV water treatment systems available which could treat largescale flowrates of water used mercury UV lamps which are power hungry, difficult to maintain, and contains toxic material.  

Though it had been discussed widely as a concept by UV System manufacturers, in 2013 Matt and Peter could not find a company with the capability to develop a UV LED System to meet their needs.

So, in 2014 Typhon Treatment Systems was founded to create one.

In the early years, the fledgling company battled with the development of a UV system which needed to be quite different to traditional mercury lamp systems. Until 2016 when the LED technology had developed to a point where it was feasible to build a full-scale reactor.

The BIO-310 was born and, with the aid of the United Utilities Innovation Lab, the first field trial were carried out in 2017.

By this time, the interest in what Typhon were doing was growing – from both water companies and competitors – but there was an important step required before Typhon could truly claim to have a product to sell.

3rd Party Validation is required as proof of a UV Systems performance capabilities before it can be sold to a water utility. Typhon completed the world’s first validation of a UV LED system – to the USEPA (United States Environmental Protection Agency) protocol – in July 2018. 

UV LED, for high flow rate, 24/7 operation applications had arrived.

Soon after the validation was complete Typhon was awarded a 10-year innovation framework by United Utilities and is currently in the process of installing a first commercial project and the world’s first Municipal UV LED installation at United Utilities Cumwhinton Water Treatment Works in Cumbria which, after some considerable COVID related delays will be completed in early 2021.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure

Solution on-sentence summary: An on-farm water treatment solution to improve operations throughout the food supply chain
Identification: Food sustains us and fuels our wellbeing, however food systems are impacting our planet. Producing a safe, abundant food supply is one of our greatest challenges and manure, when handled precisely, can regenerate our soils to create healthier and more abundant food. Traditional practices involved managing manure in lagoons. This is one of the most low-tech, difficult, expensive and limiting problems facing the livestock industry today. PLANT, on-farm water treatment solution, produces MORE food using LESS resources, reversing the environmental impacts of protein agriculture. While transforming manure into clean water, PLANT creates two fertilizers containing 13 essential nutrients and valuable organics that regenerate soils, so they become more fertile. 1 in 5 people live in marginal environments where soil is poor, and land has little or no agricultural value. The Solution digitizes manure to increase agricultural productivity, disrupting global food systems with lagoon-free food production. PLANT is machine learning enabled, using the power of data and AI to unlock worth-from-waste; allowing producers to grow more crops and produce more food using less money and fewer resources

Identification: Bulk Trip Assist aims to standardize the logistics analyst’s approach to scheduling bulk deliveries through use of an interactive tool that assists the analyst in optimising the vehicle routing (minimising kilometers) and inventory routing (maximising kg/km) on deliveries while respecting business rules and constraints. Having validated the vehicle routing in the proof of concept, the small scale commercialisation enhanced the tool’s capability of inventory routing to maximise kilograms of product per kilometer driven while also increasing interactivity features to allow logistics analysts more flexibility in planning shifts. The logistics analyst will remain the final decision maker, using the tool to support their work.

Organization short description: A world leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health.
About: Air Liquide is present in 80 countries with approximately 66,000 employees and serves more than 3.6 million customers and patients. Oxygen, nitrogen and hydrogen are essential small molecules for life, matter and energy. They embody Air Liquide’s scientific territory and have been at the core of the company’s activities since its creation in 1902.Air Liquide’s ambition is to be a leader in its industry, deliver long term performance and contribute to sustainability. The company’s customer-centric transformation strategy aims at profitable growth over the long term. It relies on operational excellence, selective investments, open innovation and a network organization implemented by the Group worldwide. Through the commitment and inventiveness of its people, Air Liquide leverages energy and environment transition, changes in healthcare and digitization, and delivers greater value to all its stakeholders. Air Liquide’s revenue amounted to 21 billion euros in 2018 and its solutions that protect life and the environment represented more than 40% of sales. Air Liquide is listed on the Euronext Paris stock exchange (compartment A) and belongs to the CAC 40, EURO STOXX 50 and FTSE4Good indexes.

Solution on-sentence summary: IGS’ vertical farming solution enables 24/7/365 cultivation of crops in a precisely controlled indoor environment.
Identification:
Think of a 300m2 sized field (for example, 50m X 60m). Then cut the field up into 50 full-size snooker table size sections (6m2 area). These sections, or Growth Trays with Lights (GTLs), are stacked around 250mm apart in two racking systems and placed inside a superstructure to create a Growth Tower (GT).

This superstructure is built to IGS’ specifications and designed to be built on structurally sound locations worldwide. Each GT houses IGS’ patented lighting, ventilation, and irrigation systems. The GT is controlled and monitored, on-site or remotely, using IGS’ cloud software. GTs are available in 6m, 9m and 12m heights. One 9m GT, for example, has a 40m2 footprint and a growing area of around 320m2. With 12 crop cycles per annum for crops like Basil, two 9m GTs can grow enough Basil to fill a football pitch. Two 12m GTs can fill one hectare. Our solution can also grow field ready starter plants like broccoli in 15 days compared to six weeks using traditional methods.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: BusinessFarming & AgricultureCrops, Public Authorities, BusinessServicesRetailerFood & Supermaket, BusinessServicesRestaurants & Canteens
Tags: Automation, Indoor farming, Agricultural Waste, Agricultural equipment & machinery, Agricultural wastewater
The environmental benefits: Our solution can operate in climates between -40°C and +50°C (from Finland to the UAE).;Two 12 m Growth Towers require a footprint that is just one hundredth of a hectare of land to achieve one hectare of cultivation area.;60% of the cultivation process is automated (level four, adaptive automation). Growth Towers are one of the few systems with 60% automation (adaptive automation). Many alternative vertical farming systems have an automation level of 40% or 20%.;By growing crops closer to the point of production or consumption our solution can reduce food transport miles by 96%.;94% less water (compared to greenhouse production). All water that is not used in the crops can be recycled and re-used. ;0 (zero) pesticides, fungicides or herbicides are used in our solution.;
The Financial benefits: Grow high quality crops 24/7 365 with total control of climate variables for consistent and predictable results.;Reduce growth cycles by 30-50% compared to glasshouse and open field farming. For example, Micro leaf 3 to 8 days; Baby leaf 14 to 30 days; Herb 13 to 38 days; Lettuce (head) 49 days.;Significantly reduce food waste in the food supply chain which currently contributes 30% of all GHG emissions. Eg, 95% of strawberry seedlings grown in UK are imported and contain pests and disease.;
Complementary solutions: NEXUS: An alternative for sustainable development of smallholder farmers and fisheries communities (Food & Agriculture);AgRho® S-Boost: An innovative solution for the treatment of seeds (Food & Agriculture);AQUA4D: Water-Smart Irrigation: Precision irrigation for water efficiency and land restoration (Food & Agriculture,Water);Living Farming Tree: A sustainable mini-indoor farm for urban farming (Food & Agriculture);
Organization short description: IGS takes Controlled Environment Agriculture (CEA) a step further with Total Controlled Environment Agriculture.
About:
IGS takes Controlled Environment Agriculture (CEA) a step further with Total Controlled Environment Agriculture. CEA is reactive and yields inconsistent results. TCEA enables predictable and consistent cultivation in any suitable location. 



At IGS we use the three dimensions of weather (sun, wind and rain) to create the ideal growing environment. In our Growth Towers, these three elements are known as illumination, ventilation and irrigation. Cloud software, automation, mechanisation, innovative LED lighting, HVAC, irrigation systems are at the heart of IGS’ TCEA platform.



Each element of the Growth Tower works harmoniously and efficiently to create a growing environment that precisely and consistently produces high yields for a diverse variety of crops without fungicides, herbicides and pesticides.

Solution on-sentence summary: Emission is an NUE (Nitrogen Utilization Efficiency) sensor system to quantify the volume of lost ammonia nitrogen during application of slurry.
Identification:
More than 1.4 million ton of nitrogen is lost every year form the use of animal slurry.  This has a socialtal cost of +48 billion Euro.  It is one of the world’s largest greenhouse gas emission contributions, air pollutant and sources of lost biodiversity.    

e-missioN sensor system is a solution that delivers information for a database to translate slurry- and climate variations into an accurate nitrogen emission loss assessment during slurry application.

This enables significantly improved management decisions for following mineral nitrogen application dosage rates.  The result is improved yields and savings on use of mineral fertilizers.  

e-missioN creates exceptional sustainability in avoided greenhouse gasses, air pollution and eutrophication.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Nitrogen, Fertilizing, Agricultural equipment & machinery, Sensors & monitoring, Software
The environmental benefits: 1 emissioN system can reduce use of 20 ton of nitrogen equivalent to 114 ton of CO2e.  ;Accurate fertilization dosage rates enables 10 % higher yield, estimated to be 32.000 € pr. year.;Identification of GPS position- and need for variable rate application further reduces need for nitrogen fertilizers and enables higher yield.  The combined effect is +100.000 € pr. year and with a significant reduction in loss of biodiversity.;Up to 20 % reduction in use of mineral fertilizer through improved use of organic fertilizer;Reduced P.M 2.5 air pollution because of reduced ammonia emission;10 % reduction in leaching of nitrogen;
The Financial benefits: 1 to 12 month payback time;Enables continued app. 50 € pr. ha subsidy support from EU through improved sustainability (EU Green Deal);20 % reduced use of mineral fertilizer results in reduced cost for mineral fertilizer and increased yield;

Organization short description: BioCover is specialised in sustainable use of organic fertilisers (slurry) during application to farmland.
About: SyreN system uses the technique of acidification (sulphuric acid) to change ammonia (gas) to ammonium (salt) during application of slurry. This reduces the emission of ammonia with up to 70% which eliminates airborne eutrophication. At the same time the method applies the correct amount of sulphur as sulphate fertilizer.

Solution on-sentence summary: A platform to centralize data and provide actionable insights in the construction industry
Identification:
Hiboo helps companies in the construction sector to use equipment data in order to maximize their productivity, profitability and lower their carbon footprint.

Its SaaS solution collects and processes data from multiple sources offering unprecedented visibility and transparency over a fleet's performance. Hiboo creates instant value by feeding software solutions with clean dynamic data. While struggling in its digital transition, the construction sector is actually experiencing a perfect storm of data for which it is a major contributor. Data is flowing but very difficult to access mostly because construction companies have to collect data from tens of different sources. This data is even harder to process, clean and standardise because it comes in different formats, units and velocity. This is where Hiboo comes in: its mission is to help the sector to democratise access to construction equipment data. Hiboo centralizes data collected from all connected equipment on a single end point and turn it into actionable insights. With clean and dynamic data reflecting equipment activities, productivity, emissions in real time, clients are now able to measure their fleet performance and take action.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Partners, Network
Tags: Heavy duty vehicles, Construction, Software, Vehicles, Trucks, Route optimization
Sectors: Buildings, Infrastructures, Logistics, Energy and fuel efficiency

Solution on-sentence summary: An industrial fire suppression system using pure nitrogen gas to protect critical assets
Identification: ExxFire is a disruptive industrial fire suppression company, using patented pressureless nitrogen gas storage technology called Cool N2 Gas Generators (CGG). These replace high-pressure gas tanks with a safer, greener, easier to handle, and maintenance-free alternative. The nitrogen gas released from CGGs potentially offsets 7-10 megatons of CO2 equivalent p.a. from current solutions, whose cylinders filled with environmentally impacting chemical or CO2 gas. The CGGs technology, available for business-critical cabinet protection with integrated smoke or heat detection, is sold/installed worldwide. The CGGs technology is being scaled to larger volumes to enter the largest part of the €4.6bn global market, providing a safe, green and more economical alternative. A segment is preventing the start of thermal runaways of lithium-ion battery energy storage systems (BESS) that otherwise end in fire and possibly in explosions and a 2nd segment is the ever-growing data center segment.

ExxFire is a spin out of the European Space Agency, having developed its disruptive technology into an adjacent area of industrial fire suppression. The business is a technological disruptor in a very large but staid global market, and has successfully developed its technology into products which it is now selling into the market. 



The company trades in a global market worth around $5.2bn (2021) growing 6.2% per year. It has developed six new products in the last year and has been selling right through the Covid trough this year. Most importantly, ExxFire also comes with a phenomenal “green” impact in terms of reducing the GWP of competing products now widely in use globally. The global industry currently deploys gasses in suppressing industrial fires which are damaging to the atmosphere. The calculations show that the current a GWP equivalent to the release of 7-10 million tons of CO2 annually, whereas ExxFire’s technology, employing pure nitrogen to suppress the fire, will have zero GWP or ODP.

Solution on-sentence summary: A software to improve the reliability and longevity of Li-ion batteries
Identification:
The M.A.P® technology aims to optimize the performance and longevity of lithium-ion batteries. Based on more than ten years of research within the CEA laboratory, the technology focuses on preserving batteries throughout their lifetimes, in accordance with their use and environment. MAP® stands for Measure, Act and Predict. 

The Solution measures the actual State-of-Health (SoH) during its use, thereby always guaranteeing its reliability and capacity. It then acts by giving customized and dynamic charging laws based on the battery’s health, environment, and use in order to increase its lifetime by up to 100%. Finally, it predicts the battery remaining useful life according to its use and the aging mechanisms it faces. The data collection and process throughout the battery lifetime enables to eventually guide toward the most suitable second life.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessEnergy Utility, BusinessServicesInfrastructureRoads & Road Traffic Infrastructure
Tags: Batteries - energy storage, Cars, Software, Vehicles, Service
Sectors: Energy, Mobility, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: Battery State-of-Health diagnosis at ±2% accuracy ;+20 to +100% battery lifetime extension;50% battery waste avoided;Reduction of emissions associated with batteries (by up to 50%) by extending their lifetime;
The Financial benefits: Less than 3 years payback time;12% savings in operating cost;

Organization short description: PowerUp enhances the reliability and longevity of Li-ion batteries, while giving indication on predictive maintenance.
About:
Founded in 2017, PowerUp has developed a breakthrough technology based on more than ten years of research by CEA-LITEN (innovation laboratory for new energy technologies), as well as on a total of 9 patents. Its solutions aim to optimise the performance and lifetime of lithium-ion batteries in order to enhance the reliability and longevity of electric systems.



With the energy transition in full swing, battery use is growing exponentially, and users are being forced to replace batteries early as a precaution, creating a genuine ecological issue. PowerUp is committed to taking the step towards greener energy by enabling sustainable, reliable management of battery fleets.



The MAP (Measure, Act, Predict) technology developed

by PowerUp is focused on preserving batteries throughout their lifetimes, taking in account their use

and environment.

- PowerUp diagnoses and measures the real state of health of batteries, thereby guaranteeing their autonomy.

- It increases the lifetime of batteries by up to 100%, via dynamic charging based on the battery’s health,environment and use.

- Finally, Powerup predicts the remaining lifetime of batteries according to simulation models and field data, and gives indications on Second Life



PowerUp’s solution is currently aimed at all manufacturers and operators who use batteries

under power-cycle conditions or for backup power applications.

Solution on-sentence summary: Reusable cosmetics to avoid single-use materials in the skin-care and bodycare industry
Identification:
Amalthea aims at providing a safe solution in cosmetics including skincare, bodycare and hygiene. All the ingredients are safe. All the bottles are in glass and refillable.

From the production to the bathroom shelf, everything has been developed in a zero-waste approach to minimize the impact on the environment while offering the best cosmetics experience. The Amalthea routine is simple and answers to the skin needs. The products are by skin type. The packaging, apart from the bottle, is limited to a leaflet around the top of the bottle and some cardboard to protect.

Either online or in our Parisian boutique, the solution offers the same client experience with a customized approach. Refill is easy in both ways. By mail or in boutique, Amalthea receives the empty bottle, cleans, sterilizes and refills it: ready to use it indefinitely!  Amalthea fills and refills all the products in store where the same norms that are applied to any cosmetics laboratories are respected.

Solution on-sentence summary: Providing Power-to-X and Gas-to-Liquid applications to produce sustainable e-fuels and e-products
Identification: Every day we use products that are based on fossil raw materials. We are heavily dependent on fossil oil, causing massive CO2 emissions every day.  As a society, we have decided to move towards a CO2-neutral world with fewer emissions and have recorded these decisions in the Paris Climate Agreement. Renewable energy and e-mobility are solutions that drive this sustainable future. But as time passes, it becomes increasingly clear that this will not be enough. Industries such as chemicals, (heavy) transport, shipping and aviation will continue to rely on hydrocarbons for quite some time for technical reasons. INERATEC provides modular chemical plants for Power-to-X  applications and supplies sustainable e-fuels and e-products that can replace their fossil versions. Hydrogen from renewable electricity and greenhouse gases like CO2 are converted into e-kerosene, CO2-neutral gasoline, clean Diesel or synthetic waxes, methanol or SNG.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

About: INERATEC provides modular chemical plants for Power-to-X and Gas-to-Liquid applications and supplies sustainable fuels and products. Hydrogen from renewable electricity and greenhouse gases like CO2 are converted into e-kerosene, CO2-neutral gasoline, clean Diesel or synthetic waxes, methanol or SNG.The innovative reactors provide a high load flexibility as well as quick start-up and shut-down times. Solution on-sentence summary: A lubricant as a substitute to the mineral oils currently used in the metal forming industry
Identification: The metal forming/working industries are totally dependent on the mineral oils, obtained from crude oil by distillation processes, to ensure the success of the forming operations. AFULudine is offering today a new way to design these metal forming operations. Indeed, acting as a surface treatment by using non-toxic molecules having excellent tribological properties, it is now possible for the user to re-design production processes to converge towards a simpler (e.g. suppression of the degreasing step, simplification of the water management, etc..), safer and efficient process, with higher productivity and zero risks for the environment. This solution provides a non-toxic, lower environmental-impact solution for industry.

Organization short description: AFULudine SAS is a start-up, created in September 2016, specialized in synthesis chemistry and surface treatment.
About: In most industries, different types of oils are used. Some are dangerous to the health, all lead to a necessity of the cleaning of the processed materials. AFULudine was created to bring about a new solution. This company is based on the patented research works of three university researchers, each in their own field, Mr LALLEMAND in surface treatment, Mr MELOT in organic synthesis and Mr ROIZARD in tribology. The original idea came from Mr LALLEMAND, who thought of using a non-oily lubricant that would save the costly steps of cleaning the materials. The lubricant is made from water and/or alcohol plus the active ingredient, synthesized by the company. The process is in the metal treatment, as the active molecules will attach themselves to the surface, creating a thin layer on the metal. The main advantage is the fact that after the application, the solvent evaporates and leaves behind just our active molecules. This means after one application, you can work the material even if you spayed it up to 7 months beforehand. The lubricants are as good as the oils used today.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Multi-Drain geothermal well for decarbonising district heating networks
Identification: Heating in buildings is at the core of energy consumption. Thus decarbonise energy sources is crucial to reduce associated emissions. Geothermal district heating is defined as the use of geothermal sources to supply heat to a group of buildings through a distribution network. The main benefits of geothermal sources are provision of local, and flexible renewable energy. Even though there are plenty of geothermal sedimentary reservoirs to use, there is sometimes heterogeneities of geological properties that limited productivity. The goal is then to optimise the draining area and thus to increase the overall energy extracted from the ground. This multidrains technology steps up the efficiency of a geothermal solution.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility
Tags: Underground, Geothermal power, District heating & cooling, Drilling and extraction
The environmental benefits: Around 80% more efficient compared to a conventional solution;Saving 640,000 tons of CO2 over 30 years exploitation period compared to a fossil energy solution;

Identification:
FIS V Zero is a solution allowing to replace highly polluting products in the construction domain, especially regarding the 

chemical fixings segment. This product has a focus on health and safety requirements. It therefore does not contain any peroxide, complies with the strict REACh regulation by not needing labelling hazard symbols, nor having a safety data sheet, nor having to make H-/P or EUH statements. Is is an environmentally friendly product, and its performance has been approved by an independent institute resulting in a certification of the European Technical Assessment (ETA) for applications in cracked & uncracked concrete, masonry and for post-installed rebar connection. This product is suitable for a large variety of standard applications with the main audience being the professional construction industry as well as in the DIY end users.

The fischer Group of Companies, headquartered in Waldachtal in Germany’s northern Black Forest, generated sales of 872 million euro in 2020 with a worldwide staff of 5,200 employees. The family-owned company operates 50 subsidiaries in 38 countries and exports to more than 120 countries. It includes the five divisions: fischer fixing systems, fischer Automotive, fischertechnik, fischer Consulting and LNT Automation

fischer fixing systems is the technological market leader in key areas of fixing technology. fischer offers products that deliver technical perfection to a wide range of customers, from do-it-yourselfers to tradespeople to key account partners.

fischer Automotive manufactures high-quality parts for vehicle interiors. The company is highly competent in the plastics processing segment and is an important partner for the automotive industry. Its range of products includes air vents, cup holders, trays and multi-function components.

With its construction kits, fischertechnik is active in both the toymaking and the educational sector. fischertechnik is one of the last remaining toy makers to exclusively develop and produce in Germany.

fischer Consulting evolved from the competence developed in the company itself, which includes the fischer ProcessSystem with its central aim of permanent improvement for the ultimate benefit of the customer. fischer Consulting advises small and medium-sized businesses, government agencies and major companies on their path towards lean and efficient processes.

LNT Automation develops and manufactures custom electronic solutions. The company also develops, produces and distributes custom and capacitive touch systems such as multi-touch solutions made of glass and the corresponding controller units. All electronics are manufactured in-house.

Solution on-sentence summary: Affordable, compressed air and thermal energy storage at half the cost of lithium-ion
Identification: Cheesecake Energy’s eTanker is a stationary, medium-long-duration energy storage solution which delivers cheap, reliable, efficient energy storage in a modular, containerised package. ​ The technology stores energy in the form of heat and pressurised air, adapting ex-service truck engines with our patented modifications to become zero-emission electrical power-conversion machines for putting energy into storage and recovering it from storage. Our proprietary system architecture unlocks low-cost performance in a compact footprint that represents a step change in compressed air energy storage capabilities.​ The system is safe, straightforward to operate, has a lifetime of up to 25 years and can deliver turnaround efficiencies of 65-70%. ​​​ eTanker can discharge at full power for up to 20 hours at 30-40% lower cost than lithium-ion batteries and can be deployed flexibly as power and energy are scaled separately from one another.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Electrical grid, Smart-grid, TES (thermal energy storage), Containerized
The environmental benefits: Can be cycled10,000 times with negligible degradation;Can operate in a wider range of operating environments from -20ºC to +50ºC (-4 °F to +122 °F)  compared to lithium-ion systems which are are efficient from 0 °C to +40 °C (32 °F to +104 °F);70% turnaround efficiency;At the end of its 25 year lifetime, 99% of CEL eTanker can be fully recycled;
The Financial benefits: Up to 40% cheaper than lithium-ion batteries ;Less than 7 year payback and as little as 3 years in some key markets;Targeting a €270/kWh total installed price (150kW-30MW, 8 hour duration);
Complementary solutions: Storage GEM®: Smart energy management system in containerized storage units for rapid deployment (Energy);Smart Energy Hub: An innovative hydrogen-based energy storage solution for buildings (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Cool Green Energy Factory: An innovative energy concept to make cooling processes economically and ecologically sustainable (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);Solar GEM® (Green Energy in Motion): Smart energy management system for solar power plants (Energy);
Organization short description: CEL's eTanker system uses compressed air & thermal storage to achieve costs 30-40% lower than lithium-ion batteries
About: Cheesecake Energy Ltd (CEL) aims to enable 100% penetration of renewable energy to power electricity grids and mini-grids right across the globe. As an OEM supplier of hardware solutions to energy storage project developers, our eTanker product provides the cheapest and greenest energy storage technology, which can be sized, transported and installed quickly and flexibly. It works by using electricity to compress air, storing the high grade heat and high pressure air until the electricity is needed again when the air is reheated and expanded to drive a motor which generates converting the stored energy back to electricity. The optimal size of an eTanker system is ideal for charging fleets of electric vehicles, supplying a residential neighbourhood or factory, or helping renewable generators to manage intermittency.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: A new generation of innovative high performance, eco-friendly servers
Identification: 2CRSi is actively participating in the redesign of hardware technology to meet the growing demands of IT infrastructure. Its strength resides in the understanding of customer needs: servers are streamlined and customized to ensure performance whilst reducing energy consumption. Compared to the traditional 19’’ server size, the 21’’ form factor of the OCtoPus solution pushes the density of its servers to the next level. Mutualizing certain components makes it possible to reduce energy consumption by up to 23% compared to equivalent conventional systems. This strong commitment to Green IT gives clients a major competitive advantage, bearing in mind that energy can account for up to around 40% of their server operating costs. At 2CRSi, it is believed that IT can be reconciled with the planet.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners
Target client profile: BusinessEnergy Utility, BusinessServicesBuildings Operators, BusinessServicesICT Company & Data Centers
Tags: Data centers, Internet
The environmental benefits: 18 big mutualized fans at the level of the rack increase energy savings;Improved space efficiency and thermal dissipation in the servers make it possible to reduce power consumption by up to 23% compared to equivalent 19'' conventional systems;Servers are independent from the racks, which integrate fans and power inputs and can be 100% reused in case of a server upgrade;
The Financial benefits: Mutualised fans and power supplies allow for better space efficiency and an improved thermal dissipation of the components inside the servers, with a positive impact on the components' lifetime;With the 21'' server solution, up to €3985 savings per year (decrease in fans power consumption) compared to traditional 19" solutions;

Organization short description: 2CRSI Group designs and manufactures storage systems, high-performance, customised and environmental-friendly servers.
About:
Founded in Strasbourg (France), 2CRSi group develops, produces and sells high-performance customised and environment-friendly servers. 

The Group today has approximately 350 employees and markets its offer of innovative solutions (processing, storage and network) in more than 50 countries. 2CRSi has beenlisted since June 2018 on Euronext. 



As a global player in high performance and high efficiency server technology, the 2CRSi Group develops, manufactures and distributes end-to-end green IT and energy-efficient computing solutions. Through our different companies and brands, we deliver a broad range of IT solutions and services for a variety of markets, including cloud computing, data center, enterprise IT, big data, HPC, artificial intelligence, 5G, IoT, rugged PCs or embedded and edge computing.



From our offices in France, United Kingdom, Belgium, Holland, Germany, United States, United Arab Emirates, Singapore, India and Australia, we deliver across 50+ countries, tailor-made solutions for companies from various sectors and industries including aerospace, defense, security, oil & gas, healthcare, scientific research, telecommunications, automotive, banking, trading & finance, media & entertainment or web services.



2CRSi Group operates 6 complementary and global companies offering hardware solutions (2CRSi & Tranquil), datacenter housing & cloud services (Green Computing), IT consultancy & solution provider (Bios IT) and IT distribution networks (Boston and Escape Technology).

Solution on-sentence summary: A water and energy saving toilet designed for out-of-home use
Identification: Propelair has one goal: saving the world’s water resources, with every flush. It is the world's lowest water usage flush toilet, specifically for commercial use. The average UK toilet uses 6-9 litres of water to flush. Propelair uses just 1.5 litres of water & displaced air technology to create a powerful, high-performance flush which easily removes all waste with 1 flush. Because less water is needed, its system reduces the carbon footprint of the average toilet by 80%. Propelair reduces water & sewage bills by up to 60%  while paying for itself in just 1-3 years. It eliminates aerosolised germs (including Covid-19) by up to 95%, thanks to a closed-lid flush, creating a more hygienic washroom environment for users. Additionaly, the Solution refills in 30 seconds, reducing queues. It can be retrofitted to existing drains, requiring little to no refurbishment prior to installation. It's robust design makes it well suited for corporate & commercial washrooms, reducing maintenance costs.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Toilets, Grey water
The environmental benefits: Replaces a 6-9 litre flush with only 1.5 litre of water and 120 litres of displaced air to create a powerful, high performance flush (84% less water);Eliminates aerosolised germs (including Covid-19) by up to 95% thanks to its unique Close to Flush system;Currently saving over 1 billion million litres of water;up to 80% reduction of carbon emissions compared to mainstream;
The Financial benefits: Propelair reduces water & sewage bills by up to 60%;By saving on water & sewerage bills, Propelair pays for itself in as little as 1-3 years;Maintenance costs are reduced by 50% on average;
Activity Region - Countries: United Kingdom,United Arab Emirates,Bahrain,Kuwait,Oman,Qatar,Saudi Arabia,Singapore,Thailand,South Africa,Australia
Complementary solutions: Kelda Technology: Halve the amount of water used by your shower without diminishing the experience (Buildings & Shelters,Water);Water Widget: A simple and inexpensive device for reducing water usage in showering applications (Buildings & Shelters,Water);Hydraloop: A fully automatic stylish in-house greywater recycling system (Buildings & Shelters,Water,Waste & Pollution);AQUA4D: Water-Smart Irrigation: Precision irrigation for water efficiency and land restoration (Food & Agriculture,Water);
Organization short description: Propelair exists to save water resources by reinventing the toilet, for commercial spaces, with a 1.5 litre flush.
About: We have one goal: Saving the world’s water resources, with every flush. We manufacture the world's lowest water flush toilet, specifically for commercial / out-of-home use. Propelair uses only 1.5 litres of water per flush, much less than the UK average of 6-9 litres. Combining 1.5 litres of water and displaced air technology creates a powerful, high-performance flush which easily removes all waste with one flush. Washrooms generally account for around 90% of all water used in a commercial building. Because less water is needed, the Propelair system reduces the carbon footprint of the average toilet by up to 76% (by saving energy typically used at water treatment plants to process and pump water).  Propelair reduces water and sewage bills by up to 60%, thereby paying for itself in just 1-3 years. In addition to reducing water, energy and bills, Propelair also eliminates aerosolised germs (including Covid-19) by up to 95% thanks to a closed-lid flush, creating a more hygienic and healthier washroom environment for users. The powerful air-flush removes 95% of bacteria inside the bowl and antimicrobial additives in the handle further help reduce germs. Propelair quickly refills in 30 seconds compared to conventional systems which take 2-3 minutes, reducing queues, especially during periods of high usage. Propelair's robust design makes it well suited for high traffic washrooms in both corporate and high-traffic spaces and as such maintenance costs are reduced. It can be retrofitted into existing drains, requiring little to no refurbishment prior to installation. Propelair’s rimless pan and side hinges make previously hard-to-clean areas easily accessible, ensuring a thorough cleaning process can be carried out. In every respect Propelair is superior - making it the commercial toilet of choice.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Constructional building material made from tetra pak waste
Identification: Retrak PolyAI is a material product of the recycling of tetrapak containers, from the point of view of its use in the form of second use, it replaces the agglomerates of wood, obtaining a synthetic wood for the manufacture of different constructions. It acts as a thermal insulator. Its composition gives it properties, is very resistant to humidity, preventing water seepage caused by rain, etc, is noise isolating. Its acoustic properties are superior to other conventional materials, filtering up to 70% of external noise, and also is anticorrosive.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Visibility, Credibility
Tags: Recycled, Packaging & plastics waste, Recycle waste, Green building, Construction materials
The environmental benefits: 100% material recycled;17 trees saved per ton of raw material used;Saves 3000 kW of electrical energy during the recycling process;Reduce 1008 tons of water in constructions;With 1 ton of Retrak PolyAl 189,756 g/CO2e is avoided into the environment;Can last over 35 years;
The Financial benefits: Between 15-20% cheaper than mainstream alternative;Circular economy reduces 40% of operating costs;
Complementary solutions: RT7000: A machine to chemically recycle plastic waste back into oil (Industry & Consumer Goods,Waste & Pollution);BIO DISPERSIS LC: Recycle vinasse, a polluting residue from the alcohol industry, into organic additives for concrete (Waste & Pollution,Industry & Consumer Goods);iNex circular: A platform for optimizing waste and raw materials management (Industry & Consumer Goods,Waste & Pollution);SopraStar: Reducing urban warming by using solar reflective cool roof membrane (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: Retrak is a social enterprise that seeks to transform the trash from Tetrapak to PolyAI plates for construction.
About:
The PolyAI (Polymer-Aluminum) plates of Retrak are made of 45% polyethylene & 55% aluminum of Tetrapak packaging. Our true impact is in the usage of this material into something valuable towards building up the future.



With a ton of recycled tetrapak packages we saved 17 trees, 750kg of paper, 200kg of plastic, 26,500 liters of water and we generated 10 direct and indirect jobs, speaking of emissions we saved 1,425kg of CO2 in the environment.



Retrak beyond using a recycling material to create sustainable construction material we look forward to creating a Triple-Bottom-Line impact in which we support specific SDGs such as 8.4, 9.1, 9.4, 11.a, 12.5, 13.3, 15.4 & 17.19.



Retrak uses circular economy, promoting public policies in the generation of jobs and the usage of recycling materials, therefore cooperation with different organizations is a strategy that benefits both our process & business, making a collaborative impact. 



About the opportunity in our market research we founded out that in 2019, an estimated 33,000 tonnes of cartons were collected for recycling; any of the bales that were purchased for recycling had to be sent to the United States or to other international purchasers. Canada does have a recycling system for tetra bricks but the next opportunity is on how to approach better that material and create a social-environmental impact.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: An energy storage system for grid stabilization and EV charging stations
Identification: NW developed the JBox®, a battery-based energy storage system, to improve the efficiency of power management. It balances the electrical grid by charging when there is too much production and by injecting the electricity back when consumption is too important. A compact all-in-one device, the JBox is easy to install and to connect to the local distribution grid. The IECharge®, an electric vehicle charging station, is directly plugged to the solution. This enables the battery to release the pressure off the grid during the charge of a vehicle at great power - up to 320 kW. The project aims at creating a strong network of ultra-fast charging stations in order to develop the use of electric vehicles on long distances without having to worry about the autonomy.
Looking For: Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: BusinessServicesInfrastructureRoads & Road Traffic Infrastructure, BusinessServicesTransportersTrucks & Other Road Vehicles

Solution on-sentence summary: An energy-efficient electric motor technology for compressor and pumping applications
Identification: The Solution aims at enabling billions of homes, businesses and vehicles worldwide to lower significantly the environmental footprint of their compression, pumping, heating, cooling and refrigeration needs through the use of a new, ultra-high efficiency linear compressor and pump technology. The Solution relies on a disruptive new linear electric motor technology, the first of its kind to successfully use long-distance magnetic attraction and repulsion to deliver linear power in both directions at unprecedented levels of efficiency with characteristics that are perfectly suited to pumping and compression requirements. Oil-free, smaller and lighter, the Solution is a drop-in replacement to the dominant reciprocating-piston based technology, reducing manufacturing costs with fewer parts and less complexity as well as shorter and cheaper production and assembly lines. Finally, end users of the Solution will significantly lower their operating costs while benefiting from better products.
Looking For: Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Heat-pump, Motors, Air-conditioning, Water pumping, Building heating
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Heating, cooling and ventilation, Manufacturing and construction processes
The environmental benefits: 38% faster whilst using 33% less electricity than a reciprocating-piston air compressor having comparable size and weight for the performance of the same compression task;No power spikes on start-up whereas reciprocating-piston compressors can have power spikes up to x5 their operating consumption on start-up;Demonstrated a net efficiency of over 90% and at least 30% more efficient than reciprocating-piston based technology;No oil lubrication required;
The Financial benefits: 5 years payback time for production lines while servicing a loan covering their initial deployment costs and attending to the payment of their maintenance costs;By using the Solution for its refrigeration and air conditioning needs, a standard household would save between $91.6 (US) and $239.7 (Germany) per year;

Solution on-sentence summary: A decentralized treatment solution for transforming organic waste into compost
Identification: Acea has launched Acea Smart Comp, an innovative distributed composting project for managing organic waste, in line with the challenging goals set by the European Commission regarding the recovery of materials during the process for "closing the loop" in the waste cycle. Acea Smart Comps are local composting plants equipped with revolutionary sensor technology that transforms organic waste into compost on the spot, using an aerobic process that produces ready-to-use fertilizer. This initiative creates a new approach focused on proximity, which closes the gap between where the waste is produced and the place where it is processed. Distributed composting targets large customers (shopping malls, cafeterias, airports and stations) that need to manage large quantities of organic waste. The first Acea Smart Comp was installed in the Acea cafeteria, which will become organic waste-free.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessManufacturingFood Products, BusinessServicesBuildings Operators, BusinessServicesEntertainment, Leisure & Art Company, BusinessServicesInfrastructureAirports and Airbases, BusinessServicesRestaurants & Canteens, BusinessServicesRetailerFood & Supermaket
Tags: Organic, Composting, Food waste, Waste treatment
The environmental benefits: One Acea Smart Comp machine provides the capacity to handle 40 to 300 tons of organic waste at the location where it is produced;During the three phases of the composting process, the weight of the organic material is reduced by up to 80%;Per ton of dry waste, up to 500 kg of CO2 can be saved by decentralizing the treatment and not transporting waste by truck;Organic compost replaces carbon-intensive peat as fertilizer;
The Financial benefits: Customers can save a significant portion of treatment costs for their organic waste compared to traditional waste collection;Customers benefit from Acea's service model, providing Smart Comp machines without any initial investment costs (no CAPEX);

Organization short description: Mana Pacific aims to deliver resilient renewable energy projects while unifying the Pacific to fight the climate crisis!
About:
Mana Pacific's primary objective is to facilitate a critical movement in the Pacific to address the climate change crisis humanity currently faces.



We are currently in the seed investment stage and negotiations with our global multinational partners (one of the top three world's largest solar module manufacturers and leading project development entity) to launch the first and largest Renewable Energy Project Development Benefit Corporation (B-Corp) to empower the entire Pacific by providing financing that has traditionally not been available: access to tier-1 products with most favoured nation (MFN) pricing of all solar components (traditionally overpriced in this market). We also will enable the local utilities and government to own and operate the projects and provide an equity position in each project for the local community to receive long-term benefits aside from the massive energy savings. Additionally, Mana Pacific is working with several universities to record, document, and report on our systems and approach to provide a "Blueprint" or "Roadmap" with verifiable metrics of our various economic, social, and environmental benefits and impacts to the local communities, allowing others to use our success as a case study to propel global renewable development initiatives further.

Solution on-sentence summary: A digital solution for cost-efficient and sustainable aircraft management
Identification:
Pacelab Flight Profile Optimizer is a portable EFB application which gives crews fully actionable recommendations on the most cost-efficient way to complete their flights under the current conditions, carefully balancing operational considerations with passenger comfort and on-time performance. It optimizes holistically all flight phases from climb to descent, relying on high-fidelity and real time data to deliver information that is accurate, relevant and complete. Pacelab FPO also offers an optional Turbulence Module, which visualizes meteorological threats in the trajectory view and enables pilots to re-optimize the flight profile towards less turbulence-free flight level.  



Is vertical flight optimization not enough? We have teamed up Nexteon Technologies to create and integrated, multi-dimensional optimization solution which combines lateral optimization capabilities with the vertical flight profile optimization of Pacelab FPO in a single, powerful system.
By: PACE Aerospace Engineering & Information Technology GmbH
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Fuel efficiency
Sectors: Freight, Mobility, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: 1% to 2% fuel saving depending on aircraft type and flight type;More than 5 Million Tons of CO2 saved by Pacelab FPO at today;Pacelab FPO allows 1% to 4% CO2 emission reduction based on aircraft type.;Savings of 1% on average can results in an annual savings potential of 555.000t of carbon reduction from entering the atmosphere. These numbers are based on a fleet size of ~1200 Aircraft.;
The Financial benefits: Customer Airlines reported up to 4% in fuel savings on regional aircraft and 1% on modern mid and long-range Aircraft per flight which results in significant cost savings for the Airline;With our optional module for lateral optimization, we roughly double the savings. No payback – start saving immediately after buying.;

Solution on-sentence summary: A technology that transforms led lightnings into communication networks
Identification:
An electronic device placed between the power supply (or LED driver) of the luminaire and the light-diffusing electronic board, the QR-Light solution transforms lighting into a new instant communication network by modulating the LED light according to the optical Morse code principle several million times per second.



Associated with a mobile application, it enables the development of location-based services. This revolutionary technology can be used in a wide variety of applications, from hospitals to airports, government and transport utilities, museums, industrial areas, etc. In addition, it can also be an important digital tool for people with reduced mobility or disabilities to give them more autonomy in their freedom of movement, in an environmentally friendly approach. QR-Light significantly reduces the carbon footprint caused by the use of digital tools while increasing profitability and savings for producers, retailers, and consumers.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: Individual, BusinessServicesBuildings Operators, BusinessServicesICT Company & Data Centers
Tags: LED, Sensors & monitoring, Plug-and-play, Smart-buildings
The environmental benefits: 80% savings by using LED lighting;8.000 tons reduction of CO2  emission; In 2018, 796,414 tons of waste electrical and electronic equipment were collected in France for a recycling rate of 73%;Using contactless services, QR-Light helps to fight the COVID-19 epidemic by eliminating all contact between the visitor and the museum employees;
The Financial benefits: less than 1 year payback time;Division by 5 of the investment budget for audioguide equipment;
Complementary solutions: Smart Street Lighting: Outdoor smart street lighting control: energy saving, security and efficiency (Infrastructures);Occupancy detector: Wall-mounted sensor for occupancy detection of commercial facilities (Infrastructures,Buildings & Shelters);LED Bulb for Household Use: A basic light bulb using the led technology (Buildings & Shelters);Solatube Tubular Daylighting : Energy efficient green building components that bring daylight into interior spaces (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: GLORYTECH turns LED lighting into a new communication network to develop Location-Based Services (LBS).
About:
GLORYETCH is a French company created in 2016 and oriented towards new groundbreaking technologies (ICT). Since its creation, it has been labeled as a Young Innovative Company by the French Ministry of Higher Education and Research and declared eligible to the “Crédit Impôt Innovation” Fund, dedicated to SMEs with disruptive technologies.

GLORYTECH research and development activities as well as its technological acquisition strategy has led to the creation of QR-LIGHT Solution, a combined software-hardware solution turning LED lighting into a new communication network, accessible in areas that current technologies, such as the GPS, could not provide ! This groundbreaking innovation is a steppingstone in GLORYTECH’s strategy of developing Location-Based Services (“LBS services”) while bettering European

goals of energy efficiency, toxic-free environment, servicing disabled persons using digital technologies. With GLORYTECH, light becomes our new network of digital communication!

GLORYTECH has a track record, since its creation, of developing innovative products in the field of Information and Communication Technologies.

Solution on-sentence summary: A packaging weight reduction solution for jerry cans
Identification:
A large end-users group is in need of oil based solutions because alternative solutions are not sufficient or cost effective for them. They search for regular supply of fuel and buy pre-filled cans. These cans need to meet safety requirements for transportation, storage and usage while answering cost conscious expectations. Polymer (HDPE) is the best material to meet all requirements on the packaging of the fuel. To meet this requirement as well as reducing the impact on the environment, PVG developed a greener packaging process.

Indeed, RPET is now used as the raw material for the cans and the reviewed design allows to reduce packaging material by 60%. Moreover, it enables to transport 15% more cans on one pallet and thus reducing the number of trucks needed to provide fuels to the customer.

Target client profile: BusinessManufacturingPlastics, BusinessServicesB2B Traders of Bulk Goods, BusinessServicesRetailerNon-food Retail Stores

Organization short description: PVG group is a European sourcing+ service partner in climate and comfort solution in and around the home for resellers.
About:
Grow your business without hassle

PVG - your partner in selling climate care and comfort solutions



Finding a product supplier is easy. But finding a long-term partner with local European sales, service and distribution coverage in over 15 countries to help you increase your business is not. We are PVG and we go the extra mile for you! We offer a wide range of indoor and outdoor home climate care and comfort solutions for all seasons. Whether low-end, mid-end or high-end, we’re here to help you select the right mix of brands, products and services that best suit your sales channels and consumer base. Our promise to you? We arrange everything from presales to aftersales service across Europe, allowing you to attract and satisfy your consumers with quality products that perform exceptionally well.



The answer to your ideal portfolio

We understand that every reseller has varying needs and wishes. That’s why our team is happy to connect with you, to define together what your ideal portfolio looks like based on consumer-driven data. Being a house of brands, we offer plenty of options for you to choose from, such as Qlima, Tectro, Stover, Webber and many more fit-for-purpose brands. Throughout Europe, Qlima is our most renowned premium brand. It’s a unique service concept that, amongst others, offers a unique combination of high-quality paraffin heaters with premium fuel – an exclusive offer you won’t find anywhere else. This fuel has been developed in our own refinery in the harbour of Ghent, Belgium. You may select products from our existing broad portfolio, or we can personally source specific products that fit your consumers’ needs. For many years, we have held a strong focus on our contribution towards a more sustainable world, and with our eco-friendly fuel packing we are the front-runner in our branch. We ensure easy access to mainstream, functionally driven, plug-and-play and light installation products that comply with both European standards and specific local quality standards. Additionally, we meet all mandatory legal, technical and environmental regulations. We can even package our products under your own private label. Either way, we always have an answer to what solution fits your sales channels.



Together, elevating your service level and performance 

We are at our best when we work closely together with you. Because that is when we excel with our outstanding pre- and aftersales service; when we are best able to provide no-nonsense, hassle-free support. Our service is fast, accurate and offered on-site throughout Europe. By providing in-person product and sales training, we elevate the knowledge and selling expertise of your shop floor personnel. By offering easy access to all product-related data, FAQs and rich content like video, online marketing and point-of-sale material in-store, we aim to boost your consumers’ understanding of the product proposition and help them to make their decision. Your concern is our concern; we partner with you to provide a solution in the marketing challenges you face. All with the aim of increasing your customer service level and contributing to your performance.



Ensuring consumer satisfaction with aftersales expertise

Put your mind at ease, as our service doesn’t end once your consumers have purchased a product. With our established network of over 1,000 independent installers in different countries, we ensure that, when installation is needed, it is carried out to our high-quality standards. These skilled professionals make sure that commissioning, repair and maintenance are always done to ensure the safety and satisfaction of your consumers. And should any of our plug-and-play products fail within the warranty, we will resolve the issue. You can reach us directly or via our online channels. For online service support you and your consumers can turn to our dedicated consumer and business websites and aftersales platforms to place orders for spare parts. By providing the best possible personal aftersales service, we guarantee that – should something unexpectedly go wrong – any issue with a product gets resolved quickly and efficiently.



Doing business with a reliable European partner

In the 1980s, founder Peter van Vugt started importing high-quality, Japanese mobile paraffin heaters to the Netherlands with exclusive representation rights. Seeing the potential of this product, he established the company known today as PVG. With our 40 years of experience and unique European coverage in over 15 countries, it’s safe to say that we are the expert in sourcing, distributing and marketing best-in-class indoor and outdoor home climate care and comfort solutions for all seasons. With our vast European distribution and global sourcing network, we get your products in store on time, while anticipating changing needs and stock management requirements. Working with PVG means doing business with a reliable partner that puts in maximum effort. Known for offering an uncompromising presales and aftersales service, we are the European partner who will be at your side for the long haul.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Smart, cost-saving and recyclable wingsails for cargo ships
Identification: The International Maritime Organisation has committed the shipping sector to reducing GHG emissions by at least 50% by 2050 and to reach zero emission "as soon as possible". London broker Simpson Spence Young (SSY) has warned that less than 25% of bulkers and tankers will attain Energy Efficiency Existing Ship Index (EEXI) and the operational Carbon Intensity Indicator (CII) compliance, leaving most of the global merchant fleet facing either engine power limitation (EPL) options or other forms of CO2 abatement. FastRig is a modular, intelligent wingsail technology is designed to address this issue for the 75% of vessels with conversion to sailing hybrid, by reducing fuel consumption and GHG emissions by 20% and to help attain EEXI compliance. – FastRigs realise 20% fuel & GHG emission savings – FastRig technology needs no additional crew – No port-side infrastructure changes required – Rapid retrofit design to minimise disruption
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: BusinessManufacturingShips, Cargo & Boats Manufacturer, BusinessServicesTransportersWaterways & Cargos

The 21st century is a time of maximum population growth.

The problem of housing shortage is very acute, prices continue to rise cosmically into space!

Solution on-sentence summary: A solar shading system to reduce energy consumption in commercial buildings
Identification:
Commercial buildings often have limited roof space for conventional solar panels. They also require shading devices for protection against the harsh summer sun.



The Solution generates solar energy, and it saves energy by reducing heating, cooling, and artificial lighting needs in commercial buildings. It is the Internet of Things (IoT) enabled and uses a sun-tracking algorithm with inputs from sensors and other data to optimize louvre slat position with minimum to no manual involvement. This allows louvres to be controlled individually, collectively, or per façade, while the stacking option can be utilised to maximise daylight, ventilation or to allow for window maintenance. It is a turn-key solution consisting of an array of double-sided photovoltaic slats installed in their frame onto a building façade, with dynamic slat control through the intelligent automation system. This is supported by an ongoing performance monitoring and maintenance service. Other than commercial buildings, the Solution is also suitable for industrial buildings, public buildings, and residential and agricultural markets. It could be installed horizontally or vertically, in front of windows, against  building façades, or as fencing/partitioning.
Looking For: New clients, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Windows & glass, Algorithms & AI, Sensors & monitoring, Shading, IoT, Solar photovoltaic, Smart-buildings
