Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable solution for rigid polyurethane foam applications
Identification:
Polylabs Bio Polyol is made from sustainable and renewable resources: Rapeseed and tall oils. It can help companies produce rigid polyurethane products with reduced CO2 emissions and increased bio carbon content. Some of the most common rigid polyurethane products include spray foam insulation, steel sandwich panels, and construction foam in a can.



Bio Polyol contains a high amount of biocarbon (83%) and is produced from natural resources in a one-step production process that does not produce any harmful waste products. Depending on the polyurethane formulation, companies can replace 10 to 50% of conventional petrochemical polyol with Bio Polyol.

About:
Polylabs is an innovative chemical manufacture company that produces and sells bio polyol - a key raw material for the polyurethane industry. Our material is created from natural oils like canola or tall oil and it replaces fossil based raw materials for the many industries including construction, shipbuilding, automotive, home appliances and even aerospace. Yes - in fact Picard's aeroplane was built with polyurethanes - unfortunately based on crude oil. With our materials this aeroplane would be more environmentally friendly and partially bio based. And it would not cost more! wouldn't that be awesome?

Our unique production method allows us to produce and sell an award winning material at the same price levels as fossil based, but it has up to 83% bio carbon, it is CO2 negative and has even some technical advantages.

Solution on-sentence summary: A service that allows users to pay for cooling instead of purchasing entire systems
Identification: Cooling as a Service (CaaS) is an innovative business model that enables end-users to access clean and efficient cooling solutions without the need of an upfront investment. This servitization model addresses the key market barriers that hinder the adoption of sustainable cooling by allowing customers to pay for the service consumed, on a fixed-fee-per-unit basis. Meanwhile, the ownership of the system remains with the technology provider, who is responsible for all operation costs. Through its CaaS initiative, the Basel Agency for Sustainable Energy (BASE), with support from the Kigali Cooling Efficiency Program (K-CEP) and with the endorsement of the Global Innovation Lab for Climate Finance, has accelerated the adoption of the business model around the world in a variety of sectors and industries, from industrial refrigeration and commercial air-conditioning to agricultural and medical cold chains.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Cooling, Service
Sectors: Buildings, Energy, Heating, cooling and ventilation, Sell and trade
The environmental benefits: 0% upfront investment;Pay per use servitisation model (for instance: $USD / crate of herbs stored in a cold room, or USD/ TR-hour). - TR: Ton of refrigerated air.;In industrial or real estate applications: can enable at least 30% improvement in Energy efficiency;In the off-grid solar refrigeration agrisector: up to 49% reduction in emissions - related to the removal of diesel generators.;
The Financial benefits: 20% increase in revenues for business implementing CaaS, with constant revenue streams.;In the off-grid solar refrigeration agri-sector: 50% increase in farmers income, and 50% reduction in food spoilage.;Incentivising a circular economy approach - which potentially further increases business revenues beyond the 20% increase, besides environmental and social benefits.;

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);Recovering heat : Standardized, ready-to-install solution for supermarkets to heat buildings or water using waste heat (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: Developing financial mechanisms to accelerate the implementation of Energy Efficient and sustainable technologies.
About: Stiftung BASE is a Swiss non-profit organization that is based in Basel. Founded in 2001, we are dedicated to develop innovative business models and financing solutions to mobilize investments in sustainable energy solutions. Our core business is to analyse and develop business models that include smart financing and risk mitigation mechanisms in order to facilitate and drive private investments into sustainable energy solutions with the objectives of addressing the challenges of climate change and promoting a more sustainable development path. In particular, Stiftung BASE brings extensive expertise in (i) identifying green market opportunities, (ii) conducting strategic analysis of clean technology markets and cost-benefit assessments, (iii) developing due diligence guidelines for green investment opportunities, (iv) setting up green private equity funds in development countries, (v) providing policy support, and (vi) developing and implementing financing and risk mitigation schemes to boost existing markets and reach out to new ones. Stiftung BASE has thus long experience and a strong track record working with both, private and public actors, such as financial institutions (incl. commercial banks, as well as national, bi- and multi-lateral development banks), industry players, development agencies, international organizations, private equity and institutional investors, etc.

Solution on-sentence summary: Sustainable building blocks to rebuild marine ecosystems in subsea and coastal projects
Identification: Reef Cubes® (RCs) are versatile cube-like marine structures that protect subsea and coastal assets, or can be used as moorings, but also intentionally benefit nature by providing hard substrate and habitat complexity. They are made from 98% recycled materials using an innovate marine non-toxic binder (Marinecrete), and have a 90% lower carbon footprint than traditional Portland cement based alternatives. They are proven to enrich biodiversity and abundance due to their size, shape, surface pH, complexity and internal chambers, which rapidly become colonised and used as spawning and nursery grounds. Every marine project can now leave a positive marine legacy by switching from Portland cement-based products to low carbon footprint Marinecrete technology that contains zero plastics, and they are designed to be left in-situ forever, removing high decommissioning cost risks. RCs have the potential to reduce the life cycle cost of subsea mattress cable protection by upto 50%.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Identification: Utilities find it challenging to differentiate their offering in a more competitive market place, have difficulties creating loyal customers that stays with them, and they have high costs of customer service. At the same time, their customers expect more from digital services than in the past as they have grown accustomed to services from tech companies. The Eliq customer engagement platform and apps bring utilities all over the world closer to their customers by offering self-service and insights giving end-customers total control of their consumption. Self-service functionality includes seeing the latest bills, an overview of contracts, and submit meter reads. Insights functionality includes forecasting of their consumption, comparison of their consumption with similar households, and a breakdown of their energy consumption into ten different categories showing how their energy is used in their home. Solution on-sentence summary: A collaborative solution to manage exchangable pallets between multiple users
Identification: PALBANK is the alternative to traditional systems of exchange and rental of pallets for manufacturers and carriers, while preserving the environment. It is a relevant and economical solution for pallet management. Based on the principle of “pallet-exchange”, PALBANK is an online solution for the accounting of pallets on a virtual credit-debit and clearing system like a bank account. Users deposit pallets therefore credit their account and take back pallets therefore debit their account. Pallets can be dropped off and picked up wherever they want at one of the 330 points of the PFM-Solutions network. PALBANK can also deliver and collect pallets on behalf of its users. The flexibility of our services makes it possible to manage small quantities such as complete batches of pallets. The Solution provides real financial savings and a significant impact on the environment with less CO2 emissions by minimising journeys.

Solution on-sentence summary: A wastewater heat recovery system for individual showers
Identification: Currently, a lot of energy is wasted in the form of hot water. In fact, each shower only uses 15% of the calories contained in the hot water. When the water is ejected to the sewers, its average temperature is about 33°C for a standard shower at 38°C. This energy could be used to preheat the fresh clear water and reduce the energy needed. Moreover, the time waiting for hot water after the tap opening waste a lot of water. At each shower, 9 litres are lost during this phase. Gecko reuse 88% of the calories contains in the wastewater and provide hot water 3 seconds after the tap opening. By reducing the energy needed to warm the fresh clear water and reducing the waiting time for hot water, Gecko has a positive global impact.

Tags: Shower, Grey water, Domestic & municipal wastewater, Waste-heat valorisation, Recycle waste, Building heating

Solution on-sentence summary: An aircraft with hybrid-electric propulsion for efficient and eco-friendly flight
Identification: CASSIO is a a unique general aviation aircraft with a seating capacity of 4-10 passengers, empowered with the world’s first parallel and series distributed hybrid propulsion system. The proprietary propulsion system delivers a total output of 600 kilowatts (kW), allowing for flight distances of up to 1,200 km. in a heavy-hybrid mode, offering 3.5 hours of flight autonomy. Benefitting from this propulsion configuration and CASSIO’s modular design, the aircraft can be configured for different flight modes that vary from from pure-electric flight (with a range of up to 200 km.), to heavy-hybrid mode, using the full 600 kW energy output for distances of more than 600 km. As most of the short-haul routes in Europe have flight distances of 100 to 1,000 km., CASSIO will provide a new mode of transportation that will: enable access to more communities in less time; enhance regional mobility; and alleviate road congestion problems – achieving all these goals safely and environmentally friendly.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

The Company was incorporated in September 2017 with an objective to realize the project that covers the entire value-added chain, starting from development, tests and certification until production of components and complete aircraft assembly. Benefitting from a combined total of 50-plus years of pioneering expertise with its founders, VoltAero is taking electric aircraft to an entirely new level. A flight demonstrator, along with a ground-based “iron bird” system test rig, have validated the CASSIO configurations in-flight and on the ground, de-risking them for airworthiness certification and the subsequent application on new-production airplanes to be built using strong, lightweight materials.

Solution name: Off The Grid electricity generating spinning bike
Solution on-sentence summary: A spinning bike generating electricity while working out for the electrical grid
Identification:
Off The Grid spinning bikes were created to reduce the ecological footprint of every workout by generating electricity with the users' energy, otherwise wasted. This technology transforms users' energy into electricity, and then distributes it directly into the building's electrical grid.

This Solution encourages people to live an active and healthy lifestyle while generating electricity. Dedicated to offering eco-friendly training equipment, it represents a technologically advanced spinning bike equipped with an integrated electronic system which allows real-time monitoring of electricity production and training statistics. Thanks to the gamification concept, users can also track their ranking and take on personalized challenges.

Identification: In 2019, 38% of the final electricity consumption in France was coming from the residential sector. With Conso Live, households can monitor their electricity consumption in real-time. The customers can understand their consumption behavior and act to improve it. Their consumption is displayed on the TotalEnergies app. They get personalized advice to reduce it, such as identifying standby devices, controlling heating during the winter, or being alerted in peak consumption. Conso Live is an enabler to empower our customers in sustainable consumption behavior. The company has already observed a reduction of 13% on electricity consumption for customers who are heating with electricity. Furthermore, the company plans to develop innovative functionalities that will further improve the energy efficiency of all our customer

About:
Over time, manufacturers accumulate stocks of maintenance parts that they will no longer use and that take up space. These so-called "dormant" stocks, estimated to be worth 3 billion euros in Europe, are doomed to destruction.



kheoos develops algorithms, in order to massively “recognize” the parts, scan the global databases and automatically constitute markets offers, with technical descriptions, photos and market prices, for automatic publication on various channels with global visibility including https://kheoosmarket.com 



In a few months, we have identified with our partners € 10 million of parts, of which € 5 million are already on sale on the marketplace.



Thanks to kheoos, some industrialists add value to their dormant parts and others can acquire rare parts that allow them to extend the life of their equipment.

PURA Inverse Osmosis, a non-bottled mineral water plant tech, removes 99.9% of contaminants such as Arsenic, Fluorine, Heavy Metals, Chlorine and its derivatives, remains of agrochemicals, glyphosate, among other impurities. Solution on-sentence summary: A device using motorized pumps to deliver hot water in 2 seconds to the taps, avoiding energy and water waste
Identification: The distribution of Domestic Hot Water (DHW) have many drawbacks. They are a source of discomfort, waste of water and energy, and a bacteriological risk. According to Enertech specialized in the energy performance of the building: “Between 35% and 60% heat of a domestic hot water production facility (DHW) is lost in the distribution, between the storage tank and the taps. Continuous operation loop distribution and widespread in apartment buildings are the main causes of these losses“. To tackle this challenge, the HotWaterQuickly delivers hot water instantly in less than 2 seconds to all taps. Indeed, in each building, a powerful motorized pump channels the hot water from the reserve, to inject it at high pressure (250 bars) into a very small section pipe (3.5mm diameter), which conducts the hot water at high speed (at nearly 100Km/h). This way, the water is provided very quickly into the customer taps.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Building heating
The environmental benefits: Hot water reaches the customer’s tap within 2 seconds;The HWQ process is 10 times more economical and environmentally friendly than a recirculation loop;DHW production can be reduced by up to 50% (800Kwh / hour / year) thus reducing CO2 emissions into the atmosphere by 10 tons per year for a residential building with 25 apartments;Allows to reduce the consumption of hot water up to 10 liters of water per day per person that will no longer be wasted waiting for hot water at the tap;
The Financial benefits: HWQ allows the user to save around 110 € / year / apartment;0-year payback period with an annual ROI of 18% in new buildings;
Complementary solutions:
Solar space heating: Solar-powered air heaters and rock bed thermal storage to heat homes 

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);Recovering heat : Standardized, ready-to-install solution for supermarkets to heat buildings or water using waste heat (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: Hot Water Quickly. Domestic hot water from source to tap in seconds. Saving energy, water and improving comfort.

No more long waits and the resulting waste of water. We help you significantly reduce your water and energy consumption, while improving your daily comfort.

Organization short description: Digimind develops AI software helping the FMCG industry optimize their packaging based on the circularity principles
Founder 1 - Last name: Katharina Eissing and Dr. Omar Fergani
About:
Digimind developed cutting-edge AI software to accelerate packaging innovation. Digimind is developing its AI software solution to enable the packaging industry to develop sustainable, safe, and cost-effective packaging in a very short time leveraging the power of AI. Our aim is to accelerate the transition from a linear to a circular economy by 2025.



The main features of Digimind's platforms are the following:



- AI design advisor: provides the designer with immediate feedback on the influence of features on performance. The tool could also propose new design features to accelerate the design process, no need for the second step of finite elements anymore. 



- AI lightweight: enables in a matter of minutes the exploration of new packages with reduced weight and without compromising the performance



- Seamless Cloud platform: The first seamlessly integrated environment dedicated to the packaging industry providing the opportunity to reduce the time to market and the iteration cycles coming from today's broken process chain



- Virtual testing and validation (digital twin): the end-user implement the expected LCA of the packages and the platform perform automatic virtual testing of the performance of the product reducing the cost and time of physical testing. This includes transportation, top load, drop test, blow molding, etc.



- Dashboard: Provide the packaging engineer with full information on the cost, sustainable impact, and performance of a package in one place



- Materials Libraries: The core capability to achieve all the previous steps is to provide customers with a core material library covering the composition of the materials models



- Platform Ecosystem: Another functionality is the openness of the platform, end-user could find help from packaging experts, suppliers and even download new software applications from other players in the ecosystem

Solution on-sentence summary: A software solution to support sales representatives in the energy field during the lifecycle of a new renewable energy system
Identification:
Since the PV market and customer needs are changing, customer orientation is becoming a major issue in the energy industry. The Eturnity Solution is replacing the efficiency barriers and persuasion efforts with automated and simple, but precise advice.

It combines two digital tools: The Eturnity Calculator and Expert, each for the PV and heating sectors. This covers acquisition, consulting, planning, and sales of renewable energy systems.



The Eturnity Calculator takes on the role as the first filter. The end customer receives a simulation of their personal energy system and then obtains a custom overview according to their criteria, incl. graphics that are accurate, but not too technical. The installer then sees who is only obtaining initial information and who is planning a concrete project.

The Eturnity Expert reduces the effort by reducing the number of interfaces. The time savings to the point of quote creation is up to 80 %. Personnel capacities can, therefore, be used elsewhere.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Solar Thermal, Service, Software, Solar photovoltaic, Building heating, Electric vehicles
Sectors: Energy, Buildings, Mobility, Sell and trade
The environmental benefits: The Eturnity platform has completed over 500’000 energy system simulations.;The Eturnity simulations have been growing by more than 50% year over year.;By reducing renewable technologies costs by around 5% compared to fossil alternatives, it speeds up the energy transition without increased subsidies.;Higher installation rates (renewable enrgy systems), our solution has helped save 45'000 tons of CO2.;Less resources (paper, time, money).;
The Financial benefits: 80 % time savings for energy suppliers / installers.;30 % more deals for energy suppliers / installers.;A reduction of the cost of renewable energy systems by 3-5% only through the software.;
Complementary solutions: Insolar Communities: Installation of photovoltaic panels for low-income communities (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Place To Plug: Platform connecting EV drivers and charging stations  (Mobility);KLAXIT: Clean, sustainable, cheap and reliable mobility for all (Mobility);Drivy by Getaround: A convenient carsharing platform for dense urban areas (Mobility);
Organization short description: A software solution to support sales representatives in the energy field during the lifecycle of a new renewable energy system
About:
Eturnity is a B2B SaaS software and combines two digital tools that focus on an automated, precise and customer-oriented process: The Eturnity Calculator and Expert, each for the PV and heating sectors. This covers acquisition, consulting, planning and sales of renewable energy systems. 



Every project information is transferred into the digital system, simulation results of different technologies are directly converted into a customer offer. In doing so, we are the first software solution that enables a combination of different technologies such as PV systems, battery systems, heat pumps and e-mobility.



Orders, the filling out of forms and the calculators work automatically and simplify the daily work of installers and energy suppliers considerably. Technical planning, design, dimensioning, cost calculation as well as simulation are integrated in one solution. The results are presented in customer-friendly quotations. This increases the sales quota by 30% and saves the installers / utilities up to 80% of time compared to traditional sales processes for small-scale renewable energy systems.



In addition, Eturnity acts as a digitization plattform that interconnects the very fragmented stakeholders of the renewable energy eco-system such as installers, utilities, suppliers, manufacturers, banks, insurances and lead generation providers.



Altogether and in its full potential, the Eturnity solution will reduce costs of small-scale renewable energy systems by up to 15%.

Solution on-sentence summary: Small-scale hydrokinetic turbines that enable users to harness clean, predictable energy from water in rivers
Identification: The DesignPro Renewables hydrokinetic turbine harnesses the kinetic energy from flowing water found in rivers and estuaries. The unique concept of this device exploits the natural phenomenon that occurs when flowing water comes into contact with an object or obstruction. By using such an obstacle as part of our design, water is compressed and accelerates as it is diverted out and around the body. The compact design makes it simple and cost-effective to deploy without major civil works with installation times as short as 3 hours for a 25kW system. The device is floating and not permanently fixed so it can be moved easily if required. The platform gives access to the turbines, which can be lifted out of the water for maintenance without having to remove the device.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Rivers, Turbines, Hydropower
The environmental benefits: No head of water is needed to generate adequate power from the ambient flow, even in sites with 1.5 metres per second (mps) means that there is no need for expensive and disruptive civil works;A 25kW turbine can displace a 90kW diesel generator that requires 24/7 operation to provide power for 20-30 homes, the turbine would save 4,642 tonnes of CO2;Efficiently capture kinetic energy of water flows ( 2M/S),  opening up viable deployment opportunities in a greater range of water flows ;
The Financial benefits: Levelised Cost of Energy of €0.27 per kW making it a sound investment for those currently reliant on diesel generators or those in areas with attractive Feed In Tariffs;Power over 60 normal households with combined battery storage with a single 60kw hybrid device or create an array to generate further power;

Organization short description: Develops and commercialises a range of small-scale, hydrokinetic turbines that will enable users to harness clean, predictable energy from flowing water in rivers and estuaries.
About: DesignPro Renewables is a sister-branch company to DesignPro Automation who, in March 2017, received EU Horizon 2020 SME Instrument funding for a €2.7 million project to develop and commercialise 25kW and 60kW hydrokinetic turbines. DesignPro Renewables is dedicated to implementing the actions and deliverables of this project and are now well underway to achieving their overall vision which is to generate viable, green energy from flowing water.

Solution on-sentence summary: Thermoplastic honeycomb cores from recycled polyethylene terephthalate
Identification: Sandwich panels are a very efficient structures, delivering high level of mechanical performance at extremely low weight and are being used in a wide range of applications. Amongst them, honeycomb has been the most efficient in terms of mechanical performance to weight ratio. Recycled honeycomb cores is seeking for replacement of foam cores and the total addressable market for RPET honeycomb is very large. EconCore has developed a continuous manufacturing process that can produce thermoformable, high-performance panels with a thermoplastic core made out of 95 % of recycled PET, in a cost-effective way. This recycling of plastic bottles is an important step forward in the pursuit of sustainability, as waste can be converted into performance-to-weight-optimized honeycomb structures. With the RPET honeycomb core, EconCore sees opportunities in many applications such as the automotive market where weight reduction becomes crucial to reduce CO2 emissions with sustainable resources and lightweight cost-efficient solutions. Also, other markets, including industrial packaging and transportation, have interesting applications where this material can be an excellent fit. The use of RPET honeycomb cores gives a sustainable solution with a good Life Cycle Assessment and low carbon footprint which fits the world-wide sustainability strategy.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility

Solution on-sentence summary: Revenue and flow metering for potable water distribution networks and irrigation applications
Identification: The purpose of a potable water distribution network is to supply users with water with adequate pressure under various loading conditions. Water utilities strive to operate this process through a model that is sustainable to nature (i.e. water as a resource) and the financials of their business. However, networks are facing growing challenges (growing water scarcity, pressure on operational costs, water leakages, and waste) that could be mitigated with accurate metering solutions. The AquaMaster4 is the ideal flowmeter for potable water distribution networks and the high-tech response to the global need for water crisis mitigation and adaptation. It is the world's first self-verifying flowmeter which allows the integrity of the meter to be self-checked every 30 minutes and ensures meters are accurate and reliable. Using readily available standard lithium cells, the AquaMaster4 can be operated for over 10 years, and the transmitter can be powered by a range of green energy sources.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility
Tags: Drinking-water, Sensors & monitoring
The environmental benefits: Unrivalled accuracy up to ±0.2% of reading ±0.5 mm/s (whichever is greater) across a wide flow range up to R1000;Estimated 11 kg CO2-eq;Expected lifetime of 15 years, batteries replacement after 10 years. Modular system easy to repair and unit entirely recyclable;
The Financial benefits: Less than 8 months payback time;Affordable solution (price range: $1800 and $2000 for a standard size needed in a water distribution network) based on the size of installed flowmeter and project requirements;Helps detect leakages promptly which can reduce water waste of up to 11,400 litres per month on an average District Metering Area, reducing the financial losses for the customer by ~300K$ per month;

Solution on-sentence summary: Energy and nutrients reclaimed from domestic wastewater treatment plants
Identification:
Hydrell technology was invented in 2016.



It has developed a wastewater treatment technology that allows the recovery of energy, nutrients, and clean water at a much smaller footprint and price than competing technologies. The technology will also be more robust than current comparable systems. Using the Hydrell technology, users have an incentive to treat their wastewater by saving 30%+ of their total operating costs. In its simplest form, the electrolysis of wastewater is catalysed by electroactive microorganisms oxidising organic and inorganic compounds on the anode (the positive electrode). The reaction products are car­bon dioxide (CO2) and nitrogen gas (N2). At the same time, hydrogen gas (H2) is formed on the cathode and converted to methane by methanogenic microbes.
Looking For: Network, Funding, Credibility
Tags: Electrolysis, Biogas & biomethane, Biofuel, Water & Wastewater treatment, Domestic & municipal wastewater, Waste-to-energy & fuels, Recycle waste
The environmental benefits: Five times smaller footprint than upflow anaerobic sludge blanket reactors;Can produce 50 m3/m3 (methane/wastewater) with high strength wastewater;Up to 90% aerial footprint reduction;More than 3 million m3 wastewater treated every year;More than 50 GWh each year;More than 20,000 tons CO2 saved each year;
The Financial benefits: Five years breakeven;CHF 300,000 customer benefit each year from energy savings and generation;

Organization short description: Hexem's microbial electrolysis allows to recover energy from high strength wastewater.
About:
Hexem has developed a wastewater treatment technology that allows the recovery of energy, nutrients and clean water at a much smaller foot print and price than competing technologies. The technology will also be more robust than current comparable systems. Using the Hexem technology, users have an incentive to treat their wastewater by saving more than 30% of their total operating costs.

In Europe and North America, Hexem’s main users are in the food and beverage industry such as brew­eries, wineries, dairies and other producers of high strength wastewater. In developing economies, anyone producing wastewater benefits from the Hexem technology. While the wastewater market is large (more than CHF 100bn), the Hexem technology also reduces the carbon footprint of wastewater treatment.

Michael Siegert (founder and inventor) has developed a TRL 5 prototype in his workshop at the waste­water treatment plant in Le Châble, Valais, which can treat 200 l/day. The prototype is currently treating cheese whey produced by local cheese makers. The plant operator, Altis, the German engineering company Zahnen Technik and the British biofuel producer Wilson Biochemical have signed letters of interest. Hexem is currently looking for more partner to build further pilot plants.

Hexem was incorporated in October 2021 in Bagnes, Valais, Switzerland. Once seed funding of CHF 0.7M is secured, the co-founders Michael Siegert (CEO) and Miroslava Varničić (CTO) will begin team building, industrialization and marketing. Three to five pilot plants, financed by grants, will serve as demonstrators for Hexem’s future customers.

Initially, Hexem will not directly sell to the users of its technology. Hexem will work with local engineering firms to deliver its products to our users. The commercial Hexem technology is a wastewater treatment system called Hydrell System. It includes electrolysis reactors, optional methane storage and power conversion units. Hexem will start its business selling electrodes and service for these system as well as licensing its intellectual property. Once the company has gained sufficient market and technical expertise through sales and hires, Hexem will pursue a renting business model together with a financing partner.

Hexem estimates CHF 4.2M series A financing from private investors to grow its team and develop its business. In return, the company promises an exit after 5-10 years for at least 5-10 times the initial valuation.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: An on-board technology injecting hydrogen that reduces thermal engines consumption
Identification: Hydrogen Injection System (H.I.S.) is an on-board technology for reducing fuel consumption and polluting emissions in thermal engines by injecting hydrogen in real time. H.I.S. is a miniaturized, autonomous and secure system for improving the combustion of thermal engines by injecting hydrogen, resulting from the electrolysis of water. H.I.S. reduces the carbon impact of any type of thermal engine , whatever its size and actively participating in the energy transition, spearheading a positive ecology and a positive, sustainable and circular economy. H.I.S. technology reduces pollutant emissions up to 70% and fuel consumption up to 25%. A benefit for the consumer, corporations as well as the planet. Fitted on all thermal engines, the Hydrogen Injection System works equally well on gasoline and diesel engines.

Organization short description: Patented and miniaturized system which reduces pollution and consumption on any existing thermal engine on any vehicle.
Founder 1 - Last name: founder Emmanuel Parmigiani and Jacques Paucker
About:
The patented H.I.S. (Hydrogen Injection System®) technology from Logikko injects hydrogen in small quantities into any thermal engine, generated in real time by electrolysis of water. The result is a reduction in consumption and pollution for gasoline and diesel engines.

The H.I.S. reduces fuel consumption up to 25% and toxic emissions up to 70% on any combustion engine.

Regarding diesel engines, the Logikko system is the only “on-board” solution currently on the market.



Logikko, created in July 2013, was based on the principle that the ecological transition would take place over the long term and that the emergence of electric vehicles would be gradual.



It took 6 years for this idea to become an economic reality accepted by the market.



The four-year period, between 2013 filing of the patent and 2017 when it is published, will have allowed Logikko to move from the stage of functional demonstrator to that of pre-production. During this period, expert assessment were organized and tests carried out on around 100 vehicles.



At Equip Auto 2019, Logikko was convinced that the market was finally here. The notion of energy and ecological transition was understood and economic and political players were beginning to admit that the market would not switch to all electricity in a few months, or even a few years.

All the players recognized the need to put in place transitional solutions in the replacement of the existing vehicle fleet.



Logikko had anticipated this change.



During the period 2017-2019 Logikko signed a partnership and support agreement for industrialization and production with a major automotive supplier.

Logikko systems have been audited by the CNRS. The result of this audit is a partnership agreement between Logikko and the CNRS for the development of new products with co-filing of patents. In this context, a doctoral student from the nanotechnologies unit of the Institute of Molecular Sciences of Bordeaux linked to a CNRS laboratory is working on the types of material of the electrolyzer as well as on the electrolyte.



Today Logikko ticks all the boxes in its value chain: Patent, Industrialization and Distribution.



Numerous developments resulting from this work are in progress in the sectors of passenger transport (Bus / Car, river shuttle), goods, public works, fishing, generators, airport, transport, production of green hydrogen for small gas storage units.



Logikko has built a solid team around basic businesses: electrochemistry, motorization, mechanics. Logikko completed its recruitment with complementary professions: methods, design, tests, etc.

Today Logikko enjoys a great capacity for development thanks to its quality recruitments.



VALUE PROPOSITION :

Today, Logikko has already created a product, the GreenPerformer, based on this technology for cars and light vehicles. Logikko develops, thanks to its partners, products based on our H.I.S. technology, adapted to each case: Heavy truck vehicles, coaches and buses; Construction machinery ; Shipyard ; Maritime and river transport; Large Gear; Fixed installation.

Thanks to our technology, individuals and professionals alike reduce their ecological impact. The H.I.S. meets 8 of the UN's 17 Sustainable Development Goals.

In addition, the H.I.S. enables companies to strengthen their CSR policy.

From an economic point of view :

-Protection of the environment and biodiversity, ecological transition and, de facto, the fight against global warming.

-Reducing consumption therefore reducing the use of fossil fuels.

-The decarbonisation of transport and the image of a positive ecology; Logikko actively participates in corporate CSR policy.

-The possibility of achieving the objectives of the Paris Agreements.

From a social point of view:

-Reducing up to 75% of toxic discharges, Logikko contributes to the improvement of public health.

-A means given to public or private users to be able to continue working in good hygienic conditions, thanks to the reduction of pollution.

- Respect for the right of workers to operate in safety.

-The creation of a market and jobs. This requires worker training using our technology.

And from an economic point of view:

-The positive AND economically viable ecology. Important point in the perception of ecology, sometimes seen as punitive.

-A vector of sustainable development. Continue the development of companies in a sustainable manner. It does not slow down business development projects.

-Revaluation of your Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), contributing positively to the preservation of the planet.

-A socially responsible investment (SRI). You enter into ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) criteria.



STUDY

According to a study published by the Boston Consulting Group, Roland Berger and HIS, the Global Automobile Fleet will experience an increase of 58.14% between 2016 and 2030, from 1,290 million vehicles to 2,040 million vehicles.



The price

The public price of Logikko is 598 € HT.



Leading team :



Jean ARJEAU, President:

25 years of financial experience in business management



Michèle THEPENIER ATANET, Financial Director:

Financial Control, Management Control, Audit and Professorship. 25 years of experience in the aeronautical and automotive industries.



Emmanuel PARMIGIANI, Co-founder and Vice-President in charge of R&D:

Research engineer specializing in the management of innovative automotive or aeronautical projects.

Solution on-sentence summary: A cloud-based energy exchange platform enabling the energy transition
Identification:
eNet is digitalizing the energy industry and connecting all energy industry players on one platform and solving the following problems:



For end consumers:

With the platform, consumers have the ability to decide for themselves where their energy comes from. For example, it can come from their neighbours or the utility company in their area owning a power plant. It is also possible to sell your own PV power or other types of energy locally on the platform manually or using third-party apps.



For energy providers:

The platform covers the current and future legislative requirements in the energy industry and generates new digital business models.



For installers and engineering companies:

It can offer and sell its physical or virtual products to a wide audience.



Other players:

Other players can use the platform to connect users, data, and devices, such as charging stations, with each other.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners
Tags: Online marketplace, Software

Solution on-sentence summary: A thermal insulation board using 100% of recycled polystyrene achieving cleaner production in the building sector
Identification:
SOPRA XPS is a highly resistant, highly moisture-proof, and easy-to-cut insulation. Made from up to 100% recycled materials, this insulation does not lose any of its insulating qualities.

Ideal for all applications: roofs, walls, floors for indoors and outdoors, it can be used by an individual as well as a professional in new or renovation.

The main objective of the SOPRA XPS solution is to provide a product recognized for its thermal performance and its specific characteristics but manufactured with a raw material that is largely recycled.

And thus it offers a reliable, sustainable, and responsible solution for the planet while limiting its impact on the environment while giving a second life to already used products.

Identification: Private swimming pools are becoming more popular in Europe, gaining significant momentum in the North of Europe. The solution Piscines Waterair significantly reduces the private pool operational carbon footprint. It provides significant energy efficient products for meeting client expectations for their private pool. Water filtration (80% of water cleanness) is achieved with a new Eco.R pump reducing energy consumption by a factor of 5, allowing a complete electricity compensation by two regular solar panel installed in the house. Protection and heating of the pool water with Solae Waterair® cover brings +6 to +9°C to water temperature thanks to greenhouse effect and no electricity consumption, while protecting the pool and securing its access when not used by the owner and family.

About:
METRON has built a unique positioning at the convergence of the digital revolution and the energy transition. METRON reshapes the way energy data is used in industries. Metron turns energy efficiency from a static, reactive process into a dynamic, proactive strategy.

>The digitalization of industries and the development of fully distributed energy systems foster the emergence of the Internet of Energy. METRON opens the way for this new paradigm by helping industrial clients leverage untapped industrial data and connect to decentralized energy resources. 

METRON combines Big data, AI and human expertise. METRON Energy Virtual Assistant EVA® analyses data generated by industrial systems in real-time and offers a deep understanding of complex energy patterns.

>Factories become energy transparent: advanced optimisations are operated directly by the platform according to the context and tangible energy savings ensure less than 12 months paybacks in all industries.

METRON-EVA® is the foundation stone to make industries more responsible and sustainable in terms of energy consumption using artificial intelligence based on Energy Data and ontologies.

>METRON imagines a future where Human creativity and collaborative robots will conceive energy efficiency strategies.

Its Digital Platform will ultimately promote fully managed renewable energies, new energy usages, peer to peer energy exchanges and more. METRON has developed 9 Operational centers in the world: Europe, Latin America, Middle East and Asia.

Solution on-sentence summary: Next-generation wind turbine system that enables the harvesting of wind energy in any environment
Identification: The VETAR aims at providing a suitable, profitable, and eco-friendly option to traditional electric energy suppliers. It is an advanced urban-friendly system that enables the harvesting of wind energy in any environment. VETAR solves several major problems of traditional wind turbines technology such as noise, vibrations, large size, inefficiency, poor safety and even aesthetics. In one sentence, VETAR is a next-generation wind turbine.

Solution on-sentence summary: Simple and affordable tools to make general aviation safer and reduce its ecological impact
Identification:
The SAFETYN’Box and its suite are simple and affordable tools to make General Aviation safer and reduce its environmental impact. This solution is dedicated to pilots, airclubs and flying schools willing to preserve the freedom of flying and relies on the pilots' capability to improve their practice continuously. 

SAFETYN is committed to support human intelligence with the SAFETYN'Box, which assists pilots in their quest for improvement and make them more aware of the impact of their flying on their environment: becoming aware of the eco footprint of the flight, search for more responsible routes, improve flight preparation even after a long period on-ground, make every flight cost less and benefits twice.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Aviation, Planning tool, Route optimization, Software, Vehicles
The environmental benefits: The use of the SAFETYN'Box and its associated elements potentially reduces the number of actual flight hours for private pilot training by 10% (without however going below the regulatory threshold of 45 hours to validate a PPL);The SAFETYN’Box addresses 4 of 7 number 1 priority safety issues of EASA ERCS Risk Score: Perception and situational awareness; decision making and planning; flight planning and preparation; experience, training, and competence of individuals. ;The impact on fuel consumption would be in the order of 684,000 L of fuel for 1 year (average consumption of 30 L of fuel/h for non-professional activity); This represents, for France, 1530 tons of CO2 (AGVAS emission factor set by the EU is 3.10, AGVAS density is 0.472 kg/L, non-professional activity);
The Financial benefits: The financial impact, for France alone, would be around 3.4 M€ for 1 year (cost of the flight approx. 150€/hour) ;Less than 2 years pay back time, 50% less expensive than installed devices, time and maintenance savings.;
Complementary solutions: SeaZen: A 100% autonomous solar boating service with license free self-service access (Mobility);ANTISMOG: An on-demand hydrogen fuel enhancement system for the reduction of air pollution from vehicles (Freight,Mobility);Bound4blue : A novel wingsail system for assisted clean sailing in the maritime transport sector (Freight,Industry & Consumer Goods);Sion: An eco-friendly and low-cost electric car with integrated photovoltaic cells (Mobility);
Organization short description: SAFETYN develops life preservation systems for all Pilots & Paxs flying General Aviation Aircrafts of today and tomorrow
About:
Considering the rising densification of low-to-mid altitudes and the absence of breakthrough safety solutions in General Aviation over the last 30 years (unlike in automotive industry), SAFETYN Co-founders decided to join forces to develop an original approach to instill a virtuous circle in Pilots’ safety situational awareness and acumen. Such thinking and development has been highly inspired by Solar Impulse pioneers – Bertrand Piccard and Bertrand Borschberg – and their team to open doors for new “Possibles”. Increasing usage of physiological sensors, remote assistance from Monaco-based and Payerne-based Command centers, were very pragmatic examples of technologies and solutions developed to reach higher safety levels for the pilots.



SAFETYN will therefore offer to all pilots the opportunity to be equipped with a set of safety solutions around the so-called "SAFETYN'Box" which will safeguard Pilots against being irremediably drawn into the spiral of fatal accidents, constantly assisting them in refining their Safety Situational Awareness & Acumen. 

SAFETYN Team expects to leverage collected in-flight data to further refine the overall incidental taxonomy in General Aviation.



Since its creation in November 2016, SAFETYN is headquartered at CERN Innogex Incubator in Geneva area, thanks to a Strategic Partnership and Technology Transfer with CERN. SAFETYN is also accelerated at AIRBUS BizLab in Toulouse – the heart of AIRBUS’ innovation – and at SAFE Cluster in Aix en Provence
SDG’s of application: SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: A new line of environmentally friendly ceramics for sustainable wall and floor coverings
Identification: In building, ceramics are popular for floor and wall coverings, and porcelain stoneware is the best performing material in terms of aesthetics, technology and sanitation. The G3NIUS FLORA collection is a porcelain stoneware designed with a reduced thickness (7.4mm) compared to the market average (9mm). The 7.4mm thickness grants many tangible benefits to the end consumer: easy to handle thanks to the lightweight; easy to cut and perforate; quicker and more economical installation; responsible production thanks to a reduced use of natural and energetic resources; reduced environmental impact and carbon footprint; logistic advantage for the distributor, with the possibility of loading 22% more sqm on the same vehicle. To ensure transparency, an accredited third-party verified Environmental Product Declaration (EPD) is available.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: A small machine using salt, vinegar and water to produce a zero-waste, toxic-free disinfectant
Identification:
With Blue, customers can replace toxic, plastic waste-producing cleaning products using a small machine that turns salt, vinegar, and tap water into a zero-waste, toxic-free and efficient disinfectant and cleaner. The mainstream cleaning products are made of 10% active agents, often toxic, transported with water in disposable plastic that threaten your health and the environment with plastic waste and toxic rejections in wastewater. Blue uses less than 2g of salt and vinegar and tap water to produce 350ml of a powerful yet harmless and efficient cleaning product that will replace 90% of what you keep in your cupboard in 10 minutes.

The final product is a certified disinfectant, proved cleaner, and deodorizer that is family-safe (no allergens, no endocrine disruptors, no hazard pictograms), zero-waste, and can be thrown away without harming the planet.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Funding, Credibility
Tags: Reusable, Domestic & municipal wastewater, Cleaning, Chemicals alternatives, Detergents & soaps
The environmental benefits: Blue disinfects 80 times quicker than most disinfectants and cleans as well as market references;Reduce both plastic waste and toxic chemicals in wastewater;The ingredients are 100% natural and available on an infinite basis (salt, vinegar);
The Financial benefits: The machine is paid for after 30L of cleaning products (2/3 years for a household, 6 months for professional use);The refills will be directly delivered in your mailbox and cost you less than 2€ per litre of final product;

Our little patented machine turns salt/vinegar and tap water into a zero-waste no hazards powerful multisurface disinfectant deodorizer and cleaner.

Solution on-sentence summary: A smart waste compactor reducing garbage volume at the source
Identification: Overflowing dustbins are a common sight in public places. The root cause of this problem is loose waste that occupies much more space than its actual volume. Garbage, in an uncompacted state, tend to overflow dustbins- and create an unhygienic atmosphere. They require frequent clearing, which ultimately increases the workload of health and sanitation workers. Garbage typically are then transported to open landfills further causing air, water and land pollution, adding to the health and environmental concerns. In most countries, only a fraction of the total garbage is sent for waste processing. The logistics cost is spent in garbage collection from door to door, waste processing centres, and landfill sites. Such collection trips are expensive due to the high number of trips required, fuel and labour cost involved, etc. The solution, RecycloBin is a smart waste compactor bin that aims at bringing efficiency in the current waste management systems by reducing waste volume at the source. RecycloBin can reduce space occupied by loose waste by at least 6 to 10 times as compared to regular dustbins. This solution aims to bring profitability and sustainability into the current waste management systems.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesBuildings Operators, BusinessServicesHotels & Resorts, BusinessServicesInfrastructureAirports and Airbases, BusinessServicesInfrastructurePorts and Marine Infrastructure, BusinessServicesInfrastructureTrain Stations and Railways Infrastructure, BusinessServicesRestaurants & Canteens, BusinessServicesWaste & Remediation
Tags: Waste collection, Sensors & monitoring, PET waste, Paper & pulp waste, Food waste, Municipal Solid Waste, Software
The environmental benefits: Reduces waste volume by 6-10 times;Allows to store 6 times more waste in the same space before clearing bin;Number of trips by garbage trucks can be reduced by 75% with compacted waste;Annual fuel savings by 75%;
The Financial benefits: 75% reduction in waste logistics cost;Less than 2 years payback time;
Complementary solutions: SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);RT7000: A machine to chemically recycle plastic waste back into oil (Industry & Consumer Goods,Waste & Pollution);PYROWATTS: A disruptive waste to energy scalable gasifier for decentralized waste management (Waste & Pollution,Energy);
Organization short description: We develop innovative & efficient technology for businesses and individuals to manage waste more efficiently.
About:
Description of solution:



Be it indoor or outdoor, overflowing dustbins are very common. The garbage typically is then transported to a landfill polluting air, after and land, and a fraction may be sent for waste processing.



In our analysis, we found out that the fundamental problem behind this problem is that loose waste occupies much more space than its actual volume. Additionally, they need frequent clearing, create an unhygienic and unpleasant atmosphere and cause health and environmental concerns. 

This in turn increases the workload of health and sanitation workers and waste transportation operators.



Did you know that most countries spend 60 to 70% of waste management funds on waste transportation alone? And this is because of the high volume that needs to be transported.

After spending so many funds on waste transportation, how much do you think is left for waste processing?



When we think about waste management, most of us think about recycling.

But imagine, along with reducing consumption of goods, if you were able to reduce the volume of waste that you are generating, at the source?



At Earthzy Technology, we help you achieve that.

With our flagship product, RecycloBin Waste Compactor Dustbin, we help reduce the volume of waste at the source. Typically waste is reduced by 6 to 10 times the original volume helping you save time, space, effort and tons of money.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable tile product favoring the employment of vulnerable individuals
Identification: Sustainable engineering for construction products is the order of the day in all areas of our society. This design methodology will become one of the most important product design methodologies in the coming years due to our needs. This sustainable engineering seeks the balance between our social needs (high quality, aesthetics, safety and comfort), providing solutions to our society, reducing costs associated with its manufacture and that means it is accessible to all and finally, something as important as being respectful with the environment. Eco Mallas by ECOCERAMIC are the perfect example of a product made with sustainable engineering. Eco Mallas are mosaics made under a highly sustainable industrial process, in which in addition to containing recycled pre-consumer material, the final product contains material that comes from other final products already manufactured and that reach the end of their life cycle. In addition, Eco Mallas are made by people with disabilities and manually, so our Eco Mallas product contributes to the improvement and helps the employment of one of the most vulnerable sectors of society.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Recycled, Walls & facades, Construction, Construction materials, Brick & tiles

Solution on-sentence summary: A bio-based solvent for extraction of vegetable oils and lipophilic fractions in the agri-food sector
Identification: For the production of oils, especially edible oils, 2 technics are used which are cold pressing for high quality virgin oils, and/or solvent extraction for commodity large volume oils, such as sunflower or rapeseed oils. For the solvent extraction step the current state of the art technology is the use of Hexane, a petrochemical solvent. Hexane is dangerous and toxic for people exposed, such as workers, but as well consumers, because traces are still found in final products brought into the food supply chain. The Solution, EcoXtract, is a safe, non toxic extraction biobased solvent derived from agriculture by-products. This solvent is eco-friendly for users, consumers and as well for the environment as it is biodegradable and reduce carbon footprint of processes where it is implemented. EcoXtract allows the production of  clean human food and animal feed products but could also benefit other industries such as cosmetics, food supplements, pharmaceuticals, flavours and fragrances.
Looking For: Visibility, Credibility
Tags: Biobased, Chemicals, Chemicals alternatives

The Financial benefits: Payback in less than 3 years for new plants;

Solution on-sentence summary: Affordable, safe drinking water refill dispensers
Identification: The Waterpod by I-Drop focuses on providing solutions to two global issues - access to affordable, safe drinking water and preventing single-use plastic waste from pre-bottled water. I-Drop designs, builds and installs self-service purified drinking water refill dispensers called Waterpods for installation in grocery stores, hospitality and public spaces. The solution targets areas with limited access to clean drinking water where consumers need or want an affordable alternative to bottled water. The solution is an innovative product and business model, enabled through a custom-built IOT monitoring and control platform, designed to be as efficient and affordable as possible, expanding the market to consumers who could not previously afford a safe drinking water alternative and enabling those who already purchase bottled water to easily switch.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Credibility, Partners

Solution on-sentence summary: A packaging service minimizing the environmental impact of e-commerce
Identification: With almost 15 billion single-use packaging sent in the world in 2018 and 10% annual growth, e-commerce shipments are generating 4 million tonnes of waste per year. And after Asia closed its doors to the waste from Europe, including cardboard, European recycling centers are saturated. Paper mills factories are now prioritising corporate waste, which is less mixed and less contaminated with other waste than household waste. Other types of cardboard waste are often incinerated or buried. Hipli is acting to minimize the environmental impact of the e-commerce packaging by helping brands to offer a great customer experience without generating waste while reducing significantly the environmental footprint of e-commerce shipments. A packaging as a service for e-commerce: mailers that can be reused 100 times and a logistics to ensure that they are really returned and reused.

Solution on-sentence summary: A hybrid technology solution for the treatment of industrial wastewater containing micropollutants
Identification:
The Solution provides a sustainable, profitable and reliable on-site unit for the treatment and purification of pharmaceutical and chemical wastewaters. It provides an alternative for transport and incineration of hazardous wastewater and removes micropollutants such as Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients and endocrine disruptors. The Solution provides a technical and economical feasible answer to the emerging problem of water quality and drinking water availability.

The solution combines 3 different complementary technology modules and removes and converts active pharmaceutical ingredients via oxygen and ozone, ozonolysis, into biodegradable compounds that can be further treated in biological wastewater treatment. The solution makes it possible to avoid the discharge of pharmaceuticals into surface water and the environment in general.

Solution on-sentence summary: Reshaping the world of packaging through its revolutionary dry forming manufacturing technology and next-generation fibre-based solutions
Identification: Yangi supports brands and converters in achieving their sustainability targets by helping them transform their packaging portfolio into new alternative renewable and sustainable packaging solutions. They assist their partners from ideation through implementation by developing and selling production solutions for dry forming including a turn-key manufacturing machine platform as well as added value services such as customised material recipes, materials on subscription, and ready-made design concepts. Converters and brands can move into more sustainable packaging solutions that offer competitive production costs, fully renewable raw materials and resource-efficient production. Practically speaking, their dry forming technology is a combination of air-laid formation and fast pressing that utilizes cellulose fibres to create 3D-formed packaging without using process water. Cellulose materials fulfil the key requirements of recyclability, rigidity and 3D formation. Yangi can produce 3D-formed packaging directly from cellulose pulp in one machine line at a 30% lower cost than existing fibre-based solutions, with minimal water and less energy use, resulting in a 75% reduction in CO2 emissions. Also, compared to other cellulose materials, dry formed packaging is unique in terms of shapeability, aesthetics, and appearance. Depending on packaging requirements, barrier chemistry can be added in the process or added in a separate sequence afterward.

Solution on-sentence summary: A solid state electrochemical device capturing and recycling waste hydrogen gas
Identification: Hydrogen is used as a process atmosphere in many industries, most notably metal treating, powder metallurgy, glassmaking, and semiconductor manufacturing. It is typically vented during these processes in the same stream as other waste gas components. To date, the waste hydrogen gas has typically not been recovered for reuse. H2RENEW™ Electrochemical Hydrogen Separation and Compression are clean technologies developed by SKYRE to tackle this challenge. SKYRE's builds and sells two products. One captures and recycles hydrogen from waste industrial streams. The other captures and converts carbon dioxide into useful fuels and chemicals. Both deliver up to a 50% cost advantage and a 50% reduction in emission of greenhouse gases over competitive methods and products.

Solution on-sentence summary: Affordable and inclusive gas solution providing clean cooking for the low-income communities
Identification: The existing energetic offer lacks a clean, accessible and affordable option to cook, adapted to the low-income population’s needs: in Africa, electricity is often not accessible and the common use of biomass (paraffin, coal, wood) burnt in open fires is extremely harmful for the consumers' health and the environment. Gas (LPG) could be the solution improving public health, reducing air pollution, with a very low environmental footprint; but the distribution and purchase barriers are too high to let traditional LPG companies to invest on serving the low-income segment. Pay-as-you-Gas is an accessible, affordable, inclusive and eco-responsible clean cooking solution: through the implementation of dispensing gas stations in townships in South Africa -managed by local micro-entrepreneurs-, Pay-as-you-Gas is giving access to LPG gas to low-income communities, fractioning quantities via a Pay-As-You-Go patented system, and avoiding the use of expensive and polluting solutions such as coal or paraffin.

Solution on-sentence summary: A low impact leather-like material from mushroom mycelium
Identification: The solution aims at having low negative impacts on environmental and human health, in comparison with mainstream leathers (animal leather). This solution is made by turning agroforestry waste, such as sawdust, into a growth medium for mushroom mycelia. The humidity and temperature of the mycelia are closely regulated during the incubation period, which is carried out for several weeks until the mycelia layer grows the appropriate thickness. Then, the mycelia are processed by using chromium-free natural dyes. The process doesn't involve animal killings and the mushrooms can grow in vertical farming while consuming less water and emiting low carbon emission. Mylea is a real and convenient alternative to the mainstream leather. The mycelium leather material can be processed further by craftsmen into various products such as wallets, bags, shoes and many more.

Solution on-sentence summary: An electric mobility energy network for light vehicles in Africa which is cheaper and more powerful
Identification: Ampersand offers electric motorcycles and a battery swap station network to power the motorcycle taxi drivers of East Africa. A driver can purchase or lease a motorcycle from Ampersand at a competitive cost with petrol incumbents. Batteries are owned by Ampersand and provided to drivers as a service. Drivers pay for the electricity the same way as petrol – they only pay for what they use. When a new battery is needed, a driver can quickly swap it out for a new one at one of Ampersand’s many conveniently located swap stations, without having to wait for it to charge. 35 motorbikes and batteries have now covered well over 1.3 million km on the streets of Kigali since May 2019.  Ampersand has 7200 drivers signed up to our waiting list.

Solution on-sentence summary: A smart home technology automating energy savings by analyzing energy needs of buildings
Identification: Nowadays a certain number of challenges in the energy sector and residential construction can be observed including high energy bills due to energy overconsumption in buildings or high operating costs for housing associations due to the lack of vision over the current state and energy consumption of their building stock.  In addition, energy-saving and home automation solutions are costly and complex to use and install for building owners. The Eco-Touch solution has been developed to resolve these problems on 2 scales: the scale of an individual dwelling and that of a building stock. The solutions (Eco-Touch, EcoBOS, Eco-Collect) are easy-to-use solutions to automate energy savings in homes and ensure energy monitoring in buildings. Focused on the essentials, they are designed to meet the challenges of energy efficiency in the most efficient way and are suitable for all user profiles (both individuals and companies). With an integrated learning machine technology, the solutions are free of programming constraints and help avoid energy wastes due to tenants' oversights.

Organization short description: The OGGA company designs and markets “Smart Home” and “Smart Building” solutions allowing buildings and homes to consume
About:
OGGA has developed complementary solutions that start from housing and end up at neighborhood level.

Specialized in energy management for housing, OGGA has developed solutions compatible with rental housing so that social landlords accept solutions without hesitation.

The solutions make it possible to reduce energy consumption between 15 and 30% per dwelling.

In addition, alerts are sent to occupants when their consumption becomes higher than expected.

To meet more global objectives, OGGA has developed data collection solutions in apartment buildings, in order to automatically supervise the proper functioning of energy-intensive installations such as the production of hot water or heating. In this way, as soon as a building exhibits abnormal consumption, the lessor is notified in real time as well as the operator of the building.

Smart Grid ready: The collection of all the data makes it possible to predict the consumption of a building complex, prediction based on the habits of the inhabitants and the building. With this information, it is easy to avoid a peak in consumption and optimize the use of renewable energies.

Solution on-sentence summary: Solar panel solution for the mobile tank vaporiser
Identification: In remote operations electric supply may not be possible from a standard land line. Without electric supply, the digital control panel, its level, pressure and telemetry would not work, and without these data, liquified nitrogen or oxygen delivery to refill the mobile tank vaporiser can not be properly planned. The Air Gas Mobile Tank Vaporiser Unit conditioned with Solar Panel aims to deliver large amounts of nitrogen or oxygen both in gas or liquid phase, in remote sites without previous arrangements, with a controlled and efficient supply of product and optimised carbon footprint. The main issues this Solution addresses are the excessive trips a conventional tank vaporiser usually performs in order to maintain non-stop operations, given the lack of proper logistics, which could cause unnecessary CO2 emissions.

Solution on-sentence summary: Revolutionizing the fashion industry by upcycling and reusing textile fibers
Identification:
NOOSA® fiber is a bio-renewable textile fiber, endlessly recyclable. 



NOOSA® provides an innovative fiber to textile manufacturers that 1. shows properties such as increased breathability, stability to UV and low flammability, 2. is 100% recyclable. NOOSA® fights textile waste at pre- and post-consumer level by revalorizing it and creating back a 100% virgin fiber, through a patented recycling technology able to separate blends and remove contaminants. From its bio-based origin to its complete recycling, it helps reducing environmental impact.



NOOSA® fiber ensures a performant product designed to last, therefore reducing consumption and educating customer to buy more consciously and responsibly.

Organization short description: The circular textile fiber
About:
We revolutionize the fashion industry by making it circular. Not only do we fight end-consumer waste but also overproduction, defects and losses along the textile value chain by revalorizing it and creating back a 100% virgin fiber, and this endlessly. 



If circularity through upcycling is our main goal, sustainability is integrated at each step of our life cycle, from raw material production to the end-product. This allows our fiber to have a global environmental impact 50% lower than cotton, the most used natural material in the textile industry. 



We guarantee that every collected clothes made from NOOSA will be recycled back into a virgin fiber. The recycling process uses no harmful chemicals and is FDA approved.



On top of being circular, our fiber has great intrinsic properties such as increased breathability, low odor retention and UV stability. Those properties ensure a performant product designed to last, therefore reducing consumption and educating customer to buy more consciously and responsibly. 



Lastly, NOOSA preserves biodiversity and human livings, both in oceans and on earth. 

NOOSA solves the problem of microplastics ending up in oceans and tap water, since it can be ingested and digested by human livings.

Our fiber is also biodegradable meaning that it will eventually disappear from oceans, should it get out NOOSA loop.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Organization short description: Addressing food shortages via seed production & e-markets by utilizing the climate-smart approaches & digital platform
About:
The major problem is that on average about 9 million people in Ethiopia are in food shortage every year. When seeds’ demand and supply gaps are compared and analyzed, only 3.5% from a total of 12 million hectares of land is planted and covered with improved seed.

Our business solution is clearly stated as follows. Haile Wako Integrated Farm is an agribusiness engaged directly in the production of high yield variety seeds by itself & multiply seeds indirectly by signing a contractual agreement with small-holder farmers via the out-grower scheme to address food security challenges in Ethiopia. Our integrated farm delivers technical support for these out-grower farmers to practice climate-smart agricultural activities such as better extension services, application of inter-cropping, crop rotation as seeds’ production approaches for the enhanced productivities. Post-harvesting of seeds, our farm collects seeds; tags on packaging materials, and ultimately competes for the tender bids on the UN website which the business has already registered on it. Given won the bids, then the farm supplies the seeds produced to UN FAO & other NGOs such as ICRC, Save the Children, etc. Hence, these clients also redistribute seeds for about 1.5 million pro-poor farmers annually and these farmers are those poorest ones that cannot afford to purchase seed by themselves due to the lower-income level till now, these pro-poor farmers have been greatly benefited from the seeds they got in ensuring enhanced production & productivity in previous years and hence improve their overall livelihoods. Besides this, the farm has a plan to establish a tomato paste processing plant to manufacture tomato paste for local & export markets. Furthermore; the integrated farm also has a plan to secure an export license and mainly to export legumes & cereals to UAE markets. This makes my business innovative & unique.

Currently, the farm is the winner of the Youth Alliance for Leadership & Development in Africa of the 2020 virtual summit pre-i-boot camp pitch competition.
SDG’s of application: SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A bio-architecture for energy efficient, natural buildings
Identification:
In the EU, buildings under construction are responsible for 40% of energy consumption, 36% of CO2 emissions and generate 1/3 of all waste. Moreover, most of the construction materials used are of petrochemical origin and have a linear life cycle. According to the “Sick building syndrome”, 40% of all materials used in the construction sector are hazardous. From an agricultural point of view, rice is the most consumed food globally with 66% of the world population basing their diet on rice. Every hectare of rice field produces 7 tons of edible product and 10 tons of residues, which must be dismantled. These by-products are burned on a global level, emitting a significant quantity of CO2. Rice Husk's solution tackles the challenging occurring in both the construction and agricultural sector. 

The company transforms rice residues into 100% natural construction materials that at the end of their service life return to nature. In particular, the company supplies 100% natural insulation material based on rice husk. By using an approach based on bio-architecture, the company enables the construction of energy-efficient, natural buildings, using low-cost rice residues.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Construction, Waste-to-materials, Agricultural Waste, Bran & husk waste, Thermal insulation, Recycle waste, Construction materials

The Financial benefits: Reduction on energy costs for more than 30%;Creation of new job opportunities in the agricultural sector connected with the collection and management of the rice residues ;

Organization short description: Through the use of rice by-products Ricehouse promotes circular economy from the field to the construction site.
About: Ricehouse uses organic residues from rice production and develops, together with partners, 100 % natural building materials that, at the end of their service life return to nature in a circular way. The products are highly efficient in terms of energy consumption. Using these materials, the buildings reduce the need of heating and cooling and become auto sufficient. In an innovative way the company coordinates a short supply chain, creating new economics from the field to the construction site.
