Solution on-sentence summary: A non-thermal plasma nitrogen fixation system for direct application to growers
Identification: Redhill Scientific enables growers to make as much fertilizer as needed, transforming an unavoidable, wildly variable, recurring expense into a one-time capitalized expense. The patented technology uses zero fossil fuels, has zero carbon releases, and can be powered by on-site renewable electricity sources such as wind and solar energy. Redhill's green technology replicates a naturally occurring process in lightning by combining air, water, and electricity to create enough fertilizer for any sized farm. Redhill's agricultural product line can create unlimited amounts of all-natural aqueous nitrogen fertilizer on-site and on-demand, potentially eliminating a grower’s unavoidable recurring cost while reducing fears of runoff and pollution. Additionally, this Solutions can treat contaminated liquids more thoroughly and faster than other existing methods- potentially saving years on project lifetimes and lowering the time-cost of money for remediation engineering firms.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, Funding, Partners, Credibility, New clients, Visibility
Tags: Fertilizing, Agricultural equipment & machinery, Soil remediation
The environmental benefits: No fossil fuels used and no carbon is released as raw materials inputs to manufacture the fertilizer;100% of a growers nitrogen fertilizer needs can be met on site and on demand by using plasma reactor device right-sized for their farm or greenhouse;99% of organic contaminants can be eliminated from contaminated water using Redhill remediation devices;
The Financial benefits: 100% of a grower's annual nitrogen fertilizer expense can potentially be transformed into a one-time capitalized tax-deductible purchase with Redhill's fertilizer production devices ;5 year remediation project times can be potentially cut in half with a Redhill remediation device with a similar ROI and lower operating cost;
Complementary solutions: NEXUS: An alternative for sustainable development of smallholder farmers and fisheries communities (Food & Agriculture);AgRho® S-Boost: An innovative solution for the treatment of seeds (Food & Agriculture);AQUA4D: Water-Smart Irrigation: Precision irrigation for water efficiency and land restoration (Food & Agriculture,Water);Living Farming Tree: A sustainable mini-indoor farm for urban farming (Food & Agriculture);
Organization short description: Redhill Scientific designs and manufactures solutions for nitrogen fertilizer production, and environmental remediation.
About:
Redhill Scientific has exclusive patent licenses on thin-film plasma reactor designs. Our low pressure, low temperature plasma technology is scalable, safe, and simple to manufacture into a broad variety of devices using a common, highly-robust architecture. Over 20 years in the making, our patented process creates nitrate fertilizer on-site and on-demand with a simple combination of air, water, and electricity.



Our agricultural product line can create unlimited amounts of all-natural aqueous nitrogen fertilizer on-site and on-demand, potentially eliminating a grower’s unavoidable recurring cost while reducing fears of runoff and pollution. Engineered for direct application to plants via spray or irrigation, our non-thermal plasma nitrogen fixation system uses zero fossil fuels, releases zero carbon, is more fully utilized by plants, and reduces the chance of evaporation or nitrogen run-off. Our machines replicate the natural nitrate creation process found in thunderstorms. It’s literally lightning in a bottle.



Our environmental remediation technology can be used to degrade numerous toxic organic compounds. Our thin-film reactor product simultaneously and rapidly treats both gas and liquid phase organic pollutants by degrading specific “non-bioavailable” organic wastes into “bio-available” compounds that can be reduced to safe levels for disposal or reduced further in a bioreactor. Our liquid film reactors create hydroxyl (•OH) radicals formed by the dissociation of water by plasma generated within the chambers. These •OH radicals, can dissociate oxidizable materials and compounds in both liquid and gas phases. Our technology is scalable, and can potentially assist clean up efforts of any size from table-top to large industrial spills.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A special cement used to improve and stabilize soils for sustainable road construction
Identification: Holcim Base Vial modifies the characteristics of the soils and the granular bases (new or existing) by incorporating cement and water, improving its mechanical properties as the cement hydrates. Using Holcim Base Vial implies an increase in the rigidity and mechanical resistance of the granular material. Consequently, it allows them to be more resistant to the permanent deformation that trucks induce to the pavement structure. These mechanical advantages translate into a considerable structural contribution that allows the thickness of the pavement structure to be reduced without affecting its structural capacity. From an environmental point of view, the implementation of Holcim Base Vial represents a great advantage because it decreases the need to search and exploit sources of very high-quality aggregates due to the improvement of the mechanical properties of the site soils.

The Financial benefits: Roads stabilized with Base Vial are 25% cheaper than roads built with traditional methods;Savings of 25,000 USD / year in road maintenance;Saving of 8.8 USD / m2 for 30% reduction of pavement structure;

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable smart village for the rural world
Identification:
The SUEZ Smart Village is a game-changer for emerging countries that will face strong uncontrolled urbanisation and increased climate change effects. It consists of an integrated solution aiming at providing basic services to isolated populations or in rural areas.

It is composed of a compact drinking water production unit, an off-grid energy supply unit and latrines coupled with a biogas plant treating the organic waste and producing cooking gas. Moreover, considering the utilities provided, the shipping containers can be reused and arranged for other services such as wifi, money transfer, post office. This solution creates real "city centers" in remote areas of developing countries in order to encourage the settlement of populations while offering concrete solutions to the challenges of climate change. Suez Smart Village is also a social project, avoiding massive migrations towards big cities.

About:
Since the end of the 19th century, SUEZ has built expertise aimed at helping people to constantly improve their quality of life by protecting their health and supporting economic growth. With an active presence on five continents, SUEZ and its 90,000 employees strive to preserve our environment’s natural capital: water, soil, and air. SUEZ provides innovative and resilient solutions in water management, waste recovery, site remediation and air treatment, optimizing municipalities’ and industries’ resource management through “smart” cities and improving their environmental and economic performance. The Group delivers sanitation services to 64 million people and produces 7.1 billion m3 of drinking water. SUEZ is also a contributor to economic growth, with more than 200,000 jobs created directly and indirectly on an annual basis, and a provider of new resources, with 4.2 million tons of secondary raw materials produced. 

By 2030, the Group is targeting 100% sustainable solutions, with a positive impact on our environment, health and climate. SUEZ generated total revenue of €18.0 billion in 2019.

Solution on-sentence summary: High-tech, low-cost building-system, without any sand or petroleum-based materials
Identification: Ecocell consists of high-tech but cost-effective composite materials. A conventional building with a living space of 100m2 causes CO2 emissions of approx. 30to CO2e, whereas the same building in ECOCELL binds approximately 15 tonnes CO2e in the wood components. In the case of Bamboocell, where bamboo is used instead of wooden boards, the CO2 reduction is further reduced to 30 tonnes CO2e. The structure of the paper honeycomb consists of 100% recycled paper and is coated with a recyclable mineral coating. The fossilised paper honeycombs do not contain any petroleum-based substances and can replace polystyrene insulation in SIP's (Structural insulated panels).
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Recycled, Paper, Construction, Construction materials
The environmental benefits: The CO2 difference between conventional building and ecocell is 60to CO2e per residential unit with 100m2;No sand required;Requires no oil-based materials;
The Financial benefits: Large-scale manufacturing of ecocell building elements allows cost savings of 30-40% in construction;The fossilized paper honeycomb does not contain any mineral oil-based substances and can be used to replace the petroleum-based polystyrene, used for insulation in house construction;
Complementary solutions: SopraStar: Reducing urban warming by using solar reflective cool roof membrane (Buildings & Shelters);IPSIIS : Insulation based on mineral foam for better energy conservation (Buildings & Shelters,Waste & Pollution);Sopratec III: Energy efficient building airtightness system (Buildings & Shelters);Pavatex: 100% bio-sourced energy-efficient thermal insulation of buildings (Buildings & Shelters,Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: Building with prefabricated standard elements, made of 1/4 sustainable raw materials and 3/4 of recycled paper
About:
The Basic Idea of the newly developed ECOCELL fast Building System is quite simply explained:



“Building as if with LEGO-Bricks!”



That meens: Building with prefabricated standard elements, made of 1/4 sustainable raw materials such as wood or bamboo and 3/4 of recycled paper that gets fossilized in a special process. These construction elements can be used like large LEGO bricks to build without architectural restrictions.



In this Process, every possible working Hour is shifted from the Construction Site to the Factory and built with high precision, but standardized Components.



Lightweight composite Technology is being used in this Process, as it already is in the Automotive and Aerospace Industries. Since a composite Element, consists mainly of a Core of Honeycombs in addition to a top and bottom cover Board, I focused on the Development of a Honeycomb, that can be manufactured quickly. With the “fossilized” Paper Honeycomb, which consists of 100% recycled paper and is provided with Mineral coating, I developed a new high-tech by low-cost Product. 



The standardized building elements can be used as Floor, Wall Ceiling and Roof Elements. Entire Houses can be built from these Components by simply plugging the together. The Aim is to reduce the Work of Craftsmen on the Construction Site, to a Minimum and the Assembly of the individual Components. In other Words, building as if with “LEGO-Bricks” and in such a way that the Houses are immediately habitable after Assembly.



In Germany alone, more than 650,000 People are Living on the Streets without Shelter, and more than 2.0 Million Homes are needed. This shows that the Construction of Housing, especially Social Housing, is no longer supported by Private Investors and is increasingly becoming the Responsibility of the individual States. The idea of ECOCELL is also to provide affordable living!



For Example, ECOCELL could save more than 35 Million tons of CO2 in the 1.5 Million Homes planned by the German Government, compared to solid Construction. This corresponds to the Annual CO2-Emissions of 20 Million Cars, i.e., half of all Cars registered in Germany. By using Bamboo instead of wooden boards, the CO2-reduction can even be increased.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Real-time indoor air quality monitoring and automation for buildings
Identification: Hardware and data analytics to help businesses today address indoor environmental concerns in an energy-efficient way. Kaiterra’s commercial air quality monitoring solution and data analytics provide a way for people to see the air they are breathing and improve their indoor environment via data-driven, energy-efficient strategies. Using real-time data collected by highly accurate air quality sensors, including PM2.5, TVOC, CO2, temperature, and humidity, and Kaiterra’s air quality dashboard and analytics algorithms, building owners and facility managers can integrate real-time air quality and environment data into existing building control and automation systems, to gain a full understanding of the indoor environment, identify risk areas, and further improve comfort, wellness, and the efficiency of HVAC and purification systems.

Organization short description: Air Quality & Environmental Monitoring Solutions for Low Carbon Healthy Buildings
About: Kaiterra is leading the global movement to help companies achieve low-carbon, healthy buildings. Founded in 2014 by Swiss entrepreneur Liam Bates, Kaiterra provides comprehensive environmental monitoring devices, intelligent software analytics, and turn-key building integrations to optimize the built environment for occupant wellbeing, energy efficiency, and carbon reduction. Kaiterra’s solutions can be found in many of the world’s most iconic buildings, such as the Empire State Building and the Burj Khalifa, as well as in commercial, residential, and industrial projects all over the world. For more information, visit www.kaiterra.com.

Solution on-sentence summary: A biogreen pyrolysis process converting waste into useful products
Identification: Biogreen decarbonises industrial processes by converting waste and biomass into renewable carbon materials and fossil free energy. Biogreen is an extremely versatile system, based on an electrically heated screw conveyor (Spirajoule®), designed for advanced thermal treatment in temperatures up to 800C and beyond. Processed product temperature is precisely controlled basing on the temperature settings. The dwell time of material inside Biogreen® reactor is regulated by screw rotation speed. Thanks to its precisely controlled continuous and fully automatic process Biogreen truly support circular and sustainable economy in a profitable way.

Organization short description: We decarbonize industrial processes, converting waste and biomass into renewable carbon materials and fossil free energy
About:
In Vow and our subsidiaries Scanship and Etia we are passionate about preventing pollution. Our world leading solutions convert biomass and waste into valuable resources and generate clean energy for a wide range of marine applications and land-based industries.



Cruise ships on every ocean have our technology which processes waste and purifies wastewater. Fish farmers are adopting similar solutions, and public utilities and industries use our solutions for sludge processing, waste and plastic management and biogas production.



Our ambitions go further than this. With our advanced technologies and solutions, we turn waste into biogenetic fuels to help decarbonize the industry and convert plastic waste into fuel, clean energy and high-value pyro carbon. Our solutions are scalable, standardized, patented and thoroughly documented, and our capability to deliver is well proven. Our solutions are key to end waste and stop pollution.



Located in Oslo, Norway, the parent company Vow ASA is listed on the Oslo Stock Exchange (symbol: Vow). In 2018, the companies that are now part of Vow had combined annual revenues of NOK 430 million and 120 employees in Norway, France, Poland and the US.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A cordless rain water tank helping you to water your garden in a more sustainable way
Identification: GardenPump 18 aims at providing clients with a sustainable and profitable option to water their gardens. Good for the environment and better for plants – the cordless GardenPump 18 works easily with all styles of garden rainwater tanks and provides faster and more effective watering around the garden. This Rainwater Pump is perfect for natural and more enjoyable watering of flower beds and fruit and vegetables, or pots and planters. Within the banded area the average household with a water tank should be able collect in excess of 1000 litres of rainwater per annum for garden use. We estimate that there are possibly 6 million water tanks in use in Europe so there is potential to save 6 billion litres of tap grade water. Garden Pump 18 has a similar flow rate to an outside tap so the water saving is actually the key factor. For users who currently use watering cans, this Solution will save considerable time and effort undertaking the watering process.
Looking For: Visibility, New clients, Credibility
Tags: Gardening, Water pumping, Irrigation

The Financial benefits: 10 times cheaper than using a water can with tap ;Payback time in 2 weeks;2 880€ saved every year per GardenPump 18V user (at least 14 400€ saved during the GP lifetime);

Organization short description: Bosch, is a world leading multinational engineering and electronics company headquartered in Gerlingen, near Stuttgart, Germany.
About:
The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. It employs roughly 410,000 associates worldwide (as of December 31, 2018). In 2018, the company generated sales of 78.5 billion euros. Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected industry. It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source. The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to create solutions for a connected life, and to improve quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is “Invented for life.” 



The Bosch Group comprises Robert Bosch GmbH and its roughly 460 subsidiaries and regional companies in some 60 countries. Including sales and service partners, Bosch’s global manufacturing, engineering, and sales network covers nearly every country in the world. The basis for the company’s future growth is its innovative strength. At 130 locations across the globe, Bosch employs 68,700 associates in research and development.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: High definition, homogeneous and precise weather data for the emerging world
Identification:
Meteorological and climate events directly affect 70% of companies’ activities in the world, and 80% of the world’s land is not covered by radar. This poses financial, social, and environmental issues, which is why HD Rain offers an expert solution with high-definition weather observations and forecasts. The data generated enables companies, governments, and individuals to be more informed, resilient, and efficient when dealing with meteorological and climate change. The company’s innovation lies in the use of TV satellite to generate data via the use of robust, autonomous, and efficient sensors and artificial intelligence algorithms. 

HD Rain offers precipitation maps among other products and services, with a spatial resolution of 500 meters by 500 meters, a forecast of up to 2 hours and minute-by-minute data processing.

This innovative solution is customizable and responds to both developed and developing countries needs for high-definition, ultra-local and low-cost weather data.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Reusable, Algorithms & AI, Sensors & monitoring, Wind power, Stormwater runoffs
Sectors: Infrastructures, Food/Agri, Crops care, Ecosystems management
The environmental benefits: A spatial resolution of 500 meters by 500 meters;A forecast of up to 2 hours in advance;Minute-by-minute data processing;100 % autonomous in energy;100% reusable ;0 electromagnetic waves created;
The Financial benefits: 10 times cheaper than mainstream alternative;4 months or less payback time;Increase of the local economy by 20% or more;

Organization short description: HD Rain provides very high-resolution weather measurements and forecasts for weather sensitive zones and activities.
About:
To reinvent the weather forecast is HD Rain’s leitmotif. 



Urged by the intensification of extreme climate events and the lack of micro-meteorological data, HD Rain's solution was developed to make individuals, companies and governments more informed, resilient and efficient when dealing with extreme weather events. 



Founded 4 years ago, by 2 doctors in meteorology and 1 engineer, HD Rain offers very high-resolution weather observations and forecasts for weather-sensitive zones and activities. Innovative at all levels of processes, the start-up opportunistically connects its sensors to lambda TV satellites to generate its data. The loss of signal in rainy days is measured, analyzed and coupled with artificial intelligence algorithms enabling the company to provide observations with a precision of 500m and forecasts of up to 2-hours in advance, both updated minute by minute on its precipitation maps. 



The system is therefore based on three pillars : 



1) Sensors | are autonomous, robust and efficient.

2) System |  uses artificial intelligence and deep learning.

3) Data | is high definition, precise and in real time. 



The 3 pillars combined offer an expert, ultra local and low cost solution to both developed and developing countries. Whether the goal is to add an additional set of data to existing infrastructures or to build up one in areas where weather data is non-existent, HD Rain's added value is multifaceted. 



The company offers 2 ways of collaboration. 

In the case where HD Rain sensors are already installed in a given area. The start-up offers monthly data subscription, with different levels of parameters (rain, temperature, humidity, pressure and soon snow and hail), data volume, insight and visualisation tools (web app or API). 

In the case where HD Rain is not present in the desired area, the start-up offers the opportunity to co-create a personalized project that answers the geographical, budgetary and technical challenges faced by the interested company. HD Rain implements projects in France and internationally, responding to various water-related issues. 



With a growing international network of 250 robust, HD Rain already collaborates with different clients coming from insurance (classic and parametric), agriculture, energy, water management, and public sectors. 2021, will be marked by HD Rain's massive deployment in the French Mediterranean Arc, with the goal of installing 1 000 sensors. In parallel, the company will keep working on its international projects in the Ivory Coast, Brazil and Georgia, with the hope to grow, widen its client's panel, and always provide the best possible data.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Smart ev routing making charging and driving evs effortless and efficient
Identification: The electric mobility ecosystem is extremely fragmented. It is complicated for individual drivers and fleet operators to drive EVs effortlessly over long distances, across borders, or use them with high commercial intensity. This is because on-route charging is complex due to the different standards in plug-type, charge power, payment systems, waiting-lines, variable charge speeds, and outside variables like temperature, weather, topography, that impact the range of a battery. Traditional routing engines cannot deal with all these additional variables. This solution seeks to overcome this challenge by providing an EV routing engine that makes EVs predictable. The routing algorithm considers 15 static and dynamic variables to calculate the best route to a driver's destination and identifies the optimal charge stations in between. Our routing engine is exposed through a GraphQL API that is easy to integrate into existing consumer navigation and telemetric fleet applications.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: Individual, BusinessServicesInfrastructureRoads & Road Traffic Infrastructure, BusinessServicesTransportersTrucks & Other Road Vehicles
Tags: Electric, Cars, EV charging, Route optimization, Software, Vehicles, Electric vehicles
Sectors: Mobility, Sell and trade, Energy and fuel efficiency

The Financial benefits: Payback period of around 4 months for API clients;TCOs of an EV are 5% lower than for a similar ICE vehicle;

Organization short description: Chargetrip offers Smart EV Routing as an API-based SaaS platform that makes it easy to drive and charge any EV.
About:
What we do:

Chargetrip offers smart route planning and navigation specific for Electric Vehicles (EV’s). This makes it easy for anyone, to use any EV beyond the range of the battery, operate fleets of EVs effortlessly, while simultaneously reducing operations costs.



How we do it:

Chargetrip develops an API-based SaaS platform for Electric Mobility. Our routing engine uses over fifteen different (dynamic) variables to calculate the real-time range of any electric vehicle (currently 246 EV models). Proprietary algorithms then compute the best route to a user’s destination, with the optimal charge stations in between, specific to their journey, business logic, and preferences. Build-in predictive models optimize for total travel time and travel costs. Chargetrip is easy to integrate into existing navigation- and telemetric fleet applications.



Traction:

Chargetrip has successfully implemented a number of EV-specific routing solutions. Our implementations include API services and front-end applications for:  

- EV-member organizations (e.g., Norwegian EV Association, ANWB), 

- Automotive Manufacturers (e.g., Porsche, Lightyear), 

- Charge Point Operators (e.g., EnBW, Iberdrola, EDP, Recharge), 

- Mobility Service Providers (e.g., Total, Autosense), and 

- Transportation Network Companies. 

Currently, over 175.000 EV drivers use our software every month, equal to 10% of all EVs in Europe.



Why it is important: 

The electric charge- and drive eco-system is extremely fragmented. It is complicated for individual drivers and fleet operators to drive EVs effortlessly over long distances, across borders, or use EVs commercially with high intensity. This is because on-route charging is complex due to the different standards in plug-type, charge power, payment systems, waiting-lines, variable charge speeds, and outside variables like temperature, weather, topography, that impact the range of a battery. 



These flaws in the ecosystem cause three adoption barriers for individuals and fleet operators; Range Anxiety, Charge Anxiety, and the TCO complexity of operating an electric fleet. We know that Smart EV Routing, including predictive models for charge-congestion, and dynamic energy prices, alleviates these barriers, and accelerates global mass adoption of electric mobility. In the coming years our API will help to optimize the TCO of EV fleets; owned, leased, rented, shared and autonomous.



Chargetrip is a team of 22 based in Amsterdam, with presence in Chicago, St. Moritz and Bucharest.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: An automated system to save up to 20% of fuel for transportation vessels
Identification: Beyond the Sea is developing a kite propulsion system to reduce fuel consumption and gas emissions in maritime transport. Today, shipping accounts for 90% of world trade and emitted 1,046 million tonnes of CO2 in 2007. Today, most ship owners are facing a decline in revenue in a competitive market due to the changing price of oil. By using wind as a source of energy, equipped ships will reduce their greenhouse gas emissions as part of the energy used will be renewable. The kite, in addition to helping to propel the boat, will reduce fuel consumption. Studies show that 20% of the fuel will be saved at constant speed. Depending on the desired speed, the engine can be turned off completely, and the boat will then use only the wind - a free and environmentally friendly source of energy - for propulsion.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Credibility
Tags: Boats, Cargo ships, Route optimization, Maritime shipping, Wind power, Vehicles
Sectors: Freight, Mobility, Energy and fuel efficiency

Organization short description: The beyond the sea®'s project aims to develop a specialised kite technology to tow ships, using wind as an energy.
About:
Yves Parlier, a sailor internationally well-known for his sporting results in most prestigious offshore regattas, has been developing with his team, since 2014, a resolutely innovative project in the purest respect of the environment. This kite traction project, straight from Kitesurfing technology, aims to use the wind as unique source of energy. 



By using the potential of French researchers, we are building an extraordinary team of competent and motivated women and men. We also develop strategic research partnerships with prestigious engineering schools, Kite professionals, and sailors, all focused on responsible Innovation. 



The scope of the kite towing will be wide: from Merchant Navy to pleasure craft, or fishing boats. 



Beyond the Sea ® will open up new opportunities for all those who practice the sea. This solution will be revolutionary from environmental, safety and economic points of view, by combining multiple strengths that will make it an indispensable solution for ships of all sizes.

Solution on-sentence summary: A new wave-powered, flexible seawater desalination system for developing countries
Identification: According to UNDP, today more than 1 billion people lack access to clean and safe drinking water and the situation will dramatically worsen in the next 20 years unless clean water supplies increase by about 50% and access is more evenly distributed. To tackle this challenge, Resolute Marine developed Wave2O™. Wave2O™ technology is a proprietary seawater desalination process that couples Resolute Marine’s wave energy converters with onshore desalination and electricity generating plants. While this solution has been designed with simple operation and maintenance in mind, it incorporates several innovative and patented technologies. Resolute Marine’s mission is to significantly improve access to water for coastal populations and industrial/agricultural operations in developing countries and small island developing states (SIDS) and to displace the diesel-electric desalination system that are in common use worldwide. The key technologies that enable Wave2O™ have been validated in a series of tests which have proven to be reliable and cost-effective to produce clean water in multiple places and across multiple uses around the world.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Coastal, Marine & Oceans, Desalination (= seawater purification), Wave & Tidal power
The environmental benefits: Employs several wave energy converters (WECs) that pressurize seawater which is piped ashore to directly drive a seawater reverse-osmosis (RO) desalination system;Wave2O™ requires no other sources of energy other than ocean waves;Due to the low permeate recovery ratio and the relatively small size of Wave2O™ plants, the post-production brine is diluted to a point where it presents no harm to the environment;Wave2O™ is powered by an abundant, inexhaustible, consistent and clean renewable energy resource and has been designed so that post-process brine can be discharged directly into the sea without harm;Each 4,000 m3/day Wave2O™ plant that replaces an equivalent-size diesel-powered plant will cut CO2 emission by 5,500 tons per year which corresponds to taking 1,050 cars off the road;
The Financial benefits: The operation and maintenance of Wave2O™ systems and the production of wave energy converters will require skilled local labor and suppliers and will create many local jobs;A 4,000 m3/day Wave2OTM plant can produce water at €1.20/m3 which is less than the €3.60/m3 minimum of diesel-electric desalination systems and 3.7x lower than the average cost of water in Cabo Verde;

Organization short description: Resolute is developing renewable water solutions that serve communities and regions in developing countries & islands.
About:
Resolute Marine is developing a technology that harnesses ocean wave energy to produce fresh water and electricity in off-grid areas of the world and thus provide relief from the harmful economic and social effects of water scarcity. Our goal is to improve access to water for coastal populations and agricultural operations in developing countries and islands and to displace the diesel-powered systems that are in common use worldwide. Resolute Marine Energy, Inc. is based in Boston, MA USA and its European subsidiary, Resolute Marine Limited, was founded in 2014 and is based in Ireland.



Resolute Marine’s Wave2O™ technology harnesses the abundant and consistent energy of ocean waves to directly drive a reverse-osmosis desalination process. The key technologies that enable Wave2O™ have been validated in a series of tests which have proven that it can be a reliable and cost-effective water production system with utility in multiple places and in multiple uses around the world. While Wave2O™ has been designed with simple operation and maintenance in mind, it incorporates several innovative technologies invented by RME.



Wave2O™benefits for customers include: low capital investment; rapid deployment; simple operation & maintenance; readily scalable; minimal environmental impact; and low cost/m3 of water produced. For our launch customer in Cape Verde, Wave2O™ can supply fresh water at a cost 3x lower than the diesel-electric systems currently in use.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: A tri-generation energy management solution for simultaneous storage, use and distribution of electricity
Identification: MAN ETES stands for Electro-Thermal Energy Storage; it produces and stores heat, cold and electricity at a large scale. Therefore, it is the ideal system for the increasingly important "Sector Coupling", meaning the merging of energy suppliers and consumers. MAN ETES helps municipalities, institutions and companies to reach their goal of CO2 neutrality by providing a system that is completely environmentally friendly and decarbonizing. In contrast to the majority of the competition, this solution uses CO2 as a refrigerant, which is neither toxic to its environment nor flammable as well as inexpensive and easily accessible. Furthermore, the technology solution is powered by MAN's HOFIM® compressor with an integrated expander, which is hermetically-sealed and operating without lube oil. MAN ETES, with electrical inputs from 2 to 14 MW, can provide hundreds of MWh of thermal energy per day and unit with temperature levels between 0° and 150°C.

Organization short description: Hya Bioplastics exists to create green and sustainable food packaging across the entire African continent.
Headquarters: 7k Old Port Bell Rd, Kampala, Uganda
About:
Hya Bioplastics is a startup that creates biodegradable packaging from agricultural waste. We use starch-biofiber composites relying on plant-fiber from agricultural waste and starch from the largely undervalued cassava(tapioca) starch.  



There is a growing demand for green food packaging across the African continent primarily coming from the customers and changing government policies. With about 30 of 53 countries across the continent having introduced partial or full bans on single-use plastic packaging, restaurants and other food-related businesses are transitioning to greener more sustainable packaging. Plastic pollution has had adverse effects such as blocked drainage channels across most major cities that lead to frequent disease outbreaks.



With the growing need for sustainable packaging, all green packaging is imported from China and India. This leaves it much more expensive in comparison to conventional plastics. There is a need for a more cost-effective green sustainable packaging made from locally available bio-sourced materials.



Our solution.

At Hya Bioplastics, we have created a biodegradable packaging material from thermoplastic starch and fiber composites. We have been able to experiment and use a variety of plant fibers such as sugarcane bagasse, corn stover, banana stems as well as sawdust. For our starch source, we have been able to extensively experiment with cassava starch.



We have been able to design and fabricate our mini-pilot scale machinery in-house including a small extruder and a thermoforming machine to achieve our current production of about 50-100 trays per day. We have been in production for the past 3 months getting more than $1000 in revenue for our vegetable and fruit trays.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Organization short description: We produce biosourced & fully recyclable hydropower solutions for rivers, tide and waves for a real sustainable future.
About:
In order to meet the environmental objectives set for 2050, it is essential to make our energy production based on real sustainable solutions. Currently, massive investments are made to develop and build renewable energy solutions like wind turbines and solar panels. Once their exploitation phase started, these solutions indeed provide an energy that is from a renewable source and do not release Carbon dioxide in the atmosphere. 

But in order for a solution to be truly sustainable, all the phase of it's life cycle need to be taken into account. That's why it is important for our future to rely on energy solutions that actually produce way more energy during their life cycle than what is required for their sourcing, production and disposing/recycling phases. Moreover, it is important for a solution to be respectful of its direct environment and not impact the wildlife.



VH quatrevingtreize was launched in 2017 with the conviction that a true sustainable future was possible. Therefore, we set the following environmental criteria for our products:

- Production of renewable energy

- Way more energy produced during the exploitation phase than the energy required for the production and the recycling phase

- Environmental friendly and not harming the wildlife

- Easy public acceptance



We produce biosourced and fully recyclable hydropower solutions that can extract energy from :

- rivers and estuaries

- tide

- Waves



The technology is based on our patented soft blade Savonius rotor. the upside of this rotor is the fact that it can harvest energy from the different sources mentioned above and its efficiency is doubled compared to a classic Savonius rotor. Moreover, its slow and smooth rotation does not harm the fish or birds living in the exploitation area.  It can even work as a wind turbine in order to produce hybrid sea solutions (wind/wave).

This is the result of Stephan Guignard's research at Aix-Marseille University then the maturation of the technology with the SATT Sud-Est in France. 

this technology is labelled "greentech verte" and has won different innovator competitions.



All our solutions are made from a local biosourced material which is a mix of pine needles and linen fiber. This material allows us to fully recycle our modules into new ones.



The simplicity of the technology and its biosourced material allow our solutions to have an economic and energetic Return on Investment lower than 5 years.     





“Reflect on the motion of the waves, the flux and reflux, the ebb and flow of the tides. What is the ocean? An enormous force wasted. How silly the earth is not to make use of the ocean.”

Victor Hugo (Quatre-vingt-treize, 1873)
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy

Solution on-sentence summary: A portable, fast, accurate, and simple water testing system
Identification: Water Lens is a portable, fast, accurate, and simple water testing system that improves public health and reduces reliance on scarce freshwater resources. The test is easy enough that anyone can test water anywhere in the world by themselves. No lab and no chemist required. The Water Lens system is run with 3 simple steps. Results are generated by colourimetric assays run in parallel. Water Lens software automatically processes the raw data and generates a formal water quality report. In addition to water composition, this report contains technical insights on the chemical properties and characteristics of the water sample. The entire process can be completed in less than 15 minutes. Most industries deal with water-related issues every day. However, waiting for days and weeks to get results back from the laboratories causes major repair, maintenance, and environmental issues. By obtaining results in real-time, companies can proactively address water issues.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile:
Public Authorities, BusinessManufacturingPetroleum & Coke Products
, BusinessWater Utility, BusinessMining & Extraction
Tags: Sensors & monitoring, Software
Sectors: Waste/Pollution, Water, Water supply, Wastewater management
The environmental benefits: Test for 29+ parameters, on location, without needing any scientific background;Similar or superior accuracy compared with fully equipped environmental laboratories;From raw sample to analysis report in less than 15 minutes;Allows increased use of non-potable water in applications that typically use potable water/freshwater;Ensures water meets environmental compliance standards before discharge;Optimize industrial processes to reduce carbon emissions;
The Financial benefits: Prevents damages to millions of dollars to industrial equipment and assets;Less than 50% of the cost of traditional laboratory analysis;Helps prevent public health problems due to poor water quality and lack of fresh water due to overuse by industrial and agricultural companies;
Complementary solutions: OSMOSUN: A sustainable, flexible energy source for affordable and renewable water for all (Water);REM: A novel acid regeneration system for steel pickling (Waste & Pollution,Water,Industry & Consumer Goods);WATA™ technology: Devices to enable local treatment and disinfection of water (Water);E.S.T.: An intelligent robot-based system for automatic extraction, treatment and packaging of sediments (Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: With Water Lens, anyone can analyze water on-site in minutes to protect public health and optimize water processes.
About:
Water Lens provides an accurate and consistent on-site water testing system that can analyze 30+ inorganic parameters in 10 minutes. The system is currently being used around the world to monitor water in all types of environments.  In 2020, Water Lens introduced its Water Genetics(TM) platform to monitor SARS-CoV-2 in individuals and wastewater.  In 2021, Water Lens is expanding this Water Genetics(TM) platform to cover a host of bacteria and viruses that adversely affect public health and water-intensive commercial and governmental operations.



Roughly 90% of the world’s fresh water is used for industrial and agricultural purposes; rather than domestic purposes such as drinking, washing, and cleaning.  However, not every commercial process, crop or animal requires the same quality of water.  Having access to rapid and accurate water quality data enables cost-effective recycling and reuse of water to give farmers and businesses the confidence they need to increase their use of recycled waters and take the pressure off freshwater resources.



The goal of Water Lens from the outset was to democratize water testing and bring it out of the lab and into the hands of everyday people for commercial or personal use.  All of Water Lens tests are designed to be fast & easy-to-use so that the average, non-technical person can gain the benefit of accurate water quality data wherever they are in the world.  No lab and no chemist required!
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure

Solution on-sentence summary: A cost-efficient, lightweight and fuel-efficient irrigation system
Identification: It is of utmost importance to push agricultural development in a sustainable, clean and economical direction. Seeking to achieve these goals, PROTECTOR emerges as an absolutely novel, and easy to use accessory based on a non-stick and water repellent protective film system placed between the ground and the polyethylene hose, protecting hose from gluing, strenuous abrasions and high friction. It is a fully automated self-efficient device with an autonomous mechanism. PROTECTOR allows the use of thinner hoses (cheaper than traditional long hoses) and lighter tractors (which are cheaper and more manageable), plus makes possible to use longer hoses in a more efficient way. In consequence, it reduces the high energy consumption used for pumping water and for positioning the hose, allowing sprinklers to work at more adequate pressure. PROTECTOR makes agriculture more environmentally sustainable: water is used more efficiently, energy consumption and associated GHG emissions are reduced and less plastic is used.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility
Tags: Lightweight, Irrigation

Solution on-sentence summary: Artificial intelligence for saving water resources and energy on water distribution networks
Identification: HpO® aims at making public water distribution networks more efficient, sustainable and resilient today and in the next decades. HpO® relies on Artificial Intelligence and engineering services to predict failures, prevent leaks and save water resources and energy on water distribution networks. It gives two valuable outputs: which streets to inspect first for leak detection so as to reduce the duration of existing leaks; and which network components to replace first for maximum technical and financial performance to reduce the number of leaks in the future. HpO® also accounts for the ageing of water networks everywhere in the world. They are buried and the threat remains invisible. The investment costs for water network replacement are too high to be sustainable on a short period of time. This investment has to be stretched out over decades, starting today. HpO® helps to predict risks and target the replacements where they will be the most efficient, year after year.

Co-founded in 2013 by IIT graduates - Tarun Mehta and Swapnil Jain, Ather Energy is one of the few hardware startups in India. The company has built India’s first truly intelligent electric scooters and is backed by the founders of Flipkart, Tiger Global and Hero Motocorp.





Designed from scratch, the Ather 450 & Ather 340 are products made in India that have been customized to Indian conditions and riding sensibilities.  Every little thing in and around the products have been crafted from seamless ownership experience. 







The ﬂagship Ather 450 comes with a top speed of 80 kmph, a range of up to 75 km and an acceleration of 0-40 kmph in 3.9sec and ensures a riding experience that’s ideally suited for city commute. Both the Ather scooters are equipped with a touchscreen interactive dashboard and an integrated app which allows ﬁrst in its category features like onboard navigation, remote diagnostics and over-the-air (OTA) updates for future improvements. 



The Ather 450 & the Ather 340 will initially be launched in Bengaluru, scaling up to Chennai and Pune. Ather has opened it's ﬁrst experience centre, AtherSpace in Indiranagar, Bengaluru. Here, product specialists personally take interested customers through every detail of the vehicles and manage the test ride, while the purchases are made online, on the company website. 



Ather will also set up charging solutions for each consumer at their residence for  overnight charging. 



What will complete the experience is AtherGrid, a comprehensive public charging network launched in May this year. With 30 locations on board, Bengalureans will ﬁnd this infrastructure within 4 km of reach. Designed keeping in mind the lifestyle of the owners, it’s set up at places they would visit-  tech parks, shopping malls, multiplexes, cafes and restaurants and allows them to charge up to 80% in an hour.

Solution on-sentence summary: A low carbon footprint solution for the cement and concrete industry
Identification: Cement production is responsible for 9% of global CO2 emissions. Today fly-ash (a byproduct from coal-fired power plants) is being added to keep both carbon footprint and costs down. However, as coal-fired power generation is being phased out in many regions of the world, there is a shortage resulting in increased pricing. The cement and concrete industry are forced to find alternatives and the CemShaleTM product produced with the CemTowerTM equipment is meeting their growing needs. The CemShaleTM + CemTowerTM solution provides a high-performance low-cost and low-carbon footprint cement additive, utilizing abundantly available raw materials. CemShaleTM produced on CemTowerTM is cheaper to produce, based on shale which is excavated in the same locations as other cement raw material (limestone) and is globally available in abundance. Additionally,  CemShaleTM has a 95% lower carbon footprint than cement and can substitute up to 35% of the final cement within already ratified standards without compromising the properties of the end product. The technology has a global reach and brings the opportunity to reduce global CO2 emissions by up to 4.81% by 2050.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: A process that reduces energy consumption for the industrial thermal drying process
Identification: The Coomtech SMR solution to drying bulk solids materials of surface moisture works by shearing the moisture off particles in controlled turbulent airflow. Warmed to an average of 85C,  it optimises its ability to hold the water separate from the particles. It is a lean phase process treating particles in under a second, dealing with a range of moisture levels dependant upon the material dried. It presents a singular and viable alternative to thermal drying which is the traditional approach, heating water till it reaches 100C then on up to vaporisation. Because it is only heating air to 85C and air does all the work of stripping, the Coomtech SMR system delivers a lower cost and lower emissions system over the life of a plant. It’s a modular configuration that can manage from 32,000 mtpa up to multiple hundreds of thousands of tonnes. The plant can integrate with existing systems including using low-grade waste heat sources or can be a standalone remote plant.
Looking For: New clients, Funding, Partners
Tags: Manufacturing, Industrial process heat
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Industrial Heat, Manufacturing and construction processes
The environmental benefits: Energy costs can be cut by up to 75% from thermal drying by traditional technologies;Can cut up to 75% of the CO2 emissions versus a thermal drying plant;The system is gentle and low temperature for materials sensitive to those characteristics and tends to break up softer agglomerates sending the particle size distribution toward the finer end for most products with agglomerating tendencies.;Can save up to 75% CO2 emissions per tonne of dried material compared to various designs and levels of efficient thermal drier currently available;Water recovered in the process can be recycled or reused for example 17% removed from a tonne creates  c.170kg of water ;
The Financial benefits: The consequence of reduced energy demand is CO2 emissions are reduced and in todays market carbon saved has a value and is rising in value in the European and in the global trading markets;Savings on OPEX and potential carbon trades mean that payback periods can be as low as 18 to 36 months for Coomtech over thermal technologies.;

Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);Claranor: Pulsed light packaging sterilization equipment for bioindustries (Industry & Consumer Goods);Qpinch: Capture waste heat and release at a higher temperature through a physico-chemical reaction (Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description: Coomtech revolutionises drying of bulk solids reducing energy and CO₂ emissions by up to 75% over traditional methods.
About:
Coomtech SMR (Surface Water Removal) – Low Energy, Low Emissions, Low Cost:

Coomtech is a UK based industrial technology company. Our easy to implement patented bulk industrial materials drying technology reduces energy costs and emission generated by our clients, supporting the drive to NET ZERO, today.



We have developed an easy to use, better way to dry bulk raw materials that reduces the amount of energy & costs required and emissions generated by some 75% when compared to traditional equipment across this $75bn+ global sector.



We are surrounded by materials that required drying before use in products we recognise in everyday life.  Examples of the industries using these bulk raw material ingredients include cement, mineral production, pharmaceuticals, food, energy including   battery manufacture and recycling, construction and many more in these global and growing market sectors. 



The world needs to reduce the amount of CO2 emitted now, but many of the most used and essential materials generate a significant volume of emissions when being processed.  Coomtech reduces the emission generated by these critical industries - today. Immediate, significant incremental change towards Net Zero, not waiting for a silver bullet!



A good example is cement.  This is the second most used material after water and requires significant energy to manufacture.  There is not currently a viable alternative to cement on the horizon, so finding ways to reduce the impact of this material whilst an alternative is developed is critical. 



•	Over 4.2 Billion tonnes of cement are used globally.



•	At 1.25t CO2/1 mt cement = 5.2 Billion tonnes of CO2 emitted annually



If the cement industry were a country it would be the third global emitter after USA and Russia according to recent BBC research.



Impact and efficiency in one simple act: Coomtech reduces the drying energy required by up to 75%, and in doing so reduces the amount of CO2 emitted by the same amount.  



New build plants, capacity expansion or general efficiency upgrades are three of the key initial opportunities for this technology.  In the future we see opportunities to supply our equipment to plant builders as a component and to license the technology to other equipment manufacturers.



Currently we have a initial plant going to Australia in the clean fuels sector,  several opportunities including a co-development programme in construction materials and  a joint development programme for the pharmaceutical industry all under way. 



How It Works:

The Coomtech SMR process uses managed, aggressive, turbulent air to shear water off the particle surface.  Moisture is stripped from the particles by: 

•	a centrifugal force caused by the spinning of the particles;

•	a linear force pneumatically induced by the particles travelling at different speed to the basic air flow. 

Conveying air is maintained at an average 85degC, the optimal moisture carrying condition to aid transport of removed moisture away primarily as vapor, aerosol and some droplets.  In the under 1 second a particle is processed the warm air does not contribute directly to drying. 



This process is in contrast to traditional thermal drying which has to conform to the natural laws of thermodynamics dictating a specific amount of heat to vaporise a given amount of water.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: An innovative hydraulic reservoir that replaces bulky & heavy traditional reservoirs
Identification: Common hydraulic oil reservoirs (CHR) found on industrial machines are often large and heavy. CHR volumes are typically between 100-500 litres of oil. The innovative Variable Volume Reservoir (VVR) solution has a capacity of just 7-21 litres, whilst providing the same or better results. The VVR weights up to 100 times less and reduces oil use by up to 50 times when compared to mainstream reservoirs. Furthermore, its much-reduced weight brings benefits for fuel economy when installed on mobile machines. Should a leak occur, the VVR will have minimal impact on the environment, resulting in lower decontamination costs and prohibitive fines. Being airless and sealed, the VVR works in any environment (from under-sea to high altitude) and in any orientation. Its versatility makes a perfect fit for numerous applications exposed to difficult conditions where CHRs is no match. Lastly, its small volume makes it more appealing to fill with bio-fluids, which can be very expensive when used in CHRs.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility, Partners
Tags: Lightweight, Fuel efficiency, Hydropower
The environmental benefits: Up to 50 times smaller than traditional reservoirs with the same performance, leading to large reduction in oil use;Sealed and airless, preventing contamination and moisture entering the fluid, consequently prolonging fluid life by 3 to 5 times;Up to 100 times lighter than traditional reservoirs, resulting in fuel savings on mobile machines and less pollution;
The Financial benefits: Reduced fluid use with the same performance delivers significant cost savings;Payback in less than three years;
Activity Region - Countries: Italy,France,Germany,United Arab Emirates,South Korea,Oman,Turkey,Canada,Mexico,United States,Argentina,Australia,New Zealand
Complementary solutions: Storage GEM®: Smart energy management system in containerized storage units for rapid deployment (Energy);Smart Energy Hub: An innovative hydrogen-based energy storage solution for buildings (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Cool Green Energy Factory: An innovative energy concept to make cooling processes economically and ecologically sustainable (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);Solar GEM® (Green Energy in Motion): Smart energy management system for solar power plants (Energy);
Organization short description:
Customised sealed & airless hydraulic reservoir design and manufacturing.

Name: Variable Volume Reservoirs or VVR's
About:
The VVR technology  is an innovative  concept derived from the aerospace ‘bootstrap’ reservoir design 

Its purpose is to replace on selected applications the ‘classic’ atmospheric hydraulic reservoir (tank)

The VVR  targets many applications like industrial hydraulic systems, mobile machinery, military vehicles, mining machinery, marine and offshore field inluding ROV's fluid power systems.

It can be from open loop systems to hydrostatic drives.

In conventional systems, the reservoir oil capacity is sized in relation to the pump flow rate (typically 2-3 times) whereas the VVR  solution requires to size from the system oil displacement and thermal expansion. Displacement could be from differential cylinders where the rod volume  only  must be accounted for .

Main return flow goes direct to pump inlet where the VVR connected to the return line will compensate for volume differential and thermal expansion, thus making the VVR totally independent from system flow.

The VVR is not part of the cooling equation; hence, classic reservoir offers very poor cooling capacity. 

It is in our philosophy that the coolers must provide 100% if this task. Why use a bulky heavy mass of fluid to obtain the same result...it is not ecological !

The VVR is sealed, airless and slightly pressurized thus offers many benefits over classic heavy & bulky reservoirs;

-	 Considerable weight reduction  (up to 100 times)

-	 Considerable space reduction ( up to 20 times)

-	 Reduced fluid cost thus 100 times less fluid

-	 Environment friendly and mostly suitable for biodegradable fluids

-	 Open loop system becomes a closed loop system

-	 Exposure to solid contaminants and moisture (oxidation) is eliminated

-	 Increased fluid and components life thus lower maintenance cost and increased system reliability

-	 Reduced contamination risk when filling

-	 Reduced oil disposal volume / recycling

-	 Reduced fire hazards and consequences

-	 Reduced decontamination cost if a major leak  occurs ( environmental hazard)

-	 Pump positive inlet pressure allows machine to operate in any orientation and altitude

-	 Pump positive inlet pressure reduces pump noise and allows for better performance and increased RPM.

-	 VVR’s can be installed in series or parallel to increase effective volume 

-	 VVR’s can be installed on independent pump to isolate circuits.



When applied on mobile machines, their 100:1 weight reduction allows for better fuel eonomy and /or higher payload.



VVR's can operate on top of Everest down to seafloor with same performance.

Solution on-sentence summary: Secure land rights documents for smallholder farmers
Identification: The land titling solution aims at delivering affordable land titles at scale to smallholder farmers by working in partnerships with the world's largest food companies, traders and governments. Meridia's solution provides smallholder farmers with formal land rights documents that put them on the path to a better income, autonomy and the freedom to take care of their farmland. On top of that, land mapping and titling provide the companies with solid insights into the value chain and traceability to farm level, preventing reputation risks from practices like deforestation and improving the return on investment in farmer productivity programs. By working together, land documentation is provided to the people who need it the most, families living off the land in places like Ghana and Indonesia. These families are smallholder farmers, the very ones producing the worlds food, such as rice, coffee, cocoa, palm oil and tea. Not only do these farmers produce our food, but they are also first in line to protect the world's forests, as they often live in or around the rainforests that are critical for maintaining biodiversity and combatting climate change. With a land document, these farmers can invest in the future of their land and their children.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners
Tags: Developing countries, Soil and land
Sectors: Food/Agri, Project planning, Sell and trade
The environmental benefits: Total duration of process to get a land title can decrease from 12 months to 6 weeks with Meridia's proprietary software and technology;Number of errors in collecting geo-spatial data is reduced by at least 25% using Meridia's software and data cleaning processes;About 20 % reduction in land use expansion;About 5 641 880 tonnes of CO2e emissions avoided (estimated for a case study of 47 000 cocoa farms)  ;
The Financial benefits: In Ghana, cocoa farmers in company productivity programs had a 21,9% higher productivity rate and a 15,5% higher income if they had a land title;On cocoa farms in Ghana, diseases were reported on 30.7 percent of farms with ownership against 48.8 percent without ownership;
Complementary solutions: Premium Hortus: A clean technology platform for scaling up agroecology and sustainable development (Food & Agriculture);Too Good To Go: Business to consumer platform aiming to fight food waste (Food & Agriculture,Waste & Pollution);Wasteless: A dynamic pricing engine to reduce food waste in retail (Food & Agriculture);Kikleo Food Waste Management : A new approach to manage food waste in collective catering (Food & Agriculture);
Organization short description: Meridia provides smallholders with land titles at scale in partnership with food companies and governments.
About:
Meridia's mission is to secure land rights for land holders in rural and peri-urban areas as having land rights is a crucial step towards sustainable development in upcoming economies.



We are a social venture with the knowledge, expertise and technology to offer land mapping and land titling services at scale.  

Meridia was founded in 2015 (then called Landmapp) with the intent to provide affordable land documentation to the people who need it the most, families living off land in places like Ghana and Indonesia. These families are smallholder farmers, the very ones producing the worlds food, such as rice, coffee, cocoa, palm oil and tea. 



Not only do these farmers produce our food. They are also first in line to protect the worlds forests, as they often live in or around the rainforests that are critical for maintaining biodiversity and combatting climate change.



With a land document in hand, these farmers can invest in the future of their land and their children. They are able to access formal credit for the first time. They are able to take a long term perspective on their land and livelihoods, shifting from living hand to mouth in insecurity, but now able to get a secured perspective on their future.



Now, we have teams on the ground in East- & West Africa and Asia. We specialise in bringing together local communities, policy makers, food companies and NGO’s to put ideas into action. We understand the food industry and are experts in the nuances driving their value chains. We work with governments and traditional authorities to ensure strict compliance with regulation and practice.  



Meridia can deliver land mapping and land titling at scale, fast and with exceptionally accurate data. We are already in collaboration with a large number of global food companies, like Unilever, Hershey & Barry Callebaut, multilateral organisations and donors to provide affordable mapping and land titling at massive scale.
SDG’s of application: SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Increasing the recycling rates of used aluminum coffee capsules
Identification: Used coffee capsules are mostly disposed as waste that ends up in the landfill. Coffee brands are increasingly searching for ways to increase the recycling rate of these capsules. The current way of recycling by the consumer is unpractical, unhygienic and not efficient. The Coffeecoiner is a kitchen tool that fits in your cutlery drawer or next to your coffee machine. The tool serves the purpose to remove used  coffee grounds from the used capsule. What remains is a flat disc of aluminum, called the Coffeecoin. The coffee grounds can be used for several household, garden and cosmetic purposes. The Coffeecoins can be melted into any new aluminum product, as aluminum does not degenerate when recycled. In this way waste is turned into a resource. The Coffeecoiner itself is made from recycled aluminum. Separating the coffee grounds from the capsule leads to a significant reduction in CO2 emissions because of large logistic savings.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, Funding, Partners, Credibility, Visibility
Tags: Recycled, Landfill, Consumer-goods, Waste collection, Corporate & Employees
The environmental benefits: 80% less volume in the recycle supply chain compared to current recycle chain;93% less weight in the recycle supply chain compared to current recycle chain;85-95% less CO2 because elimination of the bauxite mining in the aluminum production loop;90-95% reduction of CO2 emissions when using 100% recycled aluminum instead of newly mined bauxite.;93% less CO2 emitted because of less volume and less weight in transportation.;The Coffeecoiner is made of 100% recycled aluminum.;
The Financial benefits: Every single coffeecoin equals €0,01 in recycle cost savings for the coffee brand manufacturers. ;The profitability from each household starts with 12 months.;

Organization short description: With an active presence on five continents, SUEZ and its 90,000 employees strive to preserve our environment’s natural capital: water, soil, and air.
About:
Since the end of the 19th century, SUEZ has built expertise aimed at helping people to constantly improve their quality of life by protecting their health and supporting economic growth. With an active presence on five continents, SUEZ and its 90,000 employees strive to preserve our environment’s natural capital: water, soil, and air. SUEZ provides innovative and resilient solutions in water management, waste recovery, site remediation and air treatment, optimizing municipalities’ and industries’ resource management through “smart” cities and improving their environmental and economic performance. The Group delivers sanitation services to 64 million people and produces 7.1 billion m3 of drinking water. SUEZ is also a contributor to economic growth, with more than 200,000 jobs created directly and indirectly on an annual basis, and a provider of new resources, with 4.2 million tons of secondary raw materials produced. 

By 2030, the Group is targeting 100% sustainable solutions, with a positive impact on our environment, health and climate. SUEZ generated total revenue of €18.0 billion in 2019.

Solution on-sentence summary: A csr tool for the online tree planting service sector
Identification: Deforestation is clearing Earth's forests on a massive scale, resulting in damage to the quality of the land. Consequences are the loss of habitat, desertification, soil deterioration; more massive amounts of greenhouse gases entering the atmosphere and not reabsorbed; displacement of local communities and their traditional way of life and income sources. In the last decades, we have witnessed how environmental deterioration has had effects on the natural world and social well-being. Treedom decided to take concrete action by focusing on the deforestation and mismanagement of forest systems in rural communities. Treedom tackle as well the lack of funding opportunities preventing small farmers to engage in agroforestry activities, the loss of biodiversity and the information bias that discourages donors from financing initiatives managed by rural communities. Treedom is an innovative web platform that allows its users to plant a tree at a distance and track it online providing economic and social benefit for rural communities while creating an engaging and viable CSR tool. Since its founding in 2010, Treedom has introduced innovation and transparency within an industry still tied to the old charity concept, succeeding in transforming good action into a modern communication and engagement tool. Treedom is an innovative, transparent and versatile engaging solution.

Solution on-sentence summary: A new category of ultraviolet disinfection system
Identification: The Solution provides safe and clean disinfection of potable water "on demand" without the use of chemicals or mercury containing components. The basis of UV disinfection is the application of a germicidal wavelength emission (UV-C) targeting microorganism DNA which is disrupted and therefore can not replicate and hence is not able to induce illness or disease. The application of UV for this purpose is well understood and accepted. The novelty of this solution is the utilization of compact UV-C LED technology in place of existing solutions that use mercury vapor lamps to emit the necessary germicidal wavelengths. Compact dimensions and straightforward installation means the Solution can easily be integrated into typical drinking water dispensing products close to the point of consumption

Solution on-sentence summary: Benchmarking the alkaline battery market using a diy product
Identification: RegenBox is a collaborative research program aimed at any consumer using alkaline batteries for personal or professional use to regenerate them, although they are supposedly "non-rechargeable". By re-inventing from a patent fallen into the public domain, RegenBox was launched in 2017. RegenBox is the first DIY battery regenerator which reduces the tons of batteries wrongly thrown away. It is capable of regenerating LR6 and LR3 batteries using microelectric pulsions and in the future will be able to regenerate any type of “single use” batteries. RegenBox is designed to be environmentally friendly and against programmed obsolescence. To use RegenBox, users simply have to test the batteries, and if they are in the rechargeable range (0.9 - 1.4 Volt), users just have to plug the battery into the RegenBox and plug it to an electrical source.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Batteries - energy storage, Reuse waste, Do-it-yourself & hobbies
The environmental benefits: Batteries regenerate in about 8 hours;Can recharge from 4 to 20 batteries at the same time;A so-called single-use alkaline battery can be recharged up to 10 times;Multiply by 5 alkaline battery lifetime;Recuperates almost 75% of batteries that are thrown away unjustly;Save 16 batteries per household per year from the sorting bins ;
The Financial benefits: Customer’s investment pays off between 6 and 10 days;A saving of €800 Million per year on reused batteries can be reached for just the French territory ;A saving of 80% per household on their batteries purchases;

Solution on-sentence summary: Facilitating decarbonization through identifying footprints of shipments, products, and companies
Identification: The Sustainability Management Platform (SMP) identifies the carbon footprints of transports, products, and companies from any sector. The solution provides comprehensive analyses using real-time data to provide companies from any industry, reliable information and pave the way towards a more sustainable economy. The SMP is a fully integrated and automated solution to calculate and analyze ecological and social aspects along with economic values. The platform-based solution allows companies to make smart decisions about their sustainability footprint by detecting the sources and magnitude of emissions within their supply chains, which in turn, allows them to reduce their negative impact on society, the environment and the economy.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Funding, Credibility

Sectors: Freight, Logistics, Energy and fuel efficiency

The Financial benefits: Companies using the SMP pay 20% less carbon taxes compared to business-as-usual thanks emissions savings;Only 10% of the usual human and financial resources necessary to comply with regulations thanks to the user-friendliness of SMP and its pay-for-use system that doesn't require initial financial engagements;

Solution on-sentence summary: An energy-efficient platform for city services management
Identification: In many cities, city services are managed independently. Each of the utilities or services has a different power line and they are connected to each other in the same electrical distribution board where each line is managed. So in conventional installations each service has an individual power line. The Smartec solution integrates under one platform as many Smart City services as possible, crossing the data to make those services more efficient and help the city to become more sustainable. With this solution, it's possible to create more added value to the services, for instance, public lighting, maximizing the light when is needed, and to minimize the power consumption. Also, connecting existing legacy systems to the platform would allow a better performance for the control with the same hardware, remote monitoring and integration into the mesh network created by the Smartec system.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners
Tags: Electric, Maintenance and inspection, Sensors & monitoring, Carbon footprint, Software
The environmental benefits: Capability to integrate more than 20 different protocols and platforms;Reduction of up to 70% of emissions thanks to lighting management;Up to 70% less energy consumption;
The Financial benefits: Possible savings of more than 1000€/year per km;Around 70% less time consulting data to identify network issues;50% savings in maintenance;
Complementary solutions: Smart Street Lighting: Outdoor smart street lighting control: energy saving, security and efficiency (Infrastructures);Occupancy detector: Wall-mounted sensor for occupancy detection of commercial facilities (Infrastructures,Buildings & Shelters);GridEye: A digital grid optimizer for power distribution networks (Energy,Infrastructures);FLEXINERGY INFRASTRUCTURE: Leading utilities management software solution for large infrastructures, smart grids and cities (Buildings & Shelters,Infrastructures);
Organization short description: Public outdoor lighting designers & manufacturers
About:
Since 1881 Salvi Lighting Barcelona is present in the lighting world developing last generation lighting products for urban spaces.

Innovation, quality and design are three elements present in all our lighting products adding value, guaranteeing originality and longevity to our whole range of products.

Our offering includes Grip connected lighting, off grid solar lighting, and Smart lighting monitoring and controls systems for smart cities.
