Solution on-sentence summary: A collaborative platform for the management and relocation of recycled wooden pallets
Identification: Today, nearly 500 million Euro pallets circulate around the world. But with a loss rate of 10 to 15% – the result of operating in silos and a lack of communication between Supply Chain professionals – this represents a real disaster in economic and environmental terms. Opatrace helps to increase the quantity and quality of recycled and available Euro-pallets, so that the logistics actors are not only using them ... but that they reuse more and better! How? The collaborative platform provides real-time visibility of pallet flows, allowing better restitution, fewer purchases and less waste. By aggregating information, the solution helps supply chain professionals to reduce their losses of wooden pallets and to promote the circular economy of packaging ... While also reducing costs associated with the management and transport of load carriers (less CO2 emissions). From the supplier to the consignee, through the carrier, the whole chain benefits from productivity gains, but also a better management of reverse packaging. By recovering 100% of reusable wooden pallets, we do limit the purchase of new ones and preserve the natural resource and indirectly combat deforestation
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility, Partners
Target client profile:
BusinessServicesInfrastructureWarehouses and Storage Facilities
, BusinessServicesRetailerFood & Supermaket, BusinessServicesRetailerNon-food Retail Stores, BusinessServicesTransportersTrucks & Other Road Vehicles
Tags: Pallets & containers, Trucks, Logistics, Reuse waste, Software, Vehicles
The environmental benefits: 100% of pallets collected and re-used  (vs 85% with traditional tools);445,000 tons of CO2 stored per year, through 10 million pallets managed;Can preserve up to 2000 hectares of forest per year, avoiding 5 to 7.5 million lost pallets annually.;Wood material recycled and revalued at the end of the cycle, with a life span of 8 to 10 years;
The Financial benefits: Return on investment less than 6 months.;20% to 30% reduction in management time dedicated to pallet flows;

Solution on-sentence summary: Mobile unit for the conversion of unused agricultural and woody biomass residues into pellets
Identification:
Proxipel's solution allows the valorization of woody residues into pellets. Today, when they are exploited, they are exploited with very little added value and often emit greenhouse gases. Thanks to mobile innovative units that produce pellets in situ, Proxipel allows to valorize them into renewable energy with a high added value. Here are some examples of woody waste that Proxipel can transform, raw as well as wet:

- fresh wood

- wood waste

- vine shoots

- communal pruning

- forestry residues

- straw

- agricultural residues

- agri-food residues

- etc.



Thanks to the action of the Proxipel units, we will be able to produce pellets locally at a competitive price, while developing the circular economy:

- valorization of locally produced waste

- regional labor force

- consumption of pellets nearby



In addition, this will reduce CO2 emissions and increase energy independence, since 30% of the pellets consumed are imported, both in the EU and in Switzerland.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Funding, Partners, Credibility, Visibility
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessFarming & AgricultureCrops, BusinessFarming & AgricultureForestry & Logging, BusinessManufacturingWood Products, BusinessServicesWaste & Remediation
Tags: Organic, Waste-to-energy & fuels, Agricultural Waste, Wood waste, Solid biomass, Recycle waste, Industrial Waste, Biofuel
Sectors: Energy, Waste/Pollution, Power and fuel generation, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Each Proxipel's unit valorizes about 2000 tons of biomass per year into 1600 tons of pellets.;Each Proxipel's unit allows to reduce by 15 the volume of branches.;One ton of pellets provides the same amount of energy as 500 liters of light fuel oil.;Pellets produced by Proxipel's units reduces CO2 emissions by more than 20 compare to heat from light fuel oil.;Pellets produced by Proxipel's units reduces impact on natural ressources by more than 15 compare to heat from natural gas.;Pellets produced by Proxipel's units reduces impact on ecosystems quality by nearly 30 compare to heat pump supplied with renewable electricity.;
The Financial benefits: Payback time of 3 to 6 years, depending on the scenario.;Same costs for woody biomass producers as the mainstream alternative (compost), but production of renewable energy that reduces CO2 emissions by 1950 tons compared to diesel.;
Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: Proxipel SA is a company specialized in the development and marketing of mobile pelletizing units.
About:
Proxipel was created to meet the growing demand for pellets and the shortage of economically mobilizable biomass. It consists of installing a complete pellet production chain on a trailer train. Proxipel units can thus move in order to granulate the biomass available in small and large volumes in situ.

Proxipel units are able to transform many types of wet biomass into high quality pellets (ISO 17225), including wood.

The technical innovation lies mainly in the system integration, the optimisation and the patented dryer that make Proxipel the only complete biomass pelletizing plant in the world.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Building industry bricks with renewable energy
Identification: Facadeclick provides a sustainable, circular and easy solution to build a brick wall without using mortar or glue but just by clicking and inserting bricks. This solution is 100% circular as the brick can be reused and "un-clicked" whenever wanted. On top of this, bricks' production is carbon negative, absorbing CO² in the manufacturing process. On the other hand, the insert is made with 100% green energy. The current construction cost of a wall of bricks is about 140 EUR/m². Building with Facadeclick reduces this cost to 120 EUR/ m² without taking into consideration the increased simplicity of installation resulting in lower labour costs.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Walls & facades, Brick & tiles, Construction materials, Green building
Sectors: Buildings, Materials and chemicals, Manufacturing and construction processes

The Financial benefits: 21% cheaper when compared to traditional non circular solutions ;50 % cheaper labour cost;

Organization short description: Facadeclick: Click it Build it.  A circular way to build a Brick Wall, without mortar or glue. Easier and faster.
About:
Speed building system Belgium promotes Facadeclick, a patented product that combines traditional facade brickwork – a construction material that has already been used for centuries and has proven its durability – with an innovative HDPE connector that will allow for recovery and reuse of the brickwork.

Facadeclick is not a revolution, but rather an evolution towards sustainable, circular construction.

Facadeclick combines all the positive features of traditional brickwork with a unique click system, making facade construction fast, easy and above all circular. 

Thanks to Facadeclick circular facade construction has never been easier.

Solution on-sentence summary: A new, innovative and sustainable drinking water service for rural Africa
Identification: The United Nations' 6th Sustainable Development Goal (SDG6) aims at "universal and equitable access to safe drinking water, hygiene and sanitation by 2030". Today, in Sub-Saharan Africa, 55% of rural inhabitants do not have basic access to drinking water. UDUMA proposes a real solution for achieving the SDG6 in Sub-Saharan Africa. UDUMA provides a sustainable drinking water service for African villages. In a village that has chosen to delegate its drinking water management service to UDUMA, "intelligent" water points, which enable remote monitoring of consumption and breakdowns, replace pumps that have broken down or are very old. Each inhabitant has an electronic card for simplified payment of the quantities of water they need. Thanks to this approach and the implementation of these innovative tools, professional management is possible: providing services that meet the drinking water needs of rural populations in Sub-Saharan Africa is becoming an economically viable activity
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Drinking-water, Water pumping, Filtration & purification, Developing countries, Water & Wastewater treatment, Sensors & monitoring
The environmental benefits: One UDUMA's water point provides drinking water to 555 people ;Enables the rehabilitation and sustainable management of 360,000 manual pumps currently malfunctioning in sub-Saharan Africa ;UDUMA repairs any breakdown at a water point 6.66 times faster than those managed by a water users' association;Emits 1000 times less CO2 than collecting surface water and boiling it;The solution emits less than 0.283 g of CO2/L of water delivered;
The Financial benefits: Enables recovering of 5 billion euros invested in the 360,000 manual pumps currently malfunctioning in Sub-Saharan Africa;UDUMA's investments between now and 2024 will bring 300 million euros to local economies;1 dollar invested in drinking water sector leads to up to 8 dollars in benefits;
Complementary solutions: OSMOSUN: A sustainable, flexible energy source for affordable and renewable water for all (Water);WATA™ technology: Devices to enable local treatment and disinfection of water (Water);Purifaaya: Locally-produced water filters for the production of safe drinking water in uganda (Water);Elemental Water Makers: Desalination system powered by renewable energy (Water);
Organization short description: Sustainable services in sub-Saharan Africa's rural areas
About:
UDUMA helps improve access to basic services in rural areas by taking charge of their equipment and ensuring their proper operation and maintenance in the long run.



UDUMA opens up an entirely new market in Africa: offering basic services in rural areas, accessible and affordable to all. 



A novel approach combined with innovative technologies make it possible to render sustainable basic services in the most isolated areas while assuring a steady flow of revenues. 



Delivering basic services to rural populations in sub-Saharan Africa becomes a viable business.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation

Solution on-sentence summary: A refillable gas powered unit for a completely eco-friendly buffet type environment
Identification: Globally most Chafing dishes are heated by a Ethanol or Methanol which then heat a water bath, which in turn keeps the food warm. Most commonly seen at a buffet type environment. EcoBurner and EcoServe are replacements for old fashioned chafing dishes. EcoBurner is a refillable gas powered fuel source that heats the EcoServe at its core is an aluminum plate that keeps food warmer for longer due to it being more thermally efficient than water). It can reduce CO2 by up to 70% and is waterless and delivers lower running running costs than traditional gel powered water based dishes that have been in use for over 100 years

Solution on-sentence summary: In-field sensor-based digital system for intelligent insect monitoring
Identification: VOLITO is a sensor technology for the digitalization of insects monitored pre-harvest in high-input crops. In-field sensors will enable farmers to only treat fields when and where it is really needed. New and improved solutions for farmers at the intersection of sensors, data acquisition and machine learning will assist growers in improving their insect control interventions. The ability to assess in-field insect populations under various conditions reduces the risk of crop failure, drives on-farm profitability, and helps the farmer and the industry to understand the agricultural field-environment interaction. GPS tagged data from all sensor installations will additionally provide the possibility to compare development from field-to-field, region-to-region, and country-to-country over time. This unique database will provide the agrochemical industry, regulators, environmental protection agencies and researchers a possibility to track broader impacts on the environment.
Looking For: Visibility
Tags: Pest control, Insects, Sensors & monitoring, Software
The environmental benefits: 89%-96% accuracy range for insect classification;Near real-time access to insect data;Equivalent yields with lower amounts of chemistry (up to 30% reduction);100% improvement in access to insect biodiversity data;
The Financial benefits: Up to 1-week planning advantage;Up to 30% reduction in input costs;Payback in as little as two years;

Solution on-sentence summary: Turning mixed non-recyclable solid wastes into hydrogen, power, heat or cooling for direct local use
Identification: Waste is produced everywhere and even the most ambitious circular economy scenarios, predict several hundred of million tons of non-recyclable waste produced all over the world. Dumping and landfilling that waste is no longer an acceptable option. And large scale incineration is struggling with increasing cost, toxic ash residues, stricter emission regulations and social resistance. In addition to recycling leftovers, wastes like medical waste and other hazardous wastes need destruction with minimal environmental impact and maximum capital and energy efficiency – also for developing markets to afford proper treatment preventing waste from leaking into cities, rivers and our oceans. Plasma Assisted Gasification (PAG) is a clean energy recovery technology that transforms non-recyclable waste into hydrogen power, heat or greenhouse-gas-free thermal cooling for direct local use – without toxic residues or urban stress
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Developing countries, Landfill, Hydrogen, Waste-to-energy & fuels, Recycle waste
Sectors: Energy, Waste/Pollution, Power and fuel generation

The Financial benefits: 4-7 year project payback time compared to 9-11 years for incineration;

Organization short description: Thermochemical recycling turning waste and biomass into clean and affordable local Hydrogen, power, heat and cooling
About:
BOSON ENERGY offers a future-proof 'first-mile' solution for thermochemical recycling of waste and biomass. Distributed Advanced Thermal Treatment (ATT) that converts complex streams of mixed non-recyclable waste into local Hydrogen, power, heat, or thermal cooling for direct local use. Where it is most needed, and when it is most needed.



We work with local producers and owners of biomass and waste streams to treat waste locally – literally within the 'first mile'. We provide industry leading waste volume reduction ( more than 99%) and energy efficiency. No toxic ash residues an elimination of NOx and particulates emissions (both in the process and the replacement of transportation diesel by Hydrogen). 70-90% reduction of waste transportation by treating waste locally. By working with waste stream owners maximise the financial advantages of their resource - while minimising their environmental footprint.



Offering waste elimination AND local Hydrogen or baseload energy; ATT solutions like BOSON’s are highly resilient and cost effective complements to other green energy technologies such as wind and solar. BOSON also reaches a uniquely low dispensed Hydrogen cost below 3 euros per kg and low CAPEX per ton CO2e saved over lifecycle. A larger scale rollout aggregates to gigaton CO2e savings over lifecycle. 



Short animation about our first-mile concept here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-yBwVt5C5_o

Solution on-sentence summary: A new generation of biodegradable, efficient, metal-free, non-ion-relating coating and filler for medical devices
Identification: The G3® patented antimicrobial inorganic bioglass is metal and phosphorus-free and consists of a SiO2-Al2O3-Na2O-B2O3-CaO composition that has demonstrated to be very effective against Gram+, Gram-, fungi and corresponding biofilms in both relevant environments and clinical tests. It is easily and economically produced, contains no nanoparticles, and doesn't generate antimicrobial resistance due to its action principle, based on membrane depolarization instead of metal ion membrane adhesion or penetration. It does not leach metal ions or particles, and degrades as any other glass, with a useful life measured in years vs. short lived metal based solutions. It can be integrated in bulk or as additive in fibres, paints, polymers, plastics, cements and ceramics, used directly as coating on various surfaces. It is 100% biocompatible and as a coating can be used on medical devices, or as an additive in bone-grafting solutions. Upon degradation, it is even good for soils due to mineral content.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Biodegradable, Industrial coating, Bacteria, Medical & hygienic, Microorganisms
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Materials and chemicals, Manufacturing and construction processes
The environmental benefits: Metal-free, biodegradable. Waste has no environmental impact nor ends up as heavy metal in soils, tissues, etc;No need for scarce, expensive and non-renewable, aggressively-exploited metallic mineral resources;Totally biocompatible with no cytotoxicity;200 times lower GHG emissions during production for the same amount of antimicrobial active principle;
The Financial benefits: 10 times cheaper production process vs. metal based antimicrobials;Duration of the antimicrobial effect measured in years, compared to days or months at the most in standard solutions;20+ times cheaper raw material vs. the most widely adopted silver-based, high concentration antimicrobials on the market;

Organization short description: Advancing AI in the chemical industry and accelerating sustainable innovation
About:
The production of chemicals is indispensable in the products we use on a daily basis, from electronics to textiles to food. The chemical industry, however, has become the third largest contributor of greenhouse gas emissions, with more than half of its resources ending up in waste streams.



Sunthetics' mission is make the chemical industry more sustainable, one reaction at a time.  The only way to create lasting sustainable impact in the industry is to fast-track current innovation around processes that have lower energy consumption, better resource usage, safer or bio-based starting materials, and integrate with renewable energy sources.



This innovation traditionally takes years to be developed because of the thousands of experiments needed to reach a viable, commercializable product. Traditional predictive modeling tools, whether they be physical, statistical or machine-learning, also require a deep understanding of the reaction or many data points to generate valuable insights.



At Sunthetics, we're the first to leverage very few data points to generate insights equivalent to thousands of experiments, accelerating a multi-year process into just a few months.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure

Identification: The solution aims helping out industries that desire a more energy efficient and environmentally friendly process. Airec’odor is designed to be the efficient solution to treat atmospheric pollution and participate in a “zero carbon” economy. As various industrials need to comply with local restrictions and respect the wellbeing of nearby citizens, Clauger decided to create the Airec’odor to get rid of pollutants and smell annoyance emitted by factories while also recovering raw material and energy. The solution allows to maintain the economic activity of industrial sites in urban areas. Airec’odor is a customizable solution that can include: optimized odour control and treatment + energy recovery + atmospheric emission treatment + process material re-use + performance commitment contract. The Airec’odor makes it possible to 1) reduce CO2 emissions, 2) to ensure the quality of the air and the wellbeing of the residents and employees, and 3) to optimize operating costs while reducing the energy bill.

Organization short description: Founded in 1971, Clauger is a family-owned company specializing in industrial cold and air treatment.
About:
Founded in 1971, Clauger is a family-owned company specializing in industrial cold and air treatment. Today, we have more than 2,000 employees worldwide and have a turnover of 500 million euros.

For over 50 years, we have been responsible for the design, manufacture, installation, service, and maintenance of our equipment in France and on 4 continents. Our international dynamic, driven by key milestones and supported by 12 subsidiaries, allows us to export our know-how to more than 90 countries.

Clauger has used its expertise to provide industries with innovative and custom-built solutions. The company offers durable solutions for all types of markets: dairy products, fresh and cured meat, fruits & vegetables, logistics / cold chain, pharmaceuticals, chemicals, etc.

Regardless of the customer size, geographical location, type and complexity of the project, Clauger offers the most optimized solution.

Concerned about the environmental issues of our time, and driven by the needs of our customers, we rely on innovation to help them optimize their energy efficiency. Since 2013, we have saved our customers the equivalent of the consumption of a nuclear reactor (or 400,000 homes), savings that double each year. To innovate in order to bring a better quality of life is the most important leitmotiv of the company.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure

Solution on-sentence summary: A thermochemical process converting waste streams into clean hydrogen without incineration
Identification: Ways2H aims to solve two problems: demand for renewable hydrogen to replace fossil fuels and reduce greenhouse gas emissions for transportation and power generation, and the need for sustainable and affordable waste disposal. This solution seeks to improve the global environment by eliminating waste while producing carbon-negative renewable hydrogen. With 95% of hydrogen fuel currently produced from natural gas or other fossil fuels, the world needs new sources of renewable hydrogen to reach a carbon-negative future. The thermochemical process producing the syngas leaves char as a byproduct, which is virtually pure carbon. The char is collected and used as fuel together with the remaining tail-gas to generate the energy needed for the thermochemical conversion of the waste feedstock. Therefore, the system self-supplies the energy and heat it needs to operate and produce hydrogen and does not require any outside fuel except to start up a new unit for the first time.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessEnergy Utility, BusinessServicesWaste & Remediation

Sectors: Energy, Waste/Pollution, Power and fuel generation, Manufacturing and construction processes, Solid waste management

Organization short description: Ways2H, Inc. is committed to helping improve the global environment by eliminating waste while producing hydrogen.
About:
Ways2H is turning the world’s worst waste into renewable hydrogen for mobility, microgrids and power generation. 



For the past decade, Ways2H, of Long Beach, California, and its technology partner, Japan Blue Energy, Co. Ltd. (JBEC), of Tokyo, Japan,  have developed their patented process as a unique solution for the global $400 billion+ solid waste management market and the rapidly growing hydrogen economy, estimated to reach $2.5 trillion by 2050.



We are commercializing and scaling a thermochemical process that converts waste streams, such as municipal solid waste, sewage sludge and plastics, into clean hydrogen without incineration. The process produces its own fuel and heat, is carbon-neutral by itself and carbon-negative when paired with carbon capture and storage. We are exploring partnerships with carbon capture and storage companies to achieve negative carbon emissions.



The growing volumes of trash and unrecyclable plastic causing problems around the world can be upcycled to produce a major portion of the world’s clean energy resources. Countries around the world can thus increase their use of hydrogen for mobility, power generation, energy storage and other applications tapping their own, local, resources.



Ways2H aims to improve the global environment by eliminating waste while producing carbon-negative renewable hydrogen. There’s an urgent need to scale up clean hydrogen production to replace fossil fuels used for mobility, power generation and industrial applications. With 95% of hydrogen fuel currently produced from natural gas and other fossil fuels, the world needs new sources of renewable hydrogen to reach a carbon-negative future.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: An application to reduce palm oil demand
Identification: Between 10-30% of ingredients in dishwashing liquids are made of oil. The detergent industry is a significant driver for palm oil demand. Biological dishwashing liquids - except Good Soaps - contain palm oil or other tropical oils. Palm oil plantations are among the main causes for slash and burn practices in tropical areas. Many species are endangered due the loss of habitat in rainforests. Good Soaps has pioneered in developing sustainable formulations based on European vegetable oil. Using European vegetable oil instead of palm oil reduces demand for tropical oil and helps to protect tropical rainforests. Due to the same application of Good Soaps' products, customers don't need to change their habits. In addition, Good Soaps produces highly concentrated products in order to increase efficiency and reduce packaging. As a result, consumers buy more active ingredients, less water and therefore less packaging. Good Soaps has invented entirely new formulations to replace palm oil with local raw material.
Looking For: Visibility, Credibility, New clients
Tags: Recycled, Detergents & soaps
The environmental benefits: Savings between 100 and 300g tropical oil/mineral oil per kg dishwashing liquid;More than 99% plant-based ingredients;More than 99% biodegradable;Reduces CO2 emissions by 85% based on the oil part compared to products containing palm oil;3L packaging saves 80% of plastic packaging compared to the same product amount in usual 500 ml packs;Reduces transportation by about 20.000km for every kg of oil ;
The Financial benefits: Consumers save 8% to 63% compared to other brands (dosage 200ml);Consumers: 0 investment, 0 change of habits, 100% identical product;

Biological detergents & cleaning products. Entirely based on European vegetable oil.



Good Soaps has developed a technology to use domestic (European) oil instead of palm oil. Palm oil is market standard in e.g. all biological detergents. The detergents industry is a significant driver for palm oil and therefore contributes to deforestation of tropical rainforests.



Good Soaps' technology has been granted a European patent that has attracted intense interest in its industry.

Solution on-sentence summary: A platform optimizing resources and footprint to go from innovative idea to high performance product
Identification: Working with nature, the Checkerspot Platform enables the DESIGN—at the molecular level—of new materials. Our vertically integrated, rapid iteration development process is designed to optimize the time, resources, and environmental footprint it takes to go from innovative ideas to leading, high performance products. Companies are craving new, more sustainable materials to differentiate themselves with, innovators are hungry to work with something new, and consumers are demanding safer, more sustainable materials in their products. Organization short description: Checkerspot is a materials innovation company.
About: Checkerspot designs performance materials at a molecular level. It does this by optimizing microbes to biomanufacture unique structural oils produced in nature, but not previously accessible at commercial scale. A certified B Corporation, Checkerspot’s first materials are next generation polyurethanes and textile finishes designed to improve the performance of consumer products. The company is currently commercializing a performance composite engineered into skis and sold through the brand WNDR Alpine (https://wndr-alpine.com), as well as algal oil formulated into miDori® BioWick and sold in partnership with Beyond Surface Technologies. Checkerspot’s mission is to expand the palette of molecular building blocks for high performance and sustainable materials.

Solution on-sentence summary: Automated survey and automation to help companies in reducing carbon emissions
Identification: Carbo aims to empower people to be aware of their carbon footprint and to take action to achieve more sustainable practices. The solution consists of a 'Software as a Service' (SaaS) to which companies subscribe to, calculating their carbon footprint and helping them to act to reduce it. Companies are asked different precise questions about their carbon emissions that they answer manually or automatically through connection to an internal tool. Once the calculation of the carbon footprint is done, it is certified by our team of experts and then clients can start to act to reduce their emissions, thanks to the action plans that we suggest to them. They can update their data a few months after having put the actions in place in order to monitor their carbon emissions. Thanks to this solution, companies will be able to not just reduce their carbon emissions, but also save money, improve their image and differentiate themselves from competition.

Solution on-sentence summary: Hydrogen-based chp to ensure that electric power is always present in the local microgrid
Identification: Aiming to collaborate on solving problems of grid congestion and grid stability, among others, "Hydrogen powered ICE CHP" seeks to create a 100% green energy landscape including autonomous buildings and local grids. ICE CHP running on H2 is the component that ensures that electric power at 0 g CO2, heat or cooling, are always present in the autonomous micro-grid, even when the sun is not shining or when there is no wind. Its aim is to link energy flows like electricity, heat, cooling, mobility, etc. At moments when the locally produced power is higher than the local electric power demand, green electricity will be stored in hydrogen storage tanks. ICE CHP running on H2 will transform the stored green hydrogen back into useful energy flows like electricity, heat, cooling, mobility, and will supply power to the local grid. ICE CHP running on H2 CO2 emissions are ZERO! At the end and when the circle is round, nearly no renewable energy that was stored in hydrogen got lost and hydrogen is condensed back into water
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution to collect any marine floating waste, both solid and liquid
Identification: This solution brings to the market a unique and innovative patented technology to collect all types of floating waste. These ships are made of a catamaran hull in which the bottom is closed providing a channel within the boat. There is a turbine creating a suction flow pulling large amounts of polluted waters inside. Then a filtering mesh stops all solid waste and lifts it up to discharge it on deck. If there were oil spilled, the hydrocarbons being lighter than water are floating, they will go past the filtering mesh and will be pulled inside a separation and storage tank for oil. Only clean water will be flushed out of the vessel. The Double Flow technology allows the simultaneous collecting of both solid and liquid floating waste.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesInfrastructurePorts and Marine Infrastructure, BusinessServicesWaste & Remediation
Tags: Marine & Oceans, Boats, Waste collection, Oil waste, Floating debris, Industrial Waste, Vehicles
Sectors: Waste/Pollution, Vehicles and vessels, Solid waste managementEcosystems management
The environmental benefits: Double Flow technology allows the simultaneous collecting of both solid (plastics, cans, algae, driftwood, etc.) and liquid (crude oil, fuel oil, lubrication oil, chemicals, etc.) floating waste;Quick response: Acting as autonomous cleaning systems, our ships recover hydrocarbons with a working speed up to 4 knots, filling their own storage capacities. All the vessels take less than 3 minutes to go from navigation mode to clean-up mode, they have;
The Financial benefits: Low OPEX: All hydraulic controls actuating the various cleanup functions are controlled from the wheelhouse. Very few personnel needed to operate.;Multipurpose vessels: allowing tackling various services with only one ship;

Organization short description: EFINOR group is a combination of 3 business units: Engineering – Manufacturing – and Support, all involved in metal working and design.
Headquarters: ZA de, Rue de Kerpalud, 22500 Paimpol, France
About: EFINOR group is a combination of 3 business units: Engineering – Manufacturing – and Support, all involved in metal working and design. This organization gives to the group a great opportunity to provide a global service. Our Know-how, turnkey, is due to the consistency of our teams inside EFINOR but also due to the proximity of our workshops and design offices all over France and UK. Concerning EFINOR Sea Cleaner, it is a company that specializes in designing, manufacturing and marketing revolutionary oil spill recovery and multipurpose vessels for large and small scale marine cleanup operations. Our solutions hold patents worldwide for technologies that produce zero waste and byproducts, and whose efficiency and relative low cost are currently unseen in the industry. Currently, we have 3 vessel ranges WasteCleaner range (6 to 10 m): for the maintenance of ports and coastlines. One person crew, quick intervention. MultiCleaner range (10 to 20 m): for Major ports / Rivers / Coastal Areas / Offshore Supply. These vessels possess additional features, such as firefighting, lifting or towing. SpillCleaner range (20 to 65 m): Deep-sea and Major Disasters intervention, with full range of features (rescue, towing, FIFI, etc.). All vessels are certified by Bureau Veritas to guarantee and monitor their compliance with the most demanding standards for construction and safety. Our value proposition: One product to solve all weaknesses of traditional means. Quick response: Acting as autonomous cleaning systems, our ships recover hydrocarbons with a working speed up to 4 knots, filling their own storage capacities. Deployment takes less than 3 minutes. Collect both solid waste and oil spill, on the run (without creating emulsion): The Double Flow technology makes it possible to collect both solid floating waste and any hydrocarbon pollution. Operating in choppy weather conditions : Self-floating arms allows to follow the waves independently from the boat and thus allowing to collect oil in up to Sea State 6. Separating the transfer from the recovery : Ships have, depending on their size, self-cleaning storage capacities. But can also transfer as they collect for unlimited capacity working 24/7. Keep the man away from hazard : All hydraulic controls actuating the various cleanup functions are controlled from the wheelhouse. No man on the deck in contact with hazardous waste and toxic gases. Market Validation and track record: More than 100 vessels sold worldwide. Large investment in R&D, registering several patents worldwide. Its technology was tested and certified by independent organisations (BV, OHMSETT, CEDRE).
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Organization short description: 9T Labs’ technology will manufacture the structures that make society’s most audacious goals possible.
About:
Founded in 2018 by a team of pioneers, passionate about bringing the next generation of high performance manufacturing, we aspire to mass produce high performance composites as easily as metals. We do this by automating and digitizing the production workflow of composite production at the most innovative companies.



We understand the complexities of anisotropic materials and the manual process in manufacturing carbon composites. To simplify this, we set out to provide an all-in-one solution to help our customers radically ramp up their composites series production and turn their series production ideas into production cases within months - not years.



So we built a software as a service suite, powered by integrated FEA simulation tools, that allows to quickly come up with highly optimised designs. Then we combined state of the art additive manufacturing equipment with advanced post processing technology to enable serial manufacturing of structural composite parts.

Solution on-sentence summary: A biostimulant to reveal genetic potential of plants
Identification:
Cultures are subjected to various stresses such as abiotic (temperatures, drought, transplantation, etc) or biotic stresses which weaken them and lead to a decrease of production and/or quality.  Phytosanitary products and the emergence of biocontrol products make it possible to treat biotic stresses, but few effective solutions are available to protect crops from abiotic stresses. Because of climate change, these stress are more and more recurrent and intense, which threat crops needed to feed a growing world's population. It’s urgent to find solutions to this problem.

AXIOMA is a biostimulant composed of plant active ingredients that reveal plant genetic potential. Indeed, without genetic modification, it allows an improvement in plant physiology and development thanks to the improvement in nutrients uptake and use. Therefore, cultures have more energy and resources to protect themselves to different stresses and to restart their growth after the stress period.

Our remarkable biosolutions performances are the result of the combination of two technologies : the industrial vegetal extraction of active substances AOE (Axioma’s Organic Extraction), and the BAM (Bio’Activating Mix), a complex of active ingredients with biostimulant effects for crops and biocontrol effects for farm animals. 

In our circular economy, we source every raw material in taking into account ecosystems balance and resources sustainability.

Solution on-sentence summary: A digital tool to guide territories towards sustainable management strategies
Identification:
In a context of resource scarcity due to climate change, roadside management today only consumes resources, whereas it has an untapped production potential if managed sustainably. SAGID is a digital modelling tool to guide territories towards positive externalities and opportunities of roadside management. An example is collecting grass from the verges to transform it into renewable bioenergy through composting or biogas production. Therefore, it should help managers to identify and economically quantify the impacts of alternative management of road dependencies compared to conventional road maintenance.

These impacts are social (recruitment of new competencies, local partnerships between farmers, public authorities, companies), economic (less frequent maintenance operations, e.g. ditch cleaning, added value of biomass for energy production), and environmental (renewable bioenergy production without competing with food crops, water quality preservation and biodiversity enhancement).

Solution on-sentence summary: Plasma converter system for the treatment of hazardous waste
Identification: The increase in the amount and complexity of waste is currently a major environmental and health problem. Plasma technology is a proven and safe technology for treating any type of waste, obtaining a material and energy valorization in the process. This technology meets the most demanding environmental standards, such as the European Union waste framework directive. The application of the Plasma Converter System in waste treatment is based on the creation of an intense field of radiant energy to achieve the molecular dissociation of solids, liquids, or gases, giving rise to a gas formed basically by a mixture of H2 and CO and to inert vitrified matter where the greatest trapped is part of the inorganic matter. As there is no combustion there are almost no emissions and insignificant ash is formed. The Plasma Converter System recycles waste by converting it into raw materials: a gas called syngas - a source of energy - metals and an amorphous silicate.

About:
As the world’s largest food and beverage company we are driven by a simple aim: enhancing quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. To deliver on this, we serve with passion, with a spirit of excellence, offering products and services for all stages of life, every moment of the day, helping people care for themselves and their families. Our culture is based on our values rooted in respect: respect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity and respect for the future.



We can trace our origin back to 1866, when the first European condensed milk factory was opened in Cham, Switzerland, by the Anglo-Swiss Condensed Milk Company. One year later, Henri Nestlé, a trained pharmacist, launched one of the world’s first prepared infant cereals ‘Farine lactée’ in Vevey, Switzerland.



Today, we employ around 328,000 people and have factories or operations in almost every country in the world. With our headquarters still based in the Swiss town of Vevey, we had sales of CHF 89.5 billion in 2016.



Our portfolio covers almost every food and beverage category –offering products and services for all stages of life, every moment of the day, helping people care for themselves and their families.

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);Recovering heat : Standardized, ready-to-install solution for supermarkets to heat buildings or water using waste heat (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: Air Booster transforms the metal cladding of building walls into a high-performance solar aerothermal exchanger.
About:
The aerothermal wall invented by Air Booster collects solar energy from the walls of metal cladding buildings. This considerable energy, which was not really used until then, is now used to heat buildings in winter, to cool in summer at night and/or to dry agricultural foodstuffs, wood, industrial waste, or sludge from sewage treatment plants.

In winter, at the latitude of France, on a sunny day, when the outside temperature is only 8°C, that of the sheet metal cladding is around 60 ° C. It is this energy that will be valued.

By fixing a flat sheet behind the ribs of the siding, we obtain channels in which we will circulate the outside air. As it travels, the air will heat up in contact with the cladding heated by the sun. This hot air is then injected into the building.

The independent research firm Nobatek has shown that the savings are considerable : your energy bill is reduced by up to 83% thanks to a power of 600Wp / m2.

By the very nature of the system, the ROI is very short, between 2 and 8 years.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy

Solution on-sentence summary: A cooperative approach for the control of enteric emissions from ruminants
Identification:
SOP STAR COW is a complementary feed, that promotes the well-being of dairy cattle, by a contemporary action on the cows digestive, immune and neuroendocrine systems, to improve the quality and quantity of milk production. In addition to that, SOP STAR COWS improves the condition of the animals bedding, reducing odours and ammonia directly in the barns.

SOP STAR COW has also been proven to reduce enteric emissions: methane production is reduced by over 20% and CO2 by over 18% in production animals. SOP STAR COW is a solution to improve the sustainability of dairy production by giving economic benefits to the farmers, improving milk production, in quality and quantity. In addition, SOP STAR COW has strong environmental benefits, reducing GHG emissions from dairy and odours and ammonia from the farms.

Organization short description: Since 2001, SOP researches, develops and commercializes scalable solutions for Sustainable Intensive Agriculture
About:
The 2050 challenge requires the world to feed 9 to 10 billion people without compromising the needs of future generations. At SOP, we believe the only way to achieve this goal is through Sustainable Intensive Agriculture.

Founded in 2001 by Marco Poggianella, the Italian company SOP - Save Our Planet places both environmental protection and farmer economics at the center of all its activities. Thanks to the proprietary technology developed by SOP’s founder, the company has developed farmer oriented solutions that could enable faster climate policies.



Its products for crop systems and livestock operations interact with the microbial and biological activity of soils, plants, and animals and enable stable and consistent yields while reducing the emissions of greenhouse gases and other pollutants.

SOP solutions include products:

• for CROPS, which help farmers reduce the use of synthetic fertilizers, lowering inputs costs and mitigating the environmental impact of intensive cultivation of staple crops, including corn, wheat, soy, rice, alfalfa, and cover crops;

• for ANIMALS, which enhance overall health, improve feed conversion efficiency, and reduces costs of operations, while improving the production of milk, meat, and eggs;

• for WASTE MANAGEMENT, which reduce odors, ammonia emissions, and greenhouse gases, while mitigating the impact livestock waste on the environment and the surrounding communities.

The efficacy of the products has been established through scientific studies conducted by several of universities, including UC Davis, Cornell, University of Milan, Guelph, and the University of Piacenza.

SOP LAGOON, the product for manure lagoon management, was studied for its ability to reduce ammonia and GHG emissions from dairy liquid manure. The results of this study were published in September 2019 in the international peer reviewed journal called “Sustainability.”

SOP products are currently distributed in North America and Europe, enabling farmers to achieve sustainability within intensive agriculture across economic, environmental and social impacts.

Solution on-sentence summary: A resource saving concrete made of processed mixed granulates from demolition rubble
Identification: Susteno is the first resource-saving concrete in Switzerland made of high quality processed mixed rubble from demolition projects. 85% of demolition rubble is recycled in Switzerland, and Holcim found a way to close the material cycle for the remaining 15% that would otherwise be landfilled. This conserves scarce landfill space (around 1200 truck loads in 2020), conserves primary raw materials, and saves 10% CO2 compared to a CO2-optimised Swiss mass concrete (30% vs a type I concrete). The CO2 savings in 2020 were equivalent to 4700 people flying from Zurich to New York. Susteno is also a solution for companies that recycle concrete and mixed demolition waste and are looking for a sustainable alternative to landfilling the unusable fine fractions. Susteno is the next generation of mass concrets with a more ecological footprint and complies with all norms. This solution demonstrates how the construction sector can play a key role in the transition to a circular economy.
Looking For: Credibility
Tags: Cement, Concrete, Construction, Waste-to-materials, Construction & demolition waste, Recycle waste, Construction materials
Sectors: Buildings, Infrastructures, Waste/Pollution, Materials and chemicals, Solid waste management

The Financial benefits: Can deliver up to 7% higher property value;Construction companies and concrete producers have a differentiating competitive advantage when project owners ask for sustainable solutions or even demand Susteno in tenders;

Solution on-sentence summary: Innovative turbine system with uniquely high efficiency
Identification: FishFlow Innovations developed an innovative and patented design that also makes the turbine fish-friendly and silent. The turbine can withstand the incredible forces occurring at open sea. The revolutionary design saves on construction costs which makes it possible to generate electrical energy at a very competitive price per kWh. The impeller of the FishFlow Innovations Free Flow Turbine is bi-directional; it generates power when rotating clockwise as well as when rotating counter-clockwise. This means it generates electrical energy during ebb and flow when in use as a tidal turbine. The unique and patented shape of the impeller doesn’t only make the turbine fish-friendly but also makes it highly efficient. The specific shape of the impeller blades do not induce cavitation and the water leaving the impeller is released in an almost straight beam.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

FishFlow Innovations develops and builds innovative fish migration facilities and protection systems. Our mission is to contribute to solve migration barriers for fish and prevent damage to fish through our tailor-made products. We develop products with key features: fish friendly, energy efficient and silent, e.g. water pumps, turbines and impellers, ship propellers, water sieves and siphon fish ladders. 



All our products have been developed with particular attention for the natural preference and behaviour of fish. This results in facilities that are eagerly utilised by fish and enable their passage without injury or mortality.



With 8 active patents and more than 70 realized projects in 5 countries we are building a future where the wellbeing of aquatic ecosystems and the generation of renewable energy is evident.

Solution on-sentence summary: A new generation of membranes using a specific bioreactor for the reuse of wastewater in urban areas
Identification:
The environmental impact of wastewater is constantly increasing with the demographic explosion and access to drinking water is becoming more and more difficult.

The NEOSTEP solution developed by NEREUS transforms wastewater into recovered water. Thanks to its flexibility, water uses range from agricultural to drinking water. The NEOSTEP® solution embeds the latest generation of membranes allowing dynamic nanofiltration coupled with biological treatment and a final stage of filtration by reverse osmosis. Neostep is made to be energy-efficient, modular, robust and cheap ! NEREUS is the first water company to be labeled by the French environment ministry GreenTech "Acceleration" for its innovation potential.

Tags: Drinking-water, Biogas & biomethane, Filtration & purification, Urban green spaces, Water quality, Water & Wastewater treatment, Biofuel

The Financial benefits: 5 times less energy consumption than conventional static membrane;Less than 4,9 euros per m3  of recycled water on a Neostep unit, amortized over 12 years;Control of water quality according to needs throughout the year ;

Organization short description: NEREUS provides innovative and sustainable recycling systems for effluents like digestate, wastewater...
About:
NEREUS designs, develops and builds industrial water extraction units from complex effluents like manure, digestate or wastewater for industries and communities.

Industrial development, intensive farming and growing urbanization contribute to increased energy and clean water needs. According to the United Nations, in 2025, the average quantity of available fresh water per resident and per year is forecast to fall from 6 600 to 4 800m3. Experts estimate that there will be 5 times more people on Earth suffering from severe water scarcity than today, which will represents 35% of the total population. 

Because water and energy are often linked, NEREUS focuses on the recovery and recycling of these two essential goods.

Our missions:

> Recover the maximum amount of liquid wastes and remove their pollution

> Develop technologies and processes that helps our customers to integrate sustainable development by connecting ecology to economy

> Respect the nexus water-energy in all our processes

Nereus, nicknamed the old man of sea, takes its name from one of the oldest Greek divinity. He is the son of Pontus, god of sea, and Gaïa, mother of Earth. This name is the core of our mission: recover water in order to protect the Earth.

Solution on-sentence summary: A closed loop, post-industrial fiber recovery process to make low-cost recycled carbon fiber
Identification: The solution is a low-cost grade of carbon fiber obtained via a patented recycling process. This grade has mechanical properties similar to virgin carbon fiber. The recycled fibers are used in broad-ranging formats including nonwoven fabrics, thermoplastic pellets, and 3D printing filaments for applications in automotive, sporting goods, and musical instruments. This recycling process addresses the 30% of carbon fiber that is currently being landfilled as post-industrial manufacturing scrap. Via a novel chemistry-based process, Vartega is able to separate carbon fiber reinforcement from its plastic binder. Vartega then processes the fiber to make it easy to feed into traditional thermoplastic extrusion equipment. This enabling technology is solving a composites value chain problem by recovering a captive supply in the waste stream to meet an unmet demand for low-cost carbon fiber downstream.

Solution on-sentence summary: A solar processor to produce green hydrogen
Identification: SMO's mission is to address the challenge of producing clean, stable energy at an affordable price. SMO's technology is a compact and autonomous processor that uses the sun as its primary energy source to transform waste and/or biomass into green hydrogen and energy, with a negative CO2 footprint. SMO converts solar energy into powerful microwaves, which are used in synergy with thermosolar energy in each step of the process. Indeed, SMO offers the industry an innovative, very advantageous and flexible green hydrogen production. This production of green hydrogen is coupled with Carbon Capture technology allowing the absorption of CO2. A SMO site is made of independent units, allowing easy scale-up by simply adding units to meet local needs. Thanks to its modularity, adaptability, versatility and complete autonomy, SMO fits all types of areas. By using locally sourced inputs, SMO supports the circular economy.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility

Organization short description: "Take everything from waste, leave nothing to waste" Producing hydrogen and valuable carbonated products from waste
About:
SAS NumSmoTechnologie (NST) was created in 2009 by a group of partners with expertise in the fields of science, energy and urban planning. With the aim to become one of the main suppliers of versatile solutions for CO2 sequestration, green hydrogen production, treatment and non-polluting (local) recovery of a wide variety of carbonated waste, NST designed the SMO project. 

Our knowledge lies in innovative proprietary thermosolar pyrolysis - gasification solutions for carbon sequestration (CO2 recycling) and hydrogen production using waste treatment as a fixing substrate. This allows a synergistic approach to three pillars of climate resilient future: green hydrogen production, CO2 sequestration and waste treatment.

Organization short description: PRS have developed a disruptive technology for the industrial repair of large series of reusable plastic articles.
About:
PRS offers a plastic repair service based on a welding technique with high density virgin plastic filler material suitable for food use. This method guarantees 100% recovery of the repaired object’s functionality, at least 98% of its original strength and a very similar appearance. Thanks to this method, customers benefit from a 70% cost reduction in comparison to the purchase of a new item and from a 98% carbon emission reduction compared to alternative solutions. 



BENEFITS

- SIGNIFICANT SAVING COSTS: around 70%, if the customers repair their damaged goods instead of buying new ones. Example: the cost of a new pallet that weighs 18,20kg is around 40-60€ and, to be repaired by PRS, it requires only 100 grams of plastic welding material. The cost of the repair is about  30% of the cost of buying a new pallet (only 1/3 of a new item!).

Thanks to PRS repairing service, one of the leaders of the sector of can producers was able to save €1M and almost 800 tons of CO2 at the same time and, even more, they were able to create 9 new jobs for disabled people in just one year.

-CARBON FOOTPRINT REDUCTION:  repairing and reusing plastic goods emits 220 times less CO2 than recycling, burial or cremation of those items. Plastic waste and its negative impact on the environment is reduced, decreasing the carbon footprint. 

We have estimated the carbon footprint savings of our activity from the data extracted from study “Environmental impact analysis of pallet management” (A. Mazeika). The CO2 footprint per kilo of plastic disposed will be: 0.22680kg/CO2 when recycling, 0.92986 kg/CO2 when landfilling, and 1.42428 kg/CO2 when incinerating. And we also should add to this figures the CO2 emitted during the plastic production process to replace the discarded item, which would be 3.5kg/CO2 per kilo of plastic. On the other hand, repairing 1 kilo of plastic would emit 0.02039kg of C02 and as the repaired item would be ready to use, it wouldn’t be necessary to manufacture a new one. To sum up and as an example, recycling (which will be the second most environmentally friendly alternative to repairing) and replacing one pallet of 18,20kg would emit 67.828kg/co2 while repairing it would just emit 0.371kg of co2. So that is why we can say that repairing is 182 times much better than recycling and repairing it.

In the last two years PRS has achieved a retention of 12.519 tons of CO2 which would have been emitted by other alternative solutions different from repairing, such as recycling, landfilling or incinerating.

- 9 YEARS EXPERIENCE: through the last 9 years the company has developed an industrialized process that allows to offer short delivery times to guarantee quality. PRS also has set up a net of almost 20 facilities in Spain and one more in Mexico and is also planning to open new workshops in Europe in 2020.



-RELIABILITY: we should also stress the fact that PRS has his own patented and certified method. Two well-known independent technical institutes in Spain, such as AIMPLAS and CEMITEC, agree on certifying that a plastic good repaired under our method recovers 100% its functionality and at least 98% of its strength. Furthermore, Plastic Repair works under ISO quality standards (ISO 9001 and ISO 14001).

In addition, one of PRS clients, which is the largest pooling company in the world, carried out demanding test on the PRS repaired pallets in USA which validated the reparation quality. 

On the other hand, the materials used in the repair are perfectly suitable for food use. And also the exact colour of the wire can be chosen, which guarantees the aesthetical quality of the repaired items. 

-  INDUSTRY SPECIALIZATION: PRS is repairing pallets, crates, frame tops, boxes, etc. for large companies from different sectors. Just in the last year has repaired more than 100,000 products of companies such as Chep, Crown, Campofrío or Mahou.

-CONTRIBUTION TO THEIR CUSTOMERS CORPORATE SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY: as PRS is a company that enables the labour and social inclusion of people with disability, PRS contributes to the integration of disabled people in the labour market, reaching agreements with different Authorized Workshops that are Special Employment Centres. Apart from that, the activity of repairing equipment and plastic goods makes PRS a Circular Economy Company.

As a recognition of the social and environmental impact of PRS project, our company has won different prizes and awards. Those are helping PRS to position ourselves better in the circular economy industry:

· PRS has been included as one example of best practice in Circular Economy by the EU Commission.

· PRS won the first prize in the European Business Awards for the Environment 2018 in Spain.

· The interest and novelty of this project has been recognized by EU: PRS has been awarded in the Product&Services European Business Awards for the Environment, 14/Nov/2018 in Vienna (Austria).

· PRS was invited by the Commission to participate in the Circular Economy Mission to Mexico 24/April/19.

· PRS has received funding from the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme.

· PRS has been one of the 14 chosen companies by Orizont, an agro-alimentary innovation program of Sodena, a financial instrument of the Government of Navarre.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: 100% fish safe pump, with high efficiency, long lifespan, low maintenance and impervious to debris
Identification: FishFlow Innovations' fish-friendly Archimedes' screw pump is a very high-efficiency pump for lifting water. Compared to conventional pumps, not only does it save a lot of energy, but it also saves the lives of countless fish that migrate through the pump. Indeed, migrating fishes have the possibility to pass through the displaced water to find their way out of the polder, but approximately 15% of all fish that utilise this transport route suffer some kind of damage in conventional screw pump. The FishFlow Innovations' screw pump has a design that does not inflict any damage on passing fish. The blades do not stretch across the full width up to the tip of the screw, instead the width of the blades gradually decreases from the middle outwards during the last few windings. The second adaptation concerns the housing of the screw, which is enclosed in a pipe that is attached to the screw and thus rotates together with it which also ensures no water leakage. These adaptations transformed the screw pump into a fish-friendly facility for downstream migration.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Rivers, Water pumping
The environmental benefits: 0% water losses;80 - 100% hydraulic efficiency;80 years life time expectancy;100% fish friendly  ;At least 30% energy savings, compared to conventional pumps;95% Recyclable;
The Financial benefits: 80% reduction on maintenance costs;Installed in 1 day;At least 30% energy savings, compared to conventional pumps;

Organization short description: We work on the forefront of innovation and technology to take products from an idea all the way to the end consumer.
About:
FishFlow Innovations develops and builds innovative fish migration facilities and protection systems. Our mission is to contribute to solve migration barriers for fish and prevent damage to fish through our tailor-made products. We develop products with key features: fish friendly, energy efficient and silent, e.g. water pumps, turbines and impellers, ship propellers, water sieves and siphon fish ladders. 



All our products have been developed with particular attention for the natural preference and behaviour of fish. This results in facilities that are eagerly utilised by fish and enable their passage without injury or mortality.



With 8 active patents and more than 70 realized projects in 5 countries we are building a future where the wellbeing of aquatic ecosystems and the generation of renewable energy is evident.

Solution on-sentence summary: Using the low-temperature of oceans to decrease ac energy needs
Identification: In tropical environments especially, demand for air conditioning is high all year round. This typically comes at a high energy cost, which is in turn typically produced from non-renewable sources. In certain industries and buildings, such as hotels for tourism or hospitals for healthcare, air-conditioning is frequently the largest single usage of energy, representing up to 40% of total consumption. This solution aims to drastically reduce the amount of energy consumed to produce air conditioning while using a renewable natural source of cold. The solution could be implemented anywhere with suitable bathymetry and easy access to deep ocean water and strong AC needs. The concept of the solution is to give the opportunity to have cool air when needed, while considerably decreasing the energy consumption and our carbon footprint. The solution is a Sea Water Air Conditioning (SWAC) system. This system permits to save about 42% of energy comparing to a conventional AC system. It uses the temperature of the deep ocean to cool an AC loop, releasing seawater back to the ocean with no impact. This solution sends a 2,6km piping into the ocean to reach a 930m deep area. The impact on the environment is very low and safe - It provides air conditioning using the cold of the deep ocean.

BusinessServicesBuildings Operators, BusinessServicesHealthcare & Medical Institution
, BusinessServicesHotels & Resorts
Tags: Air-conditioning, Cooling, Marine & Oceans
Sectors: Buildings, Energy, Heating, cooling and ventilation

The Financial benefits: Over 40% reduction in KWh/year;Over USD 600K savings annually;14-Years payback period on gross investment cost;

Organization short description: Pacific Beachcomber is committed to providing the most authentic and enriching travel experiences to French Polynesia
About:
Pacific Beachcomber operates 7 hôtels in French Polynesia, including 3 resorts managed by InterContinental Hotel Group (IHG), 3 managed by Maitai Hotels and The Brando. 

The Brando was inspired by Marlon Brando’s original vision to create a venture of sustainable development that resonates with visitors and fosters opportunities to get to know both the place and people of French Polynesia. He was passionate about preserving Tetiaroa’s natural beauty, biodiversity and cultural richness and was determined to find a way in which it could be a center for research and education and a model of sustainability. 

In 2006, the InterContinental Bora Bora Resort & Thalasso Spa opens, with 96 overwater bungalows and 12 dayrooms. It is the first hotel in the world to use a pioneering system of deep-sea water air-conditioning (SWAC), which is also used in the Thalasso, Deep Ocean Spa, installed within the hotel. 

In 2009, PBSC begins construction of The Brando on Tetiaroa.

In 2010, PBSC acquires the 38-bungalow Maitai Rangiroa, located on one of the largest lagoons in the Southern Hemisphere. 

In 2011, The Maitai Lapita Village in Huahine opens under the management of Hotel Management Services (HMS), a subsidiary of PBSC. 

In 2011, PBSC sucessfully implements the 2nd SWAC installation on Tetiaroa. The pipe is the deepest in the world at 930 meters.

In 2014, PSBC opens The Brando on July 1, 2014. 

The Brando is a unique luxury resort on French Polynesia’s breathtakingly beautiful private island of Tetiaroa – an atoll composed of a dozen small islands surrounding a sparkling lagoon 30 miles northeast of Tahiti. The Brando offers carefree luxury in the midst of pristine nature. With access to the island by private plane, the resort features 35 villas on white-sand beaches frequented by sea turtles, manta rays and exotic birds. The resort was designed to reflect Polynesian lifestyles and culture. 

We consider ourselves stewards of Tetiaroa, and believe that we have the responsibility to treat it with the highest level of care and respect. Almost all of Tetiaroa is being protected and preserved forever in its natural state. We have touched the motu on which the resort sits as lightly as possible. The Brando and all the villas have been designed without beach obstructions to blend harmoniously into the trees. According to our LEED Platinium Certification, we have used local materials extensively in the design and construction. All building materials used are of local or certified origin, renewable, or incorporate recycled components. Furthermore, we are using a pioneering deep seawater air-conditioning system to reduce energy demands and we rely mainly on renewable energy provided by solar panels. Setting a new world standard, the resort is close to reach its goal of being carbon neutral and self-sustainable. We have built and gifted an Ecostation to Tetiaroa Society, the nonprofit organization established to lead the scientific and cultural mission to protect the atoll and to inspire sustainable interdependence on Tetiaroa and around the world.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A solar thermal-based energy system for operating a greenhouse farm
Identification: The growing world population is expected to mark an increase of 2.5 billion people by 2050 pushing the demand for food to rise by at least 60%. Providing the growing population with healthy diets from sustainable food systems is a compelling challenge. Agriculture sector will have to double food production to sustain the global population, exploiting fewer resources and causing lower environmental impact. It is proven that Greenhouse farms are able to sustainably intensify the production of fresh vegetables and fruits. They reduce the pressure on water and soil resources but require huge amounts of energy which is currently generated by burning fossil fuels. Solar PoweRed Horticultural Off-grid UniT (SPRHOUT) emerges as the most effective renewable solution to ensure the energy self-sufficiency of greenhouse farms, boosting the transitions towards sustainable food provision. By using solar power and thanks to a thermal energy storage unit, the SPRHOUT provides all the energy input needed by greenhouse farms, i.e., heating, cooling, and electricity.

Solution on-sentence summary: A new generation of composite bipolar plates for fuel cells
Identification: Hydrogen is now clearly identified as a cornerstone of the energetic transition. However, limitations on the fuel cell's lifespan are one of the technological locks that impede hydrogen mobility to spread efficiently. HYCCO develops and produces an innovative key component for hydrogen technologies. It brings a major improvement to the green hydrogen ecosystem making it reliable for heavy mobility and many other applications. The solution is an ultra-light, resilient and compact carbon-based bipolar plate for fuel cells. It brings a significant improvement since this component represents 70% of the weight for 30% of the price. It is also suitable for electrolysers - producing hydrogen from (green) electricity - and REDOX flow batteries - a promising low environmental impact energy storage system.

The environmental benefits: Lifetime 4 times longer (+20 000hrs);Weight divided by 2;No compromise on compactness;Increase hydrogen fuel cell power density by 30%;Make zero emission heavy mobility viable;100% recyclable;
The Financial benefits: Maintenance costs divided by 4;Make zero emission aircraft accessible;
Complementary solutions: Claranor: Pulsed light packaging sterilization equipment for bioindustries (Industry & Consumer Goods);RT7000: A machine to chemically recycle plastic waste back into oil (Industry & Consumer Goods,Waste & Pollution);HiLyte Power: A reliable iron battery for off-grid areas (Industry & Consumer Goods);Aluminium recycling system: An aluminium melting and recycling furnace powered by renewable biomass briquettes (Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description: HYCCO develops ultra-light, durable, compact and highly conductive composite bipolar plates for hydrogen systems.
About:
HYCCO is a French start-up that develops an innovative process to manufacture a key component present in most hydrogen systems, from fuel cells to REDOX flow batteries. 

Hydrogen fuel cells are now commonly admitted as necessary in order to reach the Paris agreement and reduce green house gases emissions from highly emissive sectors, like heavy mobility (bus, train, airplanes, trucks, ships). But to be competitive, hydrogen fuel cells need to extend their life time, reduce their weight, while being compact. As of today, unfortunately, current materials can not fulfil all those targets at the same time.

Bipolar plates represent 70% of the fuel cell stack system, for 30% of its cost, and are the main reason for low durability of fuel cell stacks. HYCCO has developed high-performance composite bipolar plates that are thinner, lighter and more resilient than any other available materials. 

This disruptive solution helps hydrogen systems to reach their technical and economic viability for a large-scale deployment.

Compared to metallic solutions, which are currently used for mobility applications, HYCCO's technology lasts 4 times longer, while dividing the system weight by 2, without compromising the compacity of the system.

Solution on-sentence summary: Carbon fibre reinforced products for ultra-light aircraft
Identification: COBRATEX focuses on composite materials, which are fibrous parts, moulded with resin. Superposed layers of « reinforcements », made of fibres, yarns or fabrics, are embedded in resin. Composite manufacturing processes are widely used in all industrial sectors and enable the production of elements for Airplanes, helmets, swimming pools, tennis rackets and many more. Cobratex manufactures and sells high-performance bamboo-based reinforcements. Cobratex is made of renewable biobased materials, which are ultra-light and offer many technical specificities, well appreciated in final applications. Solution on-sentence summary: A combined approach to increase water and soil availability for cropland and reforestation
Identification:
Our planet is losing a net of 8.1million acres of forest every year. Irrigation is responsible for 70% of all freshwater withdrawals in the globe. The MTP aims at solving these important environmental challenges and more through the introduction of a disruptive technology.  

This solution aims to restore forests and agricultural land through the use of marine water. The MTP technology has 3 different components, which all together represent a unique innovation that can revolutionize the fight to climate change: Desalination units which utilize solar energy to evaporate water and collect its condensate; the Waterboxx Plant Coocon, enabling the growth of trees, bushes and plants in extreme circumstances; and IoT modules enabling monitoring of plants to collect, analyze and share data for user-friendly purposes. This solution offers profitability and sustainability through technology.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessFarming & AgricultureCrops, BusinessFarming & AgricultureForestry & Logging
Tags: Desalination (= seawater purification), Sensors & monitoring, Irrigation, IoT, Software

The Financial benefits: At least 30% cheaper than existing alternatives having similar performance;Providing fresh water at 0.02$/Litre;

Organization short description: The Mangrove Technology Platform (MTP) – a bio-inspired, smart and modular system for dryland reforestation
About: Trees are still the most effective technology to capture carbon dioxide. However, climate change is altering the potential trees coverage and according to the actual trajectory, the global canopy cover may shrink by 223 million hectares by 2050. The ongoing degradation of land due to the growing scarcity of water resources coupled with increased salinity of soil and water directly influence the potential trees coverage. A systemic approach able to combine trees planting, soil restoration and sustainable water use is needed. The MTP provides impact solutions for regenerative reforestation and agroforestry projects to fight climate change. Combining cost-effective desalination technique with water-saving planting technology and Internet-of-Things solutions, the MTP enables reforestation projects on dryland broadening the soil availability for trees planting at the needed scale to achieve carbon neutrality
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure

Solution on-sentence summary: A water filter suitable for populations with no access to drinking water
Identification: Many families living in emerging countries or isolated areas must fight water-borne diseases every single day. Almost 2.2 billion people lack access to safely managed drinking water services, therefore one of the main Sustainable Development Goals of the United Nations is to provide for universal access to water from 2030. ORISA® water filter is a low-cost sustainable water filtration solution to meet a social and ecological challenge faced by humanity, namely universal access to drinking water. It is a portable family-sized water filter for NGOs and local organizations that ensures a sustainable supply of drinking water. The filter is fitted with an ultrafiltration membrane system and a back-washing function, and is designed to last. The filter removes viruses and bacteria in order to fight biological contamination and water-borne diseases. The filter operates manually, with no power required, and no automatic use of chemicals.
