Organization short description:
WATER PURIFICATION FOR HUMANITARIAN AND INDEPENDENT LIVING

#humanitarian #waterdrinking #impact #ngo
About:
Fonto de vivo, a company with a social and ecological impact, has designed the innovative, sustainable and autonomous water purifier ORISA®. It specifically meets the needs of international aid workers and populations deprived of drinking water in emergency situations or in rural areas. Certified Origine France Garantie, ORISA® purifies surface water and eliminates bacteria and viruses without electricity. It thus provides access to purified water for the health, autonomy and dignity of the 2.2 billion people who are exposed to waterborne diseases every year.



ORISA® is an autonomous, portable and repairable water purifier, certified Origine France Garantie. It purifies surface water (rainwater, well water, lake water, river water, etc.) without electricity for emergencies, itinerancy, prevention and outdoor leisure activities. It filters 3 litres of water in 1 minute by simply pumping it manually, so that it is completely free of bacteria, viruses and microplastics. Its integrated cleaning system and long-lasting French membrane make ORISA® a sustainable and responsible purifier.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable model of consumption allowing customers to resell, donate or recycle their past purchases
Identification: With the emergence and acceleration of fast fashion, we have been buying more than ever before, yet treating clothes as disposable items. The average consumer today buys 60% more than 15 years ago but wears them for half as long. It is estimated that 33% of women wear items in their closets for as little as 5 times before disposing of them. The current system is broken. The fashion industry is the second most polluting in the world, yet we still overproduce. Despite the amount of resources utilized for clothing production, more than 70% of garments end up in landfills or incinerators. We have finite resources that we are feeding to an industry that goes from manufacturing to waste. We need a more sustainable model of consumption to avoid a global disaster. Reflaunt provides resell as a service to brands and retailers. Its disruptive circular model allows customers of retailers to resell, donate or recycle their past purchases in a click directly from retailers e-commerce site.

Sectors: Industry/Goods, Waste/Pollution, Logistics, Solid waste management

Solution on-sentence summary: An affordable and high-performance energy efficiency window retrofit solution
Identification: The Solution is a transformative window retrofit solution that provides as much insulation as an added pane of glass at an affordable price. WindowSkin panels are attached to the inside window glazing of existing windows optimizing the volume of air trapped in between the existing window and the window insulation retrofit. Like the gap between panes in a double-pane window (or the pockets of air in a down comforter), this layer of enclosed air – and its thickness in particular – creates an insular barrier and improves the efficiency of the window. The WindowSkin is designed specifically to optimize the thickness of this enclosed layer of air, maximizing its thermal insulation properties. Plus, each panel is custom-manufactured to fit the existing window exactly, with a patented design that minimizes the possibility of air leakage to optimize the thermal barrier.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Lightweight, Thermal insulation, Windows & glass
The environmental benefits: Provides an additional R value of 0.7 and enables a visible light transmission ratio of 90%, making WindowSkin's practically invisible;On-site maintenance staff can self-install WindowSkins with just 30 minutes of training by a WindowSkin specialist;Can be used in historically designated buildings because installation doesn't change the appearance of the building, is technically “reversible”, and maintains windows operability as the windows open and close, just as they did prior to WindowSkin install;WindowSkin Insulating Retrofits reduce energy loss by 45% on single-pane windows and 22% on double-pane windows;WindowSkin panels are made with durable GreenGuard® and Cradle- to-Cradle™ certified materials and 100% USA based supply chain;In buildings constructed prior to the 1970s, WindowSkin's installation does not disturb underlying site conditions such as lead paint;
The Financial benefits: Windowskin provides up to 75% of the insulation improvement of a new Energy Star® window for less than 15% of the cost of replacement windows;WindowSkin provides up to a 10 times faster payback than replacement window and almost 5X faster payback than our nearest priced window retrofit competitor;
Complementary solutions: SopraStar: Reducing urban warming by using solar reflective cool roof membrane (Buildings & Shelters);IPSIIS : Insulation based on mineral foam for better energy conservation (Buildings & Shelters,Waste & Pollution);Sopratec III: Energy efficient building airtightness system (Buildings & Shelters);Pavatex: 100% bio-sourced energy-efficient thermal insulation of buildings (Buildings & Shelters,Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: New, simple to install efficient window insulation panels. WindowSkins work 24/7 to save energy escaping through your windows. One-click and they're installed! Nearly invisible, long-lasting and durable with guaranteed savings on your energy bills.
About:
WindowSkin® is a completely transparent custom-fit window insulation system that easily mounts onto existing windows, upgrading energy efficiency and indoor comfort. The result is an easy and affordable way to make single-pane windows work like more efficient double-pane windows, or to make your existing double-pane windows work like triple-pane options.



The science behind WindowSkin is well known, yet our implementation is both elegant and unique. When WexEnergy WindowSkin panels are attached, a volume of air is trapped between your existing window and the panel. Like the gap between panes in a double-pane window (or the pockets of air in a down comforter), it is this layer of enclosed air – and its thickness in particular – that creates an insular barrier and improves the efficiency of the window.



WindowSkin is designed specifically to optimize the thickness of this enclosed layer of air, maximizing its thermal insulation properties. Plus, each super-lightweight WindowSkin is custom-manufactured to fit your window exactly, with a patented design that minimizes the possibility of air leakage, so you get to enjoy the benefits of an ideal thermal barrier, each and every time.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: Eliminating denim textile waste through upcycling
Identification: UseDem gives materials a chance to live again. By reusing and reshaping old jeans, UseDem fights the textile industry’s pollution. It sources used jeans from individuals, brands and event discarded jeans or fabric from factories and then upcycle them into unique, beautiful and marketable products. Bags and accessories are made in partnership with Home Sweet Home, who operate their factory on the outskirts of Shanghai. They are also a not-for profit organisation which provides training and employment for Chinese people with special needs or disabilities. By bringing new life to old materials, this solution is helping to reduce waste and emissions.

Sectors: Industry/Goods, Waste/Pollution, Materials and chemicals, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Saves 3,780 litres of water by reusing old materials instead of new ones;Saves 33 kg of CO2 emission during its life cycle ;
The Financial benefits: By using inventory for the new production, customer saves about 30% of the cost after upcycling;40% cheaper than mainstream alternatives;
Complementary solutions: WOODOO: A bio-based translucent wood material for sustainable construction applications (Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);LACTIPS: A 100% biobased material for a sustainable packaging alternative (Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description:
UseDem is a denim upcycle project.

We are the first industrial denim upcycling brand in China.

UseDem aims to eliminate textile waste.
About:
UseDem is the first industrial denim upcycling brand in China which I founded in 2015. 



I have had over a decade of experience in the denim industry moved to China in 2011 and have lived in shanghai ever since. As a designer, I worked closely with many Chinese denim factories. I witnessed first hand the mass production of denim jeans for the ever growing market across the world and the subsequent negative impact this industry has on the environment. 



The idea for UseDem came about when I was asked to clear a showroom of jeans and discard them. I told myself I couldn’t throw them away, instead, I used them... or Usedem. The jeans got sent to her flat where she started cutting and experimenting to see what she could make, eventually creating the Buddy Bag. 



UseDem has one primary aim: to eliminate textile waste. We believe that upcycling is a possible solution to the textile industry’s pollution. Not only this, but by reusing and reshaping old jeans, we can transform the consumer based mindset of our society. 



What we do:

We source used jeans from individuals as well as discarded jeans and fabric from factories and upcycle them into unique, beautiful and marketable products. We allow you to take a pair of jeans that you’re connected to, that have your stories embedded in them and 

that fit your shape and your style and remake them into something perfect and unique to you. As Xenia puts it; “we give the material a chance to live again”.



Our bags and accessories are made in partnership with Home Sweet Home, who operate our factory on the outskirts of Shanghai. They are a not-for profit organisation which provides training and employment for Chinese people with special needs or disabilities.  



We are challenging the perhaps negative connotations with the term Made in China as our products are Remade in China. We take preexisting fabric, produce high quality, recycled and upcycled products in a sustainable process. 

In one year, Usedem saves approximately 400 pairs of jeans from landfills, equivalent to saving almost 4.4 million litres of water! 



Let’s use them! Usedem 





We have collaborated with brands such as Klee Klee and Hunter Gatherer to make exclusive tote bags and aprons respectively. And we have conducted corporate workshops on sustainability and implementing a zero-waste textile strategy for companies such as KPMG, Hermes, Lululemon

Identification: KLIMA-PUR is a new top-class framing material for highly energy-efficient windows & doors. This solution will reduce by 20% the direct CO2 emission associated with the building's energy consumption, responsible for 28% of total CO2 emissions worldwide. KLIMA-PUR circularity, extended lifespan of 35-45 years, repairability and low maintenance, as well as its easiness to recycle and recyclability content, is the result of a simple but resource- and energy-efficient design. INDRESMAT is a chemical startup based in Barcelona (ES) and Geleen (NL) that has redefined the thermal envelope of buildings and houses to reduce their CO2 emissions, targeting a 70% decrease in their thermal energy demand. INDRESMAT addresses the energy leaking problem in 100% of the thermal envelope of buildings (windows, doors, walls, roof and floor), through 2 circular products based on bioPolyurethane (bioPUR), this being the most insulating material with low C-Footprint:

- KLIMA-PUR, a top-class energy-saving frame for windows & doors made from bioPUR (with 45% renewable content), having excellent thermal insulation performance and improved recycling at end-of-life:

INDRESMAT has achieved support from the European Commission participating in 3 innovation programs (SME Instrument, INTERREG, NMBP), thus demonstrating the high market potential of the products developed and which business model is focused on providing technology (machinery, materials, services) to big players in the insulation, window & door markets.

Solution on-sentence summary: Innovative roof design for glass melting furnaces
Identification: The glass production sector is facing the challenge of carbon neutrality. CO2 emissions in this sector are mainly produced by the melting process (70-80% of the total emissions). H.R.A.™ Heat Recovery Area technology is an innovative combustion chamber design of glass melting furnaces that optimizes the use of flue gas heat and opens the way for fully hybrid melting technology. Implemented on oxy-combustion furnaces, the H.R.A.™ technology leads to a 6-10% reduction in gas consumption. It facilitates the shift from air to oxy-combustion furnaces with 15-25% CO2 emission reduction. Moreover, the conventional arch crown designs of glass melting furnaces are not suited when switching to hybrid furnaces with significantly reduced combustion heat input. The H.R.A.™ technology renders hybrid furnaces with up to 80% of green electrical power viable. The remaining 20% combustion can be supplied with renewable fuels like hydrogen or biogas.
Looking For: Visibility, Credibility
Tags: Industrial process heat, Industrial burner
The environmental benefits: H.R.A on oxy-combustion tanks: 6-10% better thermal efficiency of oxy-combustion ;H.R.A. on hybrid tanks: enabling up to 80% of electric melt heating;H.R.A on oxy-combustion tanks: 2800 tCO2 saved per year for a 500 t glass per day ;H.R.A. on hybrid tanks: about 80% savings on the CO2 emissions for a high fraction of green electricity  ;
The Financial benefits: H.R.A on oxy-combustion tanks: allows for a 6-10% OPEX reduction with near 0 payback time;H.R.A. on hybrid tanks: 2 years payback time ;

Solution on-sentence summary: Ultra-early detection system of wildfires using sensors, wireless network and analytics platform
Identification: Dryad Silvanet allows to reduce dramatically the reaction time and enables firefighters to extinguish a fire before it spreads out of control. The wireless sensors are solar powered, measuring temperature, humidity and air pressure. Thanks to its sensitive gas sensors, it can detect wildfires even during the smoldering phase. Dryad aims to help protect the world’s largest carbon sink and home for 3/4 of all biodiversity globally. It addresses deforestation and emissions from forest fires which contribute up to 20% of the global CO2 emissions. Dryad will also mitigate the economic damage caused by wildfires, estimated to be at $140bn per year, tapping into a substantial market potential with insurances, forest owners and governments.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Trees & Forests, Algorithms & AI, Sensors & monitoring, Wildfires, Natural disaster, Software

Organization short description: Dryad's Silvanet enables ultra-early fire detection of wildfires as well as forest growth and health monitoring.
About: Dryad Networks develops Silvanet, a large-scale, distributed sensor network to continuously monitor the health of the forest with a central analytics and alerting platform, dramatically reducing reaction time for wildfires. The wireless sensors are solar powered, measuring temperature, humidity, ozone, water consumption and growth of trees as well as detecting forest fires with smoke sensors. With reduced reaction time for wildfires, Dryad will help to protect the world’s largest carbon sink, addressing deforestation and emissions from forest fires which contribute up to  20% of the global CO2 emissions. Dryad will also mitigate the economic damage caused by wildfires, estimated to be at $100bn per year, tapping into a substantial market potential with insurances, forest owners and governments.

Solution on-sentence summary: A biodegradable building and packaging materials from coconut waste
Identification: The rate of deforestation in Ghana is estimated to be one of the highest in the world after Togo and Nigeria, at an estimated annual rate of 2%, equivalent to 135,000 hectares per annum. In the green building industry there is currently no bio-based paneling board made from 100% natural bio based fibers without added resin (glues), let alone a 100% natural flame retardant panel. The solution Ecoboard is developing sustainably sourced, newly engineered wood made from coconut husk and sugar cane bagasse, supplying the global market with a formaldehyde-free bio-based wood alternative that are better for people and planet. The solution will bring the first non-additive, bio-based, renewable wood product to market which is naturally flame retardant and anti-fungal without added binders (glues). The physical properties are better than comparable engineered woods on the market currently, all which use additives and heavy chemicals to reach additional flame retardant properties while reducing our CO2 footprint, deforestation and enriching the lives of locals in coconut and sugarcane producing developing countries such as Ghana

Organization short description: Ecovon is making biodegradable building and packaging materials from coconut waste
About: Ecovon believe that there is a better way of making building materials. That is why we are focusing our energy on completely rethinking and re-designing how the new generation of building materials is made. Ecovon are developing sustainably sourced, newly engineered wood made from coconut husk and sugar cane bagasse, supplying the global market with a formaldehyde-free bio-based wood alternative that are better for people and planet. Ecovon will bring the first non-additive, bio-based, renewable wood product to market which is naturally flame retardant and anti-fungal without added binders (glues). The physical properties are better than comparable engineered woods on the market currently, all which use additives and heavy chemicals to reach additional flame retardant properties while reducing our CO2 footprint, deforestation and enriching the lives of locals in coconut and sugarcane producing developing countries such as Ghana. The board material has been shown to exhibit excellent properties, which are comparable with or even superior to commercial wood based panels. Our product is stronger and more durable, priced considerably less, and greener. Coconut husk has the highest lignin content of any known plant and this helps the raw material to bind into a hard board without the addition of any damaging glue or binder. Due to its strength the board has the potential to be used for structural elements in buildings. It also has natural anti-fungal properties and burns three times slower than wood. The method is sustainable and environmentally friendly. The residual material of the coconut is used in its entirety. It is a good alternative to wood and helps to prevent deforestation. During production, glue and chemical agents do not need to be added. Furthermore, the production is CO2 neutral. It is inexpensive. The glue that has to be added when boards based on wood fibre are made contributes to one third of the total production costs. Glue is not required to process coconut husk into board material. It can form an extra source of income for farmers in developing countries

Solution on-sentence summary: A supercritical co2 technology to delaminate the materials from wastes
Identification: Food packaging's, clothes, shoes, solar panels, credit cards, skis  are complex and technical objects composed of multiple layers of different materials. These materials are bound together to bring several required properties to the product (mechanical strength, oxygen barrier, hydrophobicity…). Taken separately, each material can often be recycled or reused, but the separation process can be costly or sometimes impossible, especially when shredding processes are involved. The TPS process is an efficient, fast and sturdy technology based on existing industrial supercritical processes. The solvents used, coupled with supercritical CO2, allows to delaminate the different layers of the wastes' materials (glues and bonds at the interface of materials are dissolved). The TPS process is a clean chemical process using mainly supercritical CO2 for the separation of multi-layer complex wastes and products, to enable their recycling. Non-recyclable wastes can then become fully recyclable. TPS Process gives a new life to multi-layer complex wastes.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: BusinessManufacturingChemicals & Pharmaceuticals, BusinessManufacturingFood Products, BusinessManufacturingPlastics, BusinessManufacturingSolar Panels, BusinessManufacturingTextiles & Clothes, BusinessServicesWaste & Remediation
Tags: Waste-to-materials, Electronic waste, Carbon fiber waste, Textile & fiber waste, Packaging & plastics waste, Delamination, Recycle waste, Industrial Waste, Waste treatment

The Financial benefits: 18 month pay back upon raw material value;100% raw material costs controlled thanks to recycling;

Solution on-sentence summary: Autonomous and decentralised water purification system for rural Africa
Identification: In the 16 sub-Saharan African countries falling under the umbrella of the Southern Africa Development Community (SADC), some 39% of the population, which corresponds to more than 100 million people, has no access to safe water. Most heavily affected are people in rural or peri-urban areas without connection to the piped water and unreliable or no energy supply by the grid. Water used for drinking and sanitary purposes often is significantly polluted, may it be by organic or inorganic pollutants, or microbial contaminants. The SafeWaterAfrica technology represents a new autonomous and decentralized water purification system for rural and peri-urban areas in Africa and beyond. An integral part of the solution is a new European water treatment technology based on the energy-efficient production of strong oxidants, produced electrochemically from the water. It does not need additional chemicals for the effective degradation of persistent organic pollutants as well as for killing pathogens. The solution aims at delivering an autonomous, sustainable and decentralized "Made in Africa" water treatment system. This solution is highly efficient in the degradation of harmful pollutants and at the same time very effective in killing microbiological contaminants.
By: Fraunhofer Institute for Surface Engineering and Thin Films IST
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Funding

Organization short description: R&D partner in the field of coatings, coating processes and associated production processes
About:
The Fraunhofer Institute for Surface Engineering and Thin Films IST in Braunschweig is an innovative partner for research and development in surface technology, with expertise in the associated product and production systems. 

Around 110 employees work together with customers from industry and research to develop customized and sustainable solutions: from prototypes, through economic production scenarios, to upscaling to industrial magnitudes - and all this whilst maintaining closed material and substance cycles. In addition to application-oriented research and development, scientific principles are also researched within various collaborations with universities and research institutions.

Coating and surface technology are the key to innovative products and systems: Through modification, patterning and coating of the surface, a wide range of functions and functionalities can be realized. One of the institute's particularly strong points is its ability to create the optimum process chain for the respective task on the basis of a broad spectrum of processes and coating materials. The Fraunhofer IST not only has excellent capabilities in surface analysis using the very latest equipment but has also accumulated extensive experience in the modeling and simulation of both product properties and the associated processes and production systems.

Solution on-sentence summary: A predictive model for continuous galvanizing line operation
Identification: The SmartLine is a fully automatic strip processing line control system based on predictive modeling, to ensure the best quality yield and productivity. It combines process control, metallurgical know-how and a dedicated IT architecture. The solution links all key processes in a real time basis, anticipates process conditions and adapts them continuously according to line speed, to establish with minimal error the desired final mechanical and surface properties of the finished coils. It integrates a self-learning module to prevent long term deviation and allows process and line instrumentation evolution. The solution can be used to control any steel process line for flat products, such as continuous galvanizing lines (CGL) or continuous annealing lines (CAL). It enhances quality and productivity, while also allowing energy and material savings (reduction of material waste, energy and zinc consumption).

The Financial benefits: 3 M€ of yearly savings on a 350 kt/year galvanazing line;Payback time under 1 year;

Solution on-sentence summary: Electricity-free pumping solution for water purification in surgace water catchments
Identification: This solution is an electricity-free water pump. This solves one of the biggest problems in human history: Lifting water above existing water sources. Today many rural and agricultural zones are still deprived of electricity, confronting them with this age-old problem of lifting water automatically. The pump can provide a viable solution to ease life in these areas. Electricity-free pumping solution permits the filtering of thousands of cubic meters of polluted water per day from rivers, especially in developing countries. The technology uses a water head to drive the main piston, making this a high volume high-pressure volumetric pump to drive thousands of cubic meters of water per day to high altitude land that until today was only possible with electricity.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Hydropower, Water pumping, Off-grid
The environmental benefits: 24/7 operation;100% CO2 reduction when compared to electric pumps, using electricity generated by fossil fuels;Up to 50 bar output;70% of surface water is polluted and can benefit from water filtration without electricity;
The Financial benefits: Zero electricity running costs;Land situated above water springs can benefit economically from this solution for agricultural and live stock farming;
Complementary solutions: ScaleBuster: Water system treatment for scale and corrosion (Water,Buildings & Shelters);1001 fontaines: A sustainable water enterprise based on decentralization of water production and distribution (Water);PICOGEN®: A stand-alone power supply for measuring and monitoring equipments in drinking water network (Water,Infrastructures);HARSONIC Ultrasound Biofilm Removal: An ultrasound device to avoid biofilm contamination, fouling and scaling (Water);
Organization short description: Develloping a long term  high volume electricity-free pumping solution
About:
The Up-Welling Companie



has been developing a large scale water pump that does not require the use of electricity. 



 Solely powered by a hydraulic head as the renewable energy source,  we can supply the necessary pressure to treat millions of liters of water per day to filter polluted water bodies all over the world and provide clean drinking water to less fortunate people.  Other than that our solution can supply water for irrigational purposes several km away since it is also a volumetric pump. 



After depositing an international 3 party PCT patent, SAS UP-Welling was created and in April of 2019, The Up-Welling team has been laureates at the International Inventions Exposition in Geneva, where we received the gold medal in the category for Energy as well as the INPI France prize amongst others.



The local municipal water authority, La Créole, is in charge of managing water for several municipalities on the west side of the island including Saint-Paul with over 100 000 inhabitants. They have asked the Up-Welling team to show the efficiency of our pumping solution by using the wastewater of a wastewater treatment plant in Cambaie. We installed our pump as close as possible to the lowest point and it provided a 24m dynamic head. 

The pump provided enough pressure to pump 2000m3 of the 5000m3 daily wastewater back up to the treatment plant with a supplementary pressure of 2,5 bars that are used in a tertiary micro-filtration unit. Showing thus the possibility of permanently recycling water with water as the renewable energy source without the need for electricity or PV systems nor wind generators which are intermittent power sources. 



Some installation examples.



1 - Pumping and filtering polluted surface water.



The demonstration done at La Créole, proved that without the use of expensive electricity, it was possible to provide the necessary pressure and volume to filter polluted water.

Depending on the case study, with regards to the topology of the region, water from a polluted river or water body can be treated by using a membrane filter station that will be placed close to the pump. We can even pump raw water up to a water tower and then use gravity to filter the water.    

Some filtration units make use of hollow fibers with integrated backwash. Thereafter compressed air is used to complete the rinsing cycle. T This air can also be provided by the UP-Welling pumping solution.



2- Filling high altitude reservoirs. 



High altitude terrains situated above water sources can benefit from such a pumping solution by filling reservoirs for distribution. This way agricultural land can be optimized even without electricity around. 

Future demonstrations.

The Up-Welling pumping solution should find its main application in thousands of towns and villages all over the world. 

It is important to demonstrate how polluted water can be filtered at an affordable price for less fortunate people 





Since maintenance only requires the replacement of seals not so often, it can be carried out with the use of simple tools and spanners.

Two people are enough for a maintenance routine.

Solution on-sentence summary: Ultrasound system for industrial fouling control
Identification: Altum's solution purpose is to clean and/or prevent fouling within industrial production equipment such as pipelines, heat exchangers, evaporators, valves and more, without the need to stop production or use toxic chemicals to achieve this. This is done via Altum's software-guided high-power ultrasound solution. The plug and play system is clamped on externally so there is no need to make changes to the target equipment in order to apply the solution. Fouled industrial equipment is known to be a big contributor to greenhouse emissions as more energy is needed to keep up with production needs when the equipment is dirty. This means that in addition to allowing a non-stop production and product quality enhancements thanks to clean production infrastructure, industrial companies.

Organization short description: The only company to use power ultrasound to remove fouling from industrial equipment with no production stoppages
About:
Founded in Helsinki in 2016 and backed by Lifeline Ventures, Maki.vc and Finnish Funding Agency for Innovation Tekes (now Business Finland), Altum is the first and only company in the world to use software-guided power ultrasound to clean and/or prevent fouling from industrial equipment with no toxic chemicals, no production stoppages and no equipment disassembly. This cleaning is done by externally applying the system to any liquid carrying equipment (heat exchangers, evaporators, pipes, tanks, steam injectors, reactors, etc.) without the need to do any changes to the equipment or the production process.



The externally installed power ultrasound system is capable to clean almost any dirt, like biofouling, mineral scaling and chemical fouling. Benefits of using Altum Technologies’ solution are: no production downtime, improve energy efficiency, no need to use chemicals for cleaning, minimize maintenance time, increase work safety, comply with tight environmental laws, among others.

Solution on-sentence summary: An inclusive market-based sanitation service for low-income, densely populated settlements
Identification: More than 4.2 billion people lack access to safe sanitation (WHO). The consequences are disease spreading, high mortality rates, violence on women, and environmental contamination. Plus, the sanitation and water system is highly inefficient with 80% of the wastewater generated globally flowing back into the ecosystem without being treated or reused (The United Nations World Water Development Report, 2017). Mosan is providing dignifying, healthy and safe sanitation, while protecting and benefiting the environment by avoiding pollution and closing nutrient cycles. The Mosan solution is a decentralized, off-grid, in-home, and waterless service for people in densely populated settlements. The service ensures safe containment, transport and transformation of human excreta. Mosan employs circular economy principles, transforming excreta into valuable resources and reintroducing it into the economy thus shaping a paradigm shift and a creative movement that leads to long-term change. Mosan applies human-and planet-centered-design approaches, working closely with communities, building local capacities and ensuring high adoption rates
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Off-grid, Developing countries, Toilets
The environmental benefits: Avoids the discharge to the environment of 530 kg of untreated feces per year per household;Avoids the discharge to the environment of over 1300 liters of untreated urine per year per household;Biochar used as soil amendment reduces irrigation needs by 40%;A Mosan Toilet voids the emissions of 0.5 tonnes of CO2 per year per family;Uses nearly 20,000 liters less water per year than usual flush toilet;
The Financial benefits: For families having Mosan is over 60% cheaper compared to a pit latrine;For municipalities, Mosan is between 30% to 80% cheaper than traditional sewers;
Complementary solutions: REM: A novel acid regeneration system for steel pickling (Waste & Pollution,Water,Industry & Consumer Goods);E.S.T.: An intelligent robot-based system for automatic extraction, treatment and packaging of sediments (Waste & Pollution);ECOSOFTT: A suite of solutions to allow underserved communities to manage their water resources (Buildings & Shelters,Waste & Pollution,Water);BIO DISPERSIS LC: Recycle vinasse, a polluting residue from the alcohol industry, into organic additives for concrete (Waste & Pollution,Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description:
Mosan is the attractive and feasible sanitation solution that transforms communities for a healthier and safer future.



We are offering a comprehensive sanitation system, including our aspirational in-home dry toilet, feasible treatment technologies and services to improve the quality of life and health of people, protecting the environment, mitigating climate change, creating jobs and valuable resources as biochar fertilizer thanks to the circular system. Our capacity building initiatives are shaping a creative movement that leads to long-term behaviour change.
About:
Mosan provides smart and aspirational sanitation solutions for low-income communities in developing countries. The Mosan solution is a container-based sanitation service that operates off-grid, waterless and decentralized. The system is completely ecological and recovers nutrients from human excreta. We work closely with communities in the co-design of our services and for hygiene education, and capacity building.



The closed-loop sanitation system starts with the safe containment of excreta in our award-winning Mosan Toilet, used in privacy at home, continues with the secure collection and transport of excreta, and the production of valuable recycling​ products, as biochar fertilizer for agriculture. The resource recovery allows a market-based approach that benefits farmers, creates jobs and generates income for the sustainable development of communities. Furthermore biochar is a viable and scalable carbon sequestration measure, it improves soil quality and prevents artificial fertilizers and overall makes our service climate-positive.



Problem: Sanitation is immensely challenging, as reflected in the Sustainable Development Goal 6 (SDG) that targets the elimination of open defecation and achieving universal access to basic water, sanitation and hygiene on household level. In total a staggering 4.2 billion people lack access to improved sanitation (WHO) - more than half of the world’s population. The lack of sanitation or treatment services leads to disease spreading, high mortality rates, rape and violence on women when going to public bathrooms, and immense environmental contamination. Diseases cause children to miss school days and adults to miss work or educational opportunities. Prosperity starts with access to safe sanitation and water.



We believe the world can't wait for sewers!
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A standard plug and socket for full-sized dc home/workplace appliances
Identification: There has been for some years now a need and a demand for an appropriate and standard residential plug and socket for full-size direct-current (DC) household appliances, especially in developing countries. Full-size DC appliances and tools (many rechargeable and cordless) are now readily available on the market however they are typically delivered with either battery crocodile connectors, Despite having one of the World's Largest Wireless Energy Networks - that being the Sun with a 99.999% geographical 'network'; coverage, more than 80% of the geographical area of the continent of Africa is not served by the electricity grid. Of the 770 million people worldwide without access to electricity, 75% of the population of sub-Saharan Africa lives without access to electricity. Being a direct-sunlight/direct-current solution, this is the solution for eradicating this unacceptable inequality.

Solution on-sentence summary: Eliminating detergents and cleaning agents in a waste-water system
Identification: The DIRO system offers a new sustainable, environmentally friendly, healthy and allergy-free way of doing surface cleaning and laundry. The filter system is installed between incoming cold water and one or several laundry machines. A tap is also installed allowing the user to tap up DIRO water on spray bottles and use it for all daily cleaning. The DIRO system can also be installed with a recirculation system for greywater from the laundry machines. By recycling the water, users can save up to 75% of the water used in laundry and at the same time remove all microplastics from the greywater. The DIRO system comes in three different sizes depending on water usage but can also be made bespoke for larger installations in laundry facilities or cleaning centrals.

Solution on-sentence summary: Creating and developing a recycling channel for multi-component plastic packaging
Identification: The "recyclability" of some plastics is degraded by the presence of additives, which have allowed the packaging to give special qualities (strength, lightness, etc.). Once used, these materials, known as "multi-component plastic packaging," are a major problem in the plastic lifecycle (end up at best in incineration or burial), although they are a solution to reduce the carbon footprint and overall weight of plastics Packaging. "LOCAL3" proposes to create and develop an industrial solution for multi-component plastics, by processing units using post-industrial and post-consumer waste deposits and developing useful, competitive and recyclable products that can be used locally. The Solution allows all plastics to be reused in a circular economy on a human scale, easily deployable in the areas of material creation concerned. Locally sourced, locally transformed and locally used

Solution on-sentence summary: Upcycling of old diesel buses into clean, efficient buses powered 100% by renewables
Identification: Climate change is leading to various problems for society and nature. Air pollution from motorized mobility in cities harms the health of the inhabitants and jobs in the automotive industry are shifting to Asia. These are some of the reasons which led to the development of the Clean Vehicle Directive (DIRECTIVE (EU) 2019/1161). According to this directive, municipalities are forced to reach procurement targets of clean and energy-efficient vehicles. This is a huge challenge for municipalities, as existing alternatives to diesel buses are not always suitable or are extremely expensive. In order to meet the needs of these municipalities, CMF recovers their old buses and remove all diesel components like tanks, engine etc. and install the patented CMF drive. It consists of an electric drivetrain with an onboard charger and enables 3-fold energy savings: Through the recovery of braking energy, usage of engine waste heat and constant optimal load at the on-board charger. Thanks to upcycling, CMF avoids the production of unnecessary material. The CMF drive runs on liquid natural gas (LNG), Bio-LNG or synthetic natural gas. Suitable fuel stations already exist all over Europe and as soon as green hydrogen is available in sufficient amounts the CMF will easily be adapted to it.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile:
Public Authorities, BusinessServicesInfrastructureAirports and Airbases, BusinessServicesRetailerFood & Supermaket, BusinessServicesTransportersPostal Service, Couriers and Messengers
, BusinessServicesWaste & Remediation
Tags: Recycled, Vehicles, LNG - liquified natural gas, Public transport, Reuse waste, Biogas & biomethane, Biofuel
The environmental benefits: 30 % more energy efficient than conventional buses thanks to the patented CMF drive;5 minutes refueling 500 kilometers driving thanks to the on-board charger;50 % less engine noise;100 % less CO₂ emissions with Bio-LNG ;95 % less air pollution;90 tons of CO2 emissions per bus avoided through upcycling of used buses instead of producing new ones;
The Financial benefits: €200,000 to €400,000 cheaper acquisition costs than battery electric or hydrogen buses;€120,000  to €190,000 fuel cost savings over a lifetime of 12 years for one bus compared to battery electric, hydrogen, CNG or diesel bus;No charging infrastructure needed;
Complementary solutions: SeaZen: A 100% autonomous solar boating service with license free self-service access (Mobility);ANTISMOG: An on-demand hydrogen fuel enhancement system for the reduction of air pollution from vehicles (Freight,Mobility);Sion: An eco-friendly and low-cost electric car with integrated photovoltaic cells (Mobility);EP Tender: A range extending service for electric vehicles (Mobility);
Organization short description: We decarbonise urban transport by retrofitting Diesel busses with our innovative CMF Drive running on CMF Biomethane.
About:
Traffic-related emissions of CO2, nitrogen oxide and particulate matter particularly in urban areas are too high. This one the one hand contributes to global warming and on the other hand harms the health of inhabitants.



We have developed an economical and efficient one-stop-shop solution for this problem: We offer the retrofitting of diesel buses with our innovative and patented CMF Drive and and the same time offer the supply with CO2-neutral liquid CMF Biomethane.



Our CMF Drive is a serial hybrid drive train comprising of a small gas engine operated at maximum efficiency that charges a small buffer battery with electricity, which in turn supplies an electric drive axle with power and simultaneously serves as a storage for recuperation energy from braking operations.



Our CMF Biomethane is liquefied directly beneath the biogas plant and transported to our CMF Drive customers.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Identification: As a society, people want more mobility with their devices and equipment, more renewable energy battery storage and more electric vehicles on the road. Lithium-ion batteries are an important part of this future. EV adoption is growing globally and becoming more affordable for the middle class as costs come down. To meet this challenge, the denaLi solution aims to create the mine of the future. It provides a sustainable, profitable and rapid means of creating lithium products for the rapidly expanding electric vehicle sector and utilizes material and chemical innovation to unlock environmentally friendly lithium.

The Financial benefits: Less than two (2) years capital payback period, with the extremely low up-front capital expenditure, the customer is able to pay back their initial investment in 23 months;Minimum IRR of 40% on capital investment;Key factor for a short payback period and healthy IRR:  low capital expenditure (CAPEX) associated with the deployment of modular units;

Organization short description: Nanotechnology Innovation Startup. Based in Calgary. At Summit Nanotech, we leverage the best academic research in nanotechnology to build innovative solutions to help industry partners achieve project success.
About: Summit Nanotech is a Canadian based startup company that has developed a green lithium extraction technology to support the growing electric vehicle revolution. By reducing costs of lithium extraction and improving the environmental impact of this type of mining, Summit Nanotech is allowing EV adoption to be more affordable for the middle class and is directly impacting the full cycle sustainability of driving an EV. Summit’s proprietary extraction process was inspired by the human kidney and therefore encompasses the elegance of mother nature in its design. Using Summit’s technology, fresh water consumption is eliminated, land use area is reduced by 26x, chemical waste is reduced by 90% and GHG emissions are cut in half compared to industrial averages. Summit Nanotech is setting new standards for the mining of lithium that surpasses government regulatory constraints and aligns with corporate ESG strategies. Indigenous communities that have long been impacted by environmental damage during the traditional lithium mining processes need new, sustainable mining technologies and practices which are supported and endorsed by corporations and governments. Lithium ion batteries do not only support the growing EV sector, they are also important to develop and sustain a base load of renewable energy storage for solar and wind projects. Furthermore, the addition of lithium production as a secondary revenue stream for geothermal operations makes geothermal energy creation more affordable and broadens feasibility. Lithium ion batteries are an important part of the clean energy transition and  sustainable extraction methods play an increasingly significant role in counteracting climate change globally.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Organization short description: Global Database of Coastal Plastic Waste
About:
Driven by the emerging next generation AI/CV technologies it is now a viable venture to measure by direct photographic record plastic waste on our coastlines. This provides a much needed tool for existing and future players in the “Ocean Health” space with two important (and missing) aspects. 

1. An assist in choosing appropriate projects, targeted in the appropriate manner, based on data driven strategies. 

2. To enable a results orientated, measurable impact, of the investments made. 

The database records both a snapshot of existing plastic waste on beaches and coastlines and provides detail of the evolution of said waste. 

The data acquisition is done in several phases and through multiple channels. 

Phase 1: mostly visible plastic bottle count growing from regional to global capture through our Advanced AI and computer vision used to detect and count waste from the photographic record. 

Status: App and AI based engine complete. Access, at launch, to a captive boating population of 1.5M and 100M existing pictures of coastlines. 

Phase 2: Measure Global Microplastic concentrations and their evolution from automated spectrometry on drone/aircraft/satellite platforms.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Produce water from ambient air with high production capacities
Identification:
The solution fights against water shortage and lack of water in the world. As the steam on the windows in winter, it produces cold to recover water contained in the air. The high-efficiency atmospheric water generators produce pure, natural, drinkable water with a low chemical load and are autonomous and compact. Produced water can be consumed on the production site. The range capacity goes from 3.000 to more than 50.000 liters a day. Customers can expect savings on energy costs and on payback time that is lower than 5 years for a lifespan of 20 years. The energy consumption varies between 30 and 100 W. It is 50 W at 25°C and 70% humidity per litre, a considerable difference from the usual standards.

The technology uses different sources of energy: solar, gas or electric, thus having a low environmental impact.

Organization short description: An innovating company from Bordeaux specialized in atmospheric water generators for high production capacities
About:
Aquatethys is a young and innovating company from Bordeaux area (France) specialized in atmospheric water generators for high production capacities. Our productions are parts of the more efficient in the world thanks to very low consumption, our generators can be settled wherever you need even if energy resources are missing. Our patented technology, economical and eco-friendly, may works with various energy sources: solar, gas, electricity, hot source, combustion smoke… 

Our range capacity goes from 3.000 to more than 50.000 liters a day (our last quotation for example was for a totally autonomous solar production of 100.000 liters a day). We also commercialize OEM generators for specialized retailers. 

Our last innovation is a totally autonomous generator able to produce 3.000 liters a day for 30 days without any human intervention. Our main wish is to build water production units working in plug in play. For the future, we would like to propose factories working in tri-generation and providing added value on incoming and rejects or also a associate water and electricity production (patent processing at this moment). 



Our project is not only industrial but also have a societal aspect, our wish is to supply population in need by training personal on site for an easier curative and preventive maintenance of our units.

Solution on-sentence summary: Producing low-cost solar cooling for developing countries
Identification: The lack of cold chains (the sequence of measures needed to get food fresh and chilled from farm to fork) in many countries leads to large-scale loss of produce and quality, with significant impacts on rural and national incomes. Additionally, it makes food expensive in urban areas, which are becoming increasingly populous. 38% of food grown in Egypt and 48% of India's food suffer from this problem. The problem is the need for the food to be chilled on-farm as soon as it is harvested. This is difficult and expensive without mains electricity. Solar Polar's cooling modules don't need mains electricity to operate. The modules can operate both day and night due to a thermal energy storage component, have no moving parts, and provide cooling with zero carbon emissions, thus making enormous improvements to all concerned lives.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Off-grid, Air-conditioning, Cooling, Refrigeration, Solar Thermal

The Financial benefits: Repayment time of 3 to 5 years dependent on the cost of electricity;Works in off-grid communities;Local manufacture brings jobs as well as cooling;

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable and clean calcium production from seafood waste
Identification: Clams from clam fishing and processing get discarded as waste. Main problem for processing has been the lack of knowledge of their chemical potential and the organic tissue that needs to be cleaned off. Sustainable sources of calcium are not many, and most of them demand sacrifices, such as scares from extraction zones and mines, or utilization of the harvesting of vulnerable sea beds. The solution Bluecal aims to utilize waste from clam fishing giving boosting rural fishing areas and giving the market for food calcium a cheap organic and sustainable alternative. Bluecal gives end users the option of buying sustainable calcium products at the same price level as other traditional goods on the market, with the added benefit of lowering environmental impact by avoiding waste being sent to landfills and decreasing energy usage in production stages.

Solution on-sentence summary: An off-grid fuel cell providing cost-effective, emission-free power from ammonia
Identification: More than 1.1 billion people lack electricity for lighting, telecom, cooking & economic development. With 84% of these people living in rural areas beyond the reach of power grids, solutions are needed to provide clean and affordable electricity to these people. The GenCell A5 nano-plant is an off-grid power solution that provides the benefits of green fuel cell energy with an inexpensive and easily accessible liquid fuel: anhydrous ammonia. This Solution can be used for telecommunications and rural electrification, a critical need for improving quality of life in off-grid communities. In the 2020s, more than 1 million telecom towers will be in off-grid or in poor-grid locations powered by diesel generators that pollute the air and contaminate the soil. With this Solution, off-grid communities can gain access to improved communications and electricity without pollution and emissions.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Partners
Tags: Off-grid, Fuel cells, Hydrogen

Organization short description: GenCell fuel cells deliver reliable, affordable clean power for humanity that renders diesel generators obsolete.
Headquarters: Shmu'el Salant St 16, Petah Tikva, Israel
About:
GenCell Energy (GNCL: TASE) develops fuel cell solutions that offer affordable, clean power for humanity, enabling businesses to Say No to Diesel and render diesel generators obsolete. Using ultra-reliable fuel cell technology that powers spacecraft, we deliver backup power for utilities, homeland security, healthcare and automated industries. Our revolutionary process to create hydrogen-on-demand from anhydrous ammonia (NH3) enables our fuel cell solutions to also provide primary power for off-grid and poor-grid sites, as well as rural electrification. 



We develop and are moving to mass production of commercially viable and affordable clean alkaline fuel cells, focusing on overcoming the two main barriers preventing the mainstream acceptance of fuel cell technology – CapEx & OpEx – and scaling up our disruptive ammonia-to-energy technology.  In 2020 GenCell completed its first IPO on the Israeli stock exchange, with strategic investments by Paz Oil and by Japanese conglomerate TDK. 



Employing a team of more than 80 professionals including space and submarine experts, GenCell is headquartered in Israel with a worldwide distribution and support network and retains unique intellectual property that includes patents, trade secrets and know-how.

Solution on-sentence summary: Re-establish damaged marine ecosystems and improve marine biodiversity restoration
Identification: Marine biodiversity is under big threat: more than half of coral reefs and seagrass have disappeared since the 20th century and over 40% of the ocean surface shows critical signs. Experts estimate that 1/8 of marine species could have disappeared by 2050 if no action is taken.  This solution aims to restore marine biodiversity. By boosting the natural process of habitats decolonisation, it enables marine life to come back. There are many reasons for which marine restoration is urgently needed: boost the coral's colonisation in the environments stressed by climate change or fight against installation and spread of invasive species, ... On top of these rationales, the main benefit of emerging a reef is to support coastal fishing by targeting specific types of fishes and/or to promote tourism.

Solution on-sentence summary: Valorization of recycled aggregates from concrete waste in low-carbon concrete
Identification: Aggneo® recycles waste by having dedicated platforms located near concrete plants and close to city centres (-2km). The process is a circular economy loop. An example is the LHB concrete plant in Lyon, transferring its waste to the Saint Fons platform, which recycles it into aggregates for the road and for concrete. The quality of the 4/16 materials is monitored. These materials are reintroduced into the concrete formulas of the concrete plants. These aggregates, stored in the open for a long time and with significant exposure, can further capture and sequestrate CO2.

Solution on-sentence summary: Self-adapting autonomous ai technology to optimize the energy consumption of buildings
Identification: Energy agencies around the globe have concluded that residential and commercial buildings on average represent 40% of the total energy consumed. Studies have shown that on average, HVAC represents 45% of a commercial building’s total annual energy consumption, and that typically 30% of that energy is in fact, wasted. BrainBox AI's solution is at the forefront of the green building revolution with its unique technology combining artificial intelligence and cloud computing to create the world’s first fully autonomous commercial HVAC solution.  The overlays deep learning-driven algorithms on existing HVAC functionality to automate the modulation of each component, reducing a building’s total energy spend by up to 25% while improving occupant comfort by 60%. The solution creates a 20-40% decrease in carbon footprint. The solution leverages AI to predict building energy consumption at a very granular level and enables our autonomous HVAC system to operate the building pre-emptively versus the current reactive approach of existing HVAC control systems.  This shift from reactive to pre-emptive HVAC system management is applied individually to each of the building’s distinct zones, allowing for a very granular control of the system

Organization short description: Ponera ha sviluppato una soluzione di imballaggio industriale intelligente, modulare e digitale che sostituisce le casse di legno a una via.
About:
Abbiamo sviluppato un sistema di pallet modulari che, attraverso il loro assemblaggio, possono fornire pallet di diverse dimensioni in termini di superficie. Ciò è particolarmente importante a causa del costo elevato dei pallet di dimensioni non standard. Il design si concentra sul rispetto dei requisiti standard in termini di capacità di spedizione, nonché su un sistema di connessione molto sicuro e protetto per il nesting dei pallet.

Le dimensioni dei pallet Ponera sono progettate tenendo conto delle diverse fasi del processo di spedizione, al fine di massimizzare l'efficienza del trasporto aumentando la quantità di merce trasferita in contenitori standard. Inoltre, i materiali utilizzati per i nostri pallet sono considerati biopolimeri riciclabili che offrono una maggiore sostenibilità. L'utilizzo di questo materiale garantisce la possibilità di riutilizzare i pallet più volte (la durata di vita stimata è di oltre 10 anni) rispetto ai pallet in legno di dimensioni personalizzate che vengono generalmente utilizzati una sola volta, creando un grande spreco di risorse.

Al giorno d'oggi, i pallet in legno vengono utilizzati principalmente per la spedizione di merci. Anche se esistono pallet definiti convenzionali, come i pallet europei o americani, gran parte di questo mercato comprende merci di dimensioni personalizzate, ad esempio nel caso del trasporto di attrezzature industriali o di mobili. 

Il problema dei pallet di dimensioni personalizzate è che sono molto più costosi rispetto ai pallet convenzionali. Ciò è dovuto principalmente al costo di produzione di questi pallet, poiché non vengono prodotti in grandi quantità. Il secondo problema è che questi pallet vengono solitamente utilizzati una sola volta nel loro ciclo di vita, in quanto vengono rottamati alla fine del trasporto, il che offre una sostenibilità molto bassa, sia economica che ambientale.

I pallet convenzionali, d'altra parte, hanno il problema di non essere ottimizzati per ottenere la massima efficienza di trasporto, come ad esempio la massimizzazione della superficie utilizzata dei contenitori standard per il trasporto a secco. Tali pallet sono stati standardizzati in un periodo compreso tra gli anni '40 e '60 e sono ottimizzati principalmente per ridurre i tempi di carico richiesti o semplicemente per adattarsi alle porte degli edifici residenziali. La soluzione che offriamo è progettata per affrontare le sfide sopra citate. 

Inoltre, il concetto di modularità del nostro sistema di pallet ci permette di fornire soluzioni IoT, dotandole praticamente di soluzioni di tracciabilità, e crea i presupposti per un'efficiente economia circolare con un modello di soluzione unico per tutti. Il design e il concetto della soluzione Ponera sono un fattore abilitante per le iniziative di Physical Internet, garantendo una soluzione che consente un incapsulamento flessibile delle merci. Grazie a questa caratteristica, che combina la flessibilità (d'uso e di dimensioni) con soluzioni di tracciabilità, siamo nella posizione ideale per affrontare ulteriori mercati come il trasporto di merci di dimensioni convenzionali (grazie all'aumento dell'utilizzo di spazio nei container) e aumentare la nostra offerta futura di soluzioni digitali per gestire efficacemente il flusso dei moduli.

Infine abbiamo sviluppato il design e la selezione del materiale per il prodotto. Il progetto ha superato i test di simulazione per soddisfare i requisiti dei mercati a cui vogliamo rivolgerci. Il primo prototipo è in fase di produzione e abbiamo organizzato un test pilota nel primo trimestre del 2021 con un'azienda in Svizzera, e puntiamo a 3-4 progetti pilota in totale, in diversi settori e per diversi usi. Abbiamo depositato due domande di brevetto presso l'Ufficio Europeo dei Brevetti nel gennaio 2019.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Circular thermal energy storage system for peak shifting
Identification: Huge advances have been made in renewable energy production, but barriers remain to store this energy for later use. SaltX's EnerStore Solution seeks to address this issue by delivering a scientifically-proven, low cost underlying technology for energy storage and high-quality steam production. The patented Solution provides a nano-coated salt (NCS) and oxide technology that is perfect for energy storage applications. Charge it with electricity or heat when available, and release high-quality steam at up to 450°C. To store the energy, the salt crystals are heated up with electricity or heat. When discharging the salt, steam is released that serves for many applications. The model system has four key components – two storage tanks and two reactors. The reactor size is flexible and can be custom fitted to the capacity required. The storage tanks are scalable and simple to install. By using this innovative process, this Solution offers a sustainable, efficient and affordable option for energy storage.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: Retrofit showering solution preventing water and energy waste
Identification: Currently, 11% of EU territory has a serious water scarcity problem, and our overconsumption of water increases drought frequency by 20–25%. Households and service industries use 12.9% of all EU freshwater, accounting for 144 liters of water per person per day. This is 3 times the basic human water needs. Showering takes 80% of our household hot water and 31% of our total household water consumption – meaning that our showers alone account for 3% of EU energy consumption and 4% of EU freshwater consumption. Within this, we have also seen a doubling of the water used for showering over the past 30yrs. This is wasteful. In addition, this problem is exacerbated when we waste hot water. Flow Loop's Eco Loop Shower is a retrofittable water recirculation shower. Instead of letting all the warm water go to waste down the drain, Eco Loop recovers it from the floor and passes it through the filtration system, before recirculating it to your shower head cleaner than before and with 50% higher flow - while adding just a little bit of warm water to keep the temperature comfortable. This way the Eco Loop Shower enables households to save both water and energy without compromising the comfort of the experience
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Shower
Sectors: Buildings, Water, Heating, cooling and ventilation, Water efficiency
The environmental benefits: Water flow is 50% more than the flow of a normal water saving shower head;Connected in less than 30 minutes;85% water and 75% energy  savings while increasing the flow with 50%;Usage: less than 16 liters (2 gal) of water for your 8min shower - compared to 80 liters with a standard shower head;Usage: less than 1 kWh for your 8min shower - compared to more that 3 kWh with a standard shower head;
The Financial benefits: Household utility bills decrease corresponding up to 85% of water and 75% of energy savings;Up to 25% lower purchase costs and 90% lower installation costs than other recirculating showers;Return on investment of less than 1700 showers (3 years) vs 6000-7500 shower for competitors;
Complementary solutions:
Solar space heating: Solar-powered air heaters and rock bed thermal storage to heat homes 

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Kelda Technology: Halve the amount of water used by your shower without diminishing the experience (Buildings & Shelters,Water);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: Flow Loop makes showering sustainable by recycling the water. The solution can be retrofitted in existing bathrooms.
About:
Flow Loop makes a shower panel that can save up to 85% water and 75% energy while providing a much better flow than a standard shower. This is achieved by continuously filtering, purifying and recirculating a small  amount of water. Thereby Flow Loop uses only 15% water and 25% of energy compared to a standard shower while providing better comfort and even limiting lime scale in shower space.



At Flow Loop we have a vision to change the way we use water as a resource and help to secure sufficient clean water in the near future.



We believe the best way we can do this is to provide innovation that changes how we use water in our homes and support the integration of sustainable living into the mainstream market.



By doing so we also aim to change the mindset towards the way we use water as a precious resource and advance public awareness towards a more sustainable future.



Our goal is to change the way we use water in our bathrooms and ultimately our homes. Our mission is to provide solutions for any household – solutions that are affordable, accessible and attractive.



We want to create a new standard for efficient use of water (and other resources) in the shower – and to provide smarter water solutions for any bathroom/home.



We want to drive innovation and deliver solutions for a more sustainable living without compromising comfort or convenience. We aim to deliver retrofit solutions, that will require a minimum of change to the existing infrastructure.

Solution on-sentence summary: A platform for in situ data acquisition and analysis of marine environment
Identification:
Seamonitor is a comprehensive, lightweight, easy-to-deploy system aimed at monitoring: bathymetry, halieutics, seabed nature and underwater vegetation.



Acquiring environnmental data is a complex task. Especially when georeferencing is required. To build maps and monitor evolution of coastal area (climate change, erosion, posidonia field evolution,...) complex surveys are usually required, involving heavy ships and dedicated highly qualified staff just to get data in situ about ocean depth and seabed nature (sand, vegetation, rocks, ...). Monitoring is often required to measure the evolution fo the environnment after various climate events, human activity (ships in harbor moving sediments with propellers), currents and seasons. Thus, several mobilizations, transportations, and operations are planified to fullfill the need for environnemtal data.



Thanks to Seamonitor, environment monitoring is now a plugnplay, environment-friendly and cost-optimzed task.

Solution on-sentence summary: Zero waste transformation for all points of sales through bulk distribution and reusable contenants
Identification: Each household produces 568KG of wastes every year in France. There is also too much food waste with 150 kg per capita per year. (ADEME, 2018). Moreover, millions of glass bottles are thrown away when they have only been used once. To solve these problems, Liquids Bulk Expert uses the glass bottle reuse to prevent it from ending up in the trash! The Solution seeks to build a zero-waste system of distribution and consumption. It provides grocery stores with self-service dispensers, organic liquid products and reusable & returnable bottles. At the store, the consumer buys a bottle and can refill it as many times as he/she wants with various products (wine, oil, vinegar, spirits, dish liquid, soap, shampoo, etc.). If he/she chooses to, it is possible to sell it back to the store and Liquids Bulk Expert will collect and wash it before reintroducing it in stores. This is a circular business model built on the functional economy (selling the use of the bottle and not the bottle itself), on the waste prevention (reusing bottles) and promoting a sustainable consumption (be aware of the environmental-impact of your consumption). The Solution is present in more than 1000 stores with self-dispensers to distribute zero waste organic liquid products for consumers in France and Europe

Solution on-sentence summary: A water-based process to eliminate printing from plastics
Identification: Plastics with printing are only recycled to make low quality products because the pigments give the plastics very dirty colors and make it difficult to work well with them, but most of them go to landfill or incineration. By eliminating the pigments, the printing, the materials keep their plasticity and original colour, normally transparent or white; then, these plastics can be used as raw material to make the same items. This way the plastic stops being waste but becomes valuable. The Solution DEINKING is simple: a water-based process to eliminate printed ink and other contaminants in plastics, like, paper stickers, glue, dust, to obtain recycled plastics of high quality, similar to virgin, to make these plastics circular in a way that can have from 5 to 10 more cycles. The particularity of the process is that it is water-based, without any solvents involved, and it incorporates a water-treatment system to reuse the same water for several months, making it a very sustainable technology.
Looking For: New clients, Funding
Tags: Municipal Solid Waste, PET waste, Packaging & plastics waste, Waste treatment, Industrial Waste
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Waste/Pollution, Manufacturing and construction processes, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: OPEX between 180 and 240 €/t;It reduces the CO2 emissions x 5;0% of solvent usage;100% use of a waste that did not have much value;A minimum of 5 cycles of life for the same deinked plastics;
The Financial benefits: +/- 2 yers payback;Little cost per tonne of deinked recycled plastic to reuse compared with the alternative, which is to pay to be taken for incineration, etc;Cuts costs of solvents (0$)  ;

CADEL DEINKING is a technical company created to implement an innovative plastic recycling process that can remove printed ink from plastic surfaces in recycling and converting companies. It is done without solvents, in a water closed circuit.



The technology developed by CADEL DEINKING lets us remove ink from plastic before it is recycled and obtain a product with a quality similar to that of new plastic. It can therefore be used in the same applications as a new material.

Solution on-sentence summary: Access to clean drinking water that is sustainable, intelligent and affordable
Identification: In many countries, the quality of drinking water provided by the government is compromised and dependence on water filtration techniques for safe drinking water has increased significantly. In addition to increased contamination in utility water supply, ill monitored water cans have become a painful part of our daily lives. Access to safe drinking water is one of the biggest problems we face today. Deteriorating quality and rising cost of drinking water is a big challenge faced by the ever-growing population. OCEO - The New Access to Safe Drinking Water OCEO is a first of its kind IoT enabled smart water purifier that gives you healthy water right in your home without purchasing the device or pay maintenance fee. Now you only pay for the water purified from the machine (Water Purification as a Service - WAAS). With OCEO, now everyone can measure, monitor and maintain drinking water needs in an intelligent, sustainable and cost effective way. Its smart sense system automatically alert customers within minutes of a leak or a major repair and keep them informed till resolution. Machine learning in remote monitoring is continuously adapted to assure safety in every water drop and to improve remote asset maintenance

OCEO is leading the revolution of Water Purification as a Service and is the new wave in the Drinking Water Industry. Our winning solution OCEO emerged as the winner of the India-Israel Innovation Challenge for Innovative in Drinking Water and received the recognition from Prime Minister of India Shri Narendra Modi and Prime Minister of Israel Mr Benjamin Netanyahu.



With our unique positioning in serving the growing demand for safe drinking water, we are optimistic about the business prospects in the Indian market.  Our impact goes beyond the water access.
