Solution on-sentence summary: An intelligent and safe bike stand to park or rent public bikes
Identification: This solution reduces street congestion thanks to an intelligent bike rack that allows private bikes to be parked on the street with dock type security that locks the bike frame. The system can also be used as an ordinary bike stand without subscribing, by locking your bike with your own lock. Additionally, cities can also use the intelligent bike stand to provide bike-sharing services to its citizens. Highly versatile, Smart Lock & Dock offers a smart and hybrid solution to rethink and improve the use of public space and urban mobility.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesInfrastructureRoads & Road Traffic Infrastructure
Tags: Biking, Parking, Vehicles
The environmental benefits: This solution offers a solution for highly congested cities ;Job creation for every 100 Smart Lock & Dock Bike stands installed, 2 permanent green jobs are created ;No C02 emissions due to bikes transportation as they are not moved by van;Releasing street space currently occupied with many differing types of parking stands and public service bike rental docks ;Reduction of bike theft;
The Financial benefits: ROI for client cities and towns can be six months, depending on how they choose to operate;95% cheaper than current bike-sharing dock;
Complementary solutions: SeaZen: A 100% autonomous solar boating service with license free self-service access (Mobility);ANTISMOG: An on-demand hydrogen fuel enhancement system for the reduction of air pollution from vehicles (Freight,Mobility);Sion: An eco-friendly and low-cost electric car with integrated photovoltaic cells (Mobility);EP Tender: A range extending service for electric vehicles (Mobility);
Organization short description: World first intelligent bike stand
About:
As cities grow ever larger pressures on public space increase, when cars became popular, chaos on street parking resulted, the invention of the parking meter solved that problem.

The world's first installed parking meter was in Oklahoma City on July 16, 1935. Magee received a patent for the apparatus on 24 May 1938.

The main attribute of the parking meter was the ability to control any size of vehicle and to charge rent for the space used thereby increasing city revenues.

Fast forward to 2019 private bicycle and scooter, public share bicycles and scooters of all types are now creating chaotic street clutter demand from many different quarters now need their own space requirements putting enormous pressures on streetspace

They all need space that is risk assessed ,for public safety insurance cover, without this standard being authorised there is no public liability insurance cover.

For example Barcelona has Bicing, a very large expensive dock based system, that is very popular, it also has private bike hoops taking up more space, other bike share operators like donkey bikes uses these hoops, reducing private bike capacity, then there are scooter bikes appearing, some like Lime scooters, are trusting users to park safely anywhere which affects public liability insurance cover .

Who is responsible for a pedestrian tripping up and being injured.

Smart Lock and Dock solves all these issues, like the original parking meter, any type of car van or lorry becomes parking space that is controllable,

Smart Lock and Dock does the same, for any type of two wheeled vehicle, electric or pedal, can now be controlled in the same controlled securely and safely from a single unit.

The inefficiency of needing to rebalance dock based bike share, every night, using specially designed trucks is eliminated

Instead of 80% of docks being occupied with bikes waiting to be used and 20%of Docks waiting for a bike to be parked.

Smart Lock and Dock has 80% of parking space waiting for a bike to be parked allowing a free floating type use for Bicing

The Smart Lock and Dock has no infrastructure requirements and can, with operational experience, improve efficiency, by moving to better more efficient locations.

The cost of the Smart Lock and Dock is 90% cheaper than the Bicing and has a ROI of 6 months
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: A new wave energy transmission for subsea power
Identification: Capturing and making use of Naturally Occurring Motion Energy (NOME) for electricity remains a key challenge. WITT Energy addresses this challenge by taking the motion in water, wind and humans and turning it into electrical power which can be stored and called upon when needed. The Solution uses naturally occurring motions, such as those generated by water currents, to generate electricity by capturing energy from all six degrees of freedom. The system is zero emissions, recyclable and scalable, with units able to be built from centimetres to metres from standard industry parts. An example of the Solution in practice is the harvesting of sub-sea water motion & turning it into power to provide a solution for the aquaculture industry. This has huge potential for sectors such as fish farms, and could replace polluting diesel generators with clean energy.
Looking For: Network, new clients, visibility, funding, partners, credibility
Tags: Off-grid, Wave & Tidal power
The environmental benefits: Replacing diesel generators with this Solution on a fish farm would save 293 tonnes of CO2 per year;Zero emissions from operation;
The Financial benefits: Payback for clients in just a few years;Could avoid the need for diesel generators in some industries by 2022;

Solution on-sentence summary: Compact energy appliance using combustible waste to produce clean thermal energy & biochar
Identification: MAGS provides a sustainable, profitable, and ecologically safe alternative to traditional waste management and energy generation for any habitat. This solution relies on the patented “Auto Gasification” process to enable the treatment of all combustible waste on-site, generate clean energy and soil-enriching biochar to be used within the habitat, while producing clean air emissions. MAGS destroys waste on-site, reducing its volume by 95%. Bags of waste are introduced into the machine without pre-treatment, sorting or excess handling. Most types of waste can be treated including infectious waste, food, papers, pharmaceuticals, plastics, packaging, and more. MAGS is an excellent solution for many market sectors and offers economic and environmental advantages due to its energy recovery, clean emissions, carbon sequestration in the soil, reduced environmental footprint, as well as the elimination of transport, incineration and landfilling, resulting in significant GHG reduction.

Organization short description: Redefining the value of “waste” by transforming byproducts into valuable resources to be used and reused on-site.
About:
Terragon Environmental Technologies inc. is an award-winning cleantech company innovating sustainable solutions for on-site reuse and conversion of resources otherwise considered waste. Terragon provides the opportunity to convert by-products or other materials into energy through its MAGS technology and wastewater into reusable water through its WETT technology.



 

Unlike conventional waste management methods, Terragon offers an innovative on-site and cost-effective approach to clean energy, reusable water, and waste management. MAGS and WETT enable any habitat or building to use byproducts internally with significant environmental benefits including net GHG reduction as well as zero-waste and wastewater generation. In this way, Terragon enables total resource utilization or TRU.



 

Terragon is revolutionizing off-grid sustainability by enabling any habitat or building to stop exporting waste and use it locally to generate valuable resources. We offer material management and resource extraction solutions to several industries including the following: marine, biomedical, pharmaceutical, military, industrial, remote habitats, and work camps, to name a few.

Solution on-sentence summary: A biological process for energy storage and transport in the natural gas grid
Identification: The expanding installation of wind and solar plants leads inevitably to peaks in electricity generation. As a result, surplus electricity is generated in windy and sunny periods, which to an increasing share cannot be fed into the grid. On the other hand, the deconstruction of conventional power plants causes supply gaps in times of low wind and sun. Therefore the development and installation of innovative long term storage technologies is one of the main challenges in the transformation of the energy system. In order to tackle this challenge, MicrobEnergy has developed its own system of power-to-gas technology. With this process, electricity can be converted into hydrogen by electrolysis. This hydrogen can either be used directly or, in a second step, converted together with carbon dioxide from a biogas or sewage plant into methane gas. Chemically identical to natural gas, methane can be fed into the natural gas grid in unlimited quantities. In this way the existing infrastructure of the natural gas network can be used as a huge energy storage and transport system. BiON contributes to a greener world by converting the energy from wind and sun into renewable gas, thus creating a climate-friendly energy source that can be used universally.

Organization short description: The Viessmann Group is one of the leading international manufacturers of climate and energy solutions.
About:
The Viessmann Group is one of the leading international manufacturers of climate and energy solutions. This family enterprise was founded in 1917, has 12,300 employees, and the group’s turnover amounts to € 2.65 billion Euro.

With 22 production companies in 12 countries, sales companies and agencies in 74 countries and 120 sales offices worldwide, Viessmann is internationally oriented. 56 percent of turnover is generated abroad.

Because it is a family business, Viessmann places particular value on acting in a responsible way for the long term; hence sustainability is firmly anchored in its corporate values. For Viessmann, putting sustainability into practice means bringing economics, ecology and social responsibility into harmony throughout the entire company so that today’s needs can be met without harming the means of livelihood of future generations. 

Viessmann has always seen challenges as opportunities and developed innovative solutions to deal with them. Thus the company has for decades been serving the function of an environmental pioneer and technological pacemaker by supplying oil- and gas-fired, energy-efficient heating systems that are especially low in emissions, as well as solar thermal systems, wood combustion systems and heat pumps. 

MicroEnergy is part of the Viessmann group. It develops and distributes Power to gas solutions, based on microbiological products and technical system components. In addition, the company specialises in process control and in the optimisation of biological systems.

Solution on-sentence summary: Enabling year-round farming with next-generation water pumps powered by renewable energy
Identification: The Barsha Pump is a water wheel propelled pump that utilises energy from the flow of rivers and canals to pump water for agriculture without requiring any fuel or electricity. Depending upon the soil, crop, climate and irrigation technique, one Barsha Pump can irrigate up to 2 hectares of land. Using this Solution in integration with storage systems and efficient water distribution techniques such as sprinkler systems can further help to irrigate a larger area. This Solution not only delivers large cost savings for farmers, but also reduces emissions whilst delivering an efficient and sustainable water irrigation option.

About:
A high-tech startup founded at Delft University of Technology (Netherlands) in 2013, aQysta aims to provide sustainable hydro-powered pumping solutions that can have a positive economic, environmental, and social impact.



We are located in Yes!Delft, Europe’s biggest high-tech incubator that grants access to expertise, network, and research facilities. At Delft office, we conduct technology research, product design and development, sourcing, and global sales.



In the South Asian region, we have our affiliated entity in Nepal, operating since 2015. aQysta Nepal sells and implements pumps in Nepal which serve as the platform for conducting research, experiments, and gathering market feedback.



Our flagship product “Barsha Pump” is an award-winning innovative pump, which has been rolled out in various countries worldwide in a short period of time. This early success has enabled us to gain customer feedback, technical validation in diverse geographies, and market opportunity in diverse socio-economic conditions.



aQysta is on a quest to sustainably provide water for farming. To do so, we are re-investing a majority of our profits back into the business to grow our company and further our mission.

Solution on-sentence summary: Delivering fresh water for future irrigation systems
Identification: Climate Change reduces water offer locally. Population growth increases water demand, mainly by agriculture which represents about 80% of total demand. International organizations such as FAO, UNESCO, World Bank, … point at the need of sharp increases in irrigated surfaces. These important future irrigation water requirements can be met only by large infrastructure projects. Via Marina takes existing fresh water at any river mouth and transports it coast to coast through a submarine pipeline, delivering it to where it is needed by all users: human, industries and agriculture. Therefore, it is more economical and less energy-consuming. By supplying all water demands, Via Marina helps reducing inequalities between regions rich in water and those suffering from water shortages. The solution also contributes to adapting agriculture to Climate Change and to mitigating it with new forestry specially dedicated to capturing CO2. It also reduces avoidable migratory flows. Indeed, water issues are not only food and development related but also security and peace-related. Excellent impact to cost ratio.
Looking For: Visibility, Funding
Tags: Underground, Drinking-water, Water-networks, Saline water

No waste.no use of chemicals.;Potential for developping forestry for CO2 capture;Helps stopping desertification, recharge of aquifers and reservoirs;
The Financial benefits: TCO at least 30% smaller than desalination when duly considering negative externalities.;CAPEX 5 times smaller than traditional onshore transfers.;TCO derives 70% from CAPEX, so less dependant on impending increases in OPEX ;

Solution on-sentence summary: A drilling tool for making geothermal wells possible anywhere
Identification:
Geothermal energy is the only renewable source of clean and baseload energy, available 24/7/365. It works regardless of weather conditions or the day-night cycle. 

GA Drilling is developing a revolutionary tool, which is using plasma drilling to access untapped energy potential that our Earth offers. This intelligent drilling platform PLASMABIT® overcomes all current deep-drilling challenges. With our unique technology, we can drill to the previously prohibitive depths of up to 10 km and unlock clean, inexpensive, baseload geothermal energy anywhere. By combining PLASMABIT® solution with conventional off the shelf modular system, in conjunction with engineering, procurement, and construction partners, GA Drilling delivers ultra-deep geothermal energy at low cost anywhere. By accessing very high temperatures in depths, PLASMABIT® will unlock the whole cascade of applications, which can turn geothermal power into the most versatile, constant and least expensive source of energy available.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Geothermal power, Drilling and extraction
The environmental benefits: PLASMABIT® can achieve at least 3 times higher ROP ( rate of penetration) than rotary bits in hard rock formations such as Granite, Quartzite, Gnei - reaching an average ROP of 1-3m/h in igneous/metamorphic rocks;Faster tripping times: Conventional rigs will trip around 350 m/h and PLASMABIT® coil will safely trip at around 1,000 m/h – almost 3x as fast;Ecology - substantial noise reduction: Coil Tubing based PLASMABIT deployment and the Hybrid Rig design will ensure that drilling operations will have no noise generation above ground ;Could save up to 30% of annual global power sector CO2 emissions by 2040;Aims at reversing the current 75% of fossil fuel energy scenario in 2035;Brings the missing clean baseload element to the current renewable energy mix (solar, wind);
The Financial benefits: The only available clean baseload energy with competitive costs - offering a levelized cost of electricity bellow 50 € per MWh.;PLASMABIT's cost per 1 meter drilling in hard-rocks in deep depth (high pressure) is decreased 3+ times compared to conventional: 1000€ instead of 3500€+;PLASMABIT is changing the paradigm, transforming drilling costs growth per meter from today's exponential into linear;
Complementary solutions: Low-cost substructure system: Bottom-fixed offshore turbine prototype that can be installed safely, simply and without cranes (Energy,Infrastructures);PYROWATTS: A disruptive waste to energy scalable gasifier for decentralized waste management (Waste & Pollution,Energy);SOPRASOLAR FIX EVO: A photovoltaic waterproofing process for converting roof surfaces into renewable electrical production (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Pyro Power Plant: A climate-positive process for biochar and clean energy generation from biowaste (Energy,Food & Agriculture,Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: GA Drilling is a high technology company headquartered in Bratislava with branches in Bristol, Abu Dhabi and Houston.
About:
GA Drilling is revolutionizing the geothermal industry by new ground-breaking technology PLASMABIT® for ultra-deep drilling. It will make geothermal energy the most economical, sustainable, and clean baseload energy source anywhere, saving 30% of global annual greenhouse gas emissions at scale. 



Geothermal energy is heat that comes from the sub-surface of the Earth. To produce it, wells are drilled deep into underground reservoirs. Hot water is brought to the surface for direct use of the heat (for district heating) or to generate electricity. All you need to do is to reach the correct thermal temperatures cost-efficiently, which is today the prohibitive factor. PLASMABIT® can keep drilling fast and costs linear, unlike conventional methods. The exploitation of ultra-deep geothermal energy around 10km deep will unlock unlimited power, and also be very financially attractive.



PLASMABIT® is the end result of several years of R&D, supported by a team of 100+ engineers, industrial funding, private investors, 20 E.U. research grants, and strategic partnerships with the drilling industry leaders.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy

Identification:
More and more multi-family houses have to settle their solar costs and ancillary costs in line with consumer needs. This is because tenants often save over 10% of their resource consumption. Without specialists and engineers, this is currently hardly solvable. Unless you use zevvy...

Imagine a middle-aged man named Klaus, who has just inherited a small apartment building. Now he gets bills for water and heating. How can he distribute this to the tenants? He cannot do it at will, because there are strict standards. But it is too expensive to hire an engineer, as is usual with large projects.

Solution on-sentence summary: A safe, environmentally friendly and adaptable seabed-to-surface mooring system
Identification: Anchoring floating objects and maintaining their position and location normally requires a deadload (e.g. concrete blocks) or an anchor. This can have major consequences on flora and fauna occupying the seabed, and can damage fragile and biodiverse environments. Seafloatech Pod® is a reliable, recyclable and more sustainable anchoring Solution for positioning, stabilising, and securing floating installations designed to receive boats without requiring them to drop anchor. The Solution makes a connection between seabed and the surface for any floating object and is able to stand the external forces on the floating object to stabilise it. The anchoring system uses a 'screw anchor' design, preventing damage to the flora or fauna on the seabed. Installation is easy and needs only light equipment, and is fully removable. This innovative Solution is step forward in coastal management in all the aspects of sustainable development: Social, environmental and economical.

Solution on-sentence summary: Energy storage that makes clean power from solar and wind all hours of the day
Identification: Azelio has the capacity to take the role of a renewable baseload, replacing diesel that is used today, with a zero-emission solution that produces electricity at half the cost of diesel power. Azelio also has the capability of addressing the resiliency in more mature renewable energy markets. Renewables are creating an overload in existing grids, such as in California, with its intermittent supply patterns. This creates power breakdowns and natural catastrophes. Azelio can balance the output and match demand through storing energy from day to night or from one day to the other, thereby also increasing the productivity from renewable solutions and the use of clean power in the grid. Azelio is using recycled aluminum as a storage medium. It does not require any refilling for maintained capacity as opposed to thermal storage using salt or water. It can be used over and over without any degraded capacity, and it does not use any scarce minerals. This is solving the problem of energy storage solutions requiring constant refilling of salt or water, or batteries that, in many cases, are using conflict minerals.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessEnergy Utility, BusinessServicesBuildings Operators, BusinessServicesHealthcare & Medical Institution
Tags: Off-grid, Batteries - energy storage, Electrical grid, Aluminum, TES (thermal energy storage)
The environmental benefits: 96% reduction of CO2 emission compared to diesel generator;29% reduction of CO2 emission compared to Battery Energy Storage System;Recycled aluminum as storage medium;
The Financial benefits: 59% cheaper LCOE than diesel generator and 31% cheaper LCOE than BESS;Up to 44% cheaper LCOS than BESS;Less than 5 years payback time;
Complementary solutions: Storage GEM®: Smart energy management system in containerized storage units for rapid deployment (Energy);Smart Energy Hub: An innovative hydrogen-based energy storage solution for buildings (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Cool Green Energy Factory: An innovative energy concept to make cooling processes economically and ecologically sustainable (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);Solar GEM® (Green Energy in Motion): Smart energy management system for solar power plants (Energy);
Organization short description: Energy storage with dispatchable and aff clean power at all hours of the day, distributed and modular from 0.1 to 100 MW
About: Azelio has a patented thermal energy storage solution with dispatchable clean power production at all hours of the day, using a Stirling engine. The storage can be charged with electricity or thermal energy from solar and wind and stored as heat in a recycled aluminum alloy. As the sun sets and or the wind stops, the heat is withdrawn on demand from the storage to a Stirling engine - delivering electricity and generating heat around the clock. The storage units can be clustered to the desired output, from 0.1 to 100 MW. With high volume components, the system is affordable already from very small size installations. Azelio's solution is a direct competitor to diesel as it has the capability to serve as a distributed sustainable baseload, in a system with solar and wind power, with the difference that Azelio's system has zero emissions and produces electricity at half the cost of diesel-generated electricity.

Solution on-sentence summary: A simple multi-functional device for water treatment and management in aquaculture systems
Identification: Raising fish in intensive closed production systems creates challenges for fish farmers. Water quality in fish farming systems rapidly deteriorates as fishes consume O2 and discharge CO2 as part of their respiration. Uneaten food and feces accumulate creating an unhealthy environment. This is further compounded by the spread of undesirable microorganisms such as algae, bacteria and viruses in the rearing system. To tackles these challenges, Searen developed  Vacuum AirLift™ or VAL™,  a simple multi-functional device that performs essential functions reliably and efficiently.  The VAL™ is an enabling technology that makes recirculating aquaculture systems profitable and environmentally sustainable. Recirculating aquaculture systems produce high-quality protein and nutritious food in a controlled environment. High quality product requires precision control of the water condition. The VAL™ is a smart technology that provides water circulation, carbon dioxide and other undesirable gas stripping, oxygenation and particulate removal in a single simple device. The VAL™ uses a vacuum pump to power a microbubble airlift pump. The airlift pump provides low head water circulation. The microbubbles provide gas exchange allowing undesirable gases to be extracted by the vacuum. The microbubbles also attract fine particulates creating foam that is removed by the vacuum. Oxygen injected in the outgoing flow replenishes the dissolved oxygen level.
Looking For: Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Aquaculture, Aquaculture effluents, Industrial wastewater, Filtration & purification, Water & Wastewater treatment
The environmental benefits: VAL™ reduces energy consumption up to one eighth the level required for competing equipment;VAL™ has been demonstrated to reduce pathogen loads by 99.9% in 12 hours, decreasing notably E. coli concentration from 16750 u/ml to 27 u/ml;In independent testing against other foam fractionators, the VAL™ was 45% more effective in reducing Total Suspended Solids (TSS) using 66% less energy than competing equipment;Due to its high energy efficiency VAL™ has a greater than 85% reduction in CO2 emissions ;As part of a photo bioreactor based waste processor, VAL™ removed 96% of total suspended solids (TSS) and dissolved organics - Total Organic Carbon (TOC) was reduced from 210 to 7.8 mg/l;VAL™ does not produce any hazardous waste by products - it uses a purely physical process requiring no chemical additives providing a 100% reduction in consumables;
The Financial benefits: The energy cost to operate VAL™ is as low as 15% of competing solutions;In a US fish hatchery, VAL™ provided  a rate increase of 2.6 to 5.3 times depending on species;In a US fish hatchery, VAL™ provides a fast ROI and significant payback by reducing acquisition costs by 38% and operating cost by approximately 50% ;
Complementary solutions: REM: A novel acid regeneration system for steel pickling (Waste & Pollution,Water,Industry & Consumer Goods);E.S.T.: An intelligent robot-based system for automatic extraction, treatment and packaging of sediments (Waste & Pollution);ECOSOFTT: A suite of solutions to allow underserved communities to manage their water resources (Buildings & Shelters,Waste & Pollution,Water);BIO DISPERSIS LC: Recycle vinasse, a polluting residue from the alcohol industry, into organic additives for concrete (Waste & Pollution,Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description: Searen's VAL™ provides an elegant multi-functional solution to water treatment that reduces CAPEX and OPEX by 20 to 80%
About:
Searen’s solution provides water circulation, particulate removal and aeration with a single simple device resulting in water treatment systems that are less complex and more efficient. This is accomplished by using a vacuum pump to boost the performance and functionality of an airlift pump.  This patent protected technology is called a Vacuum AirLift™ or VAL™.

The inherent simplicity of the design produces a number of unique benefits.  The open, free flow design makes it high volume, non-clogging, low energy input and requires no or limited consumables.  The simplicity and multi functionality leads to high reliability and scalability.  The VAL is a high impact, platform technology that supports sustainable water treatment processes.  

Our beachhead market is aquaculture (fish farming).  The need for healthy, low cost protein sources has made aquaculture a high growth market in the US.  Land based Sustainable Recirculating Aquaculture Systems (SRAS) are the fastest growing aquaculture segment.  The VAL™ is an ideal candidate for these systems due to its ability to circulate the water, remove fine particulates, strip carbon dioxide and inject oxygen with high energy efficiency.  The particulates removed by the VAL include viruses, bacteria, toxic algae and off flavor compounds thereby increasing fish biomass yield and quality.  After establishing our beachhead market, we will expand into other industrial and municipal markets such as agriculture wastewater treatment, food and beverage industry, Harmful Algae Bloom (HAB) remediation, Volatile Organic Compound (VOC) site remediation, municipal wastewater treatment, oil and gas clean-up, algaculture as well as other opportunities.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Concentrated solar systems for water security in the middle east and north africa
Identification: This Solution aims to provide sustainable, cost-efficient, robust and simple to operate technology which cleans/distils wastewater and otherwise unusable, or contaminated water sources, to provide clean, pure and safe water for where there is need. Concentrated Solar Multi Effect Distillation & Dewatering Systems (CSMED) uses solar thermal energy to process water from a range of sources including, for example, agriculture, industry, mining or municipal wastewater, brackish bore and hyper-saline water (including salt lakes), seawater and even mine tailings dams. The clean and safe water can then be reused for agriculture, mining and industry, thus taking pressure off precious freshwater sources. In addition,  it can also be used to supply or supplement safe drinking water where needed, made available for municipal and local business use or be released back into the natural landscape. Reclaiming, purifying and reusing water reduces risks of leaching and release of contaminated wastewater into soils, watercourses, groundwater and marine environments.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile:
Public Authorities, BusinessFarming & AgricultureCrops, BusinessMining & Extraction, BusinessManufacturingChemicals & Pharmaceuticals, BusinessManufacturingPetroleum & Coke Products
, BusinessWater Utility
Tags: Solar Thermal, Drinking-water, Filtration & purification, Water & Wastewater treatment, Developing countries
Sectors: Waste/Pollution, Water, Water supply, Wastewater management
The environmental benefits: Each CSMED unit can supply around 10,000,000 litres of distilled water p.a to where there is need from otherwise unusable sources, reducing stress on available fresh water sources.;Each CSMED unit can provide enough distilled water per day at source and off grid for in excess of 3,000 kg of green hydrogen production;The CSMED units utilisation of Solar Energy as the primary source is estimated to result in 180MT - 350 MT of CO2e savings p.a. per unit when compared with fossil fuel powered alternatives;The CSMED Dewatering system can provide Zero Liquid Discharge (ZLD) solutions that can eliminate environmental impact of concentrated brine discharge into the environment;
The Financial benefits: At Scale, CSMED Levelised Cost of Water is calculated to be in line with current costs of tap water in some regions;In some cases, for example, in remote communities, the CSMED cost of water can be up to 70% cheaper when compared with current supply practices;In some regions the CSMED units used to process contaminated water on site can save customers around 90% on their current clean water supply costs;
Complementary solutions: OSMOSUN: A sustainable, flexible energy source for affordable and renewable water for all (Water);REM: A novel acid regeneration system for steel pickling (Waste & Pollution,Water,Industry & Consumer Goods);WATA™ technology: Devices to enable local treatment and disinfection of water (Water);E.S.T.: An intelligent robot-based system for automatic extraction, treatment and packaging of sediments (Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: Solar Thermal Water Purification/Desalination & Dewatering  - Clean Water Production & Green Hydrogen Energy Distillate
About: Low Impact Technologies Pty. Ltd. is D&D Manufacturing LLC's (www.h20.solar) exclusive licensee for manufacture and supply of breakthrough globally patented Concentrated Solar Multi-Effect Water Purification/Distillation & Dewatering (CSMED) Technology in all global regions outside the USA.  This Energy & C02-e Saving Technology can help to supply pure water to where there is need (e.g. to rural, regional and remote communities where access to clean water is unavailable, or unreliable and to townships, farmers, industry, municipalities, environmental rehabilitation projects, mining/mine remediation projects, etc.).  CSMED technology can be utilised to provide clean/supplemental water supplies for larger towns and cities.   Demand for, and pressure on, precious fresh water resources can thus be reduced.  The CSMED technology can clean, purify/distil water from a range of otherwise unusable water sources, including agriculture and industry wastewater, contaminated water (including mine tailings dams). brackish bore and saline/hyper-saline water, seawater. recycled water, mining and sewage sludge.  Depending on water/wastewater/sludge and irradiance availability, each modular CSMED unit can produce around 30,000 litres of pure water per day.  Units can be integrated into larger processing systems, or into large multi-unit fields, where large and very large volumes of wastewater, contaminated water or sludge needs to be processed.  For example, a major project in the Tulare Basin in California plans installation of up to 2500 integrated units in the first of several fields to process agriculture wastewater (17,000ppm to 12ppm) to produce an estimated 28GL pure water per annum.  Some harvesting of salts is also proposed.  The Dewatering units can be added at the end of a line of Distillation units, or to the back end of existing reverse osmosis systems (at the point where reverse osmosis membranes are unable to process) to further extract pure water and take heavy brine concentrate or sludge back to zero liquid discharge (ZLD), or various percentages of moisture content, as required.  This enables reduction of volumes of waste/toxic waste brine concentrate or sludge residue which requires handling, transport and safe storage/environmentally sustainable disposal, along with reductions in costs associated with handling, transport and safe storage/disposal.   Distillation and Dewatering can also be utilised for biosolids management.  Producing clean water from recycled and otherwise unusable water sources reduces demand for volumes of fresh water, along with reducing transport footprints and costs.  Fresh water resources can be preserved.  Remineralisation at end of processing is determined by end use.  Green Hydrogen Energy Production could utilise this technology as electrolysis requires availability of distilled water.  This Solar Thermal Water Purification/Distillation technology could provide distilled water, for example, by purifying contaminated, brackish/saline, recycled industry wastewater or municipal effluent, on-site, thereby reducing demand for fresh water and hydrogen transport footprints, constraints and costs.  For example, one unit can produce enough distillate to produce in excess of 3,500 kgs of Green Hydrogen per day.  Manufacture of the parabolic troughs can utilise available e-waste; the troughs are 100% recyclable.  The CSMED units were designed to be containerised for easy transport and to be able to operate off grid and in remote locations. (Alternative energy sources can be used where overnight/24 hour processing is required.)  There are no membranes.  Operation and maintenance do not require high skills sets.  The units have been assessed to withstand sustained high winds (to force 3 hurricanes in the US).   Recycling and utilising otherwise unusable water/wastewater/effluents to provide clean, safe water to local communities can help to facilitate better health outcomes, local food production,  development of local business and industry/local economies, drought resilience and future water security, whilst also  reducing demand on precious and possibly limited freshwater resources and enabling improved custodianship of natural habitats and local natural water sources.  Communities can be supported to become more resilient in the face of external shocks and climate change.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A conversion technology using co2 to produce high quality fuel for the aviation industry
Identification: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) has estimated that the aviation sector's carbon footprint will be double of pre-COVID levels by 2037. This trend will significantly increase the aviation sector's GHG footprint, which has most recently accounted for 3% of annual global GHG emissions. In response, the global aviation sector has begun establishing targets to achieve carbon-neutral growth. Considering the changing regulatory environment for reducing GHG emissions, and that there are still very few sustainable fuel initiatives for aviation, airlines will face an urgent need for low-carbon fuels in the coming years. SAF+ captures carbon and combines it with hydrogen to produce ASTM-7566 compliant jet fuel. By doing so, its jet fuel leads to an 80% reduction in life cycle GHG emissions as compared to conventional jet fuels. This helps airlines by complying with mandates set by international and national organizations seeking to meet their GHG reduction targets.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Aviation, Carbon emissions waste, Gaseous waste capture, Kerosene, Waste-to-energy & fuels, Recycle waste, Industrial Waste, Hydrocarbon fuels, Vehicles

The Financial benefits: When operational, our fuel could take 1600 passengers per day from Montreal to Chicago;Production cost is 100% independent of fossil fuel prices;We sell sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) that is 33% cheaper than SAF alternatives.;

Solution on-sentence summary: Simple, powerful floating solar technology to transform unused water space into a clean energy generation
Identification:
The current solar power plant industry is facing several challenges such as:

•	solar panels occupy a lot of land space and in many European countries there is no space available.

•	solar roof-top installation is not enough for all customers needs. 

•	power plants are traditionally prompt to have a lower efficiency due to solar panels overheating on the ground (every 1°C of temperature rise corresponds to a drop in the efficiency by 0.5%). 

To tackle these challenges, The HelioRec’s solution aims to:

•	keep land space free and deploy the power plants on the water.

•	provide possibility to generate all necessarily volume of energy for all customers needs.

•	increase the efficiency of solar panels due to cooling effect from the water.

HelioRec's solution is an innovative floating solar technology, designed specially for near-shore locations where half of global population live.

Solution on-sentence summary: Laser labelling of fresh fruits and vegetables
Identification: The solution aims at reducing the amount of paper and plastic waste that is rejected in nature by eliminating stickers on fruits & vegetables as well as plastic packaging on these products. This is achieved by means of a laser light that makes a permanent mark directly on the fruit skin. The mark is permanent and neither affects the fruit nor its shelf life. There is no ink, no coloring agent, no paper, no glue, nothing in the process. Just light. Thanks to Natural Branding, it is possible to trace fruits & vegetables from producer to the table of the consumer. Because the mark is permanent, it is possible to identify produce without relying to plastic packaging.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Target client profile: BusinessManufacturingFood Products, BusinessServicesB2B Traders of Bulk Goods
Tags: Packaging, Traceability, Plastic alternatives
Sectors: Food/Agri, Packaging, Manufacturing and construction processes, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: By eliminating the stickers on fruits, we reduce the carbon footprint by 99,9% because it eliminates the use of paper, plastic, glue, ink, as well as the energy needed to produce all these elements as well as the stickers;Increase of flexibility of change in labels and logos. Format change is inferior to 30 seconds.;99,9% reduction of CO2 emissions (from stickers);Elimination of 100% of plastic packaging items on fruits & vegetable;
The Financial benefits: The cost of labelling 1000 pieces of fruit with the Natural Branding technology is 0,5€ (0,0005€/piece) ;There are no consumables;
Complementary solutions:
SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);KITRO: Simplifying food waste management for commercial kitchen

 (Food & Agriculture,Waste & Pollution);Winnow: Food waste reduction by connecting commercial kitchens to the cloud (Food & Agriculture,Waste & Pollution);Modul'O: A small scale anaerobic unit to treat organic wastes (Waste & Pollution,Energy,Food & Agriculture);
Organization short description: Our technology eliminates the use of stickers on fresh fruits & vegetables by replacing them by a mark made by a laser
About:
In a world where plastics and unnecessary packaging items are overwhelming us, Laserfood has developed a unique technology that allows to mark in a permanent way any kind of fresh fruit or vegetable. The mark is made by a laser light and allows to eliminate the use of paper stickers and also plastic packaging. The mark is safe for the fruit as it does not damage its skin. The shelf life is not altered. 



We call our technology "Natural Branding", since there is nothing on the fruit skin. Just a mark made by the laser. As a result, we reduce the carbon footprint by 99,9% just on stickers. 



We also contribute to reducing the amount of plastic used to pack fruits & vegetables since the permanent mark allows to identify the product. Laserfood builds and sells machines that can be installed in packing houses and work at industrial level, marking large volumes of produce. 



Our goal is to convert our technology in a new way of labelling fruits and vegetables worldwide and to extend its use to other fresh produce such as bakery and pastry products, eggs, meat, fish, etc... 



We propose complete, integrated solutions that aim at reducing the impact of our society on the environment by taking out of the chain elements such as stickers that, otherwise, would end in the landfill.



A Technology endorsed by theEuropean Union



Laser Food, with the continuous desire to promote the indelible marking technology developed by the company in 2006, together with the EU promoted the Laser Mark project to identify fruits by means of laser, demonstrating that the use of this new technology reduced the footprint of carbon from the use of labels by 99.9%



The Laser Mark project started in 2010 until June 2013. 

https://ec.europa.eu/environment/eco-innovation/projects/en/projects/laser-mark 



As a culmination of the European Project and at the request of Laser Food, the European health authorities approved the regulation of this technology. Being officially published on 06-04-2013 with 100% of the member states of the union through regulation 510/2013 .
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A hydrogen fuel cell unit enabling zero-emissions propulsion and power generation in vessels
Identification: The Hydrogen Power Modules (HPMs) developed by Genevos are a drop-in, zero emissions power solution for marine vessels. The modules are fully-integrated, marinised power packs capable of replacing existing fossil-fuelled engines and generators with a clean solution that is competitive on weight, motoring range, and cost of ownership. The HPMs offer a diverse range of applications to meet the reduction in emissions required across the maritime sector, from primary and hybrid propulsion in small to medium vessels, to powering auxiliary systems for large ships in order to reduce inshore and in-port pollution. The modular technology is highly scalable enabling it to meet the large anticipated growth in green hydrogen over the next decade, which will be vital to the decarbonization of the marine sector

The Financial benefits: Payback after 6 years ;20% of savings after 10 years in operation;4-times the life expectancy of lithium batteries packs;
Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SeaZen: A 100% autonomous solar boating service with license free self-service access (Mobility);ANTISMOG: An on-demand hydrogen fuel enhancement system for the reduction of air pollution from vehicles (Freight,Mobility);
Organization short description: Genevos innovates and certifies plug and play clean-hydrogen energy systems for zero emissions power in vessels.
About:
The Hydrogen Power Modules (HPMs) developed by Genevos are plug & play marine fuel cells that provide a zero emissions solution for vessels. 



This modular technology is highly scalable providing customised power solutions from 15 kW to multi-MW scale. The innovation can be applied across the maritime sector to decarbonise vessels through primary, hybrid or auxiliary integration with a solution that offers high redundancy. These marinised power packs have been engineered to replace existing fossil-fuelled engines and generators with a clean solution that is competitive on weight, motoring range, and cost of ownership. 



This versatile innovation has been developed to meet the large anticipated growth in green hydrogen over the next decade, which will be a vital ingredient in the decarbonisation of the marine sector. The technology is suitable for a diverse range of applications to meet the reduction in emissions required across the maritime sector for a range of vessels from small to large including yachts, ferries, service vessels, inland transport and shipping.



The HPM range is in the Type Approval certification process for marine offshore commercial standards, ensuring a robust and safe solution for all vessels. These certified modules are fully-integrated with Balance of Plant simplifying the installation process for clients.



The innovation has been awarded with the Monaco Hydrogen Alliance Award, the Electric & Hybrid Propulsion Award, the Sud-Ouest Nautical Innovation Award, and the Solar Impulse Label, one of the first labels for positive impact solutions bringing together protection of the environment and financial viability. This award-winning technology revolutionises maritime power by offering a low weight and low volume zero emissions solution with high scalability and redundancy.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy

Solution on-sentence summary: An automated, battery-free, solar-based water desalination system
Identification: A permanent solution against the global water shortage. The solution does not need any infrastructure and can meet all restrictions in remote areas. It can produce high-quality drinking water from any type of water including seawater, brackish water, or groundwater. The system does not need any energy supply and our solar-based desalination can provide all its required energy. Seawater and sun energy as the most abundant resources in the world. By removing batteries, not only does the system stands alone for up to 15 years with the lowest maintenance, but also the invented control system can run the system in dynamic mode and control the quality of the water and whole operation conditions. This means that the system is fully automated and does not need an operator. To guarantee the quality of water and predict upcoming operation problems, a remote control system is also included.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, Local NGO, BusinessServicesHotels & Resorts, BusinessFarming & AgricultureCrops, BusinessServicesBuildings Operators
Tags: Off-grid, Developing countries, Saline water, Desalination (= seawater purification), Filtration & purification, Solar photovoltaic, Water & Wastewater treatment
The environmental benefits: Owing to the battery-less technology, battery charging, discharging and the intermediate converters are removed completely leading to less energy conversion stages and 60% less energy losses. ;A fully automated system. An irradiation sensor continuously measures the available solar energy and starts/stops the system automatically. This leads to 0.0% energy loss and less operation costs. ;A unique energy management system, which controls the whole energy stream from one controller. This method significantly increases water production.;Running the RO with solar energy instead of fossil fuels reduces 90% of the global warming potential (GWP). Removing batteries reduce about 35% of CO2 compared with conventional ones.;In battery fabrication processes, Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) are released, which have a negative effect on ozone depletion (ODP).  Removing the batteries can reduce the ODP by about 10%. Battery production also contributes to 25% of the Human Toxicity Pot;
The Financial benefits: The average payback time is less than 3 years:   Mozambique: 5 years – Ghana: 2.6 years – Haiti: 1.31 years and India: 1.81 years;By removing batteries, both CPAEX and OPEX are reduced. The investment cost of our system is 30% less than conventional systems using batteries. ;Containerized solution reduces installation costs and time. This version is ready to operate and easy to deploy. ;
Complementary solutions: OSMOSUN: A sustainable, flexible energy source for affordable and renewable water for all (Water);WATA™ technology: Devices to enable local treatment and disinfection of water (Water);Purifaaya: Locally-produced water filters for the production of safe drinking water in uganda (Water);Elemental Water Makers: Desalination system powered by renewable energy (Water);
Organization short description: Battery-free solar-based desalination system.Grino provides  Green-reliable-innovative water which meets all restriction
About: Grino invented a new battery-free solar-based desalination. Our smart control system automatically follows the solar curve, and manages the operation of the Borehole pump, Feeds Pump, and High pressure. The speed of pumps varies regarding the fluctuation of solar power. This dynamic operation minimizes energy losses and increases efficiency. Applying a battery is the traditional solution to compensate for these fluctuations. The operation of the system in constant condition initiates the system only work for limited hours per day when PV power is equal to the nominal required power. Instead of harmful fossil fuels, or a combination of PV panels and destructive batteries, Grino applies an innovative solution to combine only two abundant resources and provide high-quality water with minimum maintenance. Our island solution works for 15 years with the lowest maintenance cost. Grino is a proactive step forward in tackling water scarcity.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Re-using construction soil for land-use developments
Identification:
Land development and new constructions result in significant disruption to landscapes, and solutions are needed to reduce the impact of these developments. This Solution tackles this challenge by re-using inert (non polluted) construction soil to create self-financed land-use developments. These land-use developments are designed to make an environmental and societal contribution with partnerships in the fields of renewable energy, urban agriculture and conservation of wildlife. This process allows a sound and positive management of inert construction soil, which accounts into close to 60% of total waste in France. Given the fact that land-use developments created through this Solution are located close to city centres, it avoids trucks transporting soil to go to their traditional dumping places located far from the city.  Through this Solution, cities find a way to finance land-use developments and thus increase green areas. 

This is a turnkey solution for local communities, allowing them to focus on their needs in terms of land-use developments without concerns about how to finance or to manage the day-to-day complexity of such projects.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Credibility
Tags: Soil and land, Urban green spaces, Reuse waste, Construction & demolition waste, Mineral waste, Recycle waste, Construction materials
Sectors: Infrastructures, Materials and chemicals, Ecosystems management
The environmental benefits: 15 million tons of soil are processed through this Solution per year;15 operating sites are currently being developed with the Solution;10,000 trees are planted per year through our Solution;100% recycled soil used;At least 50% reduction of CO2 emission compared to trucking to other kinds of sites (e.g. quarries);
The Financial benefits: Transportation costs are on average 50% less expensive compared to other kinds of sites located further;Free land-use developments for cities;
Complementary solutions: IOT flood alert: A smart device-based solution for information, anticipation and alert of flood risks (Water,Infrastructures);Greenrail: An innovative & eco-sustainable railway sleeper (Infrastructures,Waste & Pollution);Breeze Technologies Environmental Intelligence: Smart sensors for air quality monitoring and improvement (Buildings & Shelters,Infrastructures,Waste & Pollution);Air Pollution Abatement (APA): A smart multiservice platform for air pollution abatement (Buildings & Shelters,Infrastructures,Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: ECT re-uses construction soil for land-use developments (parks, golf courses, re-establisment of agricultural land...)
About:
Everything started in the 1970’s when an extension project was launched for a park in the North of the Paris region (The George Valbon in La Courneuve).

The idea developped by the three lanscapers Allain Provost ; John Whalley and Gilbert Samel, was to create a totally artificial world made of small valleys, hills, lakes and panoramic viewpoints. At this time, big construction works were happening in Paris, amongst which a huge whole was being dug underneath the former covered market (le Forum des Halles).

Claude Picard organised the matching between the need of soil for the creation of the park extension and excavated soil coming from construction works in Paris.

As construction companies were paying for the evacuation of their excavated soil this also became a source of financing for the George Valbon park. ECT’s business model was born!

Circular economy strategy leads ECT’s growth. The company re-uses excavated soil from construction sites to promote with local authorities, mainly in the Paris region, concerted and sustainable development projects. These developments are designed to make an environmental and societal contribution with partnerships in the fields of renewable energy, urban agriculture, and preservation of wildlife.
SDG’s of application: SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A low-energy, healthy and comfortable prefabricated home built from local sources
Identification: Today, the construction sector is responsible for ≈39% of total annual greenhouse gas emissions. While the energy consumption of buildings is expected to decrease steadily, the energy embodied in building materials still accounts for 11%. The conventional buildings rely upon concrete or terracotta for the structure, and petrochemical foam or mineral fibres for insulation which are carbon-intensive. In opposition, Paille-Tech houses offer a comfortable, healthy and durable home, highly energy-efficient and environmentally friendly. Compared to the standards materials, the solution is low in embodied-energy and not exhausting non-renewable resources. All materials are hardly processed (e.g. no cooking) and locally procured (less transport). One m² of Paille-Tech wall requires for its production 68 kWh of non-renewable primary energy, compared to 251 kWh for a concrete and XPS wall with the same insulating value. In-shop prefabrication ensures fewer nuisances for the neighbourhood and a shorter installation time, resulting in economies (scaffoldings, no double house-renting). During its manufacture, no less than 44 kg of CO₂ equivalent is stored, whereas a conventional wall releases 50 kg into the atmosphere.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility, Network
Tags: Biobased, Wood, Construction, Carbon footprint, Construction materials
Sectors: Buildings, Project planning, Manufacturing and construction processes
The environmental benefits: Walls are 84% more insulating than the Belgian norms, and roofs 71%.;Quickly habitable house – 3 weeks of prefabrication, 1 week of installation, 4 months of equipment and finishes;A single compact stove can heat an entire house. No air-conditioning needed.;The production of a Paille-Tech house requires 73% less non-renewable primary energy than equivalent mainstream alternative. ;Carbon sink – building a Paille-Tech's standard house stores 18.84 tons of CO₂ over its entire lifespan. ;No toxic products are required to guarantee protection against fire or rodents;
The Financial benefits: Up to 2105 € / year of energy savings, compared to a house conforming to the 2017 thermal regulation in the Walloon Region;Thanks to its rapidity of building, one year's rent can be saved compared to a conventional construction; Used materials have proven their durability over more than a century.;
Complementary solutions: IPSIIS : Insulation based on mineral foam for better energy conservation (Buildings & Shelters,Waste & Pollution);BHEP: A new generation of buildings designed to create financial, human and societal value (Buildings & Shelters);Sopratec III: Energy efficient building airtightness system (Buildings & Shelters);SOPRASOLAR FIX EVO: A photovoltaic waterproofing process for converting roof surfaces into renewable electrical production (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);
Organization short description: Paille-Tech produces sustainable buildings based on wood, clay and straw, through a prefab’s system in factory.
About:
Our goal is to build green, healthy, comfortable and positive buildings!



◆ For this, we use natural, sustainable and local materials (wood, strawbales, raw earth) and support the development of a local circular economy. A large part of a building's carbon footprint comes from the building materials themselves (manufacturing, destruction, polluting waste). The use of straw and wood not only avoids these drawbacks, but also allows the storage of CO₂. 



◆ We prefabricate our elements in our workshop, for quality control, quick installation and a reduction in transport and nuisance on site. We have developed an innovative production line that is totally specific to the implementation of straw bales in a wooden frame. In parallel with this research, a great deal of work has been carried out on the development of clay-based coating techniques laid in the workshop. 



◆ We produce very efficient buildings that require minimal energy for use and production and therefore have a low environmental impact (low energy, passive or even positive energy). Over the past 10 years, we have built more than 50 buildings: houses, schools, workplaces, etc.



◆ The company is set up as a cooperative, where the workers are all independent and actively participate in decision-making. We also have about fifty external cooperators who are as many resources and motivation to push us to always move forward.

The capital is open to anyone who actively joins the company, be it the workers or certain subcontractors that we are used to work with. This means that we can work together in a collective reflection and a spirit of continuous improvement of our actions.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: MaGie creations: turning food waste into food ingredients
Identification: MaGie Creations aims to create a world where food waste is not seen as the end, but as a new beginning. MaGie Creations aims to achieve this by creating sustainable and healthy food products from food waste. The first food waste stream focused on is beer grain (officially known as Brewer's Spent Grains, BSG). Every year, 560 kton of beer grain is produced in the Netherlands alone. The majority of these grains are currently fed to milk cattle. But beer grain is still incredibly tasty and contains valuable nutrients, such as protein, fibre and amino acids. This is why MaGie Creations collects beer grain from breweries and converts it into food ingredients, offering significantly more sustainable and healthy ingredients compared to traditional ones.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Ingredient, Protein alternative, Waste-to-materials, Agricultural Waste, Recycle waste
The environmental benefits: 100g of PowerFlour holds 899kJ of energy, 64.1g of fibre and 23.5g of protein;Every kg of PowerFlour consumed reduces CO2-eq emissions by 0.19kg;Every kg of PowerFlour structurally frees up 2m squared of farm land;
The Financial benefits: PowerFlour enables food producers to produce protein and fibre rich products at mainstream prices;Consuming PowerFlour, and thus more fibres and protein, will allow for public health savings;
Complementary solutions: Cycle Feed: Insect-based feed for West African tilapia farmers (Food & Agriculture);Agolin® Ruminant: A plant-based feed additive to reduce enteric methane emissions from ruminants (Food & Agriculture);Afynerie: An industrial scale bio-based chemical technology (Industry & Consumer Goods,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Protifly: An industrial unit to recycle organic waste for a more natural and sustainable food chain (Food & Agriculture);
Organization short description: MaGie Creations realises scaleable upcycling of Brewer’s Spent Grain, resulting in a unique flour: Power Flour.
About:
At MaGie Creations we want to live in a world where food waste is not seen as the end, but as a new beginning. We take our share in this change by making sustainable and healthy food products from food waste. The first food waste stream we focus on is beer grain (officialy known as Brewer’s Spent Grains, BSG). 



Every year, 560kton of beer grain is produced in the Netherlands alone. The majority of these grains are currently fed to milk cattle. But… beer grain is still incredibly tasty and contains valuable nutrients, such as protein, fibre and amino acids! So why not look for a solution where we can enjoy the grains not once, but twice? 



Here is where MaGie Creations comes into play: we collect beer grain from breweries and convert it into our PowerFlour; a significantly more sustainable and healthy flour compared to traditional flour. With our PowerFlour, we  provide an ingredient to the food industry that is locally sourced, rescued from being wasted, significantly contributes to the reduction of CO2 emissions and offers a high nutritional value. Which makes PowerFlour the perfect solution for food producers that want to create innovative food solutions that are both more sustainable and healthier.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A self-powered solar led lighting solution for outdoor use with remote control
Identification: Nowadays the electricity network is easily accessible in almost all our cities where a large part of them have large infrastructures; but when we refer to roads with difficult geographical conditions or interurban roads we find smaller electricity network infrastructures or even none at all. This type of roads are the ones that get more traffic accidents, and Solar Intelligent Lighting (S.I.L.) has the potential to increase road safety. S.I.L. is a self-managed solar LED lighting solution; its solar panel feeds a Lithium battery that allows for short charging cycles, increasing its durability and efficiency. This solar LED lighting solution not only has advantages in its installation but also in the consumption and the amount of CO2 generated. The potential impact is the reduction of CO2 pollution and above all the security, providing lighting to areas where it is not available due to lack of resources or geographical conditions. With a single, not very high investment they can obtain at least 10 years of lighting without energy or CO2 costs to generate it. By providing security in these areas, mobility is increased and with it progress.

The company’s customer-centric transformation strategy aims at profitable growth over the long term. It relies on operational excellence, selective investments, open innovation and a network organization implemented by the Group worldwide. Through the commitment and inventiveness of its people, Air Liquide leverages energy and environment transition, changes in healthcare and digitization, and delivers greater value to all its stakeholders. Air Liquide’s revenue amounted to 21 billion euros in 2018 and its solutions that protect life and the environment represented more than 40% of sales. Air Liquide is listed on the Euronext Paris stock exchange (compartment A) and belongs to the CAC 40, EURO STOXX 50 and FTSE4Good indexes.

Solution on-sentence summary: A natural and biodegradable technology for the improvement of water and soil management
Identification: Land and water are sources of life. Polyter Gr is a concrete and effective response to the need for better water and soil management worldwide. It accelerates plant growth with a high reduction of water and fertiliser inputs for all types of crops. Polyter Gr can be used with independently from cultivation and irrigation methods, climate or soil type, and plant varieties. It improves the quality and quantity of productions by ensuring storage and transport performance. It protects the environment by quickly restoring ecological balance while combating desertification and soil degradation. It is an innovative product with universal and high-performance applications whatever the nature of soils or climatic conditions. By modifying all the agronomic parameters known to date, this advanced technology activates growth by delaying hydric stress and nutritional deficiencies, while sublimating the latent genetic potential of the plants. Both fertilising and hydro-retentive, it is natural and fully biodegradable. Highly versatile, Polyter Gr can be used for greenhouse, nursery, open field, agro-industrial and market garden crops to forest restocking, substrates, plants in pots, above-ground crops, revegetation of sloping areas. Polyter Gr is one of the answers to food self-sufficiency and economic sovereignty.

Target client profile: Public Authorities, Local NGO, BusinessFarming & AgricultureCrops
Tags: Biodegradable, Soil and land, Fertilizing

On the other hand, it stabilizes and fixes the soil, while restructuring the humus and reducing losses through evaporation and percolation.; By reducing the negative effects of leaching on soil structure, it protects the environment and groundwater;

Organization short description: PODG Développement is a company dedicated to developing innovations respectful of our natural resources for agriculture.
About:
After reaching an optimum result, P.O.D.G Development was created in early 1992 with its active ingredient was named Polyter… Very quickly, the use of Polyter confirmed its efficiency to save more than 50% irrigation water and save nearly 30% of fertilizer input and treatment products while saving more than 50% electricity on the operation of crop irrigation pumps while increasing the yield by 50%.

Many countries have used the Polyter successfully, such as Austria, Morocco, UAE, France, Switzerland, Spain, Vietnam, Senegal, Ivory Coast, Cameroon, Madagascar, Mexico, Brazil and many others.....

Plantoïd is an invention that has the power to create centuries-old trees in a few months and wins in 1991 at the Salon Hortimat in Orléans a special prize created for this invention that subjugated the profession and the horticultural World award named “Coup de chapeau du Jury” handed To Philippe OUAKI DI GIORNO from the hands of the Minister Mrs. Elisabeth GUIGOU. The main basis of this invention is the creation of a specific active material to develop for this particular application an aberrant root mass which is twenty times greater than the root mass of traditional plants.

Very quickly, it was obvious that the root mass multiplier active ingredient developed by Philippe OUAKI DI GIORNO was more important than the application for the invention of Plantoids. This is why Philippe OUAKI DI GIORNO has worked for almost a year of research to reduce the increase in root mass, no longer to twenty times but to five times greater than a traditional root mass, this is very important to be able to make this active ingredient usable in agriculture.

Since that time, he has continuously improved his invention and implemented it on all types of plants, soils and climates in order to optimize its efficiency and effectiveness.

Today the technology is mature and meets all the requirements of compliance with legislation and especially on the environment. Polyter Gr is the result of years of research and development. A technology that responds to the urgent need for a better management of our natural resources (Soil and Water) and savings on inputs. While allowing a development of an agriculture that must be sustainable and produce in quality and quantity of a world population in continuous growth.

Solution on-sentence summary: A filter-free, low-tech solution for the removal of microplastics in water treatment
Identification: Waters worldwide are contaminated with a highly diverse mixture of pollutants, among them micropollutants and microplastic. These are an enormous threat to the well-being of our planet and humankind and a big challenge for science, politics, and the water industry. Wasser 3.0 PE-X® is a Green Chemistry based, modularly adaptable process for removing microplastics and/or micropollutants from waters. Wasser 3.0 PE-X® material-technology combination does not require a filter and can be used anywhere, in any waters (wastewater, process water, seawater, freshwater). The implementation takes place in a space-saving container solution or integrated into existing processes. The process technology is therefore easily adaptable and exportable.

Solution on-sentence summary: Capturing waste in rivers before it reaches the ocean
Identification: Ocean plastic is a huge threat to marine life and is increasingly high on the political agenda. 80% of waste discharged in oceans originates from land, meaning pollution must be stopped before reaching the mouth of rivers. The H2OPE River Whale® provide an innovative waste collection solution to capture plastic in rivers. This Solution is specifically designed to capture floating and immersed waste carried along in rivers. The River Whale® is a static cleaning device, acting as a  fully autonomous natural dam for plastic, using no other energy than the strength of the current. Easily installed and able to operate 24 hours a day, a network of River Whales® is able to capture 80 to 90% of plastic waste, which can then be sent to waste management and recycling sectors. The Solution helps to protect rivers, oceans and allow waste to be captured at an early stage, thus preserving its recycling potential.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, new clients, visibility, funding, partners, credibility
Tags: Rivers, Waste collection, Low-grade plastic waste, Floating debris, Municipal Solid Waste
The environmental benefits: A network of River Whales can catch up to 90% of the aquatic waste; One River Whale can stop the equivalent of 500,000 plastic straws in 2 months;Removing plastic protects biodiversity and can be recycled after extraction;
The Financial benefits: A River Whale® costs as little as 1 car parking space per day;River Whale® captures plastic which can be recycled. Recycled plastic is 300€/t to 800€/t less expensive that virgin plastic.;
Complementary solutions: Hawa Dawa GmbH: Intelligent iot sensor-based environmental monitoring for air-quality improvement (Waste & Pollution);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);E.S.T.: An intelligent robot-based system for automatic extraction, treatment and packaging of sediments (Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: H2OPE is proposing innovative solutions and services to capture waste in the rivers and fight against ocean pollution.
About:
Every year, 8 million tons of plastics end up in our oceans, 80% directly coming from our rivers. The solution to limit the pollution of rivers and to slow down the extension of “plastic oceans” must therefore be located upstream of the river mouths.

H2OPE has invented and patented a waste collector especially designed to operate on rivers : the River Whale.

This innovative device can operate 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

It acts as a part of the global river cleaning services we offer.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production
