Organization short description: Atmove offers the value chain of biomethane mobility aiming to reduce fuel costs by 50% and GHG emissions by 100%
About: Farmers, cooperatives and food industry increasingly produce biogas and fertilizer from the waste of the food production. Besides producing electric energy, heat and organic fertilizer, a part of the biogas can be refined to 98% biomethane as a fuel with the promise: 50% less fuel costs than diesel, 100% less GHG emissions. “CH4pa”, a multifunctional transport and working vehicle and “Mobi”, the Mobile Biogas Upgrading, are 2 global market innovations, specially developed to introduce BioCNG for gas driven vehicles in inland regions where no Natural Gas is available. Ch4pa is especially interesting for the 430 million farmers worldwide, that produce 75% of the global food supply and spend half of their income on diesel and fossil fertilizer. Mobi as a core component offers on-site "biogas upgrading - AS A SERVICE”, as only few biogas plants are equipped with upgrading facilities (1-4% depending on the region). By using Mobi also small and medium scale biogas plants can benefit from producing BioCNG for their own fuel usage and by sharing the costs for upgrading technology. In those decentralized biomethane regions diesel vehicles will be substituted by CNG vehicles like CH4pa and other new gas vehicles from Scania, New Holland and others. Atmove technology helps those remote areas to develop a market for CNG vehicles at all, as there are no gas grids available. We showcased the BioCNG system with CH4pa successfully in cooperation with Itaipu/Brazil, the biggest hydropower plant in the world. Global OEMs like Scania and New Holland are starting to adopt the business model of BioCNG mobility as they also see the potential to market their CNG vehicles in remote areas. Target regions for Atmove should fulfil following criteria: strong agricultural sector (especially livestock farming), popularity of CNG, price sensitive customers, poor infrastructure (gas pipelines, electricity supply), logistical challenges (transport of goods mainly by trucks), and a strong dependency on oil imports. These countries are situated in regions with a lot of biomass potential like In Latam, Africa, India and SE Asia, even in countries of Eastern Europe. Atmove is supporting the SDGs 7, 8 and 9.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A vertical farm to provide diversified food in isolated sites without electricity or a water network
Identification: The solution aims at providing sustainable, profitable and fresh organic healthy food, using only renewable energy and rainwater. This solution relies on mobile and modular indoor farming techniques in a recycled maritime container. All fruits and vegetables are grown on independent planters, on multiple floors, with soil and organic compost mixed. The light comes from automatic Led systems, powered with solar panels on integrated on the roof. The drip irrigation system is supplied with rainwater collected from the roof and stored in a tank inside the Food container. The air is renewed thanks to a double-flow ventilation connected to a Canadian well to recover heat from the ground. Electronic sensors analyse different parameters in real-time including the temperature, CO2, humidity level, light, plant growth speed and many more.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Indoor farming, Hydroponics

The Financial benefits: Few months payback time;Zero cost for energy and water;No transportation needed : it is the production system that moves to the consumer area;

Integral Co. Water Solutions is an innovating company which develops, manufactures, and sells disruptive water treatment solutions for industrial and tertiary clients. Our unique approach combines state-of-the-art technology with environmental-friendly solutions.



Our flagship product, called blubalance, is a revolution on the water treatment market. It is a best-in-class, chemical-free solution which treats water in cooling tower networks. Solution on-sentence summary: Scalable silicon anodes for high energy lithium ion batteries
Identification: Batteries are in almost everything we use, almost every day of our lives. Whether it is your phone, laptop, or eventually all the vehicles that we drive, batteries will affect most areas in our life. To combat climate change, it is critical that we move to a majority of fully electric vehicles and renewable energy within the next decade. The key to both is the ability to store energy quickly, safely, and to store enough for hundreds of miles of range, or hours without wind or sunlight. The GDI solution aims at providing large scale manufacturing of 15 minute fast-charging energy storage technologies with 30% higher energy to increase utilization of renewable energy, mass transportation, and electric mobility. Also, the GHG footprint of a Lithium-Ion NMC battery using GDI silicon-based anode is estimated to be 92.5 kgCO2e per kWh, 21% lower on average than traditional Li-Ion NMC batteries. GDI’s mission is to develop cleantech that can scale to large volumes at attractive economics.

Solution on-sentence summary: An efficient multimodal logistic and delivery system in urban areas
Identification: LUMI addresses the need for an efficient multimodal logistics and delivery system in urban areas. Urban transport operators, platforms (MyTroopers, Trusk, Stuart,...) and specific services (bicycles, walking) optimize each for themselves, without being able or willing to make any synergies on behalf of the customer. For example, the right solution for a tour (price, carbon impact, delays) can be the combination of a vehicle and a group of delivery people on foot. No carrier is in a position to offer this to the customer on an objective basis. As a transport organizer, LUMI plays the part of an international logistician which select the right combination between sea, air or road freight. This approach is imperative to gain efficiency, absorb the extra cost of green transport solutions and create a smart ecosystem. With its innovative transport ecosystem, LUMI makes it possible for users to choose and benefit from these synergies.

Solution on-sentence summary: Solar-powered water pump for smallholder farmers and communities
Identification:
The sunlight pump is a small-scale, solar-powered water pump. Being a modular and versatile system, it can be used for a wide range of applications: productive use (e.g. irrigation, livestock, fish farming), drinking water supply and hygiene. It is an affordable, reliable and environmentally sustainable technology that brings water to where it is needed and contributes to the economic well-being and health of farmers and communities. 



The sunlight pump is a highly efficient water-lifting technology that does not require electricity or diesel to function. There are no operation costs, meaning that there is a higher return on investment over the lifespan of the sunlight pump. It is the right choice for anyone who wants to turn a free source of energy into time and money savings. The sunlight pump turns sunrays into savings.

ennos is a Swiss company founded in 2016 as a spin-off of Berne University of Applied Sciences. We are an interdisciplinary team of experienced engineers and marketing experts. We are dedicated to developing pumping technologies that are affordable and appropriate for farmers and communities in Africa, South Asia and Central America.





Our vision is a world where everyone has access to water to drink, to nourish crops and to wash their hands. ennos aims to make its award-winning sunlight pump widely accessible in regions of the world where water is lacking, but sunshine, a free source of power, is available in abundance.

About:
DimEye Corp. 



DimEye (Dimensional-Eye) is a high-tech company based in California, founded in 2009 and specialized in 3D High Accuracy Imaging into inaccessible environments (Subsea, Nuclear, Space).  The main customers are the Energy companies, among which BP, Shell, Exxon, Chevron, ENI, Westinghouse, Framatome, Exelon as well as engineering companies.

DimEye’s operations consist of capturing videos of inaccessible assets (in the USA, West Africa, South America, North Sea, and Indonesia), process images at the office, and send 3D As-Built CAD Models as well as 3D Maps of anomalies (such as cracks, dents or corrosion) to Clients.



DimEye has developed and patented a unique technology called “Video Laser Scan™” or “VLS™,” a combination of Advanced Photogrammetry and Laser Techniques.



 The main applications are:

•	3D As-Built CAD Modeling for Engineering & Modifications/Repair Projects.

•	3D Mapping of Anomalies for Integrity Management purposes.



DimEye technology uses “off the shelf” HD Cameras and Lasers (plug & play on any ROV, AUV, UAV, operated by pilots, technicians, and divers).

Solution on-sentence summary: Ai-powered tool for smart water management and pipelines risk identification
Identification: In many cities around the world, drinking water and wastewater infrastructure was built between the 1940s and 1970s, meaning that a significant percentage of these assets is close to or has already reached the end of its useful life. Water infrastructures are crumbling and in need of replacement and repair, especially today with climate change causing significant temperature and drought variations, putting additional strain on these infrastructures. CANN forecast developed InteliPipes, a tool which enables the identification of vulnerable pipes within a city's water distribution system in order to make proactive decisions concerning the rehabilitation of water main pipes. These tools were developed using artificial intelligence models that rely on available data to provide useful insights to decision makers to help municipalities decide which water main pipes should be replaced in order to limit water loss.

It is becoming urgent to replace the most at-risk drinking water pipes before they break. 



New technologies such as artificial intelligence can greatly help municipalities in their strategic decision-making. However, managers who want to innovate face

several major obstacles: lack of expertise in artificial intelligence, lack of time and lack of budget. CANN Forecast Software Inc. (CANN) applies artificial intelligence to the water management industry. We build reliable decision tools that enable municipalities to protect public health,  reduce their operating costs,

and to have a better understanding of their impact on the environment, all by leveraging their existing data.



CANN forecast developed InteliPipes, a tool which enables the identification of vulnerable pipes within a city’s water distribution system in order to make proactive decisions concerning the rehabilitation of water main pipes. Solution on-sentence summary: Making artificial reefs from natural seawater
Identification: CCell builds artificial reefs from recycled rebar, mimicking the shapes and properties of naturally occurring reefs. The reefs are powered with renewable electricity, producing a chemical reaction within the seawater that causes limestone rock to form around the reef structure. This rock provides a foundation for coral restoration and marine wildlife while strengthening the defensive properties of the reefs. CCell’s advanced modelling capabilities, combined with electronics and cutting-edge wave-energy capture technology, allows this solution to be customised for a given area. Local expertise, coral out-planting and education initiatives are able to support and boost this solution.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: Fluorine gas mixtures as an environmentally friendly cleaning gas alternative for semiconductors
Identification: Semiconductor chip manufacturers use in their processes a variety of gases to pattern silicon wafers. After a number of wafers processed, the process chambers must be cleaned. To meet the need of the semiconductor industry, Solvay developed and patented globally two different fluorine gas mixtures as environmentally friendly gases for CVD cleaning processes. Solvaclean is a cleaning gas to replace three major cleaning gases C2F6, CF4 and NF3, with environmental friendly fluorinated gas mixtures. This project included validation and optimization of the new cleaning processes on production equipment and release to FAB production (semiconductor fabrication plant where devices such as integrated circuits are manufactured). Solvaclean is cleaning with similar speed and efficiency than the alternatives, with less gas used per utilisation.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility
Tags: Cleaning, Chemicals alternatives
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Waste/Pollution, Manufacturing and construction processes

The Financial benefits: Payback time to replace C2F6 is less than 2 years;Solvaclean does not need plasma incinerators to destroy remaining C2F6,NF3 or SF6 inducing a cost reduction;

Solution on-sentence summary: A drone for precice weed detection allowing farmers to spray exactly where the weeds are
Identification:
Farmers are wasting herbicide by spraying areas of the paddock that don't need it. It is not only expensive for farmers, but also pollutes the soils, waterways and in some cases can affect human health. The solution is a fallow weed detection platform that allows farmers to target weeds using their existing machinery. This reduces chemical use by up to 97.5% and turns their existing machinery into a weed targeting platform.  

The solution uses aerial imagery (drone or plane), to identify and locate weeds. From there a tractor ready file is generated and given to the farmers. This file helps control the nozzles, turning them on if there are weeds and off if there are no weeds. This platform has helped a farmer save over $14,000 in chemical costs on a 700ha paddock.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Drones, Pest control
The environmental benefits: InFarm taps into this existing technology to target herbicide application.;Data is delivered to farmers overnight and is compatible with their existing spraying machines.;6TB of data are obtained per day in InFarm's data acquisition phase.;Up to 97.5% reduction in Herbicide use in broad acre farms.;InFarm's fallow weed solution directly decreases the amount of chemical used on-farm. ;
The Financial benefits: No CAPEX required for farmers, immediate pay back for below 30% weed coverage in the paddock. ;Up to 97.5% chemical saving can be up to a $250,000 per year saving for farmers. ;
Complementary solutions: NEXUS: An alternative for sustainable development of smallholder farmers and fisheries communities (Food & Agriculture);AgRho® S-Boost: An innovative solution for the treatment of seeds (Food & Agriculture);AQUA4D: Water-Smart Irrigation: Precision irrigation for water efficiency and land restoration (Food & Agriculture,Water);Living Farming Tree: A sustainable mini-indoor farm for urban farming (Food & Agriculture);

Organization short description: Rent maternity/breastfeeding and baby clothes! A trendy and sustainable alternative!
About:
Based on our experience as mothers and with the mothers around us, we have found that maternity and baby clothes are used for very short periods of time and are therefore worn very little, resulting in significant over-consumption and waste.



It is therefore quite natural that the idea came to us to reuse these clothes by renting them, to offer them a second or third life and thus move from a linear consumption to a circular consumption.



Our maternity and baby clothing boxes are an eco-responsible, economical and practical solution!
SDG’s of application: SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A shower tray with a heat recovery device that reduces shower water heating bills
Identification:
The solution recovers heat from the used shower water, preventing it from being lost down the drain. That energy is reused to warm the incoming cold-water mains. It halves the amount of energy used by your shower without diminishing the experience. 



It is physically a regular shower tray that reduces energy consumption, carbon emissions, and saves money compared to traditional showers. The product is maintenance-free, with no moving or electrical connections.

Complementary solutions:
Solar space heating: Solar-powered air heaters and rock bed thermal storage to heat homes 

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);animeo Connect : Facade shading management solution for increased energy savings in buildings (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: The energy-saving shower tray. It doesn't make sense in the 21st century to throw energy down the drain.
About:
WHAT IS IT?

A Shower tray with a heat recovery device that reduces shower water heating bills by up to 40%, improves energy efficiency, and cuts carbon footprints. It is a passive energy-saving element with a static heat recovery unit, without moving elements, it does not need maintenance and it has the same useful life as the building. Quite simply, it is a system or technology that uses the heat from the waste hot water in the shower to increase the temperature of the incoming cold water.



HOW DOES IT WORK?

When we take a shower we are throwing away the energy we have used to heat the water down the drain. During the process, the hot water used flows directly down the sewerage system and much energy is wasted. It doesn't make sense to waste all that energy and reheat cold water to use it again for just a few seconds. This is the challenge that Cerian steam tried to overcome with their technology. It is possible to recover and reuse that energy that we have already paid for to heat the water again without having to consume more energy and money. Cerian shower EcoTray is a wastewater heat recovery (WWHR) system that can effectively recapture and reuse instantly a high percentage of the energy lost into the drain, reducing energy consumption in a cost-effective manner. It is a simple system, with no moving parts, no storage, no control system, and requires no electricity to operate. A specifically engineered heat exchanger transfers heat energy from the waste hot shower water to the incoming freshwater supply, warming it from around 10 up to 30°C. When the cold water arrives at the mixing valve, it is much warmer, and therefore substantially less hot water is required from the water heater or solar array. 



WHERE TO INSTALL?

It can be installed in newly built homes and in bathroom renovations and bathtub-shower changes.

Due to its flat design, it is installed as a conventional shower tray, without making holes in the floor, facilitating the use of the shower for people with reduced mobility.



Easy installation

It is installed as a conventional shower tray, without making holes in the floor, facilitating the use of the shower for people with reduced mobility.

Solution on-sentence summary: Geothermal surface heat exchanger to cool buildings

The GeoTerre Geothermic Wall reduces complete cost of ownership, has a 100 year life time, has nearly no running costs and installation costs which are nearly the same as HVACs. This Solution can help eliminate the heat island caused by HVACs, and can deliver a 90% CO2 emission reduction compared to HVAC. It can be used in a wide range of contexts, including houses, small buildings, schools, colleges, small medic centers, small server rooms.

About:
Duromers such as glass fiber reinforced plastic (GRP) have excellent properties. They are inexpensive to manufacture, very stable, durable, light and weatherproof. Because of these characteristics, they are used in numerous industries (automotive, wind turbines and boat industry).



Due to the excellent properties of glass fiber reinforced plastics, their production has been increasing continuously for several years. In 2019, more than 1.141 million tons of this material were produced across Europe, with an annual growth of 2% forecast for the coming years. At the same time, the amount of GRP components that reach their EOL and have to be disposed of is increasing as well. Already today, more than 200,000 tonnes of GRP waste per year have to be disposed of in Europe, although the quantities will increase significantly in the future.



Because this topic was hardly given any importance in the past, there is currently a disposal problem that threatens to worsen. Today GRP waste is either incinerated or disposed of in landfills. Sustainable GRP recycling is therefore urgently needed. To date, however, no recycling method in the sense of circular economy has established itself on the market.



That is why iwas-concepts AG, together with partners from research and industry, develops and implements innovative and sustainable solutions for GRP recycling in order to process these high-quality waste products and return them to the material cycle.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Preventing the buildup of hard mineral scale on heat exchange surfaces
Identification: Industries rely on water for many different purposes, but its unique properties mean that it is particularly efficient at transferring heat, so water is vital to both cooling and heating applications. When the state of water is changed, for instance when the water is heated, it is less able to hold on to the minerals dissolved in it and they precipitate out to form a hard mass on the surfaces of pipes and equipment, most commonly calcium carbonate or limescale, but also phosphate or sulphate scales. This blocks and damages equipment, requiring its premature disposal. The layer of scale also forms a thermal barrier, meaning that heat transfer is greatly reduced and leading to major inefficiencies - just 2mm of scale can lead to an efficiency loss of 20%. HydroFLOW units induce an electric field into the water and the pipe network to prevent the buildup of hard mineral scale without adding chemicals to the water, keeping equipment running at maximum efficiency and for longer.
Looking For: Visibility, Credibility
Tags: Cooling, Maintenance and inspection, Scaling and corrosion control, Building heating, Industrial process heat
Sectors: Buildings, Industry/Goods, Heating, cooling and ventilation

The Financial benefits: Annual saving on water and electricity of $73,000;Annual saving on chemical treatment of $13, 000;Maintenance reduction of 50% ($5000) and increased equipment lifespan;

About:
Water is used in increasingly innovative ways in modern society, from modern irrigation systems to the cooling of power stations.



Ensuring that water keeps flowing and performing its many roles, and reducing the quantity of wasted or contaminated water is a major environmental goal.



HYDROPATH Technology contributes to this through its range of HydroFLOW® electronic water conditioners. These units protect water systems from blocking and losing efficiency due to limescale or biofouling, and enhance filtration to maximise water reuse and minimise waste.



Based in Nottingham, UK, HYDROPATH encompasses an international network of distributors and clients. HydroFLOW® systems are used all over the world as a cost-effective, energy-saving, green solution for conditioning water. From keeping homes supplied with hot water, to maintaining efficiency in industries such as aluminium casting and agriculture, to enhancing the clean-up of sewage, HydroFLOW® units save water and energy and reduce chemical use and waste.

Solution on-sentence summary: Exploiting waste heat in industrial processes and power generation systems
Identification:
The complexity in designing ORC plants meant only niche applications with large uniform heat sources, e.g. geothermal, could be exploited commercially. Orcan developed a new generation of ORC products based on a modular design. These ORC units are much more versatile and feature significantly lower LCOEs, even reaching the level of baseload electricity driven by fossil fuels.

Orcan is the leading supplier of such modular and compact ORC products, both in terms of the number of ORC units installed as well as cost-effectiveness. By converting a complex thermodynamic system into a plug & play product, the technology has been made available for mass application.

The Efficiency Packs are designed in a way to reduce project-specific engineering effort. The final ORC unit was designed with manufacturability in mind. Cost positions previously only available in large-scale ORC plants, can now also be achieved in the small- to mid-scale waste heat market.

Organization short description: Orcan Energy AG is a leading European CleanTech company offering efficient energy solutions based on Organic Rankine Cycle (ORC) technology for the conversion of waste heat into electricity. Orcan Energy AG was founded in 2008 by physicists Dr. Andreas Sichert, Dr. Andreas Schuster and Richard Aumann, with the aim of providing companies from a variety of industry sectors a simple, cost-saving and efficient energy solutions that unlocks the enormous energy potential of unused industrial waste heat sources. Orcan Energy AG currently operates 70 plants in Europe, making it the most widely used provider in the low-temperature sector in Germany. Orcan Energy AG employs 60 people and is headquartered in Munich.
About:
The efficiency PACK developed by Orcan Energy, a compact micro power plant, converts waste heat energy, for example from industrial companies, into electricity. Users of the efficiency PACK thus benefit from carbon-free power generated at the extremely low cost of around 0.04 euros per kilowatt hour. A large-scale rollout of the technology could reduce costs to as little as 0.03 euros. This means that Orcan Energy provides the lowest power generation costs from waste heat in the entire industry worldwide. The power is fed directly into the grid or can be used immediately.

Orcan Energy’s portfolio includes integration solutions (employing waste heat as a component) that are ready for series production as well as plug & play electricity generation modules that use Organic Rankine Cycle technology to convert waste heat into carbon-free electrical energy. Based on intensive research, development and market trials, Orcan Energy is now the technology leader in the low temperature segment upwards of 60 degrees Celsius.   

Because Orcan Energy exclusively utilizes tried-and-tested standard components to produce the efficiency PACK, which boasts an innovative design, operation of the solutions is particularly stable and low-maintenance. Since the Orcan technology is also extremely flexible in terms of the source of waste heat, it can be used in virtually all scenarios in which waste heat is generated – in foundries, biogas installations, glass-making plants, building materials production, breweries, and ship and truck engines.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Digital supply chain monitoring and elimination of chronic waste problems
Identification: Centaur builds a software and sensor-based platform to transform today's grain & cereal bulk supply chain into a trusted, end-to-end, post-harvest quality chain. With its monitoring solution, Centaur offers visibility, quality control, traceability and sustainability along all stages of the supply chain. This is achieved by automatically creating a digital simulation (a "digital twin") of the conditions both inside and outside the grain storage.  To achieve this, the Internet-of-Crops platform pulls in all available digital information such as weather and climate data on outside conditions, plus internal conditions identified by sensors (e.g. gas profiles, temperature, moisture levels) and inputs all of this into a state-of-the-art digital model of how grain performs when subject to any and all of these conditions.  The result is a state of the art prediction tool of likely problems, allowing remedial action in advance.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Algorithms & AI, Sensors & monitoring, Bran & husk waste, Agricultural Waste, Software

The Financial benefits: 3x to 4x return on investment for grain and rice growers;50% cheaper than the mainstream alternative (grain cables) which don't solve waste and spoilage problems;Up to 1 trillion USD prevention of losses due to crop value spoilage and improper storage methods;

Solution on-sentence summary: A high-tech electric road system for electric vehicles
Identification: The transportation of people and goods needs to become sustainable. Battery prices, lack of raw materials and immature charging infrastructures are slowing down necessary development. There is an urgent need for a green and lean charging infrastructure to move our world forward. Elonroad is a high-tech electric road system that auto charges electric vehicles both while driving and when parked. It aims to electrify the entire transport sector and make fossil fuel a thing of the past. Its implementation will enable the electrification of vehicles just like fiber has done for digitalization. Elonroad can contribute to reducing road transport CO2 emissions by up to 50% within 10 years! The mission is to transport people; goods in a safe, fast and energy efficient way, by delivering a green charging infrastructure. Elonroad builds smart electric roads that can be used by all kinds of electric vehicles; cars, trucks and buses.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesInfrastructurePorts and Marine Infrastructure, BusinessServicesInfrastructureRoads & Road Traffic Infrastructure, BusinessServicesInfrastructureWarehouses and Storage Facilities
Tags: Electric, Road, Vehicles, EV charging, Software, Electric vehicles
Sectors: Freight, Infrastructures, Mobility, Power and fuel distribution

The Financial benefits: 20% less TCO compared to the installation of charging stations across countries and charging poles at homes;Vehicle cost reduction of 50-80%;
Complementary solutions: Cryonod: Recovering energy from natural gas networks by liquidizing industrial gases (Energy,Infrastructures);Atawheel: Zero emission mobility based on hydrogen energy storage and water electrolysis technology (Infrastructures,Mobility);JuiceNet: A smart platform matching drivers’ historical charging patterns to manage charging station demand (Mobility);Place To Plug: Platform connecting EV drivers and charging stations  (Mobility);
Organization short description: Elonroad is a modular platform system providing smart seamless electric mobility, everywhere and for everyone. Our system consists of a conductive rail that can both be laid on top of the road as well as integrated into the road. A conductive pic-up under the vehicle connects to the electric rail via sliding contacts. The rail is only active when covered by the vehicle. Our software system will manage safety and billing issues as well as compile data from all vehicles using the platform.
About:
Elonroad Electric road system (“ERS”) is a charging infrastructure for all kinds of electric vehicles. It charges electric vehicles batteries both when parked and while driving with an effect of up to 300kW with 97% efficiency. It´s a conductive solution similar to traditional methods like the third rail used in the metro but including high level of IT technology embedded in the rail. It has been developed and tested in Sweden with support from University of Lund and the Swedish Energy Agency since 2015. The Elonroad ERS works for all electric vehicles, cars, taxis, buses and trucks.

It will make it possible for Long Haul Trucks to drive electric without the need of large and heavy batteries. Without ERS an electric truck would need approximately 6 tons of batteries to drive for 8 hours (a workday). With the possibility to charge while driving the battery need is reduced by 80%. Instead of having 6 tons of batteries, an BEV Truck can have only 1 ton of batteries in order to drive from the ERS to destinations 50km away. Such battery can also be used for driving in between electric roads. For example and as a consequence, a highway would then only need to be 50% electrification because the charging on the road gives the double power than needed for the truck so it can drive twice as long as the length of the electric road.  This reduces the investment cost of charging infrastructure.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: A monitoring platform for drinking water treatment and beverage production plants
Identification: The actual situation in terms of microbial contamination detection on drinking water plants is very slow and not reliable. First, the actual method takes 2-3 days to show any abnormal situation, time where population will get sick.  Secondly, the actual procedure identify only a small percentage of bacteria (1-5%) as not all bacteria are able to growth on a dry nutrient support. The whole procedure requires 50 gr of plastic of lab consumable. The BactoSense device detects automatically in less than 30 min all bacteria in water directly coming from the process via a single sampling tube. When placed at the entry of the plant, the device acts as an early warning system in case of abnormal microbial conditions. When placed in other locations, process optimization can be generated with potential reductions of chlorine, impacting positively tap water acceptance and bottled water consumption (EU major initiative). On a 10 years basis, 1000 kg of plastic consumption and more than 3 to of CO2 can be avoided.
Looking For: Visibility, Funding
Tags: Drinking-water, Bacteria, Software, Water quality, Maintenance and inspection, Sensors & monitoring, Microorganisms
The environmental benefits: 70 times faster than actuals standard method for bacteria detection and monitoring in drinking water plants;7 times less CO2 emission generated by the removal of plastic consumption with the actual method in drinking water plants;Provides near real hygienic conditions of production lines in food and beverage plants, reduce risk of out-of-spec product and recall actions ;No generation of toxic release (HCL, dioxins, heavy metals) during the plastic waste disposal (combustion, landfill, etc);More than 20% water consumption reduction in beverage plants with an on-line bacteria monitoring  providing near real time hygienic status;
The Financial benefits: Drinking Water: Reduce waterborne illnesses medical, societal costs for the population today about CHF 2500 per day;Payback time less than 2 years for beverage - reduces rinsing timing can save up to 20% (3000 m3/month) per plant which means about €40'000 per year or more than 300'000 m3 of water;Tap water acceptance may decrease the spending by EU Households for bottled waterfor up to € 600 Mio per (year);

Organization short description: Fast and automated Microbiology!
About:
The breakthrough proprietary technology developed by bNovate Technologies opens the door for fast automated online measurements of cells in industrial environments.



The BactoSense and Aqu@Sense MB, our first products on the market, address the needs of customers in the field of water treatment, water utilities, processed water, bottled water and pharmaceutical grade water. In the field of drinking water, our technology allows a more efficient usage of natural resources, with less chlorine, less rinse water that is wasted and less plastic usage. 



Today, you need to wait 3-5 days before the bacteria concentration in water can be assessed (HPC cultivation actual methods. Wth our proprietary systems you get a results in only 20 min, before the water has been distributed! Everything is connected (IoT) and automated, perfect for new "smart cities" integration.



In development, our future products will also be able to specifically detect pathogens like E. Coli and address larger market segments such as food & beverage and industrial microbiology applications.

Solution on-sentence summary: Precision irrigation technology and services for growers
Identification: As global demand for food grows and accessible freshwater resources continue to shrink, the world’s agriculture industry faces a huge challenge. It must produce more food with fewer resources. Traditional irrigation farming practices are leading to resource degradation and subsequent decline in crop yields. In the present world environmental context, it is imperative that growers find a way to enhance their present irrigation practices to improve agricultural productivity while conserving and enhancing natural resources. Precision irrigation management, such as Hortau’s, is key in providing the sustainable solution growers require. Hortau's soil tension technology allows growers to know exactly when, where and how long to water crops, resulting in greater water, energy and labour cost efficiencies. Hortau's solution makes farming practices more accurate; an important step towards sustainable agriculture.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners
Tags: Soil and land, Sensors & monitoring, Irrigation, Software
Sectors: Food/Agri, Water, Crops care, Water efficiency
The environmental benefits: In field tomatoes production, at -30kPa irrigation threshold, yield went up to 25% higher using our solution compared to using water content technology;In cranberries, water use efficiency increased between 21-92%, whereas yield improved between 12-100%;

Organization short description: Hortau’s irrigation management solutions help growers ensuring optimal crop growth while reducing water and energy use.
About:
Since 2002, Hortau has been a leader in the irrigation management systems industry. Hortau developed and marketed one of the first irrigation management tools on the web, allowing producers - no longer to leave irrigation management to chance. Founded in 2002 by two entrepreneurs passionate about agriculture, Dr. Jean Caron, an agronomist with a doctorate in soil physics and Jocelyn Boudreau, an agricultural engineer with a master's degree in soil physics, the company Hortau organizes regular conferences and training courses on irrigation management in order to allow its customers to optimize the use of water and get the best from their crops.

Hortau is headquartered in Lévis, Quebec (Canada) and San Luis Obispo, California (United States), and has offices, representatives, and technicians across North America.



Equipped with sensors for measuring soil tension to determine the precise amount of water that must be sent to plants, Hortau's patented system helps producers of countless types of crops to improve the health of their plants, to obtain higher yields and lower costs associated with irrigation.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Bio-sourced wind turbines for private and industrial applications
Identification: Philéole comes from the desire to use the force of natural elements. The wind is everywhere around us, with different forces, more or less stable or turbulent. It is present in all areas of the world; whether it’s an energetically isolated environment or a hyper-connected urban environment, whether it’s a marine or terrestrial environment. Philéole's solution is focused on the energy developed by the wind. Thanks to the wind and the natural and sustainable materials used, this solution offers the tools for a cleaner world, where the effect of climate change can be mitigated. To meet this challenge Phileole has created a 3-blade wind turbine on a vertical axis. This wind turbine aims at providing a sustainable, ecological, green and bio-sourced energy production to any human who would like to be independent energetically. Highly customizable, Philéole's solution can be installed on sailboats, private houses, buildings highways and many others.

Solution on-sentence summary: An energy assistant based on artificial intelligence to reduce electricity consumption at home
Identification: Electricity is invisible causing 25% of electricity waste at home. In France, 25% of waste is proven by the CNRS, it is equal to 300 Euros per year, per household. For example, a bad configuration of a heating system by only 1 degree Celsius will have an impact of 100 Euros on an electricity bill. The average consumption of on-going losses are 80 Euros in France. Most of these losses can be simply reduced. Ecojoko is a simple-to-install solution for households to reduce electricity consumption by 25%. The solution provides the user analysis on their electricity consumption and shows that it is simple to reduce energy waste. The data and analysis is relayed to the user in real time using artificial intelligence to detect devices and electronic signatures.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility
Tags: Behavioural, Algorithms & AI, Sensors & monitoring, Software, Smart-buildings
The environmental benefits: CO2 neutral after only 2.5 months (in France, Ademe results).;25% reduction in a household's electricity consumption (CNRS study and internal data);
The Financial benefits: A French household can save up to 300€ per year.;Turning off standby devices such as TVs makes it possible to save up to 80 euros per year;

Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);animeo Connect : Facade shading management solution for increased energy savings in buildings (Buildings & Shelters);Recovering heat : Standardized, ready-to-install solution for supermarkets to heat buildings or water using waste heat (Buildings & Shelters);LightFi: Continuously measure building occupancy to optimize energy use for HVAC and lighting



 (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: Ecojoko is a home energy assistant based on artificial intelligence to reduce electricity at home.
About:
Ecojoko is an Home Energy Assistant to reduce electricity at home. 

Unlike water, electricity is invisible causing 25% of electricity waste. 



The French research Institute CNRS have shown that an equipment such as Ecojoko can reduce by 25% the energy consumption. 



In France, it means that people are losing 300€ per year. 

Besides, 25% equals to half of the reduction France is engaged to make with the Paris Agreement on the climate : this is huge !



To understand,  a bad configuration of your heating system by only 1°C will impact by 100€ your bill. The average consumption of on-going losses are 80€ in France. Most of it can be reduced simply. Same for your fridge, your cooking. 



So, Ecojoko is a simple solution to avoid wasting electricity at home. 

Ecojoko provides electricity consumption in real time, consumption of the main uses, and simple actions to reduce them.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy

Solution on-sentence summary: An additive speeding up the natural biodegradation and making plastics composable
Identification:
Evanesto® is an additive that speeds-up the biodegradation and compostability of PLA-based plastics. 

This additive, based on an enzyme, accelerates the depolymerization of PLA to achieve Home Compost certification. Used as a masterbatch, it requires no changes in industrial transforming processes. With Evanesto® inside, PLA-based plastics become universally compostable both in industrial and domestic conditions. Thanks to Evanesto®, plastics that are too thin, soiled or made from multi-materials can be composted whereas they couldn’t be recycled today. The additive can help tackle plastic pollution and change consumers behaviours regarding plastic and the sorting of wastes. It is a turnkey solution that targets millions of tons of plastic wastes that are incinerated or landfilled today, creating major pollution issues the solution aims to tackle thanks to composting, a complementary solution to reuse or recycling of plastics.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners
Tags: Biodegradable, Compostable, Industrial additives, Waste treatment, Packaging
The environmental benefits: 1 ton of Evanesto® = 20 tons less of plastic waste;In less than 200 days, PLA-based plastics will be fully composted;In less than 200 days, PLA articles will be fully composted without any microparticules nor ecotoxicity;Longitudinal strength improved by 2 compared to polystyrene materials;
The Financial benefits: Reduction of the plastic landfill by 30% by 2024;Price increase of the overall packaging cost would be limited to 1 to 3% maximum and will be compensated by the final cost in the end of life (incineration or industrial composting);

About:
Carbiolice was created in 2016 by three partners based on a common ambition.



Carbios a green chemistry society developping enzymatic solutions, 

SPI, an investment fund managed by BPI France and Limagrain Ingredients,

which is the global leader on production and commercialization of cereal ingredients.



The aim of Carbiolice, is to develop,design and industrialize patented solutions

that speed-up biodegradation and compostability of single-use plastics

or packaging.



Carbiolice has an exclusive licence from Carbios, on enzymatic biodegradation technologies. This technology is based on an enzyme. This additive name is EVANESTO.



EVANESTO is integrated during plastic fabrication processes without machine or process modification. It is a powerful additive, based on an enzyme which accelerates the biodegradation and compostability of PLA based products.



Everyday, 25 people are committed in this work shared in R&D department, production or business development.



We are convinced that plastic can be useful for humans without destroying the planet.

Identification: The solution aims at providing safe drinking water to rural communities of 200 to 2000 people in emerging countries. Thanks to 8 solar panels, the water is pumped from boreholes or wells and flows through a treatment line that eliminates the particles in the water and add a specific amount of chlorine to make the water potable. Identification: This solution makes dignified sanitation possible for every individual, no matter the location. By re-using the treated effluent on site for non-potable applications (toilet flushing, irrigation, etc.), this solution can significantly reduce potable water consumption. By making use of this solution, it is possible to develop in areas where there is no infrastructure. This is a perfect solution for bringing sanitation to all schools, reducing potable water demand in the urban edge (domestic, commercial and industrial) and bringing new opportunities through the re-use of the treated effluent. This also speaks directly to Green Building, sustainable living and is the perfect answer for the "living building" model. The operating cost of this solution is much less than alternatives, which makes it one of the most affordable and most sustainable alternative water sources available today.

Solution on-sentence summary: A low-cost water filter for providing clean and safe water without using electricity or any chemicals
Identification: With the Nanofilter® technology, it is now possible to modify the properties of nanomaterials that are used in Nanofilter® to trap and remove a wide range of “targeted” water contaminants which vary from one geographical area to another. Water pollutants vary geographically because of different human activities and geological formation of soil and rocks. To design a Nanofilter® for removal of contaminants, water is first tested in the laboratory in order to identify the contaminants contained therein. Thus, the properties of nanomaterials are changed according to the findings of the laboratory test. As required by WHO Standards, the Nanofilter® “selectively” removes 99.999% of contaminants from water, including bacteria, viruses, and chemical contaminants (of any category). One filter purifies 10 liters/hour, lasts five years, and has relatively lower operation cost (~GBP 1 per month) compared to other existing technologies of similar quality, making it affordable to a majority of Tanzanians, Kenyans and soon Zambians, who live in underserved areas.
Looking For: Funding opportunities, Partnership opportunities
Target client profile: Public Authorities, Local NGO, BusinessServicesRetailerB2C E-Commerce Platforms
Tags: Developing countries, Nanotechnologies, Filtration & purification, Water & Wastewater treatment

The Financial benefits: Less than 2 years pack back time;Five times cheaper than the commercial bottled water;

Solution on-sentence summary: A smart guide that helps anyone track, reduce, and offset their carbon footprint
Identification: We have reached a pivotal moment where climate change is finally moving to the forefront of everyone’s minds, thus creating a demand for industry to create new solutions to the problems we are facing. With this rapid shift in the public's mindset, individuals increasingly want to take responsibility for their environmental impact into their own hands, however, they struggle to do so because of a lack of actionable knowledge, limited access to sustainable solutions, and their skepticism about individual impact. Since people still struggle to make sustainable choices, there is a huge opportunity in guiding them towards living more sustainable lifestyles. Eevie embeds a behavior detection algorithm with more than 1 billion data points resulting in a behavior detection accuracy above 90%.

Organization short description: Climate Engagement Tool to Measure & Reward Employee Climate Action!
About:
Leading enterprise corporations are under tremendous pressure to decarbonize their businesses.  We believe that they will only be able to achieve their goals if they fundamentally change their work culture from within!



eevie is an employee engagement tool designed to foster a climate-friendly work culture in large-scale enterprises worldwide.



eevie empowers enterprises to plan & run highly configurable sustainability programs suited to their individual requirements, to reward employees for their participation with nature-based CO2 compensations, and to measure the impact of the programs to maximise employees’ emission reduction efforts.



In order to support behaviour change for the employees, we have developed a climate guide app called eevie that allows the employees to measure, track, reduce and offset their carbon footprint. eevie helps users make small changes on a daily basis by nudging them with actionable information in the right moments, by providing immediate feedback on how conscious decisions affect their day-to-day carbon footprint and by enabling them to offset their unavoidable emissions by planting trees that offset their remaining carbon footprint.



Every day that an employee engages with the eevie App, they receive 1 tree as a reward from the "Impact Partners". They can plant their trees in the App to offset their unavoidable carbon emissions. Each tree grows to sequester on average 12,5kg CO₂ per annum for 25 years.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: An autonomous electric minivans for convenient transport in urban areas
Identification: Due to the poor quality of public transport in suburban areas, over 130 million Europeans depend on a car to go to work. SuburVAN are door-to-rail autonomous electric minivans that pick suburban commuters at their door and take them to a commuter railway station in less than 10 minutes, so that they can continue their trip on public transport. Combined with commuter railways, SuburVAN autonomous electric minivans can provide the fastest commute in metropolitan areas and small and mid-size cities, while reducing CO2 emissions coming from cars by 99%. Using the minivans is completely contactless, and they are automatically disinfected after every trip.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Solution on-sentence summary: A nanoporous silica material derived from algae for personal care products and solar cells
Identification: The development of sustainable personal care products is important to avoid further harm on life and seas, but also for human health. The solution aims to show that it is possible to create an industry that is positive for the environment and not only less negative. By using algae as a resource for the production of a unique advanced material, called Algica, a business model like this has been proven financially viable. By using this material to exchange ingredients used in personal care products, personal care products become less environmentally and health-damaging. By using this material in solar panels the efficiency is increased and more renewable energy can be produced. In the production process of this material nutritious water is cleaned and thereby valuable nutrients recycled into the remaining biomass of the algae after the extraction of the Algica material. This biomass contains besides these nutrients omega 3 rich oil. By producing Algica in this way a contribution to a more sustainable food chain is also made as well as a contribution to less eutrophication and thereby healthier seas.
Looking For: New clients, Partners,
Tags: Algae, Silicon & solar panels waste, Biodegradable, Consumer-goods, Industrial Waste, Solar photovoltaic
The environmental benefits: At least 4 % efficiency increase of solar panels;More environmentally friendly and less health damaging than 99,9 % of all personal care ingredients;Contributes to recycling of nutrients and thereby healthier food chains and seas.;
The Financial benefits: Less than 4 years pay-back time when used for efficiency increase of solar panels;Exchanges up to 4 ingredients with 1 in personal care products with less need of material;

Organization short description: Extracts a unique nanoporous silica material from algae with light manipulating and absorbing and releasing properties
About:
Swedish Algae Factory extracts a unique nanoporous silica material from algae with light manipulating and absorbing and releasing properties. 



The material is branded under the name Algica and is today used as an ocean-safe moisturizer, cleanser, rheology modifier and anti-pollution agent in skin care products. Algicas UV light blocking traits are being tested for use as a UV filter in personal care products.

 

Algicas light manipulating traits has also in lab and field tests shown to be able to increase the efficiency of solar panels/solar cells. This application wil first be commercialized when Swedish Algae Factory´s first larger facility is up and running. 



Both Swedish Algae Factory´s current smaller facility and the larger one is operated with a circular economic mindset. Our algae cultivation are using nutrients and water for growth from a nearby land-based fish farm. After extraction of the nanoporous silica material the rest of the omega 3 oil- and nutrientrich organic biomass is used to feed fish more sustainably, for energy and ecofertilizers. 



Swedish Algae Factory is focusing on cultivation of saltwater species to aviod using the scare fresh water supply.

Solution on-sentence summary: Scalable, intelligent and flexible process for sustainable agriculture
Identification: Gigrow aims at solving a problem of quality, logistics, production, and environmental impact of agriculture. It reduces to the minimum the consumption of soil, water, the energy needed to provide a reliable source of vegetable locally grown, scalable, everywhere. The solution consists of a rotating system for plants, giving better climate control, more lighting optimization. The liquid is injected through a patented injection system giving high precision water feeding. The process is designed to be intelligent, yet flexible, through AI and other systems, it adapts to the environment to leverage local realities to reduce cost and increase productivity to get a reliable quality product. For example, energy used for a plant is used for dehumidification, but also can heat greenhouse or building at night or in winter, using multiple times the same energy. It can also adapt its growing cycle to minimize energy consumption or take more energy during peak. All with ease. The system has been tested for 2 years with independent studies and government of Canada prooving more than 100 types of plant and vegetable can grow in the system

Gigrow is a Vertical Farming process that give the opportunity to grow in soil 12month per year with the minimum possible amount of water. 

The density, precision, and automation make the growing easy and repeatable. The process is clean, everything reusable. Using high technologie with AI and very precise control, we give the plant what it need at the right time.

Gigrow is can be local everywhere, and make vegetable in a more sustainable way.

Solution on-sentence summary: An app that connects businesses with consumers to avoid food waste
Identification: One third of food products on the planet are thrown away without being eaten. In other words, one third of the energy and resources necessary to produce, transport and distribute our food is thrown in the trash. Food waste is thus a major environmental, social and economic challenge. Nevertheless a large part of food waste could be avoided. The Phenix App aims at reducing the waste of food businesses (grocery stores, restaurants, bakeries, convenience stores) by connecting them to consumers eager to save money and act for the planet. The consumers can buy themed baskets of unsold products on the Phenix App (fruits&vegetables, bread& pastries etc) at a reduced price from those businesses. The consumer pays on the app and goes to the business to pick up his meal.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Restaurants, Retailers, Online marketplace, Software, Food waste, Reduce & prevent waste, Municipal Solid Waste
Sectors: Food/Agri, Sell and trade, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: 1M users;5,000 businesses onboarded;2.5 kg of CO2 avoided per meal saved;70M meals saved since the creation of Phenix;
The Financial benefits: For consumers, 50% cheaper than the mainsteam alternative;Upsell and more traffic for businesses;

 (Food & Agriculture,Waste & Pollution);Winnow: Food waste reduction by connecting commercial kitchens to the cloud (Food & Agriculture,Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: PHENIX is a social company which turns waste into wealth
About:
Who?

Phenix is a Tech For Good startup that implements solutions to ensure that no product goes to waste. For Phenix, each unsold item should be given a second chance. If we know how to put it in the right hands, nothing should be lost!





What?

As the saying goes, one man’s trash is another man’s treasure. When we throw something away, it is because we no longer use it, not necessarily because the product has no value. Based on this principle, Phenix connects those who have excess with those who do not have enough.



Phenix offers 4 alternatives to the trash can: 



- The Phenix mobile app, which allows customers to buy unsold items from shops at a reduced price 

- Donations to food banks and other nonprofits, allowing us to avoid food waste while benefiting individuals in need

- Donations that repurpose food waste into animal feed, making good use of unsold goods and leftovers not suitable for human consumption

- Compost and anaerobic digestion to process organic waste



Thanks to these solutions, Phenix is the leading startup in the fight against food waste in Europe, with more than 120,000 meals saved everyday leveraging its network of professionals and committed customers





How? 

Phenix develops innovative technology to facilitate the transfer of unsold items: 

 

- The platform places a focus on donations, using just-in-time and wholesale principles to ensure that unsold products can be used to benefit food banks and other food-related organizations.   



- The application addresses individuals committed to fighting waste, allowing them to geolocate and book unsold products at a reduced price. 



Phenix is also a pioneer in the social enterprise space, showing that economic development and environmental stewardship can go hand in hand in a new and innovative business model. Phenix is part of the Tech For Good movement and leads by example in putting the social and environmental impact of the company at the heart of its technological innovation, all of this without jeopardising economic growth. In that respect, Phenix is proud to be recognized as both a B-Corporation and an ESUS (Entreprise Solidaire d'Utilité Sociale).







Why?

One third of what we produce is produced... for nothing.

In other words, one third of the energy and resources expended to produce, transport and distribute our food goes to waste!



Waste has huge environmental, social and economic consequences:



- Environmental: If food waste were a country, it would be the 3rd largest greenhouse gases emitter. In fact, food production is now the main source of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. As a result, every time food is thrown away, it results in unnecessary and preventable CO2 emissions, undermining efforts to combat global warming.

- Social: The food thrown away in France alone could feed 10 million people. This is more than the number of people in need in France, which stands at 8.8 million people. Efficient allocation can effectively address our problem of hunger.  

- Economic: Waste costs more each year than the social security deficit. The ADEME (The French Environment and Energy Management Agency) estimates that food waste costs 16 billion euros each year.
SDG’s of application: SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

About:
Photovoltaic is one of the promising renewable energies, if we can apply PVs onto 1 billion people or devices to generate 5Wh/day for self-use, the amount power will be equal to 2.5 nuclear power plants and yearly save 1,137 Tons CO2. However, the present technologies are difficult to get into our daily use because of the limits: 1. rigid and heavy; 2. dark color; 3. poor lifetime of flexible thin-films.

Flexwave uses an optical way to overcome those limitations of traditional PV modules. This innovative “Flexible Waveguide Technology” owns unique talents of easy shapeable, colorful and scattering light collection, which can help PVs to be lightly integrated into devices and create an energy-smart sustainable future.

DPM Mashel has used its combination of old paint knowledge and new raw materials to make FARNOVO, the innovative, premium, new generation wall paint. The Solution gives a 100% emission and pollution-free room environment, high hiding power and wet abrasion resistance and fast application, which can improve the environmental footprint of construction drastically. FARNOVO reduces transport costs and emissions, saves water use treatment costs, and saves packaging costs and waste. Through its environmentally friendly, high quality and durable Solution, FARNOVO provides a sustainable painting option for everyone.

Organization short description: DPM Mashel GmbH is an innovative young company specialized in the production of sustainable building materials.
About:
In 2018 we developed our first sustainable product with the highest market quality. FARNOVO brand has been on the market since 2019 and changes the world of interior paints. We are the innovative dry mineral wall paint of the future. 



We do not use any biocides, preservatives, formaldehydes or any other harmful additives. Our wall paint is ecological thanks to our sustainability concept - based on the protection of water (0% production and waste water), air (up to 60% less CO2 emissions) and soil (up to 80% less plastic bucket / plastic waste). Our emission-free wall paint has a VOC value of -0g / l and is highly permeable and breathable with an sD value of -0.03. We ensure a healthy indoor climate and are suitable for allergy sufferers. Our dry material is not freezing and has a shelf life of minimum 2 years (no product waste due to mold and expired quality).



The mixing time is only 5min. due to our new development DPM Blander and after mixing, the pH value of FARNOVO is 8.5 (sea water) and our customer do not need protective clothing and respiratory protection during the application. FARNOVO has the highest German market quality with an opacity and wet abrasion resistance of class 1. We are the first dry mineral wall paint that can compete with emulsion paints. Designed as a 3-in-1 product, only FARNOVO offers the possibility to mix spatula or primer in addition to wall paint. All you have to do is adjust the amount of water added to the system. In conjunction with our DECOTON mineral color pigment range, we offer painters, but also inexperienced do-it-yourselfers the opportunity to create breathtaking structures and patterns on the walls with little effort.



After a successful year 2019, we would like to expand further and win a larger auditorium for our sustainability concept. With FARNOVO (dry wall paint) and DECOTON (dry mineral pigments) we can offer an environmentally friendly but also high-quality alternative to conventional wall paints. We always need strong partners who can steer us into the sustainable future of the construction industry and the ecological interior design. A small step for man, one giant leap for mankind. Be a part of it!

Solution on-sentence summary: A carbon-free power source for liquefied natural gas vaporization and storage
Identification: Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) Import terminals are important power consumers and need vaporizers to regasify LNG. Powerfin is a LNG vaporisation system for import terminals, able to produce carbon-free electricity using the otherwise wasted cold energy contained in the LNG. It is based on an innovative thermodynamic cycle which achieves state-of-the-art cold recovery, and high reliability. The carbon-free electricity produced can be exported and/or used locally by the terminal itself. LNG regasification terminals become not only energy importers, but also local and green energy producers.
Looking For: Visibility, New clients
Tags: LNG - liquified natural gas, Waste cold recovery
The environmental benefits: 40 kWh of Power generated by ton of vaporized LNG;Carbon free electricity from wasted cold;Power: 160tLNG/h*40kWh/tLNG = 6,4MW;Around 52 kg of CO2 saved per ton of vaporized LNG;Avoid any natural gas consumption for LNG regasification;
The Financial benefits: IRR is between 2-5% and the payback period is 10-13 years (highly related to the domestic electricity price);Possibility to sell carbon credits related to power produced and carbon footprint decrease;Reduce by up to 70% the energy consumption of the terminal, therefore decreasing by the same amount the variable part of the electricity bill;

Organization short description: A world leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health.
About: Air Liquide is present in 80 countries with approximately 66,000 employees and serves more than 3.6 million customers and patients. Oxygen, nitrogen and hydrogen are essential small molecules for life, matter and energy. They embody Air Liquide’s scientific territory and have been at the core of the company’s activities since its creation in 1902.Air Liquide’s ambition is to be a leader in its industry, deliver long term performance and contribute to sustainability. The company’s customer-centric transformation strategy aims at profitable growth over the long term. It relies on operational excellence, selective investments, open innovation and a network organization implemented by the Group worldwide. Through the commitment and inventiveness of its people, Air Liquide leverages energy and environment transition, changes in healthcare and digitization, and delivers greater value to all its stakeholders. Air Liquide’s revenue amounted to 21 billion euros in 2018 and its solutions that protect life and the environment represented more than 40% of sales. Air Liquide is listed on the Euronext Paris stock exchange (compartment A) and belongs to the CAC 40, EURO STOXX 50 and FTSE4Good indexes.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A green energy solar water heating and storage system
Identification: In most residential buildings, hot water consumption and hot water production are not in sync. When hot water is used, a volume much greater than what is actually needed is heated up, leading to unnecessary energy use. Thermoflex™ 16 solves this problem using large hot water reservoir as energy storage. The Thermoflex™ 16 is an off-grid hot water storage system, based on renewable energy (sun and wind). This is an ideal Solution for remote locations that need hot water on regular basis like residential complexes, safari lodges, medical clinics, and others. A 16 CBM double layer water bladder is installed inside the container. Once the water in the bladder reaches the desired temperature (~55 degrees C), the small daily changes in the water temperature, is compensated by  solar and wind-turbine sources integrated with the Solution.
Looking For: Network, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Containerized, Solar photovoltaic
Sectors: Buildings, Heating, cooling and ventilationPower and fuel generation
The environmental benefits: The Thermoflex uses 30% less electricity than a regular boiler;Can deliver carbon savings of 19,710 kg per year;Reduduces grid electricity use by 80%, thanks to the use of solar energy;
The Financial benefits: For existing buildings, ROI is 7-8 years;Up to 30% cost saving compared to mainstream alternative;Annual maintenance is 80% less that current solutions;
Complementary solutions:
Solar space heating: Solar-powered air heaters and rock bed thermal storage to heat homes 

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);BASIL: Fully-integrated rooftop solar and a nano-grid to power IoT-ready DC home appliances (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: Develops, manufactures and markets unique proprietary solutions for water storage, distribution and transportation; green-energy hot & cold water storage; pre-paid blockchain water billing systems..
About:
EZPack Water Ltd. is a private Israel company that manufactures and markets 3 line of products: 

 

1.	Proprietary-innovative self-powered hybrid-green-energy water heating and cooling systems. 

2.	Water storage, transportation and distribution systems based on proprietary 2-layers bladders. 

3.	Pre-paid blockchain water billing systems.

 

EZPack® products are based on the concept of double liner bladder that was developed in response to the requirements of the Israel Water Authority to provide a complete solution for water storage and transportation in crisis situations. Over time EZPack® product line was expanded, and it is now including a large variety of models and accessories. 

 

EZPack® hybrid-green-energy systems introduce new innovative concept of using water to store energy. Using this concept, EZPack® has developed new-cost-effective line for green-energy water heating and cooling systems.  

EZPack® pre-paid blockchain water billing system includes the following elements: Cell-phone app for ordering and paying for water; Payment and control system based on Blockchain; Smart meters at the customer location. Using blockchain technology the system is secured and almost impossible to hack; No fake transactions can be generated; No single-center point that controls the system; All information is transparent to all blocks.
