Solution on-sentence summary: A systemic approach to address environmental footprint and recyclability trade-offs in plastics
Identification: The Keiryo PET solution is a manufacturing process that reduces the environmental footprint and manufacturing cost of plastic (PET) bottles. The Keiryo PET solution modifies the performance of the material during the injection process. This allows to produce PET containers using less virgin material and/or increase the uptake of recycled feedstock. Enhanced performance has been measured (up to 15% barrier improvement for carbonated soft drink containers). This result is achieved by integrating a patented 3D printed metal insert into existing industrial production assets. 3D printing enables low-cost manufacturing and global scalability. The KP technology generates a significant environmental impact that scales with its adoption and flows from the reduced use of materials. It will accelerate the transition to a Circular Economy as it reduces the amount of virgin plastic produced and increases the reusability of plastic waste. The technology is also applicable to bio-based feedstock.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: 3d-printing, Packaging, Manufacturing, PET waste, Reduce & prevent waste
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Waste/Pollution, Packaging, Manufacturing and construction processes
The environmental benefits: The metal insert is 3D printed weights  20 grams, measures approx 6cm and is retrofitted into existing machinery in less than two hours;At the current development stage, performance enhancements can generate up to 15% material savings;Every ton of PET avoided, saves 2,2 tons of CO2;Every ton of PET saved reduces the amount of plastic leaking in the ocean by 9%;
The Financial benefits: Low manufacturing cost of 3D printed inserts means payback time in 2/3 weeks;The technology can generate up to 735 million € savings per year in raw material for the industry;
Complementary solutions: Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);LACTIPS: A 100% biobased material for a sustainable packaging alternative (Industry & Consumer Goods);Claranor: Pulsed light packaging sterilization equipment for bioindustries (Industry & Consumer Goods);RT7000: A machine to chemically recycle plastic waste back into oil (Industry & Consumer Goods,Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description:
Our Mission: Reducing the environmental footprint and manufacturing cost of plastic packaging by changing the performance of the material in the injection process.



What we do:

•	KP offers an upstream solution to the sustainability challenges of polymer-based packaging by changing the performance of the polymer during the injection process. It allows to use less virgin material and a better uptake of recycled material when manufacturing PET bottles.

•	This is achieved through a technology retrofitted in existing injection machinery, hence low cost and scalability as there is no need to develop a new industrial footprint.
About:
Many innovations that address waste issues and recyclability of packaging come with trade-offs in terms of cost, Co2 emissions, energy footprint and scalability.  From the inception Keiryo realized that in order to achieve a systemic impact an innovation needed to address these trade-offs. 

Hence, it has to fulfill a number of criteria in terms of sustainability:

o	Achieve reduced use of material without complexifying recycling streams

o	Enable better recyclability without increasing CO2 Emissions

and in terms of cost:

o	Create new industry margins and/or reallocate industry margins

o	Enable global roll out based on low capital requirement for technology conversion

o	Having a strong IP basis and proprietary know-how that can be shared in a non-competitive way with all stakeholders of the supply chain.



On this basis Keiryo Packaging Technologies looked for scientific pathways to extract more value from the base material. 

To achieve this Keiryo based itself on the well-grounded polymer rheology science of Flow Enhanced Nucleation and Induced Crystallization. According to this science any semi-crystallizable polymer can alter its crystallization and morphological structure when subjected to deformational flows. This phenomenon is what enables fibre spinning. Keiryo Packaging Technologies developed a mechanism to apply it to the Injection Stretch Blow Moulding (ISBM) process of PET Bottles. 



How is this achieved?

A 3D printed metal insert is retrofitted to existing industrial hot runner nozzle housing. (see attached ppt for visual rendition). The insert is designed to generate the required activation energy into the polymer during the injection process. This triggers flow enhanced morphological changes leading to an improvement of the overall material performance (Reduced weight per bottle – higher recycled content).   



Scalability is enabled by the technology and the IP position

The Keiryo Packaging Technology materializes itself in a (670mm/2.5inches) large metal insert which   can be retrofitted in existing ISBM machinery globally. As it is manufactured through a 3D printing process it can be produced in a decentralised way.  

Intellectual Property: The KP technology has 3 patent families covering a large geographical landscape (incl. EU & US). IP has a broad scope across method and product claims. This broad IP enables to share the KP technology in a non-compete way with all stakeholders of the supply chain. Hence, enabling a large roll out of the technology.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: An app for more public participation in climate protection measures
Identification:
Changers CO2 fit App works in the field of CO2 tokenized economies for cities and companies. The Changers CO2 Fit App motivates to walk more often, cycle, use public transport and take part in eco-friendly and healthy activities, where citizens and employees learn more about waste reduction, healthy nutrition, energy-saving, green mobility and much more. 

 

The Changers CO2 fit App records all activities, calculates the CO2 balance and rewards the CO2 savings with climate points. The points can be used in donations or tree planting projects or can be redeemed against offers from the city administration, local shop owners and cultural institutions. 

 

Changers is available as Software as a Service (SaaS), White Label and as an SDK for 3rd party App integration. Assets can be managed via a Blockchain infrastructure.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Service, Software, Behavioural

The Financial benefits: 3-6 times of an ROI on the budget spent for implementing the application plus additional rewards and incentives. ;Savings of 388.000 € per 1000 participating employees per year by reducing absenteeism  ;30% cheaper than mainstream alternatives;

Changers CO2 fit App works in the field of CO2 tokenized economies for cities, companies and merchants. The Changers CO2 Fit App motivates citizens to walk more often, cycle, use public transport and take part in eco-friendly and healthy activities, where they learn more about waste reduction, healthy nutrition, energy saving, green mobility and much more.

Solution on-sentence summary: Using UV light to reduce pesticide use
Identification:
Pesticides use is one of the major challenges for agriculture, as the massive use of pesticides is a threat for human health and the environment. UV Boosting solution is changing the way farmers protect their crops against disease with a clean, high performance and affordable technology. The goal of the Helios solution is to make agriculture cleaner at scale with a financially attractive solution. UV Boosting solution is based on the stimulation of natural defenses of plants with Ultra Violet (UV) flashes. UV rays help plants to become more resistant to potential threats, especially powdery and downy mildew. The Helios Solution is designed to be easily adapted to farmers and winemakers equipment. It consists of UV lamps panels designed to be waste-free, chemical-free, with no residue and no impact on biodiversity. Our design-to-cost approach enables an affordable price with a quick return on investment for farmers wishing to reduce their consumption of pesticides.



As of 2022 the Solution is also commercialized in the following countries: Italy, Spain, United States.

Please notice: this information has been added post-publication (December 2020) and has not been validated through the labeling process nor can be verified at date.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility,
Tags: Pest control, Chemicals alternatives
The environmental benefits: Reduces the use of conventional fungicides by farmers and wine makers by 50% in average;
The Financial benefits: Payback ranges from immediate to several years;Savings vary between 200 and 800€ per hectare;

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution for collecting, transporting and treating all domestic wastewater in low water supply areas
Identification: Clearford, has spent 25 years developing and installing its unique, proprietary sewage collection, treatment and recycling system to tackle this very issue. The Clearford One solution works on the principle of decentralized sewage collection and has three major components: underground ClearDigest Smart Digester tanks, a ClearConvey network of sealed HDPE piping and an end of the line ClearRecover Wastewater Treatment Plant (STP) dedicated to recycling as much of the water as possible improving water security. This step-by-step decentralized process offers many advantages over traditional sewerage collection and treatment systems and allows effective sewerage coverage helping achieve SDG 6.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Credibility
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesBuildings Operators, BusinessServicesInfrastructureUrban Planning
Tags: Developing countries, Toilets, Grey water, Gaseous waste capture, Waste collection, Underground, Anaerobic digestion, Waste treatment, Domestic & municipal wastewater
The environmental benefits: Clearford One system with a 17 KLD STP in a village of 56 Homes has a OPEX of € 0.50 / Home;In a small village of 1000 people getting 70 L/capita of water supply assuming 85% water captured = 59,500 L recycled daily and 2.17 Million litres recycled annually;85% of wastewater recycled for reuse;100% of all wastewater generated is captured via Clearford One;
The Financial benefits: 15 - 50% cheaper CAPEX against comparable alternative;30 -90% cheaper OPEX versus Mechanical SBR/MBR STP;
Complementary solutions: REM: A novel acid regeneration system for steel pickling (Waste & Pollution,Water,Industry & Consumer Goods);E.S.T.: An intelligent robot-based system for automatic extraction, treatment and packaging of sediments (Waste & Pollution);ECOSOFTT: A suite of solutions to allow underserved communities to manage their water resources (Buildings & Shelters,Waste & Pollution,Water);BIO DISPERSIS LC: Recycle vinasse, a polluting residue from the alcohol industry, into organic additives for concrete (Waste & Pollution,Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description: Clearford India Private Limited is the fully owned subsidiary of Clearford Water Systems Inc. (TSX-V:CLI) setup in 2012
About:
Clearford India Private Limited is the fully owned subsidiary of Clearford Water Systems Inc. (TSX-V:CLI) setup in 2012 to execute projects in the Indian sanitation market. We have been executing projects in India using a NBS approach since late 2015 and and have completed 2 village projects, 3  phases of another 2 villages and are executing another village. We have also installed our system at 5 industrial units with the treated domestic wastewater is used for agricultural, landscaping or process requirements. 



Clearford has spent twenty-five years developing and installing its unique, proprietary sewage collection, treatment and recycling system to tackle this very issue. The Clearford One™ solution works on the principle of decentralized sewage collection and has three major components: underground ClearDigest Smart Digester™ tanks, a ClearConvey™ network of sealed HDPE piping and an end of the line ClearRecover™ Wastewater Treatment Plant (STP) dedicated to recycling as much of the water as possible. This step-by-step decentralized process offers many advantages over traditional sewerage collection and treatment systems and for the first time allows the deployment of sewage collection and treatment across the vast majority of India’s 500,000+ unsewered small to mid-size rural and urban communities (population > 100,000).
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: Developing facilities to produce renewable fuels for use by air, ground and marine vessels
Identification: The climate challenge for aviation is worse than expected. Without any change, airplane emissions of CO2, having reached over 900 million metric tons in 2018, will triple by 2050. While other transportation modes can electrify, commercial aviation does not have the ability due to weight and flight ranges. The best option is to adopt drop-in sustainable aviation fuels (SAFs). Technologies for the production of SAF have matured and allow to now implement location-appropriate solutions on a broad scale to supply airlines. With a background in wind, solar, and clean transmission project development, the Refuel team is advancing a project to bring low-cost, sustainable, and community-building renewable fuels to aviation at commercial scale by 2024. This solution brings together the most efficient technology using societal waste streams as renewable feedstock. To date, Refuel the Future has already three projects on their roadmap and welcomes interested partners and investors.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Recycled, Biodiesel, Aviation, Fuel distribution & refuelling, Oil waste, Industrial Waste, Biofuel, Vehicles
Sectors: Energy, Waste/Pollution, Power and fuel generation, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Based on a life-cycle assessment, Refuel the Future's fuel can reduce emissions by 90% or more as compared to conventional jet fuel or diesel fuel;Refuel the Future's fuel is approved for blends up to 50%, however it has been tested successfully at 100%;By displacing fossil fuels, carbon reduction are expected to reach 244,000 MT per year at one facility;90% reduction of CO2 emissions compared to fossil jet fuel;Refuel the Future's feedstock will be 100% waste resources and off-spec oils, eliminating the need for these resources to end up in landfill and avoiding competition with food supply;
The Financial benefits: 20% cheaper than fossil jet fuel in 2024;With a conservative blend mandate, airlines can still save 6% from now to 2050 compared to use of fossil jet fuel;A large airline purchasing $1 Billion per year in fuels could save ~$60 Million per year on average, or $1.5 Billion in total by 2050;
Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: Refuel develops sustainable aviation fuel for major airports to drastically reduce life-cycle CO2 emissions from flying
About:
Refuel is acting on a plan to profitably develop sustainable aviation fuels for major airport hubs at a cost that is competitive with traditional fossil fuels but with a massive ecological benefit. Starting with Toronto Pearson International Airport and to be replicated at other global hubs, the use of sustainable fuels by air transport operators will be key to reducing aviation’s environmental footprint and to meeting ICAO carbon emissions reduction goals starting in the early 2020s.



Refuel takes an industrial ecology approach to maximize resource efficiency and uses society’s waste streams as resource inputs for the production of sustainable aviation fuels and other renewable fuels.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: An electric modular vehicle providing a multi-role, scalable and tailored mobility Solution
Identification: NEXT is a modular electric vehicle offering a number of mobility options, including use as a shared car, taxi, bus, last mile delivery van, a truck for long distances, or an interchange hub for passengers and goods without outdoor transshipment. NEXT is based on 'swarms' of modular electric vehicles, with each module being able to join and detach with other modules on standard city roads. When joined they create an open, bus-like area among modules, allowing passengers to stand and walk from one module to another. Modularity allows 'en-route-transfer' which optimizes system capacity, cuts cost and traffic, increase ubiquity and comfort for the passengers. This Solution not only offers an efficient transport option, but also delivers emission-free mobility for cities.
Looking For: New clients, Funding, Partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesTransportersTrucks & Other Road Vehicles
Tags: Electric, Vehicles, Carpooling & carsharing, Public transport, Electric vehicles
The environmental benefits: 60% less distance traveled by the entire fleet to move the same amount of passengers compared to a taxi service;60% to 80% less traffic generated due to the compact form factor and occupancy rate optimisation;60% reduction of CO2 emission per passenger;80% recyclable;
The Financial benefits: Less than 2 years payback time (for a taxi-like scenario);50% - 100% less driver cost due to higher average occupancy rate and driverless option (once permitted);50% less infrastructural cost for charging and parking compared to electric buses;

This green energy production will allow ski resorts to reduce their electricity bills over the year.

Solution on-sentence summary: A p2r process to collect and treat oily residues from ships
Identification: Various oily residues are produced (pipeline cleaning, contaminates, tank bottoms), but most of them come from ships, which ensure 90% of the world merchandise transportation. There is a strict regulatory framework (IMO, MarPol) but its implementation is difficult and costly. To comply with these rules, oily waste producers most often have to pay to have their waste collected and/or treated. It unfortunately still leads to illegal dumping and discharge at sea or in rivers. Buying back these oily wastes is an incentive for producers to get them collected and treated, and helps the collectors to be sustainable. After the water and sediment have been removed, the Petroleum Residue Recycling Unit (P2R unit) then upcycle these residues into several types of new commercial products, compliant with international standards. The distillation scheme, specifically designed in order to treat slops which are variables by nature, involves atmospheric and vacuum distillation in successive steps.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: BusinessServicesInfrastructurePorts and Marine Infrastructure, BusinessServicesWaste & Remediation, BusinessServicesTransportersWaterways & Cargos
Tags: Waste-to-energy & fuels, Oil waste, Cargo ships, Fuel oil, Biodiesel, Recycle waste, Industrial Waste, Biofuel, Vehicles
Sectors: Energy, Waste/Pollution, Power and fuel generation, Manufacturing and construction processes, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: The P2R can offer worldwide port infrastructures, waste collectors (maritime and terrestrial) and ship-owners a cost-effective, environmentally friendly solution that complies with international and EU regulations regarding the treatment of oily residue;The P2R process can divide greenhouse gas emissions by three compared to the traditional process based on crude oil extraction, and helps preserve the raw hydrocarbon material stock. ;Thanks to a financial incentive for waste generators and/or collectors, the process also allows to preserve oceans and rivers;
The Financial benefits: Ecoslops' solution financially benefits vessels and oily waste collectors. Its installation sustains the local collection system, creates new qualified jobs, and enhances local economy.;
Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: Ecoslops is the cleantech that brings oil into circular economy
About: Ecoslops is the cleantech that brings oil into circular economy thanks to an innovative technology allowing the company to upgrade oil residues and used oil into new fuels and light bitumen. The solution proposed by Ecoslops is based on a unique micro-refining industrial process that transforms these residues into commercial products that meet international standards. Ecoslops offers an economic and ecological solution to port infrastructure, waste collectors and ship-owners through its processing plants.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A cost-effective plastic manufacturing technology for recycled and lightweight packaging
Identification: Packaging is used everywhere from to-go food service to FMCG and industry. But, it is having a significant damaging impact on our environment — producing unnecessary greenhouse gases (GHGs) that are causing global warming as well as polluting water and land with waste. Indeed packaging alone contributes 5% of carbon emissions for food production. EcoCore technology will help to solve these pressing environmental problems by making it simple and cost-effective for packaging manufacturers and brands to use more sustainable packaging that is reusable, recyclable and lightweight. The new technology is easy to use and works with existing injection moulding machines as well as tried and trusted polypropylene plastic. EcoCore® can already be found in applications that are in use, or under trial, by well-known organisations across many different sectors — from Waitrose to The NHS and Hay Festival. The technology is patent protected and available for use under licence.

About:
Bockatech EcoCore mouldings feature skin-foam-skin walls formed almost instantly and are used in applications for major sectors from food service to FMCG and industry to healthcare.



Packaging and products made with EcoCore use a combination of innovations — in materials, processes as well as moulding design — and are lightweight, insulated, strong and durable.



EcoCore uses tried and trusted polypropylene plastics, as well as injection moulding processes, in new ways — making safe and reliable mouldings with a minimum of investment in new equipment.



The innovative foamtech is already found in applications in use, or under trial, by well-known organisations across many different sectors — from Waitrose to The NHS and Hay Festival.



Bockatech EcoCore® is patent protected and available for use under licence.

Solution on-sentence summary: A solar module optimized for low-speed electric vehicles, extending their range and battery life
Identification: These small vehicles pose a lot of problems for the environment and to the companies that possess them. Most of them are charged with electricity that has been harvested using non-renewable sources, such as coal and natural gases in the U.S. On top of that, their batteries require regular maintenance due to their short lifetime. This costs a lot of money to the companies and costs a lot to the environment in terms of CO2 emissions. To remedy these problems CAPSolar uses the energy from the sun, which is 100% free and clean, to power the batteries of these vehicles. By doing so we are able to increase the range of these vehicles by about 25% and the life of its batteries by 1 to 3 years. These advantages allow the companies to use their vehicles for longer and spend less money on maintenance, but most importantly, greatly reduce their CO2 footprint.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesEntertainment, Leisure & Art Company, BusinessServicesHotels & Resorts, BusinessServicesInfrastructureAirports and Airbases
Tags: Vehicles, Electric, Solar photovoltaic, Electric vehicles
Sectors: Mobility, Vehicles and vesselsPower and fuel generation
The environmental benefits: The 560W solar module can increase the range of the vehicle by about 25%, which reduces the amount of charging stops;Increases the battery life from 1 to 3 years to reduce the amount of batteries that need to be produced, recycled and/or thrown away;The solar module allows us to save over 290kg of CO2 emissions per vehicle per year;Can save up to 7,200 kg of CO2e during the lifetime of the product;The module is predicted to be 96% recyclable and, interestingly enough, 80% of the solar components (solar cells) can be reused;
The Financial benefits: The customer can save 9,000$ on battery maintenance and charging costs during the lifetime of the vehicle;Offers a 250% higher cost efficiency compared to the closest competitor, which means that more performance is offered at a lower price;Payback time is 2 years and 8 months in North America, which is far less than the average payback time of 8 years for residential solar installations in the U.S;

Organization short description: CAPSolar develops a first-of-its-kind solar module designed exclusively for Low Speed Electric Vehicles.
About:
CAPSolar's vision is to accelerate the world's transition towards cleaner transportation. Its instrument: everlasting Solar Power.



Solar Power is the world's largest source of energy (by far) and we believe that it should be used in all applications possible. Our focus: Mobility.



CAPSolar currently develops a first-of-its-kind, add-on solar module designed exclusively for Low Speed Electric Vehicles (LSEVs), ranging from golf carts to neighborhood electric vehicles used for micro-transit. It will boost their efficiency by extending their range, battery life and by offsetting the infamous parasitic current drain LSEVs are prone to, which will all help in the management optimization of businesses with LSEV fleets.

Therefore Artificial Intelligence based algorithms of Utilit-e allows accelerating the energy transition by reallocating investments on strategic tasks.

The Financial benefits: Access to simulation tools for all DSOs by automating grid model integration and saves 10 k€ for each km of cable digitalized;On a 20 years lifetime, Odit-e will allow to install at least twice more PV production while reducing the cost in asset management by more than 50%;Pay back is made shorter than two years;

Organization short description: Odit-e propose machine learning algorithms able to process metering data to automatically digitize utilities’ networks.
About:
Distribution networks collect productions, serve consumers, and now have to deal with flexibilities, but their behavior is still obscur, leading to oversizings and increased costs.

Managing these flexible networks requires a whole new level of transparency and understanding of their behavior. However, the complexity of distribution networks, especially Low Voltage ones, coupled with the lack of reliable information, make their digitization a real challenge. 

Our unique selling point is to create a digital twin of the network with no other information than the measurements provided by smart meters. 



No network map, no electrical information, no manual effort to model the network. This has been made possible by combining a deep expertise in electrical networks with a broad knowledge of machine learning algorithms.



Our digital twin enable digital simulations and real time visualizations for utilities, and therefore flexible management of their networks, without requiring any effort.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: Optimal energy storage for solar collectors and data centers
Identification:
Energy is wasted all over the world in nearly every thermal energy systems. 20 billion EUR or 250 million metric tons of CO2 equivalent green-house gases could be saved only in Europe with optimal thermal energy storages. Traditional systems store heat by changing the temperature of the water. Instead of water, the Solution HeatTank uses special biomaterials called phase change materials. By changing the phase, like melting and solidification HeatTank can store the energy in a more concentrated way, reducing storage volume by 90%, enabling energy savings of at least 20-50%, with a total return on investment of 3 to 5 years. HeatTank uses eco-friendly bio materials as Phase change materials, as recycled materials from by-products.

Due to the concentrated heat storage, the storage volume is smaller, allowing clients to save more space. In addition, HeatTank can store energy on different temperatures and also increase the efficiency of the energy systems by 20-50% with a 3-5 years ROI. With HeatTank it is possible to generate energy only when it is the most efficient, store it and use it when it is less efficient to produce it.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: BusinessServicesBuildings Operators, BusinessServicesICT Company & Data Centers
Tags: Waste-heat valorisation, TES (thermal energy storage), Recycle waste, Data centers, Building heating
Sectors: Buildings, Heating, cooling and ventilation, Energy storage, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: 90% smaller than the traditional water storages.;HeatTank has huge 200 kW performance in 1 m3;Enables energy savings of up to 20-50%;54 metric tons of CO2 could be saved during the 20 years life cycle;
The Financial benefits: Reduce the operational costs with 20-50%;Total return on investment is 3-5 years;

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);animeo Connect : Facade shading management solution for increased energy savings in buildings (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: The revolution of storing thermal energy. HeatTank can help your business decrease its energy costs by 20-50%.
About:
HeatTank - Thermal Energy Storage



- Thermal Energy when you NEED IT, regardless when you produced it!

- Substantial energy savings (up to 50+%)

- Charge HeatTank as you would a battery.

- Store the cold (or heat) when it's efficient to do so.

- Discharge it and use it when your operations benefit the most. 

- Reduced CO2 emissions

- Reduced Maintenance

- Increased operational security

Solution on-sentence summary: A simple yet ecological shower drain with heat recovery
Identification: The impressively simple Joulia-Twinline technology proves that there is another way. By means of an ingenious heat exchanger module, the heat energy of the used shower water is reused to warm the incoming cold water mains. Thanks to this technology, the cold water arrives at the mixing valve up to 20°C warmer than before (from 10°C up to 30°C). Therefore, substantially less hot water is needed. By this simple means, a 4-person household can save about 1900 kWh per year. Joulia-Twinline is particularly performant in places where many people shower, such as sport centres, gyms, hotels or clinics. A single Joulia- Twinline can generate about as much heat energy as a 15m2 photovoltaic array would produce in one year (1'900 kWh/a). Showering with a clear conscience is thus both ecological and delightful. The sophisticated technology is concealed under a simple stainless steel cover. Because the heat exchanger cover also serves as a trap, the total installation height is comparable to conventional shower drains and can also be used in renovations. The technology is practically instant and cleaning is simple thanks to the easily-removable cover.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Shower, Building heating
Sectors: Buildings, Water, Heating, cooling and ventilation, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: The drain doesn't emit any CO2 in the atmosphere, doesn't use any electric energy, just works by water flow;Save as much energy as 15 m2 of solar panels would have produced, whilst showering;Joulia-Twinline wins up to 60% of the normally lost energy back;Joulia-Twinline can be recycled by almost 100%;No impact on health;
The Financial benefits: Joulia-Twinline saves up to 60% of thermal energy with each warm shower;A 4-person household can recover arround 1'900 kWh per year;
Complementary solutions:
Solar space heating: Solar-powered air heaters and rock bed thermal storage to heat homes 

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);animeo Connect : Facade shading management solution for increased energy savings in buildings (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: How can one shower in comfort while still saving energy? With Joulia, the shower drain with heat recovery.
About:
Joulia SA has been founded in 2010 to commercialize an innovation originally developed at the innovation house Creaholic. The Joulia SA operations team is comprised of an interesting mix of different professions and talents and cut no corners in turning a bold idea into a product with great market potential.



Joulia-Inline and Twinline, the shower drain with heat recovery offers all the comfort and soothes your guilty conscience. With “Joulia-inline” technology, heat recovery is very attractive. This scalable heat recovery module is invisibly integrated into a slim channel in the shower floor, and efficiently recovers heat energy from the warm shower water as it goes down the drain. In this way it provides more comfort while using less energy.

Solution on-sentence summary: A scale inhibitor made from plants, replacing petroleum-based substances in industrial water treatment
Identification: The teams at ODYSSEE have developed ODYLIFE, first bio-based anti-scaling actives, preserving environmental resources. There are many possible applications, such as cooling towers, steam boilers, closed loops, reverse osmosis and saltwater desalinization, but also the geothermal, detergents, domestic supply water. With ODYLIFE, ODYSSEE is able to produce a natural ingredient endowed with strong properties and extracted using green techniques. ODYLIFE can be implemented at a competitive price, without the need for any investment or technical conversion, as the transition has intentionally been designed to be that simple. More than that, switching to ODYLIFE means taking concrete action to promote a corporate social responsibility policy that is in line with a number of United Nations Sustainable Development Goals. Besides the ecological benefits, this solution ensures complementarity between local industries and regional ecology, with plants and farmers replacing chemical factories.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners
Tags: Biobased, Cooling, Desalination (= seawater purification), Chemicals alternatives, Maintenance and inspection
The environmental benefits: 300% more biodegradable: ODYLIFE analyses yield outstanding results compared to polyacrylates, one of the primary alternatives in use today.;0% harmful substances: aquatic organisms can tolerate higher doses (at least 10 times more), with no adverse effects. As a result, ODYLIFE is not considered to be a dangerous substance under Regulation (EC) No 1272/2008.;€0 investment required to implement ODYLIFE. ODYLIFE has been designed to be a “plug and play” solution, to replace current solutions.;98% fewer CO2 emissions: as shown in the LCA, the emission of CO2 equivalent associated with climate change is very low. ODYLIFE represents a 98% reduction, compared to traditional phosphate-based treatments.;50% fewer non-renewable resources are needed to produce ODYLIFE than phosphate. Consumption today is primarily linked to fuel for agricultural machinery, transportation and manufacturing processes. As ODYLIFE production grows, it is clear that economies o;75% less water consumption: our extraction process is nearly solvent-free, mainly using the water contained in the raw materials, which explains the resulting water consumption levels that are three times lower than for polyacrylates.;
The Financial benefits: The break-even point is instantaneous. When sold at the market price, ODYLIFE offers positive externalities that make ODYLIFE even economical.;€0 investment required, as ODYLIFE’s formulas demand no special equipment.;
Complementary solutions: REM: A novel acid regeneration system for steel pickling (Waste & Pollution,Water,Industry & Consumer Goods);E.S.T.: An intelligent robot-based system for automatic extraction, treatment and packaging of sediments (Waste & Pollution);ECOSOFTT: A suite of solutions to allow underserved communities to manage their water resources (Buildings & Shelters,Waste & Pollution,Water);BIO DISPERSIS LC: Recycle vinasse, a polluting residue from the alcohol industry, into organic additives for concrete (Waste & Pollution,Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description: Designs and manufactures sustainable high-performance industrial water treatment solutions.
About:
We design and manufacture a full range of chemical formulations to treat cooling towers, steam boilers and closed loop systems, focusing on reducing production costs, saving energy and water, at limited product consumption, minimizing our environmental foot print.



After 14 years of existence, ODYSSEE Environnement is organized with 4 sites in France: One manufacturing plant including our Research and Development Laboratory in Requeil 72, one Service Department with two local offices in Paris and Lyon - The Export Management and the Executive Committee based in Paris and Lons.



ODYSSEE Environnement supports positive initiatives, for example by sponsoring the Tokyo 2020 Paralympic triathlon, by signing the Act4Nature. We were proud winning the innovation grand PRIX ENTREPRISES & ENVIRONNEMENT in 2018.



Nowadays, ODYSSEE, it is more than 70 people dedicated to industrial water treatment, used to work with disruptive technologies as already proven by the success of our Film Forming Product (FFP), another specificity of ODYSSEE recognized throughout the world. Rather than treating large amount of water, the FFP focus on what is essential: metal surfaces. Coating all of them, the FFP comes up with a very good corrosion inhibition and shows further benefits as, a very low dosing rate, a cost-effective price, energy saving, low environmental impact. The market is huge, greater than 5 billion €uro. Thank to those FFP, being a symbol of innovation, inventiveness, ODYSSEE Environnement has come a long way in a short time.



Lately, our international growth, setting up a distribution network over 28 countries in the world, in Europe, in north, central and south America and Africa, allows us to set up two subsidiaries, one in Germany and the other in Mexico.



ODYLIFE is our latest flagship innovation. It is used to avoid scaling into all industrial water system. It participates greatly to the development of the green economy, the carbon-light economy as well as the circular economy: all the majors news economical tendencies.



Made from renewable resources, ODYLIFE avoids uses of harmful substances (phosphates or polyacrylates, chemical synthesis from petroleum sources).



Our objective is to replace those existing solutions relying on mining and fossil resources with an environmentally friendly solution.



Thus, switching to ODYLIFE means having a Responsible Consumption and Production in line with some of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and ISO 26000. It is undertaking a concrete action promoting Corporate Social Responsibility policy.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Small water turbines to produce energy in drinking water or irrigation networks
Identification: The turbines can reach up to 25kw and they can be installed at any point of the water network as long as there are a circulating flow and pressure available. The generated energy can be used for self-consumption in any nearby installation (pumping station, treatment plant, etc) or directly sold to a local or national grid. The crew behind this solution will help users to evaluate the energy potential, calculate the economic payback and give support during the installation process including, if necessary, a commissioning service on the field for first start-up of the system. This solution offers grid-tied and off-grid solutions based on battery charging turbines. Thanks to this technology, it is now possible to generate energy with a turbine instead of wasting it in heat and noise in a valve.

Organization short description: Water turbines specifically designed for power generation in water networks
About:
Powerturbines is a pioneer company in the application of PAT (pumps used as turbines) for power generation in water networks.

Our patented technology, result of years of research and development, allows us to be at the forefront of an emerging sector such as distributed microgeneration, where any energy resource, no matter how small, is used to support the electrical system. In this sense, the water distribution networks represent an opportunity that has barely been exploited and with a high generation potential.

Powerturbines has an extensive and experienced team in mini-hydraulic installations since 2013 that can help you to define the ideal place to locate the equipment inside the installation, as well as to provide support during the execution of the project. Additionally we can provide a commissioning service direct on place to check the correct equipment installation and put the turbine to work.

Our turbines can be installed in drinking water networks, irrigation networks or for energy production with ecological flow in rivers or dams.

Basically the turbines can be installed in any place with a differential pressure and a circulating flow.

Solution on-sentence summary: Online marketplace where renewable energy consumers and producers directly connect and exchange
Identification: This solution provides a flexible, online marketplace, where consumers and producers of renewable energy can interact directly with each other. Using a real-time proof-of-origin procedure, electricity is tracked from source to destination. The marketplace supports all aspects of electricity retailing. It covers the full user-journey from sign-up to contract signature, from automated meter reading to billing. Smart-grid components can be integrated into the solution to support different use-cases. For instance, using the customers own PV electricity to charge an electric vehicle or demand-side response to reduce grid congestion. Possible applications include for instance household energy retailers looking to deploy a marketplace as a white-label solution to engage with their consumers, diversify their portfolio, manage prosumers and improve their transparency or corporate retailers looking to supply a 24/7 verifiable green energy solution to satisfy the sustainability goals of their business clients.

We game change the way businesses and households get renewable energy.

Solution on-sentence summary: A self-learning box to monitor solar installations and optimize domestic hot water tank management
Identification:
One of the key issues to for the development of domestic solar energy is intermittency of the production, combined with a variable intra-day price of electricity. Management of the domestic hot water tank is a typical example. 



Box Meteoptim monitors solar home installations and optimizes self-consumption of locally produced energy. This smart box, connected to your solar installation allows you to 1) check out, day after day, that the solar production is in accordance with the day's weather, and alerts you on your smartphone in the event of a problem; and 2) to control the electric supply of your hot water tank, ensuring that it is maximally heated by the sun, and that your particular needs are fulfilled. Indeed, hot water tank is not only a major home consumption item, it is also the first storage device of each house's energy. Its algorithms use weather forecasts and rely on Artificial Intelligence, making the Solution compatible with solar thermal, photovoltaic or hybrid panels, whatever the manufacturers, and automatically adjust to the family's hot water consumption's habits. Increasing by 30% your self-consumption of solar energy, this easy-to-install box ensures the profitability of your solar investment.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Sensors & monitoring, Algorithms & AI, Solar Thermal, IoT, Solar photovoltaic, Building heating, Smart-buildings

The Financial benefits: Cumulate savings of 2300 € on your electricity invoice, on 20 years, compared to a standard solar water heater;Cumulate savings of 3500 € on your electricity invoice, on 20 years, compared to a standard PV installation in self-consumption;

Organization short description: METEOPTIM develops a monitoring and optimization box for thermal, PV or hybrid solar installations, to maximise autonomy
About:
In a context of development of self-consumption of solar energy, our conviction is that the use of weather information is an important lever, making it possible to manage energy consumption more smartly.



The first product – under development – is a box connected to the domestic hot water tank. Powered by solar or non-renewable auxiliary energy (electricity, fuel, gas, etc.), it is in fact the first energy storage device in the home. Restricting the use of auxiliary energy to just what is necessary, taking into account the consumption patterns of the home and future solar gain, can reduce the needs not covered by the solar installation by up to 30%.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy

Solution on-sentence summary: Contact technology for energy reduction in industrial environments
Identification: The DECONTACTOR, is a connector which combines the advantages of a power socket with the performance of a switch. The socket-outlet has an integrated switching function and spring-loaded, silver nickel-tipped butt style contacts. The technology, as well as the superior quality of materials, result in a CO2 footprint reduction of 5,7 times more energy-efficient than a standard pin and sleeve product. The use of a machine or other equipment produces heat, and therefore energy - the goal is to limit it. With regard to industrial electrical socket outlets, several factors must be considered including heating due to the passage of the current, thermal cycle linked to multiple "start & stop" or manoeuvres - rorrosion resistance.  The DECONTACTOR™, has been developed to meet these criteria, with limited contact heating and better compensation of the thermal cycle.

Organization short description: The MARECHAL® Electric Group counts among the major players of innovative low voltage electrical connection systems.
About:
Founded in 1952, MARECHAL® Electric, a family owned business, has specialized in the manufacture of low voltage electrical connectors. 



The product offering ranges from 5A to 700A, including electrical solutions for potentially explosive atmospheres.



With our operational and/or sales subsidiaries in Europe, America, Asia, the Middle East, Africa and Australia, we are able to offer the best products and local services to the most demanding customers. 



A workforce of nearly 500 worldwide includes R&D, manufacturing and commercial development.



TECHNOLOGY

The MARECHAL® patented butt contact technology, is up to 5.7 times more energy efficient than the industry standard.   The design limits heating and stabilises the thermal cycle and is designed in accordance with the requirements of the European Low Voltage Directive (LVD no. 2014/35/EU since April 20, 2016).



SAFETY: OUR CORE VALUE

Each and every one of the products, decisions, developments made by our R&D department, are made with the safety of end users as a priority. Our compliance with all major safety standards and our commitment with IEC and IECEx ensure the quality and the performance of our technology.



VALUE CREATION: OUR STRENGTH

Listening to your needs is our first objective to define, improve, adapt,

customize and make sure our solution matches as closely as possible to your expectation.

MARECHAL® Electric invests 5% of annual turnover into R&D creating several thousands of new part numbers annually to ensure that we meet our customers needs.



ECO FRIENDLY: BECAUSE WE ONLY HAVE ONE PLANET

MARECHAL® Electric solutions show measurable return at all stages of the products lifetime with the key benefits being:



Energy Saving

Cost Saving

Less Cooling Required

Reduced Carbon Foot Print

Complementary Dual Voltage Construction 



The first electrical connector that makes you go green!

Solution on-sentence summary: Solar blinds to reduce your carbon footprint and cut energy bills
Identification: Although most of the solar panels need to be installed on the roof, the majority of us live in a city building with little to no access to the roof. On top of that, most of the "green energy" from utility companies is never 100% green. The energy you get at home will always remain a "grey" mix of both mainstream & renewable energy. To tackle this challenge, Plug & Play Rollable Solar Panel offers the possibility to use the window's surfaces to harvest solar energy. The Solution is a smart solar blinds system that allows anyone to cut their energy bills by up to 50% while getting closer to carbon neutrality. The Solution is connected to an App, enabling users to set a schedule to deploy or retract the blinds. Each stripe has also a sun tracking feature inspired by the Sunflower movements to increase the energy efficiency output by at least 20%.

Solution on-sentence summary: Enabling smart worksites and underground infrastructure management
Identification: Every minute in the United States and every 6 minutes in France, a buried pipe is damaged by an excavator for an overall cost of more than €25,000 / damage. These events are due to inaccuracies in plans combined with the fact that underground networks are difficult to visualise. To solve this issue, Syslor applications and antenna, capture, map in 3D and visualize in augmented reality buried pipes, at any time with centimetric accuracy. This digitization process of the underground is helping utility operators, public works companies and industrial to achieve works more safely, accurately and efficiently, at a lower cost while saving carbon emission and avoiding casualties. Syslor services include the automatic conversion of plans and their permanent availability in augmented reality, creation of as-built 3D plan from a video taken with a smartphone, guidance to the point/lines to implement, and the automatic update of real locations of manholes, power boxes, etc... Syslor aims to revolutionize buried pipes management to make it safer, better, cheaper and greener!
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Underground, Road, Street, Software, Sensors & monitoring
The environmental benefits: 40 to 50% faster drawings for mandatory marking picketing;A smartphone, internet plus an antenna are the only prerequisite to use Syslor solutions;Visualization of buried pipes in augmented reality available 24/7;9 tons of carbon emission equivalent saved per workroad;Drop from 10 to 30% of damages to buried utilities;
The Financial benefits: 6 months ROI for direct benefits of Syslor solutions;Sales price 4 to 6 times lower than any other such device filling the same goals on the market;
Complementary solutions: FutureproofedCities: Horizontally integrating climate action plans (Infrastructures);aREAL®: A platform for digitising inner-city development potential (Infrastructures);Colouree: An Ai and location intelligence web platform for a people-centric rating of urban contexts (Buildings & Shelters,Infrastructures);Urban Heat Vulnerability Map: A map highlighting the vulnerability of urban areas to extreme heat (Infrastructures);
Organization short description:
Faster, safer, cheaper and greener ! 

Syslor centimetric digital solutions lead you toward easy buried pipes management
About:
Every minute in the United States and every 6 minutes in France, a buried pipe is damaged by an excavator for an overall cost of more than €15,000 / damage.



There are two reasons for this waste of money :

- The unreliability of the plans

- Networks are not visible



At Syslor, we have invented two solutions that solve both problems:



For the visualization of buried networks, for instance, from Enedis pipes plans, we have modeled 8 * 8 km of buried pipes in Augmented Reality, put them in the cloud, so that they can now visualized in Augmented Reality on a smartphone with a centimeter accuracy.



When Enedis wants to modify a new pipe, they simply take a video of the new pipe, send it to us and we make an as-built 3D plan and a digital twin of the pipe and its location, then we update the Augmented Reality model in the cloud and in the client's Geographic Information System.



Our added value: Faster, more reliable, greener and cheaper!
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: Fuel-efficient biomass cookstoves for sustainable living in sub-saharan africa
Identification:
Brun products provide consumers with a cost-effective solution to the issues presented by traditional cooking methods. With the fastest-growing population on earth, Africa will require the proliferation of millions of improved cookstoves to avoid catastrophic environmental and health impacts associated with the inefficient use of biomass resources.

The use of Jikokoa contributes to significant savings of time (both for cooking and fuel procurement) and money which can be utilized for other needs like education, healthcare, and income-generating activities. In Kenya, a family saves on average $96/year, which is equivalent to a monthly average salary in rural Kenya. Jikokoa contributes to the reduction of indoor air pollution (smoke, particulate matter, and carbon monoxide), resulting in a decrease in respiratory diseases, headaches, and itchy eyes. One Jikokoa reduces greenhouse gas emissions by up to 4.46 tons of CO2 per annum and therefore helps to combat climate change.

BURN Manufacturing designs, produces and distributes Africa’s best-selling, most durable and economical charcoal and wood clean cookstoves. Not only do our products save money, fuel and natural resources, but they also dramatically reduce harmful indoor smoke emissions which can cause significant health problems, even death.  



With more than 800,000 stoves sold since commencing manufacturing operations in 2013, BURN has established itself as Africa’s most trusted cookstove brand thanks to our unwavering commitment to innovative research and design, manufacturing excellence, and customer care.



BURN manufactures its products in sub-Saharan Africa’s only state-of-the-art clean cookstove manufacturing facility. Solution on-sentence summary: Hardware as a service for sustainable electronics
Identification: The electronics industry generates a huge amount of negative externalities, from the mines to the products' end-of-life. Many studies showed that most of these impacts occur during the product birth and death. Thus the first priority is to reduce the number of electronic devices made and sold. However, this is not viable for companies that rely solely on the sale of these devices. There is therefore a need for another business model: Hardware as as Service (HaaS). Commown is a French Société Coopérative d’Intérêt Collectif (SCIC) that supports fair and sustainable electronics by providing HaaS services with devices designed to be repaired and to last longer. The service includes providing smartphones, computers, headphones and managing repairs  beyond the manufacturer warranty, with a monthly subscription. Commown uses easy-to-repair devices and offers customer support to fix devices when issues occur. In doing so, this service extends product lifetime, reduces material waste, and offers a cost-effective option for smartphones and other electronics.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility
Tags: Reusable, Electronic waste, Maintenance and inspection, Repair, Service, Industrial Waste
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Waste/Pollution, Sell and trade, Solid waste management

The Financial benefits: Cost of all breakages and repairs are covered in subscription fees;Commown offers a 40% price reduction for the smartphone contract after 2 years if the customer keeps the device;

Organization short description: Commown provides long term leasing solutions with services (HaaS) of the most ecological and ethical electronic devices.
About: The electronics industry generates a huge amount of negative externalities, from the mines to the products end-of-life. Many studies showed that most of it stems from the product birth and death. Thus, the first priority is to reduce the number of devices made and sold. However, this is not viable for companies that relies solely on the sale of these devices. Hence the need for another business model : Hardware as as service (HaaS). The overall user experience is usually muh improved. On the other side, the company remains the owner of the fleet of devices and has strong interest in providing long lasting and repairable hardware. Solution on-sentence summary: An efficient and affordable vegan protein
Identification: Global consumption needs are driving overexploitation, with the global consumption of natural resources increasing over 190% in the last 150 years. Yet, in 2017, 1 in 9 people in the world were undernourished. By 2050 the world will need to produce 70% more calories to bridge to bridge the food gap to feed 9.7 billion people. Noblegen Protein is a vertical fermentation Solution using Euglena gracilis, a microorganism, to upgrade its own biology to create an efficient closed-loop solution. Noblegen is working towards their goal of creating a microbially driven process that leads to the mass production of complete, non-animal and affordable protein from locally sourced starch inputs such as corn and cassava. The potential to produce protein from starch could transform regions of the world that are typically undernourished while simultaneously addressing major global challenges such as deforestation caused by industrial agriculture and the overuse of water, land, and energy.

Tags: Biobased, Organic, Ingredient, Protein alternative, Microorganisms

Organization short description: A food technology company leveraging microorganisms to address environmental and nutritional challenges
About:
Noblegen studies the natural genius of Euglena, a complex, single-celled microorganism, and uses the novel discoveries to collaborate with and empower each cell to upgrade its own biology.



Euglena contains both animal and plant genes which means that with our advanced understanding of the microorganism, we can efficiently produce protein, carb, and oil ingredients in a closed loop. This means that we have the ability to make a transformational difference on water usage, land usage and greenhouse gas emissions compared to the production of traditional plant and animal ingredients.

Solution on-sentence summary: A viable solution to water supply- and sanitation problems in informal settlements
Identification: With the Zerho, the faecal matter as well as the urine, are contained and offers the users a high level of hygiene. By not flushing, one person saves on average 7000 litres of potable water per year. When a dry toilet is designed and constructed in such a way that the faeces receptacle can be quickly and easily emptied with minimal risk to human health, the biggest operational and maintenance problem associated with these toilets will be obviated. When the excreta can also be productively and safely used for fertilizing crops and improving poor soils, the technology will become even more attractive. This is what the Zerho Toilet offers.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Organization short description: The Zerho Waterless Dehydrating Toilet is sludge-free; safely containing solid human waste until dry and pathogen-free.
About:
The Zerho Waterless Toilet is a once-off, cost-effective, robust, eco-sanitary product that would serve to replace the Rudimentary Sanitation (traditional pits, VIP- and chemical bucket latrines) used throughout South Africa.  

It is designed for a family of less than ten users per day.  The Zerho is fit-for-purpose in Rural, Peri-Urban, Construction and Emergency applications.



The Zerho Toilet has several elements that sets it aside from other products on the market.  These include:  

•	The Zerho waterless toilet is a small-dimension (160cm diameter x 90cm), off-grid toilet system which enables fast installation and relocation when necessary – saving on time, infrastructure and labour costs.

•	The Zerho waterless toilet system uses no water, additives or chemicals.  With a Urine Diversion toilet pan, there is no faecal sludge.

•	The Zerho waterless toilet system is robust and user-friendly and  has a potential lifespan of  more than 20 years.

•	Very little maintenance on the unit itself is needed due to the robust design. 

•	Odours and moisture are disposed of by effective air circulation  and solar heat onto the unit;  drawing fresh air from the indoor toilet seat section and effectively disposing of odours and moisture via the vent pipe.



The Zerho Toilet has not been tested outside of South Africa - therefore not tested in freezing temperatures.  However, no additives or special steps would be used here either.  Ambient temperatures will always impact the desiccation time;  and the (non-sludge) solid waste is always safely contained. This makes for easy removal and transport when necessary.



The Zerho Implementation Plan incorporates the support of the following Sustainable Development Goals in project communities:



SDG 6 - Clean Water and Sanitation - Mitigating further contamination of underground water sources by traditional pit latrines and open defecation.  The Zerho Toilet offers heightened personal hygiene in a home.



SDG 9 - Industry - Local assembly of the Zerho in the project community; and development of related business activities.



SDG 11 - Sustainability in the Community - Using the Cooperative Principles for development, governance and long-term planning.



SDG 12 - Production & Consumption - Food Security; Agriculture using humanure in soil regeneration.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A natural solution to reduce chemical fertilizer use in the world
Identification: In a 1999 PNAS article, Charles Frink noted that -The increase in fertiliser use associated with increased food consumption has been described as exponential and has raised concerns about water pollution and the resulting methaemoglobinemia and hypoxia. It has also raised concerns about the warming of the greenhouse effect and the alteration of the global nitrogen cycle, and thus of primary production and vegetation diversity. The use of chemical fertilisers is always a necessity, however, for the chemical form that these fertilisers have, they are also biocidal agents, killing certain elements in the soil, such as micro-organisms, which could transform them into elements immediately absorbable by crops. The destruction of these beneficial micro-organisms also creates the conditions for pathogens to develop in the soil, thus increasing the need for polluting plant protection products. All this has a direct impact on productivity and quality, as the entire crop food chain can be affected. Bioma has developed new, completely natural solutions, to be used once a year at the beginning of the agricultural season, which allow the soil microbiology to develop rapidly, within a few weeks, and immediately transform and provide nutritional elements to the crops. The solutions have been shown in several studies to reduce chemical fertilizers by at least 50% while increasing the quality and quantity of production. The theory behind the solution is that when there is a balanced microbiology in the soil that transforms the elements, then 50% of the fertilizer doses are sufficient.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility,
Tags: Microorganisms, Soil and land, Fertilizing
Sectors: Food/Agri, Crops care, Manufacturing and construction processes

The Financial benefits: Increase of gain from crops up to 30%;Up to 40% higher production per hectare while maintaining stable costs;

Solution on-sentence summary: An energy management system to optimize energy efficiency of industries
Identification: It is common for energy systems to suffer inefficiencies regarding energy optimization. In a more particular case, photovoltaic production could be lost or sent to grid when electric consumption is lower than production. SmartEMS is a connected smart box that helps adapting the energy production of several inverters of a photovoltaic installation, taking into account the power consumed by the user. It is thus possible to limit the power injection of the installations when not authorized or when the cost of connection to the network is too high. SmartEMS regulates the active power injected into the grid by controlling the maximum power point (MPPT) of the photovoltaic inverters. Photovoltaic plant operators and managers can have the SmartEMS operating adapter to meet the requirements of each self-consumption installation. This includes the collection of additional consumption points than the control and regulation of third-party consumer equipment, such as heat pumps, charging stations or power regulation components.

Solution on-sentence summary: A control system for photovoltaic power plants enabling ancillary services for the electrical grid
Identification: To accelerate the transition towards a 100% renewable and functional electrical grid, we need to replace by renewables not only the energy but also the ancillary services needed to maintain a reliable and safe operation of the electrical grid. The Solution consists of a control system for PV plant that enables the plant to provide ancillary services. It works by allowing the PV plant to be controlled remotely by the grid operator and to react and adapt power production, electrical grid frequency and voltage avoiding blackouts, failures and damages to the equipment of the consumers. By doing this a PV plant can stabilize the electrical grid guarantee a safe and reliable operation. At the same time, the PV plant can effectively reduce its use of other technologies, such as polluting thermal power plants that currently operates for the sole purpose of providing reliable services to the grid.

Solution on-sentence summary: A platform to produce green heat for industries and cities
Identification: Companies strive to reduce their carbon footprints by introducing renewable energy resource. In order for them to continue to pursue that goal, new renewable alternatives to fossil fuels for industrial processing are needed. With Azteq's CST platform technology, companies can substantially reduce their carbon footprints generated by the mainstream alternative (burning gas). By harvesting the sun's thermal power based on concentrated solar thermal technology, Azteq's expertise helps companies to reach their corporate sustainability goals and ambitions. The CST platform provides high-temperature thermal energy with zero CO2 emission. The parabolic mirrors concentrate solar irradiation on a collector-tube in the focal line, generating temperatures up to 400°C in the collector. The thermal oil running through the collector tube is piped into a heat exchange unit. Depending on the customer application the exchange unit generates steam or heated thermal oil going into the industrial process of the customer. Azteq's business proposition based on a heat-as-a-service model provides a low and stable energy price which is beneficial for stakeholders.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Solar Thermal, Industrial process heat

Solution on-sentence summary: High power, low-cost, energy-efficient plasma torches for industrial applications
Identification: Over 30% of global GHG emissions come from the energy-intensive industry sector, necessitating mitigation options beyond energy efficiency to achieve major reductions. PyroGenesis’ APT-HP presents an environmentally friendly alternative to fossil fuel burners by producing thermal energy from low-carbon electricity for use in industrial applications. The high power of the APT-HP (up to 1 MW) enables a plasma plume exceeding 5,000 C and transformation of materials to valuable products from various industrial and waste materials. The APT-HP offers a lightweight, vortex-stabilized, compact configuration which can be retrofitted into existing installations such as iron ore furnaces and cement kilns, featuring long electrode life, low maintenance, automated operation, and a high level of safety and reliability. When replacing conventional fossil fuel burners, plasma torches potentially reduce operating costs by up to 30% and GHG emissions by about 250 MT CO2e per GW·h when using hydro power.

Solution on-sentence summary: Recycled roof tiles from discarded tires with high durability, stability and insulation
Identification:
Each year 16 thousand tons of solid pneumatic waste are dumped in the final disposal site of waste in the city of Mar del Plata, which is incinerated, buried or thrown into the sea, generating 4 tons of CO2 for each tons of poorly managed tires on average. Pneumatic material is an excellent insulator, withstands all inclement weather and, since it cannot be degraded, its final common disposal solutions are to bury it, to incinerate it or to throw it into different ecosystems. The Solution EcoTiles offers the possibility of reusing these resources, transforming them into rubber tiles.

In this way, it is possible to achieve a sustainable action with positive multi-impacts for the communities carrying it out: no public space is used with containers full of wheels, which later becomes a highly toxic waste if they are incinerated, buried, or thrown it away to the sea or in abandoned properties, with the risk of contamination and insect pests that this entails. In addition, they are given a new use and are turned into tiles, at a lower cost than a traditional roof.

Solution on-sentence summary: Giving new life to copier paper through laser technology
Identification: Paper is a vital everyday product, but requires significant natural and chemical resource to manufacture and produce. Approximately 95% of copier paper is used only once, then downcycled for the production of tissue paper, cardboard and other materials. As a result, virtually all copier paper is produced from virgin tree fibre. REEP aims to extend the lifespan of paper through its innovation Solution: a reusability model for paper. REEP’s Solution is based on laser deinking to completely remove the ink from the page, combined with advanced materials that enable paper re-use. Implemented initially for copier paper, the system allows users to print on the same sheet of paper, again and again, up to 10 times. REEP’s reusability system is the world’s first technology to enable the circular economy model for paper. In comparison to the mainstream option, REEP's reuse model massively reduces the environmental footprint of office paper usage, decreasing carbon emissions, resource consumption and waste generation by over 90%.
