Solution on-sentence summary: A novel, low maintenance technology to keep sharks separated from swimmers and surfers
Identification: The fear associated with shark attacks is causing a sharp decline in beach usage where these accidents frequently occur. SharkSafe Barrier™ (SSB) is the only tested eco-friendly shark specific barrier to protect surfers and swimmers from large sharks. The SSB merges the biomimicry of a thick kelp forest, known to be a natural barrier to some shark species, with large permanent magnets (which overwhelmed sharks' electro-magnetics receptors) to create a shark-deterrent magnetic field. The SSB works 24/7 and is 20 times cheaper to maintain than shark exclusion nets. This novel technology solves problems associated with shark attacks including loss of lives, loss of income for local businesses, and loss of biodiversity in marine ecosystems associated with current sharks culling programs. It thus contributes to the preservation of a healthy ocean ecosystem, while also promoting the sustainable use of ocean resources for economic growth.
Looking For: Network, new clients, visibility, funding, partners, credibility
Tags: Coastal, Marine & Oceans, Saline water, Floating debris
The environmental benefits: No entanglement of non-target species, unlike with nets;Protects people and sharks whilst avoiding culling;
The Financial benefits: Payback in five years thanks to reduced maintenance costs compared to mainstream option;20 times cheaper to operate than shark exclusion nets;
Complementary solutions: IOT flood alert: A smart device-based solution for information, anticipation and alert of flood risks (Water,Infrastructures);Breeze Technologies Environmental Intelligence: Smart sensors for air quality monitoring and improvement (Buildings & Shelters,Infrastructures,Waste & Pollution);Air Pollution Abatement (APA): A smart multiservice platform for air pollution abatement (Buildings & Shelters,Infrastructures,Waste & Pollution);Urban vegetation monitoring: Supporting cities and planners with an inventory of the ecological status of the territory (Infrastructures);
Organization short description: We provide the first effective and nature inspired eco-friendly barrier to protect swimmers and surfers from sharks.
About:
The SharkSafe BarrierTM technology consists of merging two well-known shark deterrent technologies: it bio-mimics the visual appearance of a kelp forest and emits a strong magnetic field. The SharkSafe BarrierTM technology proved to be 100% effective to exclude great white sharks and bull sharks from a food source in all tests conducted. The results of the scientific tests are published in peer reviewed scientific journals (www.sharksafesolution.com/our-product/#publications).

The SharkSafe Barrier concept has been patented in Australia (213350811), Europe (13821175.0), the USA (14/647,646) and Africa (F2016/00959; F2016/00960; F2016/00961; F2016/00962).

Microgreens, leafy greens and herbs are grown in tall production towers at optimal environmental conditions year-round. Our innovations reduce energy use, cut greenhouse gas emissions, and 

produce huge energy and cost savings.

System Specification

This GGI Smart BESS containerized system is designed to fit into 20’ or 40’ standard shipping containers. The 20’ version holds 500kWh of power and the 40’ hold 1 MWh of battery capacity. 

The system consists of:

• multiple LiFePO4 batteries built into standard 19” server racks, 

• a HVAC (Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning) system, 

• a Fire Fighting system, 

• an internal lighting system, 

• a bi-directional Power Conversion System (PCS) 

• an AC/DC distribution capability

• a Smart Switch (Smart Automatic Transfer Switch), used to manage the 

connections to and from the grids and 

renewables to the various loads (Micro￾Grid)

• BMS/System Controller

Solution on-sentence summary: A lightweight solution for air transportation efficiency and emissions reduction
Identification:
TiSeat is the lightest aircraft seat in the World. Made by Expliseat, its patented technology combines high performance materials and innovative solutions to improve transport efficiency with a seat 40% lighter when compared to other certified seats in the aircraft market. 

Certified by the industry, it's the first aircraft seat made from composite. 

Since it's first introduction in 2014, TiSeat are now flying with 15+ airlines worldwide with great feedback and recognized benefits on both revenues and the environment (reduction of fuel consumption and CO2 emissions reduction)
Tags: Lightweight, Manufacturing, Fuel efficiency, Aviation, Vehicles
The environmental benefits: 40% lighter compared to other certified seats in the market;4% of aircraft CO2 emissions reduction on every flight ;
The Financial benefits: Payback from 12 to 16 months considering fuel saving;
Complementary solutions: SeaZen: A 100% autonomous solar boating service with license free self-service access (Mobility);ANTISMOG: An on-demand hydrogen fuel enhancement system for the reduction of air pollution from vehicles (Freight,Mobility);Bound4blue : A novel wingsail system for assisted clean sailing in the maritime transport sector (Freight,Industry & Consumer Goods);Sion: An eco-friendly and low-cost electric car with integrated photovoltaic cells (Mobility);
Organization short description: Expliseat combines high performance materials and innovative design to improve transport efficiency.
About:
Expliseat combines high performance materials like carbon fiber and titanium and innovative design to develop new cutting edge solutions in the transport industry. 



Our solutions offer optimal transport efficiency to our Customers.



In 2013, we have certified the first and only aircraft seat with a primary structure in composite; the TiSeat. TiSeat is the World lightest certified aircraft seat. Starting at 4 kg, the seat is 40% to 60% lighter when compared to other certified aircraft seats in the market.



Our advanced technology is allowing our customers to save 1.5 tons on their single aisle aircraft like the Airbus A320 or Boeing 737 or 500 kg on their regional aircraft like ATR or Dash 8 aircraft.



For more details, the seat is certified according to latest ETSO C127b requirements from EASA (the  European airworthiness agency). Those requirements include 16g dynamic tests that simulate an aircraft accident and Head Injury Criteria (HIC) tests to insure passengers safety. TiSeats are available on Airbus A320, Boeing 737, De Havilland Dash 8, COMAC ARJ21, ATR and Dassault Falcon Jets.



In 2020, TiSeat is flying with 15+ customers worldwide with great feedback and recognized benefits on both revenues and the environment:

*Huge positive impact on fuel saving and environment footprint with more than 400 tons CO2 saving per year per aircraft on Single Aisle aircraft,

*Customizable seat platform selected by low-cost or legacy airlines recognized by Skytrax on short-haul or long-haul operation,

*Use of recycled carbon fiber to reduce the environment footprint,

*One of the lowest direct maintenance cost reported thanks to the extensive use of long lasting materials with no plastic parts,

*First high-density regional aircraft with both ATR at 78 pax and De-Havilland at 90 pax, 4 more pax than previous configuration with no impact on aircraft performance.



Our profitable solutions to protect the environment have been selected by multiple airlines all over the World like SpiceJet in India, Air Tahiti in the Pacific, Porter Airlines in Canada or Cebu Pacific in the Philippines.

Solution on-sentence summary: Zero emission of paint microplastics and grit from surface treatment of industrial, infrastructure and marine assets
Identification: Over its normal life, paint is removed during surface treatment/maintenance. The predominant methods of surface maintenance are open grit blasting and water jet blasting.  They crush old paint into microplastics, and if these microplastics are not collected (and for the most part, with the traditional systems they are not!), those paint microplastics are released into the environment. To tackle this challenge, the Pinovo system delivers a solution that removes paint and rust from corroded steel surfaces, without microplastics emissions. Inside the tools, grit hits the surface to be treated at high speed. The old paint and rust are then sucked back into the system by vacuum, and are kept in a closed loop and not released into the environment. The grit is recycled and reused 10 to 20 times. After treatment, the surface has a superior finish, and is ready for the new coating. In this way, Pinovo's circular system stops the contamination of the oceans with the paint microplastics from traditional open grit blasting and water jet blasting methods, specifically addressing the objectives of SDG14.1.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Funding, Credibility
Target client profile: BusinessConstruction, BusinessEnergy Utility, BusinessWater Utility, BusinessServicesBuildings Operators, BusinessServicesInfrastructureAirports and Airbases, BusinessServicesInfrastructurePorts and Marine Infrastructure, BusinessServicesInfrastructureRoads & Road Traffic Infrastructure, BusinessServicesInfrastructureTrain Stations and Railways Infrastructure, Public Authorities
Tags: Paints, Sand-blasting, Maintenance and inspection, Marine & Oceans, Walls & facades, Cleaning, Construction & demolition waste, Reduce & prevent waste
Sectors: Infrastructures, Industry/Goods, Buildings, Waste/Pollution, Materials and chemicals, Manufacturing and construction processes, Solid waste management

The Financial benefits: Cost savings of up to 60% for customers doing spot blasting and using rope access;Recycling of grit 10 to 20 times reduces grit usage by up to 80%;

Early 2018 its presence as exhibitors at the CES Las Vegas demonstrated its will to export its technological solutions, to confront new markets and thus new challenges. This experience, especially rewarding, also was the opportunity to present the first component of its innovation program, i2M, with its artificial intelligence project dedicated to Mobility, Aiko. 



Mobility Tech Green definitely turns its gaze towards the future and is well aware that the transformation of the mobility market has only begun. With this in mind, the company has announced in september 2018 its innovation programme on three years, Intelligence to Mobility (I2M).

Solution on-sentence summary: A smart and flexible sensor network for waste control in the streets
Identification: Very often we see waste around open containers or lids due to excess garbage or misuse of them. This causes a negative visual impact, odors and possible pandemics. Urban Conectum, a device which is installed on street lamps to deploy telecommunications networks and sensors, solves the waste control in the streets predicting the level of content of waste containers as well as evaluating the state of cleaning of the streets. It transmits the following data to the system: level of filling of each container, cleaning rate of the sidewalks, noise level, CO2 level. It allows you to manage alerts about: upcoming overflows of containers, open lids, fire, vandalism, etcetera. The number of openings and closings is measured. An algorithm predicts the fill level by relating the number of openings to the collected weight. Sends an alarm when the speed and fill level is going to overflow. It also sends an alarm when it detects that the container has been left open. The artificial vision for the control of containers and the level of cleanliness of public roads provides: Optimization of capacity and routes Control of the state of road dirt Optimization of cleaning crews.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Funding, Partners
Tags: Bins, Waste collection, Sensors & monitoring, Software

Solution on-sentence summary: Changes non-recyclable waste into stones for the construction sector
Identification: To tackle this challenge as well as landfilling, Néolithe transforms non-recyclable waste such as municipality waste, construction waste, industrial waste into stones. The Anthropocite, the mineral aggregate produced, can be used as raw material for the construction sector, especially for roadbeds and concrete. The waste is processed by the Fossilizator, a mobile treatment unit in containers that can be deployed easily next to waste production. The Fossilization aims to replace the current waste treatments, incineration and landfills, that generate a lot of CO2 emissions. Highly scalable, the Fossilization technology is cost-competitive when compared with other conventional solutions.

Identification: One billion people and a quarter of all marine life depend on coral reefs, but half of the global reefs are dead and over 90% are on track to die by 2050. The solution consists of a land-based farm capable of potentially supplying an entire nation’s reefs with sufficient capital investment. Coral Vita innovative form of high-tech coral farming supports a for-profit business model to sustain large-scale restoration. Given reefs’ tremendous value, the technology favours the transition of the restoration space into a commercial industry. Implemented restoration projects directly benefit communities by sustaining biodiversity, increasing fish stocks, protecting shorelines from storm surges, boosting tourism, and creating jobs.

Using breakthrough methods to grow corals up to 50x faster while strengthening their resiliency to climate change, we can supply large-scale restoration projects with more diverse, hardier, and affordable coral. Our reef restoration helps protect the biodiversity, communities, industries, and nations that depend on healthy coral reefs for livelihoods and revenue.



Up to one billion people rely on coral reefs for food, coastal protection, and income. But reefs are rapidly dying due to climate change, pollution, and overfishing. Over 50% have died since the 1970s, and 90% are projected to die by 2050. By establishing a global network of land-based farms to grow diverse corals resilient to changing ocean conditions, Coral Vita helps protect the communities, industries, and nations that depend on healthy reefs.

Solution on-sentence summary: A magnetic plug for electric vehicles conductive charging
Identification: PAM! is a magnetic plug that accelerates electric vehicles adoption and reduces the financial and social cost of charging infrastructure thanks to an automated plug-in. The first is a hands-free charging solution, the best charging experience an EV maker can offer: EV drivers do not even have to think about charging their EV, and AVs can charge without human intervention! Solution on-sentence summary: Waterproof heating film providing clean and quiet heat to buildings
Identification:
The effects of climate change and increasing awareness have forced society to reduce the use of fossil fuels such as coal, oil and gas. Reliance on these resources for heating of homes, buildings and industrial processes release carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases into the atmosphere, which are a major contributory factor in climate change. The solution aims at providing a fossil-free, low carbon, energy-efficient, waterproof FAR infrared heating film for quiet, clean, healthy heating of internal and external homes and buildings. The ultra-thin, flexible heating film can be installed on walls, ceilings and floors and can be cut on the graphene mix to accommodate lights, switches and plug sockets. The heating film can be powered by renewable energy or AC/DC low voltage transformers to heat the building fabric and occupants, saving energy and costs. 

Imagine living and working in a space that brings the outdoors indoors and is not only great for your health but also your pocket.

We believe it is about looking to the future and not the past. Finding solutions for social and economic issues, and driving change to help lower our carbon footprint. 

We are a startup company embracing new disruptive technologies. Our vision is to provide a portfolio of solutions which contribute to a lower carbon footprint, address fuel poverty,  and create a range of innovative products designed to disrupt market sectors and challenge the status quo. 

The first product in our portfolio integrates our NexGen nanotechnology to develop the most advanced low resistance, waterproof heating film available. Suitable for use in internal and external projects.

This graphite and graphene base nanomaterial is being used as an innovative heating solution for multiple applications across industry sectors including Construction, Automotive, Marine, Stadiums & Events and Consumer Goods. Using our core technology we work with our clients to develop bespoke solutions for integration into their various projects. 

Our multi-award winning, low resistance heating films have been developed by a team with over 30 years’ experience working within the fields of engineering technology and conductive and resistive inks. 

Ongoing research and development by our pioneering team is driving our nanotechnology forward to meet future challenges. Our company strives to be ahead of the curve and deliver cutting edge solutions to solve tomorrows problems today.

Our company’s long term vision is to collaborate with individuals and organisations that share our vision and ethos, and adopt their solutions into our portfolio.

Solution name: Harvest to Harvest food recovery solution
Solution on-sentence summary: Turning food waste into valuable agricultural products
Identification: Food waste is a global problem. Up to a third of all food gets wasted, ending up in landfills and producing greenhouse gases. According to the UN FAO, if food waste were a country, it would be the third biggest GHG emitter after the USA and China. Food can however be recovered before it becomes waste. The Harvest to Harvest Solution provides a sustainable, profitable and ecologically healthy option to recover food that might otherwise become waste and end up in landfill. The H2H Solution uses a proprietary enzymatic digestion process to recycle food into liquid H2H fertiliser and dried H2H pet food in only a matter of hours. H2H fertiliser improves soil health, feeding plants and beneficial microbial communities, improving plant flowering and fruiting and increasing crop yields. H2H pet food captures the nutritional benefits of perishable fruits and vegetables, meat, fish and prepared foods for greater pet health and wellness.
Looking For: Network, new clients, visibility, funding, partners, credibility
Tags: Organic, Fertilizing, Gardening, Agricultural Waste, Food waste, Municipal Solid Waste
Sectors: Food/Agri, Waste/Pollution, Crops careMaterials and chemicals, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Each commercial scale H2H facility will reduce annual GHGs by 150,000 MT CO2 eq.;Emissions reductions from a commercial scale H2H facility are equivalent to taking 30,000 cars off the road;
The Financial benefits: Enables supermarkets to reduce waste costs by over 20%;Growers can increase crop yields by 10% - 20%, worth over $2,000/acre/year;

We have related innovations, including proprietary organic ammonium and organic potassium products.

Solution on-sentence summary: Production of high-performance polymer foams in an industrial scale
Identification: In order to achieve better insulation performance, conventional insulation materials with greater layer thicknesses are preferred for cost reasons. In areas where space is limited or where special curvatures and shapes have to be preserved for monument protection, expensive high-performance materials such as aerogels are required. This often leads to compromise solutions, so that performance is avoided due to the costs. Sumfoam enables a completely new class of polymer materials by reducing the pore size within the foam by a factor 1000 compared to common foams. It has been proved for the first time that the production of these foams is possible using high-pressure extraction technology with climate neutral foaming agent in an industrial scale at short cycle times. Therefore, this is the first technology that allows an economical large-scale production of polymer based high-performance materials, which additionally influence numerous fields of applications in a positive and sustainable way.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Thermal insulation, Chemicals, Construction materials
The environmental benefits: Reduction of 20-25% CO2-Emissions (compared to Aerogels);2-3 times the performance properties (compared to commodity insulation materials);SUMTEQ-technology reduces the pore size within the foam by a factor 1000 compared to common foams;
The Financial benefits: Reduction of costs up to 50%;

Solution on-sentence summary: A more sustainable aquaculture process to provide the world with healthy Shrimps
Identification:
tru Shrimp is the first commercial-scale, shallow-water indoor shrimp farming technology in the United States. The solution produces superior-quality shrimp through a developed and patented land-based shrimp aquaculture technology. Shrimp grown with this method are traceable, sustainable, and antibiotic-free. By combining disruptive aquaculture technologies with operational expertise, tru Shrimp is capitalizing on shifting market paradigms to disrupt the U.S. shrimp market.

​

Collectively referred to as Tidal Basin™ technology, tru Shrimp deploys three existing patents, one pending patent, and three to-be-filed patents that far exceed the performance of traditional RAS technology to create the most stable and efficient shrimp growing environment in the world. The solution aims to produce the highest quality, most sustainable shrimp in the world using the technological capabilities and overall business model developed within the company.
Looking For: Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Protein alternative, Aquaculture, Traceability, Indoor farming, Ingredient
The environmental benefits: Growth rates 81% better than the best ponds in the world;Survival rates 32% better than the best ponds in the world;Water is reclaimed and reused in the tru Shrimp system;GHG emission rate 69% lower than extensive ponds;GHG footprint of 11.8 kg of CO2 per kg of shrimp, 69% lower than Extensive;Tidal Basin technology reuses nearly 100% of water addressing the world's growing demand for water.;
The Financial benefits: Projected EBITDA of $60+ Million annually with a 4.4 year payback period;Each harbor produces 4.3 million pounds of shrimp and approximately 20,000 pounds of Chitosan;
Complementary solutions: Cycle Feed: Insect-based feed for West African tilapia farmers (Food & Agriculture);Agolin® Ruminant: A plant-based feed additive to reduce enteric methane emissions from ruminants (Food & Agriculture);Afynerie: An industrial scale bio-based chemical technology (Industry & Consumer Goods,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Protifly: An industrial unit to recycle organic waste for a more natural and sustainable food chain (Food & Agriculture);
Organization short description: tru Shrimp challenged standard shrimp practices to bring a cleaner, safer shrimp to your family’s dinner table.
About:
THE NEW STANDARD IN SHRIMP

Located in Balaton, MN, The trū Shrimp Company is the first company to test and validate a true commercial-scale, shallow-water indoor shrimp farming technology in the United States. trū Shrimp developed and employs patented, land-based shrimp aquaculture technology to produce superior-quality shrimp that are traceable, sustainable, and antibiotic-free. By combining disruptive aquaculture technologies with operational expertise, trū Shrimp is capitalizing on shifting market paradigms to disrupt the U.S. shrimp market.

​

REVOLUTIONARY TECHNOLOGY

Collectively referred to as Tidal Basin™ technology, trū Shrimp deploys three existing patents, one pending patent, and three to-be-filed patents that far exceed the performance of traditional RAS technology to create the most stable and efficient shrimp growing environment in the world. trū Shrimp will utilize its technological capabilities and overall business model to produce the highest quality, most sustainable shrimp in the world.



FUTURE GROWTH

Tidal Basin™ technology will enable trū Shrimp to pursue significant market share with the goal of becoming the largest domestic aquaculture producer in the U.S. The company’s integrated strategy is designed to maintain the quality of its product from genetics to consumption. While the company’s Balaton Bay Reef is already producing FDA-approved, market-ready shrimp, larger scale harbors will be built in order to meet consumer demand and increase market share.



​



MADISON BAY HARBOR

The first planned harbor complex will be built in Madison, SD. The Madison Bay Harbor Complex and subsequent Harbors will include:

A Hatchery focused on genetics and reproduction

A water reclamation system to ensure responsible water use

A series of Tidal Basins™ for shrimp to grow and thrive until they are market ready

Saltwater created on-site, which is then cleaned and reintroduced into our system

A commitment to exceeding state and local regulations related to water stewardship





The Madison Bay Harbor Complex will positively impact the local economy both during its construction and in the future. During the 18-24-month construction period:

At its peak, 800+ construction employees

Over $100 million in annual economic impact*





Once fully operational:

Over $40 million in annual economic impact*

Creation of an estimated 150 jobs upon facility launch

Competitive pay within the region

Company benefits including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)



​*Based on estimates from an Extension Study by the University of Minnesota
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Complementary solutions: SeaZen: A 100% autonomous solar boating service with license free self-service access (Mobility);ANTISMOG: An on-demand hydrogen fuel enhancement system for the reduction of air pollution from vehicles (Freight,Mobility);Sion: An eco-friendly and low-cost electric car with integrated photovoltaic cells (Mobility);EP Tender: A range extending service for electric vehicles (Mobility);
Organization short description: Providing a better understanding of batteries, to eliminate one of the main obstacles in our ecological transition.
About:
WE UNDERSTAND THAT...



Today, there is a strong desire in both politics and industry—motivated by growing climate and health concerns—to make an ecological change in the way we live.

However, despite financial and tax incentives, consumers are still reluctant to embrace greener solutions, such as electric cars or home solar power systems.

Many are worried about adopting green energy solutions due to doubts about electricity consumption and the reliability of batteries.

The use of electric vehicles, for example, raises serious concerns about battery life and the quality of used batteries.



OUR GOALS



Our aim is to speed up this crucial green revolution by offering tools especially designed to meet the needs of businesses and individual consumers, in order to reassure them and convince them to adopt a greener lifestyle.

In addition, we wish to contribute to the development of new battery technologies, thanks to our unique technical expertise in battery performance.



OUR SOLUTIONS



In house, we develop advanced technical expertise related to lithium-ion battery performance and to the changes in the way batteries are used in the real world, thanks to a Machine Learning model derived from data collected directly in the marketplace. This approach is both unique and innovative, since the results are based on how batteries are actually used, as compared to the vast majority of experiments today, in which lab conditions are greatly removed from reality and thus skew the results.

In addition, we create services and products based on this expertise, for individuals and businesses alike, in response to their specific concerns. These services allow us to obtain the necessary data to improve our Machine Learning algorithms.
SDG’s of application: SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: Onsite elimination of waste activated sludge into food for microbes
Identification: The MicroPoP technology focusses on the common and costly waste to dispose of from microbial waste water treatment processing called WAS (waste activated sludge), which is excess waste bacteria to be disposed of. MicroPoP simply lyses (or pops) 100% of the bacteria in the WAS, better than competitors, thereby making an easy food source for the bacteria back in the aerobic or anaerobic treatment system. The digester or waste treatment system bacteria can easily and quickly eat this new food eliminating the waste in a beneficial manner. MicroPoP can be applied beneficially from both an economic and environmental standpoint at almost every industrial facility that uses microbial wastewater treatment processes and that produces WAS. The savings that can be achieved over what is done today can be re-applied to other social purposes.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile:
BusinessManufacturingBeverages, BusinessManufacturingChemicals & Pharmaceuticals, BusinessManufacturingFood Products, BusinessManufacturingPaper Products
, BusinessManufacturingPetroleum & Coke Products
, BusinessWater Utility
Tags: Recycled, Microorganisms, Anaerobic digestion, Industrial wastewater, Activated sludge, Waste treatment, Water & Wastewater treatment
The environmental benefits: MicroPoP simply lyses (or pops) 100% of the bacteria in the waste activated sludge;Enables savings of 90% of polymer use;
The Financial benefits: MicroPoP has a 1.5 to 2 year payback;provides 3X plant throughput capacity, and is one tenth cost of equivalent;
Complementary solutions: REM: A novel acid regeneration system for steel pickling (Waste & Pollution,Water,Industry & Consumer Goods);E.S.T.: An intelligent robot-based system for automatic extraction, treatment and packaging of sediments (Waste & Pollution);ECOSOFTT: A suite of solutions to allow underserved communities to manage their water resources (Buildings & Shelters,Waste & Pollution,Water);BIO DISPERSIS LC: Recycle vinasse, a polluting residue from the alcohol industry, into organic additives for concrete (Waste & Pollution,Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description: MicroPoP destroys waste microbial sludge from wastewater treatment plants that serve cities and some industries
About:
MicroPoP uses a proven mechanical device to lyse (or pop) bacteria in waste activated sludge (WAS), a waste by-product from municipal and some industrial wastewater treatment plants (WWTPs), eliminating WAS for costly dewatering and disposal.  



MicroPoP lyses microbial cells using a high pressure homogenizer, a proven industrial machine that has been used in food processing for decades.  This cell disruption converts WAS into a readily available food source to produce biogas by anaerobic digestion, and/or formation of carbon dioxide gas by aerobic co-digestion with in-coming wastewater in the WWTP' aerobic treatment system.



MicroPoP provides the following operational, environmental, and economic benefits:

•	Destruction of WAS by aerobic activated sludge treatment and/or by anaerobic digestion, so dewatering and disposal of WAS is no longer needed.

•	Significant savings in operating costs and capital costs for sludge management at WWTPs.

•	Reduced GHG emissions through less truck hauling, less sludge to degrade to methane upon disposal, lower polymer use, and biogas displacement of fossil fuels, helping cities achieve carbon neutral and climate action goals.

•	Less residual solids (only primary solids remain) for handling, processing, and disposal, and therefore less reliance on landfills, incinerators, or land application.

•	Increased biogas production by double or more by anaerobic digestion, increasing energy self sufficiency for WWTPs.

•	Reduced treatment time for anaerobic digestion, increasing the digester capacity by three times, so fewer or smaller digesters are needed.  This avoids high capital costs to build additional anaerobic digesters and to increase capacity for sludge handling, thickening, storage and transport.

•	By liquefying secondary WAS, MicroPoP reverses WWTPs' effect of concentrating pharmaceuticals, metals and PFAS in sludge.

•	Small and modular equipment can be retrofitted into the available footprint of most wastewater treatment plants.

•	Phosphorus removal with a technology called MagPi as a simple add-on. MagPi became available one year ago.

•	Ammonia nitrogen removal with a technology called Misty as a simple add-on.  Misty became available about 6 months ago.

•	MicroPoP minimizes costs to process WAS and extracts value from waste in the form of biogas for renewable energy and nutrients for sustainable agriculture.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

We use  proprietary magnesium based , fire rated, non toxic, low-carbon cementitious building materials and pre-fabricated panels ( SIP style) to construct commercial and residential buildings. Our ZS2  pre-fabricated TechPanels  have a minimum 1 hour fire rating , are resistant to mold/mildew/bacteria/viruses, and are thermally superior to all forms of conventional construction or concrete type structures.  In addition, our materials have no off-gassing, a low carbon footprint and stand the test of time, even in the harshest of conditions.  



 ZS2 TechPanels are flat-packed and shipped to site, where the external envelope ( basement, walls, roof) is assembled on a prepared foundation in record time.  On average, utilizing Zs2 TechPanels and building a SIP type of structure reduces the construction time of the building envelope by 50-70%.  In addition, because our structures are engineered and designed for  SIP panel construction, there is little to no waste on the job site. 



With the current COVID pandemic and history showing that conventional/modular construction using traditional building materials is neither healthy, sustainable, safe or thermally efficient, we believe its time for a change.  ZS2 is committed to  researching, developing and manufacturing superior materials combined with digital technology to achieve resiliency and longevity in construction.

Solution name: Internationally scalable waste anaesthetic capture and recycling system
Solution on-sentence summary: Efficiently capture volatile anaesthesia agents and aims to protect healthcare workers
Identification: Volatile anaesthetic drugs are widely used with a global annual turnover of $1.3bn. The drugs are expensive to produce, in monetary and environmental terms. In practice, once exhaled by patients the drugs are vented to atmosphere. This is very damaging to the environment, contributing a huge 3.1 million tons of CO2 equivalents a year. SageTech’s solution prevents this atmospheric discharge, collects the exhaled drug, and re-purifies it, fit for human re-use. Drug metabolism is low, around 5%, so recovery yields are very high. The solution deploys a system of collection and purification that has sustainability at its core. Working with our pressure systems keeps instruments compact and no organic solvents are used in our process. SageTech’s solution offers large financial savings on hospital infrastructure installations and maintenance costs by eliminating the need for expensive air extraction systems to take the exhaled drugs from the operating theatres to the chimney.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Medical & hygienic, Gaseous waste capture, Hazardous waste, Industrial Waste
The environmental benefits: Prevents release of 3.1Mt CO2-eq per year;
The Financial benefits: Eliminates the need for expensive air extraction systems;Substantial financial savings on hospital infrastructure installations and maintenance costs;50% saving versus current environmental damaging infrastructure;

Improving its carbon footprint is, therefore, a significant challenge, with a targeted effort on heating, which accounts for 75% of the emissions. This is a global issue as most developed countries display similar patterns. ACCENTA invented a low-carbon heating and cooling system that reduces up to 95% of the CO2 emissions compared to standard solutions. It relies on inter-seasonal geostorage and waste heat, from air-conditioners or low-carbon solar heat, produced during summer and stored into the ground. In winter, heat pump's yields are optimized by up to 50% using the stored heat, drastically cutting both energy consumption and CO2 emissions.

Solution on-sentence summary: An electrical power converter to transform solar dc to ac power for water pumps
Identification:
The solar pump drive technology addresses the challenge of making water available when and where required even in remotest locations which do not have access to AC Grid Power to run a pump motor. With more than 40,000 solar pump drives installed across the world, Solar Pumping technology is a scalable solution which can address the demand of providing water when and where it is required, thus using clean energy for a sustainable life. ACQ80 enhances methodology of water pumping by putting the sun to work for all water pumping needs, without energy costs and Zero CO2 emissions. 

Compared to diesel generator pumps, the ACQ80 is environment friendly, with a long lifetime and low maintenance cost when running on solar power. Typical applications are irrigation, community water supply, fish farming and agriculture.

Built-In MPPT functionality ensures the best output possible from your solar panel and extract maximum water flow from your pump throughout the day.

Identification: This solution is a new and sustainable plasticizer, a key component of flexible plastics, which is biobased and biodegradable. Plasticizers are common components of plastics in everyday use and in industrial applications (such as phthalates). The main issues of plasticizers used today include a high risk of spreading into water, ground and atmosphere, becoming pollution as VOC while affecting human and animal health. To tackle this challenge, Cereal Docks developed a Bioplasticizer which is safe, plant-based, biodegradable and environmentally friendly. Technically, Cereal Docks Bioplasticizer is included in plastic compounds, which are produced at large scale, and then transformed by manufacturers into final products. Thanks to Cereal Docks highly scalable innovation, Bioplasticizer' users will be able to cope with future, more stringent regulations related to the use of plastics.

Organization short description:
Today, the demand for healthy, genuine foods and increasing health and wellness needs mean that the agro-industrial sector must provide consumers with safe, traceable products processed sustainably, with transparent and certified quality standards.



To meet the changing needs of the consumer, the Cereal Docks Group has established three objectives:



To process agricultural raw materials and ingredients and components with more added value



To generate innovation, thanks to research and development of new solutions, products and possible applications, based on a circular economy model



To be an inclusive company that acts responsibly towards people, communities and the environment
Headquarters: 36043 Camisano Vicentino, Province of Vicenza, Italy
About:
Cereal Docks is an Italian industrial group operating in the feeds and foods primary processing sector, producing ingredients including meals, oils and lecithin, derived from oil seeds (soy, sunflower and rapeseed) and grains (corn, wheat, barley) intended for applications in the foods, pharmaceutical, cosmetics, animal feeds, technical and energy sectors.



With 6 production facilities and 2 storage centers, Cereal Docks processes over 2.5 million tons of grains and oil seeds annually, with the participation of more than 14,000 agricultural companies in Italy.



The company’s general headquarters is located in Camisano Vicentino (Vicenza), where Mauro and Paolo Fanin founded the company 36 years ago, a shining example of a successful family business.



We are the connecting link between the world of agriculture and the industry close to the final consumer. Thanks to this connection, we transfer the demands of the industrial sector, and therefore those of the final consumer, to farmers, differentiating and enhancing raw materials through our productive processes.



We work together with farmers to create sustainable production chains, thanks to production chain agreements that guarantee tracking from the origin of the product, quality and safety of raw materials and the formation of a virtuous agricultural model, respecting the environment, the work of suppliers and all the players along the chain.



In close partnerships with our customers, we are committed to implementing quality and sustainability in the food and feed production chains, creating innovative products and eco-compatible solutions for human and animal nutrition, the cosmetics and naturopathic sector, and green chemistry.

Organization short description: Green alternative for removing micro-pollutants from water
About: BioStart is positioned in the market for removing chemical and biological micro-pollutants from the aquatic environment. More than 110,000 chemical substances are estimated to be in use within the EU. Some of these substances, micro-pollutants, can have toxic properties at minute concentrations in a given environment (of the order of one microgram per litre in water). The EU Water Framework Directive (2000/60/CE), adopted by the European Parliament and Council in 2000, imposes on member states the requirement to take action to preserve water quality. Our offer: a green alternative for removing micro-pollutants from water that’s more effective, less expensive and adaptable to major players’ existing installations. The challenge : to provide simple, effective solutions to water treatment operators.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation

Solution on-sentence summary: A big data platform for zeroing plastic footprints on the global plastic supply chain
Identification: Plastic waste from the food retail sector is a huge challenge, both for land and water pollution and for carbon emissions.  MIWA technology aims to minimise waste from the single-use packaging of food, non-food and liquid products. MIWA is a smart reusable packaging, built as an integrated hardware and software solution. MIWA reusable packaging works in tandem with unique electronic dispensers placed in retail and the MIWA information system operating in the Cloud, with the connectivity allowing for near-real-time data flows. MIWA packaging and dispensing shelves are equipped with RFID chips and readers, offering substantial opportunities to all value chain stakeholders to enhance efficiency and product/consumer safety and outperform the effects of the current single-use dominant approach. Life Cycle Assessment study shows that MIWA can reduce the overall negative environmental footprint by up to 71%, material usage waste by up to 90% and carbon footprint by 46%. Within the first 5 years MIWA plans to prevent up to 20,000 tons of packaging waste while still reaching only a fraction of the EU market.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Tags: Reusable, Consumer-goods, Packaging

MIWA reusable packaging works in tandem with unique electronic dispensers that are placed in retail and the MIWA information system operating in the Cloud, with the connectivity allowing for near-real-time data flows. MIWA packaging and dispensing shelves are equipped with RFID chips and readers, offering substantial opportunities to all value chain stakeholders to enhance efficiency and product / consumer safety and outperform the effects of the current single-use dominant approach. Life Cycle assessment study shows that MIWA can reduce the overall negative environmental footprint by up to 71%, reflecting on packaging waste reduction, but also numerous other factors such as eco-toxicity, fossil fuel consumption, influence on climate change, and water consumption. MIWA in its convenience, hygiene and large scale potential is unparalleled to immature solutions on the market & matches highly rising consumer demand after sustainable packaging.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A new first choice to reduce  energy losses in industrial motors
Identification: Industrial electric motors use one-third of all the world’s electricity, and the number of motors is set to double by 2040. There’s a clear need for more efficient motors to save energy, cut power bills and reduce CO2 emissions. The IE5 ultra-premium SynRM motors offer up to 50% lower energy losses, lower energy consumption than the commonly used IE2 induction motors. Case studies in industrial installations have demonstrated energy savings of up to 25%, depending on the application. The IE5 level of efficiency is made possible by the SynRM design which combines the performance advantages of permanent magnet technology with the simplicity and service-friendliness of an induction platform. To ensure an environmentally friendly design, the permanent magnets do not feature rare earth materials. Additional benefits of the IE5 SynRM motor are lower bearing and winding temperatures for enhanced reliability and long life. The design also creates less motor noise for a better working environment. IE5 SynRM motors can be used in a wide range of demanding industrial applications where they offer accurate control and high efficiency across the whole speed range, even at partial loads. This makes them an ideal upgrade option for standard induction motors in pumps, fans and compressors as well as in more demanding applications like extruders, concha mixers, winches, and conveyors. IE5 SynRM motors are an easy replacement for induction motors as they have the same size and output power, so no mechanical modifications are required.
Looking For: Visibility
Tags: Motors
The environmental benefits: One 315 kW IE5 motor can reduce the CO2 emissions by 22,000 kg/year compared to IE3 motor.;40% less energy losses compared to IE3 induction motor;Increased reliability;No rare earth metals needed;
The Financial benefits: Less than 1 year payback time compared to IE3 motor in similar variable speed drive duty;Increased reliability lower the total cost of ownership;

Solution on-sentence summary: Modernization of outdated sugar mills increasing their role in global energy production
Identification: The production of energy from renewable fuels is now a strategic priority and part of a major energy transition program for several Caribbean countries. Today, most of these countries suffer big energy issues such as unreliable fuel supply, fuel dependency resulting in common electricity shortages.  At the moment, the majority of the sugar mills are inefficient, meaning that their energy consumption is extremely high, while they could be a source of power generation for national grids. The Green Sugar solution is targeting the heart of the sugar industry process, the cogeneration biomass thermal installations. The direct result of the optimization is ample clean energy that can be used for production needs and sold as clean energy to national electricity grids. The sugar mills get concrete results and return on investment within a known repayment period while reducing their environmental footprint.

Solution on-sentence summary: A nature-based technology for treatment of wastewater
Identification: Wastewater treatment is a vital part of society but can create large emissions during treatment. The System O)) is an effective domestic wastewater treatment system combining Advanced Enviro-Septic (AES) pipes and a bed of filter sand. The system has three functions: Firstly, it helps evenly distribute wastewater coming from the septic tank over the entire leaching bed; Secondly, it treats the effluent; and thirdly, it releases treated water safely into the environment via infiltration into the soil. The strength of this product is in this triple action that mimics the way nature works. It is the only technology that distributes, treats and infiltrates at the same time (no moving parts, no electrical components, no maintenance, no filtering media change).
Looking For: Network, new clients, visibility, funding, partners, credibility
Tags: Grey water, Domestic & municipal wastewater, Constructed wetland, Water & Wastewater treatment

About:
Water and energy are the strategic issues of the 21st century.

Access to water and sanitation is now part of basic human rights.

Bamboo For Life has created a green technology that perfectly addresses these issues.

The Bambou-Assainissement® technology is used to treat industrial and domestic wastewater but also to create three other related functionalities essential for our future.

-We produce bamboo biomass that can be converted into energy or raw material

-We sequester CO2 to improve the quality of the air

-We provide bioclimatic cooling in an open environment to lower city temperatures down to -20 °C.

And all this by treating industrial or domestic wastewater with a technology that does not produce sewage sludge (unique in the world) and is able to make a zero discharge in the natural environment.

Our goal to date is to design, finance, build and operate multi-profit processing units for industrial and resilient cities of tomorrow.

About: Sunstore Technologies Ltd is a spin-out company (Faculty of Engineering at the University of Strathclyde in Glasgow) that has developed the world's most cost effective solar hybrid (bio-char) feeding station. The unit can perform 6 solar cycles and 10 bio-char cycles per 24 hour period, with each cycle producing 100 standard 330g portions of rice (or equivalent). The unit design is based on solar concentration using a new type of fresnel lens integrated with a 'firetray'. The lens tracks the sun during an 8 hour cycle using the principles of a 'Roman' water clock that can  filter up to 300 litres of polluted water. If used 24/7 the unit can displace up to 40 tonnes of CO2 per annum.

Solution on-sentence summary: A new approach to reduce carbon footprint in public and private fleets of vehicles
Identification: Seeking to solve inefficient and wasteful fleet vehicle usage, Concept Geebee Inc. has developed the GEEBEE, an all-terrain electric scooter for use by professional fleet owners. In most cases when professionals need to mobilize to various locations, they will use a car, a pick-up truck or a van, or a specialized vehicle. These vehicles are expensive to buy, expensive to run and to maintain. Also, in most instances, a single person will use a vehicle that can accommodate 5 people and can move heavy loads in a very inefficient use of resources. The GEEBEE is meant to be added to existing fleets of vehicles so that fleet usage can be optimized. By replacing a vehicle using fossil fuels by a GEEBEE, organizations will reduce their carbon footprint, save money and increase employee productivity.

It can handle asphalt as well as loose or uneven ground. It is able to climb onto sidewalks or over obstacles so that you can venture anywhere, providing a sense of freedom.Concept Geebee Inc. is a Canadian company founded in 2013 by Jean-Luc and Sabine Le Névannau. Its head office is located in the city of Sherbrooke, Quebec. The company’s mission is to design, manufacture and market motorized personal transportation vehicles, in keeping with the Government of Quebec’s political commitment to promote the electrification of transportation and sustainable mobility and to support innovations by local companies. The GEEBEE® is the result of many years of research and development, supported by many stakeholders and programs, including the Prêt à entreprendre Estrie loan program, the Business Development Bank of Canada, the Center of Excellence in Energy Efficiency, the Ministère de l’Économie, de la Science et de l’Innovation du Québec (Quebec ministry of economy, science and innovation), the IRAP-NRCC, Canada Economic Development, Réseau M (mentorship service), Écotech Québec (Quebec Cleantech Cluster), Sherbrooke Innopôle, Défi Montréal and the Montreal Innovation District. The GEEBEE® has been a finalist for many awards, including the AQTR’s 2016 Transportation Award of Excellence, in the sustainable mobility category, as well as the 2016 Environment Award from the Fondation Estrienne en Environnement

SPEED turns this expertise into differentiating solutions, enabling configurable and energy-efficient 'Application-Specific Integrated Circuit' (ASIC) design. Solution name: Kinetic Energy Recovery System (KERS) for Heavy Goods Vehicles (HGVs)
Solution on-sentence summary: A retrofittable kinetic energy recovery system for heavy-goods vehicles
Identification: Our economy depends on trucks bringing goods where they need to be cheaply and reliably. Those same trucks generate a considerable amount of pollution that must be reduced: in London, for instance, road freight is responsible for 13% of CO2, 24% of NOx, and 12% of PM2.5 emissions. How can this circle be squared? Some use cases, like short, clearly defined, and unchanging back-to-base routes, such as postal delivery, lend themselves to electrification but this is not the case for the majority of 12t to 44t vehicles and OEM offerings reflect this. Even when available, fully-electric solutions require operators to spend more, haul less, and to depend on charging infrastructure which is sometimes proprietary, in a business sector where margins are razor-thin. The stop/start nature of driving urban or congested routes leads to excessive fuel consumption and emissions. By capturing energy during braking, storing it, and then using this recovered energy to help power the next acceleration, Adgero's KERS can reduce fuel consumption and CO2 emissions on these cycles by over 20% while also reducing NOx and PM. The KERS telematics suite will stream data to the telematics solution of the operator's choice and its ECU is designed to receive over the air updates to ensure peak performance. Adgero's Kinetic Energy Recovery System is affordable, retrofittable, reusable, and compatible with virtually any HGV on the road, whether rigid or tractor-trailer combinations. The electric motor/generator uses no permanent magnets or copper and the energy storage uses no heavy metals, which enables safe and easy recycling at end of life.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Funding, Partners,
Tags: Electric, Motors, Trucks, Fuel efficiency, Electric vehicles, Vibration-to-power, Vehicles
Sectors: Freight, Industry/Goods, Vehicles and vessels, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: Retrofittable hybridization system; 25% reduction in fuel burn resulting in a similar drop in CO2 emissions;Reduction of NOx and PM emissions;
The Financial benefits: Payback under three years;Saves 6800 £ per year;
Complementary solutions: ANTISMOG: An on-demand hydrogen fuel enhancement system for the reduction of air pollution from vehicles (Freight,Mobility);WeNow: A plug-and-play system for the driver to act for the climate now (Freight,Mobility);Bound4blue : A novel wingsail system for assisted clean sailing in the maritime transport sector (Freight,Industry & Consumer Goods);Skybreathe: An eco-flying solution based on cloud and big data for open airlines (Freight,Mobility);
Organization short description: Kinetic Energy Recovery for Haulage
About: Adgero's Kinetic Energy Recovery System can be fitted to most rigid lorries of 12T or greater and to semi-trailer combinations of 44T and up.  The system uses ultracapacitors to capture energy during braking which is then used when the vehicle next accelerates.  The system is easy to install and requires no permanent modification of the chassis, thus preserving the residual value of the vehicle, an important consideration for rental fleets.  The system can be removed from a vehicle leaving the fleet and re-installed on its replacement. Responsible end of life disposal is designed in: The motor uses no permanent magnets or copper and is 100% recyclable while the ultracapacitor storage contains no heavy metals or other hazardous materials.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: The world's first breathing bioreactor to produce food ingredients and proteins more efficiently
Identification: The FAO predicts that we’ll need 100% more plant crops by 2050; however, crop yield improvement is slowing rapidly (now down to 1-2% annually) and it is hard to find new land for agriculture. There is an opportunity in growing food on barren land. Arborea believes that “photosynthetic microorganisms” will be a key choice for the production of food ingredients. Photosynthetic microorganisms are the fastest-growing primary producers of food in nature, and they produce the same ingredients as plant crops, without environmental constraints and pollution. They yield up to 40x time more proteins than plant crops in a single acre of land. Furthermore, they don’t need agricultural feedstock like cane sugar, they don’t need soil, don’t produce nitrogen runoffs, consume little water, don’t promote deforestation or loss of biodiversity.  The “BioSolar Leaf” is a membrane-driven breathing-bioreactor® technology that enables a hyper-efficient gas transfer and temperature control while maintaining optimal growth conditions. In doing so, it creates a radically more effective food production platform resulting in a capital-light, scalable solution that slashes the costs of fermentation.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners,
Tags: Protein alternative, Algae, Bacteria, Microorganisms, Automation

The Financial benefits: Lower costs in respect to alternative cultivation methods.;

Arborea’s breakthrough breathing-bioreactor® technology mimics the functioning mechanisms of a real leaf to enable hyper-efficient gas transfer and self-maintain optimal growth conditions. In doing so, it has created a radically more effective food production platform resulting in a capital-light, scalable solution which slashes the costs of fermentation. We will disrupt ingredients markets by enabling hitherto expensive nutritional ingredients and proteins to be produced sustainably, efficiently, and affordably.

Wild Urban Spaces specialise in the creation of micro forests for urban areas and communities. 



Micro forests offer an exciting unique solution to today’s many environmental problems by sequestering carbon, increasing biodiversity, engaging the local community and seeding the ancient forests of tomorrow - all in one go! 



We believe micro (and macro!) forests offer a genuine and authentic alternative to help companies and institutions worldwide have a direct impact on their local environment and communities.  

While it could perhaps be said some carbon credits are slightly faceless and  disconnected from the goal, micro forest funding and creation is personal, authentic and locally beneficial.



Often just the size of a tennis court, but containing 600 trees, micro forests are tiny stand alone forests that create incredible biodiversity. As the mini forests are rapid to establish and essentially maintenance free , they can be created in any environment and thrive in urban areas.



Our pioneering methods of forest creation,  based on the Miyawaki method, are unique and adaptable to any situation from suburban England to arid deserts and can create growth at least 5 - 10x faster than monoculture tree planting while creating a biodiversity haven often 100 times more diverse.

Most off-grid power for critical infrastructure comes from diesel or gasoline generators. Can you imagine eliminating the pollution and noise and reducing the carbon footprint and cost of electricity from these generators without sacrificing their flexibility? SIQENS is now entering the multi-billion-dollar generator industry with a power source that reduces fuel costs by up to 70% and emissions by 99%. SIQENS has created a plug and play battery charger based on its methanol fuel cell technology. The internationally patented technology called ‘4CycleTec’ transforms methanol to hydrogen by recycling all energy and media flows (heat, fuel, water, and catalyst electrolyte). It improves efficiency and durability and reduces purchase and operation costs.

Solution on-sentence summary: A globally preeminent lithium-ion battery resource recovery technology
Identification: Traditionally, when li-ion batteries have reached the end of life, they have predominantly been treated as waste and landfilled, or partially recycled through pyro-metallurgical processes, which have average recovery rates of 40%. However, these methods are inefficient and can lead to environmental contamination, safety hazards at general recycling plants and otherwise dampen the environmentally friendly vision of electrification. Li-Cycle Technology™ aims at recycling all types of lithium-ion batteries used in electronic devices, electric vehicles and energy storage. It can do so with an unparalleled recovery rate of over 95% of all materials. The company’s industry-leading processing technologies uniquely position it to be a key player in supporting the growing international movement towards zero-carbon technologies and the creation of a circular economy for lithium-ion batteries.

Solution on-sentence summary: A cryogenic liquefaction solution to temporarily store excess biomethane production from AD plants.
Identification:
Azola BIO aims to tackle the following problems: -Loss of income impacting biomethane injection projects due to seasonal/recurrent low gas demand periods -Lost biomethane injected into gas distribution networks due to flared production as a response to congestion occurrences. -Lack of profitability for certain remote methanization projects that cannot be connected to a nearby network mesh. 

Azola developed a modular, no rotary machinery and low CAPEX solution for biomethane producers that comes with an integrated polishing, liquefaction-cryogenic storage, vaporization-reinjection, and plant control solution. The process uses an open cycle of liquid nitrogen for liquefaction, and where nitrogen is further valorised to regenerate the polishing unit's adsorption columns. The reinjection module uses a pressure build up PBU system, to vaporize and reinject the stored liquid biomethane into the grid. The whole process is automated for start-up and shutdown and could be remotely controlled and operated.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Credibility,
Target client profile: BusinessFarming & AgricultureLivestock & Dairy, BusinessEnergy Utility, BusinessServicesWaste & Remediation
Tags: Biogas & biomethane, Nitrogen, Anaerobic digestion, Waste treatment, Biofuel, Cryogenic gas
The environmental benefits: Avoid the release into the atmosphere of 172 tonnes of CO2;Nitrogen is valorised to regenerate the polishing unit's adsorption columns;
The Financial benefits: Save around 12% of annual production capacity;Losses avoided by Azola: around 260,000 Nm3/year, approximately 260 k€/year;A less than 4 years payback-period;
Complementary solutions: Storage GEM®: Smart energy management system in containerized storage units for rapid deployment (Energy);Smart Energy Hub: An innovative hydrogen-based energy storage solution for buildings (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Cool Green Energy Factory: An innovative energy concept to make cooling processes economically and ecologically sustainable (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);Solar GEM® (Green Energy in Motion): Smart energy management system for solar power plants (Energy);
Organization short description: An intermittent storage solution aimed at suppressing flaring in biomethane production sites during low demand periods.
About:
Azola is an innovative solution based on a patented process that aims to store the surplus production from biomethane injection plants under liquid form during periods of low demand. Azola allows biomethane producers to store up to 12 000 Nm3 of biomethane under liquid form, for a later re-injection in the grid.



In fact, when congestion occurs in the natural gas distribution network during the weekends, summer, or when a producer reaches his maximum contractual injection rate, or during maintenance work, biomethane is flared in order to ramp down the pressure levels within the distribution grid, or to avoid penalties due to excess production.



With Azola, small to medium sized producers (up to 500 Nm3), are given the opportunity to temporarily store the biomethane that is today being flared, and reinject it when the distribution pipe pressure permits it.

Under the assumption that the average methanization unit operates around 8200 hours per year, this would leave a potential gap of about 565 hour per year down time, divided between periods of low demand and/or maintenance/ plant unavailability. 



For a common small-scale agricultural methanization unit in Frane (around 100 Nm3/h injection capacity) this represents a loss of about 56,500 Nm3/year of biomethane, or over 90 m3 of BioLNG. This translates to a €54,000/year loss of income, or about 5% of an average methanization plant turnover.



For such plants, the intermittent storage solution provided by Azola, could lower the GHG emissions and avoid the release into the atmosphere of about 110 tonnes of CO2-eq per year*



On the other hand, the GRID solution of AZOLA, aims to provide flexibility to the natural gas distribution network, by automatically storing gas under liquid form as soon as a preset maximum operating pressure is reached. The unit starts re-injecting the stored gas on the same part of the grid once congestion phase is gone, or elsewhere through deported injection. The GRID unit is made of transportable skids that may then be easily disconnected and displaced from one part of the network to another depending on the operational needs.



Current Projects

AZOLA Producer Unit: 

•	Project Epaux Bezu: Demonstrator plant tested from 2017 to 2019. 

The project successfully tested a liquefaction rate of up to 250 Nm3/h of biomethane, with a storage capacity of 10 Nm3 of bioGNL.

 



•	Project Plainval: Currently under final engineering phase, the plant is set to start operating on September 2020 with a liquefaction capacity of 250 Nm3/h of biomethane, and a storage capacity of 20 Nm3 of bioGNL.

AZOLA Grid Unit:

•	Project Flores: a pilot project is set to start operations on November 2020 in partnership with GrDF. The plant will be testing our first polishing module designed to treat fossil gas, and test the intermittent storage solution as a localized flexibility tool that aims to accomodate more biogmethane into the blend, and handle congestion issues at grid edge.



*Assumption is made on a 565 hours per year of down time basis, and where all the biomethane produced at a rate of 100 Nm3/h undergoes a complete combustion where 1 mol of CH4 produces 1 mol of CO2.

CO2 density under normal conditions: 1,96306 kg/m3.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure

Solution on-sentence summary: A system for powerlines protection and wildfire prevention, enabling safe power supply
Identification: The Ground Fault Neutralizer [GFN] is a protection system with unmatched performance for power lines. It minimizes the risk of fires, injuries and damages caused by power lines enabling to maintain safe power supply without any power outages, something all smart grids will demand. The GFN can neutralize power lines' single phase to ground faults (75 - 99% of all the faults in power networks) ultra-fast before they ignite a fire, where traditional protection is too slow and cannot prevent ignition. The GFN is proven technology, already protecting communities in Victoria, Australia.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Maintenance and inspection, Sensors & monitoring, Wildfires, Electrical grid, Natural disaster
The environmental benefits: 100% of the quantity of CO2 potentially emitted in the atmosphere by wildfires;Same quantity of non-renewable resources used or used without recycling;Same quantity of water used (production, utilization);
The Financial benefits: From one accident to roughly 10 years, depending on application type;Protected assets and saved lives;
Complementary solutions: Low-cost substructure system: Bottom-fixed offshore turbine prototype that can be installed safely, simply and without cranes (Energy,Infrastructures);DI Global System: A carbon dioxide supplementation system for the maintenance of metal structures (Industry & Consumer Goods,Infrastructures);CO2-cured low-emissions cement: Low emission process for cement and concrete production (Buildings & Shelters,Infrastructures);SonoAsh: A waste-to-value technology that enables decarbonized next generation infrastructure (Waste & Pollution,Buildings & Shelters,Infrastructures);
Organization short description: Swedish Neutral has developed the Ground Fault Neutralizer, a protection system for power lines with world leading performance that can help prevent catastrophic fires started by power lines.
About: Catastrophic fires started by power lines is a large growing problem in the world today. Climate change is creating conditions in many places that traditional protection systems cannot handle.One example of this is Victoria, Australia where almost 200 people died from catastrophic bushfires in 2009 that were proven to be caused by power lines. A more recent example is the terrible fires in California in 2018 and 2019, these fires cost almost 100 deaths, also caused by power lines. In addition to the lives lost, the monetary damages are enormous, in the billions of dollars. However, what might be worst in the long term is the enormous release of CO2 these fires cause.. That power lines need better protection is clear, and this is what the Ground Fault Neutralizer [GFN] offers. The GFN can detect the faults, where traditional cannot (by being 25 times more sensitive), the GFN can neutralize these faults ultra fast before they ignite a fire, where traditional protection is to slow and cannot prevent ignition. The GFN is made up of three components (a high voltage device, power electronics and a control cabinet that uses advanced algorithms). The GFN is installed in the substation and protects the entire grid from one point. The GFN is proven technology, already protecting the communities in Victoria, Australia as a result of the REFCL program.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure

Solution on-sentence summary: An improved biodegradable polyamide synthetic fiber with enhanced biodegradability
Identification: The secret of Amni Soul Eco® is its enhanced 6.6 polyamide formula, allowing for the use of garments which decompose rapidly after they have been discarded and landfilled. When disposed of in landfills Amni Soul eco yarn degrades in around five years while other synthetics fibers take decades to decompose. Amni Soul Eco® thus substantially reduces the impact on the environment and the amount of waste which is passed on to future generations. It helps to safeguard the environment because it helps reduce to a minimum the impact from the textile industry on nature and to make the world better for future generations. Amni Soul Eco® may be used in all segments of the textile industry: lingerie and underwear, hosiery, beach- and sportswear, casual, jeanswear and fashion per se.

Solution on-sentence summary: An integrated solution for smart home, office and building energy management
Identification: Many connected objects are available on the market today. They can tell us what is happening in an environment when we aren't physically there and help manage the energy consumption in a building. However, these objects can't communicate with each other. Users have to control them individually using a variety of mobile apps, which lacks convenience. The Evey Pulse Solution overcomes these challenges by integrating all the connected devices in a space, which can be controlled at home, at the office or remotely, using nothing more than voice commands, a visual interface or an app. The Solution uses artificial intelligence to recognise and learns from users' habits, and adapts to their preferences to create a space tailored to the their needs. Evey Pulse can reduce home energy consumption by 30% by making smart use of energy. Overall, the Solution is solving problems of efficiency and practicality in the use of connected objects and addresses people's concerns regarding of safety, security and energy efficiency.

Solution on-sentence summary: A smart, secure & sustainable packaging for better customer experience in e-commerce
Identification: Global e-commerce is a 3.6 trillion euro industry that is growing by over 20% each year. That significant growth has to contend with many problems: Every year, over 700 million trees are felled to produce the 100 billion packages of waste required for online delivery. 85% of all customers are or have been dissatisfied with their delivery performance due to damaged/stolen packages or never arrived deliveries. Legislators have understood that packaging will have to be eco-friendlier, reusable, and smart. THE BOX combines all ingredients to ensure its success in this movement: it is eco-friendly, reusable, it opens access to second-hand markets and it provides essential data to delivering companies to develop more intelligent logistics. THE BOX can enable the transition to a circular economy in transport. It ensures the same primary function as cardboard and advantageously replaces it: It is designed to fit different sizes and shapes of products without the need of filling material. It can be reused up to 1000 times before any refurbishment. The body of THE BOX is made of expanded polypropylene - fully recyclable while being light and robust.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Partners,
Target client profile: BusinessServicesRetailerB2C E-Commerce Platforms, BusinessServicesTransportersPostal Service, Couriers and Messengers
Tags: Reusable, Packaging, Sensors & monitoring
The environmental benefits: 500 Cardboards generate 433 kg.eqCO2 while one BOX used 500 times emits 131 kg.eqCO2;
The Financial benefits: 10 times more profitable than a cardboard box if used 1000 times;Amortized after 50 shipments;

LivingPackets invented the future of packaging.

An intelligent and sustainable shipping box to replace cardboard boxes.
About:
LivingPackets was founded in Nantes in 2016 and specializes in innovative and secure solutions for online orders. 

Our goal is to replace hundreds of millions of cardboard boxes in the e-commerce market over the next decade.

With that, we reduce the impact of the entire industry on the environment and create a significantly improved experience for e-commerce companies and their customers.

Since the beginning of our research, our company has grown to more than 70 employees with branches in France and Switzerland.

We have generated great interest in some of the most important e-commerce groups in Europe and have successfully implemented several pilot programs with the biggest eCommerce and logistics players in France and Germany to enter the European market in 2020 with a full commercial launch.

Our operations are fully funded by ourselves (savings etc.) and we will be able to continue working independently for many years to come. This means that we have the freedom to concentrate on the development, production, and growth of our company.

All team members are shareholders in the company and are personally committed to the company. This creates a strong common mission and purpose, as everyone will benefit from LivingPackets' success, from the employees to the partners and end customers.

Solution on-sentence summary: An intelligent lighting system for significant reduction in energy consumption
Identification: In order to supply a high energy demand, energy suppliers must increase energy production, which could be avoided if smart energy solutions are taking place. One and a half nuclear power plants are needed only to power the lights in Switzerland. Up to 30% of a building’s electricity consumption is related to lighting. In addition, 90% of the costs of a lighting system is incurred in operation for electricity and maintenance. All these issues could be avoided by implementing smart-energy efficiency Solutions. LEDCity developed an autonomous plug and play lighting system which is equipped with various sensors to reduce energy consumption by 90 % by controlling the light intensity. It's a user-friendly system which is not dependent on an initial configuration. In addition, to the easy installation, maintenance and the enormous savings in power consumption, it will also be able to replace entire security systems, optimize ventilation systems, etc. based on the collected data.

With an active presence on five continents, SUEZ and its 90,000 employees strive to preserve our environment’s natural capital: water, soil, and air. SUEZ provides innovative and resilient solutions in water management, waste recovery, site remediation and air treatment, optimizing municipalities’ and industries’ resource management through “smart” cities and improving their environmental and economic performance. The Group delivers sanitation services to 64 million people and produces 7.1 billion m3 of drinking water. SUEZ is also a contributor to economic growth, with more than 200,000 jobs created directly and indirectly on an annual basis, and a provider of new resources, with 4.2 million tons of secondary raw materials produced.

Identification: MIMO C1 features a customizable front cargo space that takes up to 70kg of additional load and a quick-folding mechanism. On-the-go battery swapping allows MIMO C1 users to commute longer and further. Smaller than a bicycle, MIMO C1 is easier to handle and more affordable than cargo bicycles.
