Identification: The construction industry uses moulds, also called formwork, to pour concrete and form a structure. These moulds are traditionally made from wood, which requires the use of toxic chemical solvents to stop the concrete sticking to the mould. NanoPhyll's SuRelease™ nano950 presents a sustainable solution to this problem. The Solution is single-application, reusable nanocomposite polymer top coat which can be used on a range of materials, including steel, aluminium, wood, PVC, HDPE, rubber and concrete substrates. SuRelease™ nano950 has excellent properties in strength, durability, anti-abrasion, corrosion, antibacterial, antifungal, and weather resistance. SuRelease™ nano950 is specially designed to withstand high abrasion and to use as a permanent release agent for formwork. By embracing this Solution, the construction agency can save time, reduce material use and increase the sustainability of their operations.

Solution on-sentence summary: A programmable smart light solution using sunlight's full spectrum
Identification: Horticultural lighting systems are designed the same way lighting has been designed for over a hundred years: they consume a lot of electricity, have a short lifespan, emit pollutants, produce a fixed spectrum, aren’t programmable and lack integrated connectivity. Sollum Technologies addresses these challenges thanks to its programmable smart lighting solution that combines a programmable LED light fixture which recreates and/or compensates the full spectrum of the sun's natural light with a cloud-based platform predicated on intelligent algorithms that command and control the fixtures. Sollum’s simple and user-friendly SUN as a Service™ application enables greenhouse producers to program, adjust and modulate light fixtures according to their specific needs remotely and in real time to create optimal lighting conditions. The solution increases the productivity of greenhouse cultivation while improving quality and taste and reducing energy consumption.
Looking For: Funding, Partners, Visibility
Tags: Greenhouse, LED, Indoor farming, Agricultural equipment & machinery
The environmental benefits: Energy savings of over 30% compared to HPS solutions;Reduction in water consumption by 10% compared to HPS solutions;

We work closely with our clients to create light recipes adapted to each product’s growth cycles, regardless of its native climate and the location of their greenhouse. Solution on-sentence summary: Floating solar system enabling affordable clean energy
Identification: One of the limiting factors to deploy widely solar power plants is the lack of suitable land area. Floating solar is a relatively new technology. Ocean Suns has developed a novel solution to floating solar based on rigid solar modules mounted on hydro-elastic membranes. Designed for minimal use of materials, the solution is efficient at a lower cost. The lean floater design reduces wind drag and the hydro-elastic properties provide excellent seaworthiness. Extensive use of recyclable polymer materials reduces problems with corrosion and fatigue. Consequently, the Ocean Sun solution enables floating solar to a larger geographical area. It is not limited to rivers, lakes and reservoirs, but also nearshore and offshore deployment. The resulting cost of energy is lowered to an unprecedented level
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Lightweight, Offshore wind power, Marine & Oceans, Solar photovoltaic
The environmental benefits: 10% higher efficiency through direct water cooling.;CO2 is reduced by about 10% compared to other floating solar solutions;
The Financial benefits: Payback time can be in less than two years depending the project;
Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);PowerCorner: Mini-grids for affordable, reliable, sustainable energy-services for rural and off-grid populations (Energy);
Organization short description: Ocean Sun introduces a novel, efficient, cost-effective and durable solution for floating solar energy generation, designed to be installed in any type of water body, including offshore since the system can withstand harsh ocean and weather conditions. This novel patented technology is composed of  modified silicon PV solar modules deployed on a special floating membrane structure. The hydro-elastic property of the thin polymer support floating membrane prevents breaking of waves and salt water intrusion, similar to the effect of oil on troubled water.
About:
The Ocean Sun floating system requires minimal use of materials (and of commodity nature). It is simple and quick to assemble and install, almost to plug-and-play. It requires a very low Capex, which represents a reduction of 20% compared to other FPV already in the market for freshwater. The fact that the Ocean Sun system uses standard (off-the-shelf) components enables a business model based on high local content in the supply-chain. Unlike some competitors who establish central factories and ship equipment worldwide, Ocean Sun will procure material locally, and train local firms to do the construction and installation activities.

More than 80% of the solar radiation falling on PV cells is not converted to electricity. It is lost by reflection, transmission or absorption. Reflected radiation is about 5-10% depending on the incident angle in comparison to transmitted and absorbed radiation. About 20% the non-reflected energy is converted into electricity and the rest into heat, which inevitably increases the PV panel temperature. Higher temperature have a negative influence on PV panel efficiency, which is highly sensitive to temperature fluctuations: PV output efficiencies can be reduced by 10-25% under real-life operating conditions (i.e. temperatures of 60-70ºC). Our innovative 1mm thick floating hydro-elastic membrane provides 8-10% average higher efficiency over the day as a result of the consistent contact and cooling effect between the solar cell modules and the water body. Cells operate at a lower temperature through direct heat transfer to the water. 



Floater system architecture and seaworthiness is obtained with materials that are durable with world class maritime quality and are 100% recyclable. With superior seaworthiness albeit minimum use of material, the floater is composed by the floating membrane itself and by a mooring system, both designed for optimal offshore usage with a technology inspired by the aquaculture industry, which has been in use for over 20 years in Norwegian rough waters. The unique UV and hydrolysis-resistant floating membrane have been designed to (1) effectively prevent breaking of waves, (2) move with regular sea swell, and (3) provide an absolute barrier between solar panels and saltwater. 

The floating membrane is specifically built to ensure good and safe working environment for installers who almost "walk on water" , so the modules can be securely and efficiently attached to withstand rough weather. PV modules are not harmed even when exposed to quite harsh sea conditions. The Ocean Sun Design Premise has received a “Statement of Conformance” from DNV GL. Five demonstration systems has been built on the west coast of Norway, in the Johur strait in Singapore and on Luzon Island in the Philippines.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: A whole-home smart water system for real time water management and early leak detection
Identification: The Intellecy BluView is a smart water system that provides two major benefits: 1) saving water by managing water use in real-time and the reduction of wasted water and 2) leak protection by providing complete leak detection coverage of the structure and remote water shut-off. BluView is a smart home/IoT system using a highly reliable static, non-intrusive sensor and machine learning technology to monitor and measure water flow in realtime. BluView detects water leaks, big or small, anywhere in a home or building. It can help minimize damage by enabling the user to shut off their water remotely from their smartphone or from the web-based dashboard. Our machine learning helps the user know their normal usage patterns, set conservation goals and track their savings. BluView alerts the user of abnormal high use to prevent water bill surprises.

Electromaps is accelerating EVolution by connecting all charge point operators of the world to one standard charge and billing solution. Borderless, Electromaps is a simple charging solution for everyone who is driving an electric vehicle.

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution for providing electricity to undeveloped areas having some water stream resources
Identification: This solution, named by Floating Drum Turbine or FDT, provides distributed generation of hydroelectricity from the water streams (canals/rivers) using an innovative micro-turbine which is registered in the WIPO-PCT system. This turbine consists of an undershot waterwheel floated on a water stream using a buoyant skid, and be anchored to the water bankside using some cables or hinged arms. By the way, the water stream makes the turbine and its coupled generator to rotate which causes to generate the electricity. This solution provides steady electricity generation (365 days, 24 hours) with constant efficiency.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Funding, Partners
Tags: Off-grid, Rivers, Turbines, Hydropower
The environmental benefits: This solution is suitable for undeveloped areas having minimal water streams, and have no access to any local electrical network.;The product will be offered to the market directly, or through an EPC project execution, or by selling the generated electricity from an erected plant to clients.;Compared to solar power, this solution has 80% lower CO2 emission, doubly used energy, full-time energy supply, higher efficiency, good reliability, no land usage, and steady state which makes it fully competitive.;Compared to solar power, this solution has 30% lower payback time, 10-15% lower cost, and more governmental subsides for clients.;
The Financial benefits: The economic benefits of this solution in comparison with the solar power includes 30% lower payback time;10-15% lower cost, and more governmental subsides for clients.;

Solution on-sentence summary: The use of biomethane as truck fuel: a circular economy
Identification:
The solution aims is to develop biomethane as truck fuel. Carrefour designed a biomethane ecosystem, by setting up patnerships with gas industrials, car manufacturers and transport companies. The goal is to gathered every actors of biomethane chain and lead them toward a common goal : developping biomethane trucks instead of diesel. Gas industrials developped biogas stations. Car's manufacturers engineer biogas trucks, and transport companies purchased those trucks. Carrefour's role is to garantee, negociate and support each link of biomethane ecosystem, in order to reduce its carbon footprint, anticipate regulation and innovate.

The development of biomethane allow to reduce by 75% CO2 emissions and remote small particulates emission (on same distance as diesel). Biogas also have an impact on traffic noise and reduced by 50% this nuisance.

Biomethane relies on circular economy, as it is made from organic waste: like agricultural waste or Carrefour shop's organic waste.

Solution on-sentence summary: A peat substitute for use as casing soil in the mushroom industry
Identification: The company has developed a patented process that can produce the products TEFA and BABS from corn straw residues. TEFA is a full-fledged peat substitute and is ideal as a structural material in plant substrates as well as cover soil for mushroom cultivation. By replacing peat with TEFA , the CO2 emissions associated with peat consumption are reduced by 85%, ecologically valuable peatlands are spared and the transport routes to end-customers are shortened. BABS has similar characteristics as charcoal, polystyrene or superabsorber polymers. The unique properties of the material enable new applications in the areas of plant substrates (extension of casting intervals), buildings insulation and exhaust air purification (removal of ammonia from animal husbandry).

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution to urban mobility challenges in africa
Identification: Access to transport and energy are often the main concerns faced by communities across Africa. With a lack of access to vital services, opportunities to reach markets, business areas, educational and health facilities become limited, and there's a pressing need for more affordable, effective and sustainable alternatives. In peri-urban areas in Namibia, people spend up to 1/3 of their disposal income on mobility needs. Mobility in the delivery industry is dominated by fuel-driven motorbikes (125cc), causing pollution, congestion and health risks. With e-mobility booming globally and Africa being the ideal continent for solar energy, Ebikes4Africa introduced electric two-wheelers, solar recharge stations and customised container hubs as a solution to communal needs. E-bicycles and e-scooters are designed to meet the challenging conditions of African environments and provide reliability at an affordable price, while an open-source approach facilitates self-service and maintenance. In addition, E-Hubs – modified shipping containers fitted with solar recharge and e-bikes – provide modular solutions to communities. The Hubs include an efficient DC/DC solar recharge system to charge a variety of Li-Ion batteries, which can be swapped to eliminate the inconvenience of waiting for the battery to charge. E-Hubs offer an easy to install, turn-key ready unit, also for remote or unserviced settlements.
Looking For: New clients, Funding, Partners,
Target client profile: Public Authorities, Local NGO, BusinessServicesTransportersTrucks & Other Road Vehicles
Tags: Electric, Biking, Solar photovoltaic, Off-grid, Developing countries, Electric vehicles, Vehicles
Sectors: Mobility, Power and fuel generationVehicles and vessels
The environmental benefits: iFePO4 battery swapping and direct DC/DC solar charging system to provide convenient mobility with 0 tailpipe emission;Open source, simplified and modular to facilitate implementation and maintenance;90% reduction of carbon emissions;No direct emissions or noise pollution;
The Financial benefits: 50% Cheaper than Mainstream Alternative;Payback time less than 2 years;

We apply our skills, experience and technology to empower locals in their everyday environment. Whether it's transporting children to school or goods to the market, patrolling protected areas or protecting our precious natural resources, our E-Bikes present a solution for every mobility need. To complement our E-Bikes, we also provide communities and off-grid areas with solar powered stations and E-Hubs, to provide a more sustainable source of energy.

Solution on-sentence summary: Food waste monitoring system for commercial kitchens
Identification: Food waste has also a huge environmental impact, knowing the carbon, water, chemical and land footprint of agriculture. From an economic perspective, the BCG estimates that this global food waste issue is worth $1.2 trillion but represents in the other hand a $700 billion opportunity. Misunderstanding about the financial/social/environmental impacts of food waste by food professionals explains why so much is still wasted, and this misunderstanding is intrinsically linked to a lack of tracking. A cost-effective food waste monitoring system, helping to answer the key questions pertaining to this issue (how much is wasted, when, where, what it is, why, and how much it costs), will help overcome this . This newly available information is the knowledge needed to bring change in operations.

Solution on-sentence summary: A versatile drone designed to monitor air quality
Identification: Air quality has become an issue worldwide, most importantly because of the harm it causes to people, but also because of regulations which demand companies worldwide to abide to air quality emission standards. The goal for this solution is to help companies operating in harsh terrains to be able to monitor the air quality in the area of operations, thus being able abide to these laws. The solution: the Andean Drone, a drone aimed towards mining companies operating in harsh conditions, named after the Andes mountains in Peru. This drone is capable of flying in altitudes up to 5000 meters above sea level, wind velocities of up to 30 km/h, resistant to rain and extreme climates. This drone is adequate for working in the harsh conditions where mining operations usually take place. It carries a load which monitors the concentration of particulate matter and pollutant gasses. The collected data is then transformed into a real time contamination map.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Drones, Air quality monitors & filters, Sensors & monitoring, Maintenance and inspection
The environmental benefits: Operates in harsh terrain;Monitors the air quality in the area of operation;Data collection;
The Financial benefits: 70% cheaper than currents solutions;Same range of action as other measurement systems;
Complementary solutions: Hawa Dawa GmbH: Intelligent iot sensor-based environmental monitoring for air-quality improvement (Waste & Pollution);E.S.T.: An intelligent robot-based system for automatic extraction, treatment and packaging of sediments (Waste & Pollution);Ambee: Pollution heatmaps of cities using portable sensors and purifiers (Waste & Pollution);PlakMan: A solar powered boat to remove floating plastic debris from the seas and oceans (Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: Our objective is monitoring air quality continously anytime and anywhere.
About:
qAIRa: Know your air, become the change. 



Air is the most valuable resource of our planet and nowadays is being threatened by the high levels of pollution: bad air quality causes 1 in 10 deaths worldwide, 7 million people die each year. It also contributes to climate change. The current solution for air quality monitoring consists of dispersed networks of static stations that capture isolated information in small areas and limited heights; these cost approximately $ 300,000.00 in implementation. This is a costly and non-scalable solution.



qAIRa, Guardian of the Air, has the main objective of monitoring air quality continuously anytime and anywhere. qAIRa proposes to complement the dispersed networks of air quality monitoring, with dynamic, scalable and high density networks conformed by drones and modules that measure in real time the environmental contamination (gases, dust, climate). Our low-cost technological tools are efficient for environmental monitoring in wide areas. The information is processed using big data analytics and is democratized through a map of global pollution in a mobile application, with the purpose of empowering the people to know the air they breathe and even ask their authorities for actions in favor of the environment.



In 2013, around 9,500 million metric tons of carbon were emitted globally, of which 21% were from industrial activities; Peru contributed with 0.2% of these greenhouse gas emissions. The economic and political situation is favorable for businesses related to the care and protection of the environment. The governments are more demanding in the compliance of environmental laws (in Peru the law establishes the Environmental Quality Standards and Maximum Allowable Levels) and are more aware in their controls, this drives companies into being responsible in the use of their resources and increase their environmental controls. Besides of this, people are everyday more concerned about their health and the protection of the environment.



qAIRa develops in-house technology in hardware and software, which are robust for difficult geographical conditions (operations at 5000 masl), autonomous and connected through mobile 4G internet. The products qAIRa offers are the following:



	qAIR: unmanned aerial system for air quality monitoring.

	qHAWAX: fixed module for continuous air quality monitoring.

	qDUST: unmanned aerial system for dust detection.

	qEYE: unmanned aerial system for industrial and environmental safety.

	qLAND: unmanned aerial system for topographical mapping.

	qFARM: unmanned aerial system for precision agriculture.

	qMAP: specialized software that shows in mobile application the real-time air quality information of qAIRa’s products and other equipment that measure environmental pollution.



The members of qAIRa are recognized professionals in the innovation and entrepreneurship fields, with experience in robotics and environmental projects. qAIRa has key alliances with national and international institutions. At the national level, with the Pontificia Universidad Católica del Perú (PUCP), the National Society of Mining, Oil and Energy of Peru (SNMPE), the National Service of Meteorology and Hydrology of Peru (SENAMHI). Internationally, with the accelerators 1776 from USA and Seedstars from Switzerland.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Imitating nature with bioluminescence to jump-start the bio-economy
Identification: Fireflies, glow-worms, and more than 80% of marine organisms (jellyfish, plankton, fish, squids, krill) are able to produce this biological light without needing the Sun. Glowee has decided to imitate what nature does best and use these super-powers to develop biological lighting and thus jump-start the bio-economy. For 5 years, Glowee’s pluridisciplinar team (biologist, designer, business and finance) has been working to create a living system producing continuous bioluminescence in order to integrate in urban lighting a better product-usage fit, reduce environmental impact, improve well-being and offer new creative possibilities.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Street
The environmental benefits: 98,9% less CO2 emission in the production phase;40% less electricity in the use phase inducing operational savings;95% less water used over the entire life cycle;100% organic and biodegradable waste;Avoids the use of limited resources and the pollution generated by its extraction and distribution;
Complementary solutions: Smart Street Lighting: Outdoor smart street lighting control: energy saving, security and efficiency (Infrastructures);Occupancy detector: Wall-mounted sensor for occupancy detection of commercial facilities (Infrastructures,Buildings & Shelters);Philips SunStay: A integrated solar street light with lithium-ferro-phosphate battery, solar panel and charger (Infrastructures);Philips TrueForce LED Public: An easy and short payback led solution to replace high intensity discharge lamps (Infrastructures);
Organization short description: Glowee is an environmental biotech company using the super-powers of nature to produce light, called bioluminescence, to reduce the environmental impact of lighting and revolutionize the way we produce, consume and enlighten.
About:
Light is what powers the world and makes our cities live. Light is identified as civilization’s first marker of development. In our lives, light is everywhere, produced by the Sun or artificially created by human ingenuity. However, today’s lighting technologies contribute to global warming, threatening our planet from natural resources to biodiversity.  Ironically, Nature has done 3.8B years of research and development through evolution to find the most efficient lighting solution: it is called bioluminescence. Fireflies, glow-worms, and more than 80% of marine organisms (jellyfish, plankton, fish, squids, krill) are able to produce this biological light without needing the Sun. Glowee has decided to imitate what nature does best and use these super-powers to develop biological lighting and thus jump-start the bio-economy. 

For 5 years, Glowee’s pluridisciplinar team (biologist, designer, business and finance) have been working to create a living system producing continuous bioluminescence in order to integrate in urban lighting a better product-usage fit, reduce environmental impact, improve well-being and offer new creative possibilities. 

Glowee has acquired unparalleled and world-leading expertise in the field of bioluminescence, recognized globally by more than 20 innovation awards, and 3 patents filed, one of which already granted.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Aircrafts engine performance optimization making flying smarter and greener
Identification: DECISIONX technology could save up to 1% emissions from commercial aviation, which currently accounts for 2% of global emissions. Periodic engine washing to remove contaminants like dust, sea salt and air pollution increases gas turbine fuel efficiency and service life, so less fuel is required to generate the same thrust compared to before the wash. SATAVIA's DECISIONX technology takes into account the history of each individual aircraft, correlates this data with global environmental contaminant modelling and predicts the rate of contaminant damage to the engine, and provides bespoke washing recommendations tailored to each engine. Maintenance recommendations can be prioritised based on historical or planned flight operations. The platform is scalable to calculate exposures for a single aircraft, a fleet of aircraft, or eventually, global aircraft operations.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Aviation, Fuel efficiency
Sectors: Freight, Mobility, Industry/Goods, Vehicles and vessels, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: Reduces commercial aircraft emissions by 0.5-1.0%;Saves almost 2 billion kg of carbon emissions each year;
The Financial benefits: Reduces fuel costs for aircraft operators;Savings up to $40m each year;
Complementary solutions: SeaZen: A 100% autonomous solar boating service with license free self-service access (Mobility);ANTISMOG: An on-demand hydrogen fuel enhancement system for the reduction of air pollution from vehicles (Freight,Mobility);WeNow: A plug-and-play system for the driver to act for the climate now (Freight,Mobility);Bound4blue : A novel wingsail system for assisted clean sailing in the maritime transport sector (Freight,Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description: SATAVIA simplifies decision-making to make aviation smarter and greener via our cloud-based AI technology, DECISIONX.
About:
SATAVIA is a data analytics and AI company based in Cambridge UK helping the aviation industry to make flying smarter and greener.



THE CONTRAIL CLIMATE CHALLENGE:

Recent research shows that contrails formed by aircraft at cruise generate 59% of aviation’s climate impact, versus 32% arising from direct CO2 engine emissions. Future NetZero emission engines and fuels may exacerbate contrail formation as a result of higher water emissions. Contrail formation therefore presents the most significant climate challenge that aviation will face in the post-COVID19 era. SATAVIA is currently the only team offering a practicable solution to the contrail challenge.











OUR SOLUTION:

SATAVIA’s unique DECISIONX:NETZERO system uses AI-powered data analytics and enterprise-grade data to deliver actionable insight, enabling aircraft operators to accurately forecast, avoid, validate, quantify and offset aviation contrail emissions.



Pre-flight, operators can optimise flight plans to minimise contrail formation by targeting low-risk altitudes identified by SATAVIA modelling. Post-flight, DECISIONX:NETZERO validates contrail formation against modelled predictions and quantifies climate benefit, which is then converted into carbon offset credits for operators. With a conservative target of 50% contrail prevention, SATAVIA could enable annual emissions savings in excess of >1,000 Mt CO2e/year across all operators.



Alongside ongoing, incremental efforts to develop greener engines and fuels, DECISIONX:NETZERO offers a revolutionary, application-ready solution capable of targeting and minimising aviation’s most damaging environmental impact.



While SATAVIA’s vision centres on the goal of making aviation greener, the company also offers products focused on improving condition monitoring. SATAVIA’s DECISIONX:FLEET allows operators to improve asset condition monitoring (e.g. corrosion risks for parked aircraft) by ~10%, while also optimising engine core

wash scheduling.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Organization short description: Alpha Cleantec AG (ACT) is an environmental technologies company. The company developed new approaches and unique solutions in the field of soil, groundwater, sewage and wastewater decontamination and treatment of contaminated railway ballast. The company developed two different processes (AFA and SOA) for straightforward, efficient and cost-effective in- situ generations of superoxide radical and applying of the radical as a strong oxidizing agent, under NTP conditions. Under these conditions, superoxide radicals reveal properties of a super nucleophile and super oxidizing agent which rapidly reacts with a wide range of soil and water pollutants (such as Hydrocarbons, TPH, BTEX, Petroleum leftovers, Aromatics, PAH, Chlorinated Solvents, PCB, Dioxins as well as Pesticides and Herbicides) on concertation up to 100,000 ppm and responsible for the swift mineralization of the contaminants.
About:
Alpha Cleantec AG (ACT) was founded in 2016 as environmental technologies company, with experts bringing in-depth relevant technological know-how.

The team of high-qualified multi-year experienced scientists and experts have reached solid and promising results to be competitive and prominent with the company’s innovative solutions on a world-wide level.

The basic philosophy of the ACT team is to design tailor-made, patented and safe approaches to eliminate the impacts of the industrial activity with minimized economic input and maximum environmental-friendly output.

Apart from our own R&D Division, ACT has a direct co-operation agreement with Casali Institute of Applied Chemistry in Jerusalem, Israel, which is a department within the Institute of Chemistry at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem. It conducts research and development in a wide range of topics in chemistry, biotechnology and related industries.

Despite its short existence, the company has been patented in national phase and approved by independent tests carried out with TÜV Süd, Germany, showing conversion rates of up to 97% and is now in the process of carrying out pilot tests and projects to prove the scale-up capacity of its technologies.

ACT is very proud to be engaged in the field of environmental technologies not just as a promising business opportunity, but also to solve one of the world's greatest problem, contamination from industrial activity, and to make the Earth healthy and green again for future generations.

Alpha Cleantec AG (ACT) is an environmental technologies company. The company developed new approaches and unique solutions in the field of soil, groundwater, sewage and wastewater decontamination and treatment of contaminated railway ballast. The company developed two different processes (AFA and SOA) for straightforward, efficient and cost-effective in- situ generations of superoxide radical and applying of the radical as a strong oxidizing agent, under NTP conditions. Under these conditions, superoxide radicals reveal properties of a super nucleophile and super oxidizing agent which rapidly reacts with a wide range of soil and water pollutants (such as Hydrocarbons, TPH, BTEX, Petroleum leftovers, Aromatics, PAH, Chlorinated Solvents, PCB, Dioxins as well as Pesticides and Herbicides) on concertation up to 100,000 ppm and responsible for the swift mineralization of the contaminants. While AFA is based on advanced Fenton and Haber-Weiss reactions activated for superoxide production. SOA is a unique process of alkali superoxide production from standard and stable shelf products. Both of our patented methodologies applicable for in-situ and on-site treatment approaches. The laboratory development phase with dozens of different types of contaminated substances and first pilot tests in a real condition has been accomplished. The technology stability and efficiency have been approved by independent tests carried out with TÜV Süd, Germany certification authority. The conversion rates of up to 97% for lab tests and pilot tests were achieved after two hours.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Organization short description: Building IoT devices for monitoring fill-level of bins combined with an AI prediction model for increased efficiency.
About: WasteHero offers an end-to-end IoT solution that optimizes waste collection processes using machine learning. WasteHero devices monitor activity, including bin fullness, and temperature/ fill rates to identify waste generation patterns. Data from bins is collected on the company web-based platform, which produces real-time analysis for city officials to visualize the fullness of trash bins and deploy haulers only when needed. WasteHero Fleet Management and Intelligent Routing harness AI and machine learning to present reports containing actionable insights that help waste management officials identify areas in need and track the efficiency of improvements over time. The insights help mitigate container overflow, reduce the number of overall collections, guide bin placement and optimize operational efficiency.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution name: HYGEN Plus - a supercharger for business fleet vehicles
Solution on-sentence summary: Fueling gas powered vehicles anywhere in just a few minutes
Identification: Unlike large centralised public stations that require millions of euros to build, HYGEN+ is a cost-effective decentralised system, dedicated to the owner of the NGV. HYGEN brings to the market superchargers for G-Mobility that can fuel your Bio-CNG Vehicle at home or at office in just a few minutes. By offering convenient refuelling for the motorist, HYGEN+ removes the bottleneck of a limited centralised refuelling network of stations.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: New clients, Visibility and Funding.
Target client profile: BusinessEnergy Utility, BusinessServicesInfrastructureRoads & Road Traffic Infrastructure
Tags: Vehicles, Biogas & biomethane, Biofuel
The environmental benefits: 4.4 million tonnes of CO2 eq. will be removed from the atmosphere between 2021-2029 ;
The Financial benefits: HYGEN+ units sold between 2021 and 2029 will lead to cost reductions across Europe of €424.9milllion;
Complementary solutions: Biomethane for clean transportation: Production and distribution of biomethane as fuel  (Energy,Freight);Shore-to-Ship Power: A state-of-the art electrification solution to make ports more sustainable (Freight,Infrastructures);EcoStruxure ™ EV Charging Expert: Smart management system for ev charging while ensuring building power availability (Freight,Mobility,Infrastructures);HYGEN Plus - a supercharger for business fleet vehicles: Fueling gas powered vehicles anywhere in just a few minutes (Freight);
Organization short description: HYGEN brings to market home/office superchargers for g-mobility that can fuel gas powered vehicle in just a few minutes.
About: Hygen SIA is an ambitious and innovative Latvian SME dedicated to the development and commercialisation of refuelling technology for the natural gas vehicle (NGV) market. Our company has a host of awards to its name, including EIT Innovators Award Nomination 2018 and 3d place of Innovation Prize of German Gas Industry 2018. Hygen employs 14 highly qualified staff and has a strong and ambitious leadership team lead by CEO Mario Parraglia, CNG market guru and former Senior Vice President of Business Development & Strategic Planning of a Canadian manufacturer of home fuelling appliances FuelMaker. Alex Safronov, the inventor of the HYGEN core technology, founded the company in 2009 to develop and commercialise an innovative new approach to refuelling VFAs, at a time when others were spearheading solutions based on unreliable mechanical piston compression technology. Hygen has received a total of €3.5million, which it has helped to develop the HYGEN technology platform. The technology has just been successfully independently tested by ENGIE Lab on behalf of GRDF, one of a number of large energy companies very interested in our HYGEN VFAs (“HYGEN-Plus” for business fleets and “HYGEN-Gasdroid” for homes). Today we have 5 major players from the energy industry (GRDF, ENAGAS, GCA, FLUXYS, UNIPER) committed to piloting the coming HYGEN+ system for small business fleets after succesfully testing the previous model for homes (https://www.gasconnect.at/ueber-erdgas/erdgastechnologien/compressed-natural-gas-cng/home-fill-gastankstelle/).
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable and affordable alternative to single-use plastics
Identification: Plastic pollution has become one of our planet’s greatest environmental threats. Much plastic may be single-use, but that does not mean it is easily disposable. When discarded in landfills or in the environment, plastic can take up to a thousand years to decompose. Ecoware tackles this issue by providing 100% biodegradable and compostable packaging that negates the need for single-use plastics. Made from the waste of common agricultural crops, Ecoware has disposable tableware, packaging and medical-care products that offer an affordable and sustainable alternative to single-use plastics.
Looking For: Network, new clients, visibility, funding, partners
Tags: Packaging, Waste-to-materials, Agricultural Waste, Plastic alternatives, Recycle waste
The environmental benefits: 100% compostable and will biodegrade in any natural environment;80% less energy used in production than mainstream alternative;Uses 78% less water than paper alternative;
The Financial benefits: $2.47 of impact created for every $1 invested;
Complementary solutions: LACTIPS: A 100% biobased material for a sustainable packaging alternative (Industry & Consumer Goods);Claranor: Pulsed light packaging sterilization equipment for bioindustries (Industry & Consumer Goods);Paptic: A novel paper production technology for sustainable packaging (Industry & Consumer Goods);BioPak: A compost service to reduce the environmental impact of single-use foodservice packaging (Food & Agriculture,Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description: Ecoware is India’s first and largest sustainable food packaging company. The Ecoware range of 28 compostable products includes tableware, cutlery and takeaway packaging. All products are 100% natural and biodegradable in 90 days. They use only local raw materials thereby keeping their costs and carbon footprint low.
About:
Ecoware is India’s first and largest sustainable food packaging company. The Ecoware range of 28 compostable products includes tableware, cutlery and takeaway packaging. All products are 100% natural and biodegradable in 90 days. They use only local raw materials thereby keeping their costs and carbon footprint low.



Ecoware takes immense pride in being over-certified. Ecoware is the only USDA Bio-based certified manufacturer in India, is PFAS free, and have been audited on Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) parameters and achieved $2.41 of impact for every $1 invested. Ecoware has been recognised for its efforts to promote the principles of a circular economy by finishing runner up in the Indian Circular Economy Awards and by being a finalist at The Circular Awards presented by the World Economic Forum in Davos.



Ecoware has 12 sales partners globally, 23 distributors in India and 150+ point-of-sales shops across India. They export to Sri Lanka, Kuwait, Peru, France, Ecuador, Kenya, South Africa and the Caribbean.



Ecoware actively works with farmers to turn their biomass - which is usually burned, which is both financially and environmentally detrimental - into a source of positive outcomes. From rice to sugarcane to wheat to bamboo, Ecoware is taking what was once waste and turning it into a 100% eco-friendly product curbing the production of plastics and their dispersion into the natural environment.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Identification: Every activity needs water for its operation. However, the resource is becoming scarce. Recycling is now a necessity. MBBR BOX packages help small & mid-size customers to save water while complying with increasingly complex discharge regulations. With its water treatment efficiency 3 times higher than current technologies, 1H2O3 offers compact and modular packages for Aquaponics, Aquaculture, Municipal and Industrial wastewater treatment. MBBR BOX is a highly customizable solution that will help small and medium-sized customers looking for a smarter, less expensive and cleaner solution to their water treatment needs.

Solution on-sentence summary: Predictive maintenance and precision mapping of buried pipelines against safety and environmental threats
Identification: A significant portion of pipelines across the world cannot be secured and inspected through traditional tools. In certain cases, such as for Oil & Gas pipelines, this constitutes a major safety and environmental threat for pipeline operators and local communities in close proximity. Incidents on such infrastructures can have devastating consequences as seen on several occasions. The US safety material administration estimates that in the past 6 years, in the US alone, there were over 3,300 incidents resulting in over 80 deaths and 400 injuries while causing $4bn of material damages. Pipelines transporting water are reported to have the same safety issues with an estimated 25% product loss due to poor infrastructure conditions. The advantage of the technology proposed by Skipper NDT is related to its ease of implementation (no disruption of operations) and its accuracy.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessMining & Extraction, BusinessWater Utility
Tags: Water-networks, Cleaning, Maintenance and inspection
The environmental benefits: Skipper NDT could help prevent 45% of water waste during in pipelines;It could help prevent 21% of incidents responsible for the release of 325 million tons of Green House Gas worldwide;
Complementary solutions: ScaleBuster: Water system treatment for scale and corrosion (Water,Buildings & Shelters);1001 fontaines: A sustainable water enterprise based on decentralization of water production and distribution (Water);PICOGEN®: A stand-alone power supply for measuring and monitoring equipments in drinking water network (Water,Infrastructures);HARSONIC Ultrasound Biofilm Removal: An ultrasound device to avoid biofilm contamination, fouling and scaling (Water);
Organization short description: Contactless magnetic technology for the inspection of buried oil & gas pipelines. Safety of people, environment & assets.
About:
To date approximately 30% all oil & gas pipelines across the world cannot be secured through traditional tools, representing a total of 1.5 million KM . This constitutes a major safety and environmental threat for pipeline operators and local communities in close proximity.  Incidents on such infrastructures can have devastating consequences as seen on several occasions.  A single incident on a gas pipeline in Belgium caused 24 deaths and 132 injuries.  Another incident in the French natural reserve of La Crau resulted in the spillage of over 5’400 m3 of heavy crude oil over 5 hectares with a severe impact on the local ecosystem.

The US safety material administration estimates that in the past 6 years, in the US alone, there were over 3,300 incidents resulting in over 80 deaths and 400 injuries while causing $ 4bn of material damages. 

   

To solve this issue, Skipper NDT develops a contactless magnetic technology to help secure this energy infrastructure where traditional means are not applicable.  Our objective is to contribute to the safety of the people and the environment while ensuring no operational disruption.  

 

We are currently deploying on the field the 3rd version of our hardware prototype while continuing to develop more performant algorithms and machine learning techniques to automatically detect danger zones on a pipeline.  The current version is commercialized. Among our clients in Europe: TOTAL, Air Liquide, Fluxys, Dépôts Pétroliers de Foss (DPF)...

 

TOTAL supports our R&D efforts, providing technical expertise and financial resources. We also have collaborations with major R&D labs such as the Geeps laboratory (Centrale Supelec), IFP EN (Institut Français du Pétrole et des Energies nouvelles). Discussions are underway with MIT. 

 

A French patent has been awarded, and pending in Europe, Canada & the US. 

 

The technology received several awards, the French Ministry of Research award (iLab 2017), the EU Excellence Award (H2020 SME 1), selection to the NETVA program in North America, selection to the Creative Destruction Lab program at the University of Calgary...

VIDEO PRESENTATION: https://vimeo.com/194726707
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: Investment capacity of small farmers to reverse the vicious cycle of migratory agriculture
Identification: Ecotierra does so through the combination of lending patient microcredit (at half the market rate) to small farmers, building the infrastructure required to add value to the agricultural products and increase productivity (e.g. mills, collection, centres, compost production centres), sales services, and VCS certified carbon projects. It is financed by a private equity fund, Urapi Sustainable Land Use. In Latin America alone there are more than 155 coffee producer cooperatives, and Ecotierra is currently working with only 7 of them offering significant market opportunities. Furthermore, beyond coffee, the business model could be applied to other dry commodities such as cocoa and nuts.

-	development of high impact and financially sustainable business models which do not rely on grants and philanthropy

Solution on-sentence summary: Circular led solutions reusing existing lighting features
Identification: Most lights today are designed to be thrown away after one usage, are not made to be detached and reconstructed, and are mainly made out of a mix of plastics which makes them very hard to recycle. Venus is trying to solve this problem by reusing existing lighting features. We produce circular LED solutions built on existing fixtures, which are functional, high-quality, and use energy-saving technology. The solution reuses waste such as fishnets to create lighting features that are made to be detached if one piece isn't working anymore which enables consumers to keep the same lighting feature for decades if wished.

Organization short description: We produce circular LED solutions built on existing fixtures, but offering all of the functionality, lighting quality and energy saving technology expected from state-of-the-art LED.
About:
Fischer Lighting is a sustainable business in rapid development, launching a unique circular concept. We see no reason to discard perfectly functional lighting fixtures, if they can be renewed and turned into something even better.



We aim to steer away from the traditional use-and-discard consumer culture which is prevalent in the lighting business. Every year, millions of functional lighting fixtures with outdated electronics are thrown away and end up in trash heaps.



Renewing is simpler, better for the environment and cheaper than buying new materials.



This is why we produce modular LED solutions built on existing fixtures, but offering all of the functionality, lighting quality and energy saving technology expected from state-of-the-art LED.



We create solutions with a better quality of light, lower energy consumption and reduced environmental footprint.



LED solutions from Fischer Lighting frequently lead to fewer disruptions in the installation phase, as it will not be necessary to rebuild or restructure ceilings. Our solutions can be taken apart, eliminating the need to discard the lamp or fixture in connection with future upgrades.



Our method is responsible renewal for a brighter future.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution name: NAWACAP: High Energy High Power Ultracapacitors
Solution on-sentence summary: A new high-energy and power density ultracapacitors for energy storage
Identification:
The so-called NAWACap products are advantageous either as substitute to classic batteries and supercapacitors for application that require a short level of power providing a solution that can be 2 times smaller in size/volume/weight than existing solutions often oversize. Or it can also be stronger in hybridization to either batteries pack or Fuel cells stacks to create hybrid power supply units. 

By handling power peaks, NAWACap can significantly expand the battery life and improve safety. In an electric car for instance, an NAWACap can provide the power surge needed for acceleration, and recharge during regenerative braking (deceleration) phases. 

NAWACap is positioned in between classical ultracapacitors, where it is better in energy, and lithium batteries, where it is better in power. Our product is long-lasting (1 millions cycles), green, safe and more easily rehabilitated and recycled. NAWACap is the perfect solution for combining the power of ultracapacitors and the autonomy of a lithium battery or a fuel cell in an "hybrid system".
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: NAWA is looking for ambitious or crazy projects that can benefit from our technology which can also include unbreakable composites and advances electrodes for Lithium batteries and Fuelcells.

Organization short description: SOFTCAR SA offers licenses to assemble low footprint cars next to mega cities. SOFTCAR propose soft mobility
About:
SOFTCAR for SOFT MOBILITY SOLUTION

SOFTCAR offers a new solution of soft mobility, ideal for cleaning up urban centers. Everything is designed at SOFTCAR to reduce the carbon footprint as much as possible. The vehicles are designed in 4 modules, which are sent from assembly centers.



DNA: Descendant in direct line of Swatch - mobile idea, SOFTCAR took over from 0 the conception of a vehicle to propose a new solution allowing to produce vehicles with the lowest carbon footprint ever realized.

From the off-site assembly center, to the new materials used, to the ultra-light chassis, everything at Softcar is designed taking into account the complete life cycle of the vehicle to reduce the carbon footprint.

The genes of evolution have been integrated at the start and 4 bodies and 16 graphics will be produced annually.

Via the "Soft Cloud database", users will send back a global user experience and the evolution will be in the addition of lightness, reduction of CO2, and reduction of the carbon footprint, safety and associated services.

The chassis and hull have been designed to enter the circular economy and the license sale system allows us to quickly propagate our Softcar product all over the planet, which will ultimately allow these avant garde vehicles to be distributed for the most large number.

We are positioning ourselves as precursors of a paradigm shift in the design, manufacture and distribution of our vehicles.

We let you discover in this document how, starting from the probably cleanest car, we are going to make leaser our vehicles cheaper than our competitors and how we manage to concentrate such a quantity of USP on a single vehicle.

Mission: The Mission of SOFTCAR is to offer a solution to depollute mobility in the megacities of our planet. SOFTCAR has designed the cleanest car and the assembly center to produce, sell, recycle vehicles as close as possible to users. We introduced a notion of sharing in the limited series then that part of the gain from the sales is returned to humanitarian organizations

Goal: The company goal is to reduce CO2  for mobility.

To achieve this goal, SOFTCAR  WILL finalize the development of a clean city car, will  set-up a pilot plant in Switzerland in order to demonstrate that SOFTCAR is the lowest cost and cleanest car ever, and then leverage on this success , with a geographically distributed manufacturing model based on a worldwide licensing approach. License package contain patents right of use, factory and equipment  layout, parts design,  access to production tools , complete recipice to build the cleanest car ,communication  from SWIZERLAND, parts organization to start an assembly production plant in a few months, new limited series of graphic art .



Technologies: SOFTCAR SA has developed a range of innovative technologies to conceive vehicles with very low environmental footprint. These technologies are mainly based on the massive use of novel materials such as polymers and advanced composites, which allows for vehicles with breakthrough light weight architectures to be produced. This approach also reduces by a factor 20 the number of parts in the vehicle compared to standard commercial electric vehicles, which simplifies enormously the manufacturing process and hence the production costs. A further key innovation lies in the complete decoupling of the chassis and body, away from classical integrated steel frame chassis, which offers a range of technical and commercial advantages, as a complete SOFTCAR  body can be  



Micro-manufacturing: SOFTCAR’s manufacturing process is unprecedentedly low capex, thanks to the very simple vehicle architecture and assembling approach. This unique manufacturing approach allows for micro-factories with capacity as low as 5000 vehicles / year to be economically viable, while producing clean vehicles with highly competitive prices. This is a paradigm shift compared to the current trend for automotive giga-factories. Moreover, each micro-factory could benefit from a dedicated vehicle design. These assets offer the unique opportunity to deploy geographically distributed micro-factories to meet local market needs, while generating local jobs and strong product identification by local populations.  



Licensing model: The company goal is to set-up a pilot plant in Switzerland to produce and commercialize a SOFTCAR city car in order to demonstrate that our technologies allow to manufacture the lowest cost and cleanest car ever. We will then leverage on this success to capture growing market shares globally, both for city cars and light duty vehicles, based on a worldwide licensing approach for micro-factories. License packages contain amongst other things the right of use of SOFTCAR’s patents, the factory and equipment layout, the parts design, the complete manufacturing recipe, the technology transfer until operational start-up, and a unique vehicle design upon request.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable water saving aerator used in hand washes & sinks
Identification: In a typical American house, faucets run for around 8 minutes a day and consume nearly 11 gallons of water per person per day. That’s close to 42 liters per person every day. The water that comes out from the faucet is close to 24% of the overall water used every day. Earthfokus water savers have a unique atomization technology that converts normal flow to a fine gentle mist. The covers create a single layer of water on the surface and remove the dirt and wet the surface evenly. Plus with the fine mist, It creates a cloud around your faucet and improves your hand wash efficiency. It not only saves water but also the energies that are associated with it, Like energy and our earthfokus water saver saves more than 95% water from your tap as well as reduce your building's carbon footprint.

Solution on-sentence summary: Building a zero emission, energy consumption, energy efficient and sustainable house
Identification: Housing is energy consuming and expensive to buy and to heat. Traditional construction techniques are expensive and inefficient because they haven't reaped the benefits of industrialization, include too many stakeholders, and are not technology-oriented (12 times fewer R&D investments than any other industrial sector). Bhaluu constructions address the challenge by defining housing based on the demand’s priorities. A house is a shelter protecting its inhabitants from exterior hazards (weather, energy prices, etc.) they focus on insulation without compromising core construction features: solidity, stability, sustainability, acoustics & aesthetics. Bhaluu's technology consists of a continuous layer of self-supporting material avoiding thermal bridges which essentially blocks any exchange of temperature between the house and its environment. Combined with a construction process integrating logical steps, lean principles & automation the technology is able to provide accessible, efficient Housing. The solution product is a zero-emission housing with no concession built with industrialized processes and logical steps to gain on timing and productivity.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners,
Tags: Thermal insulation, Walls & facades, Construction materials, Green building
The environmental benefits: Avoid thermal bridges ;Build a continuous insulating envelope around the house ;Lowers housing energy consumption by 17 times;
The Financial benefits: 15 to 20% cheaper than the traditional construction;25% cheaper for the same energy performance;

Organization short description: We innovate construction technology to improve the well-being of end-users while ensuring budget and timing certainty.
About:
Our mission is to offer high-performance, qualitative housing accessible to all demographic classes. Our objective is to guarantee direct comfort and certainty for the future to the future residents.

We want to have an environmental and social impact by developing innovative techniques that reduce waste, pollution, energy consumption and encourage local hiring.



Our technology meets the present and future needs of housing. The heart of our technology is based on a continuous insulating envelope allowing construction with zero thermal bridge without compromise of stability, acoustics, structure or architectural form.

Better and cheaper: our constructions consume 17 times less energy than the existing fleet and 20 to 30% cheaper than traditional constructions.



It is unique because it allows the envelope of a building to be produced according to the theoretical ideal, without compromise. We have no knowledge of any other constructive method that meets these criteria. This process therefore allows the performance limits to be pushed back to the theoretical maximum values, in an area not yet exploited for energy optimization. 



It’s a quantum leap, a renewal in the construction industry, with immediate financial, social and lasting benefits.

Solution on-sentence summary: A high-efficiency gas microchp heat pump enabling trigeneration for the residential sector
Identification: Climate change and depletion of resources are urging to create new energy models, aiming at reducing the greenhouse gas emission by reaching higher conversion rates, avoiding energy losses, and using resources of lower carbon intensity. Today, heating and cooling small businesses and residential settings represent 25% of the EU’s energy consumption. Condensing boilers and heat pumps are the main options nowadays. If heat pumps have a much better energy efficiency than condensing boilers, they are also more expensive during the initial installation and their exploitation. Indeed, heat pumps are powered with electricity coming from the grid and their efficiency is jeopardized by the higher cost of the electricity in comparison to natural gas. In addition, during wintertime, the efficiency of the heat pump significantly decreases which contributes to a significant increase of electricity consumption. Moreover, the inefficiencies of centralized production (40%) and the losses in transportation (5-10%) contribute to lower the global footprint of heat pumps. FLAMINCO merges 3 technologies in one pathway towards energy decarbonization: gas micro-CHP (Combined Heat and Power), heat pumps, and condensing boilers. It can be powered with natural gas, biogas or electricity to deliver up to 135 kWth of reliable and sustainable heat (and sometimes electricity supply) and/or 50 kW of cooling.  The technology merges cutting-edge technologies for heating sector, micro CHP, and gas heat pumps, in a versatile technology, reaching efficiencies over 175% and thus saving costs 4,600 €/yr. while reducing greenhouse gas emissions by 31%. It is ready to integrate into smart grids and it may decide how to work depending on economic and environmental factors, contributing to a more sustainable energy production
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility,
Tags: Heat-pump, Biogas & biomethane, Cooling, Biofuel, Cogeneration (heat and power), Building heating
Sectors: Buildings, Heating, cooling and ventilation, Energy and fuel efficiency

The Financial benefits: The gas bill reduced by 31% compared to a conventional boiler;Payback time of 4 years;

Solar space heating: Solar-powered air heaters and rock bed thermal storage to heat homes 

 (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);X-Sol 100 : Resistant and low-cost solar water heater using special plastic materials (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Heat recovery system: Low temperature heating of premises by recycling waste heat from refrigeration systems (Energy,Buildings & Shelters);animeo Connect : Facade shading management solution for increased energy savings in buildings (Buildings & Shelters);
Organization short description: MITIS is a startup company developing decentralized small power and clean energy systems.
About:
Decentralized or distributed energy systems such as wind turbines, photovoltaic solar panels, fuel cells, cogeneration (or CHP, Combined Heat and Power) and many others present the invaluable advantage of providing electricity on-site, avoiding big losses in transport and making them much more efficient and sustainable than current old centralized power generation plants. In particular, micro cogeneration in the residential and commercial sectors allows householders and business owners to produce their own electricity (that they can also export to the grid) and use by-product heat for heating and/or cooling, significantly reducing greenhouse emissions and saving primary energy. Their huge potential has been recognized by the EU, especially considering that households’ consumption accounts for 25.4% of total European energy consumption.



MITIS develops efficient and innovative micro CHP systems based on gas microturbine, delivering between 10 and 50 KWe for three major applications and sectors:

-	Collective residential and small business: a ground-breaking micro CHP boiler system combined with a heat pump designed to replace conventional domestic boilers, and that can be integrated in individual/community smart grids (micro-networks) with other renewables.

-	Agriculture: micro CHP systems for small biogas production plants. 

-	Transport: new generation range extenders for the electrification of transport industry.



Some of our main innovations, all designed and engineered by MITIS:

-	Flameless combustor adapted to a microturbine which produces extremely stable and clean combustion with ultra-low emissions of NOx and CO as well as adapted to various gaseous (NG, methane, Biogas) and liquid fuels (ethanol).

-	Patented gas-gas recuperator and high efficiency heat exchanger to boost the thermal efficiency of our microturbine.

-	Permanent magnet synchronous generator and air foil bearings with no lubricant leading to low maintenance cost and low downtime.

-	Low CAPEX and OPEX energy conversion thanks to simplicity, modularity and low maintenance.

Our first micro CHP system is named MITIS µ10 ready for field testing and commercialization planned for 2022.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A smart-grid pontoon delivering renewable energy for electric boat charging
Identification: Inland waterways transport is an ecological mean of transport (compared to road and air carriers) on a worldwide navigable network of almost one million kilometers. With a huge fossil energy consomption fleet and underdeveloped infrastructure, it remains a reliable and inexpensive mean of transport. The E-ROW concept would allow the recycling of this fleet in electric or hybrid propulsion recharge with an ecological smart grid pontoon equipped with tidal/ river turbine, low in carbon footprint compare to other technologies.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: BusinessEnergy Utility, BusinessServicesInfrastructurePorts and Marine Infrastructure, BusinessServicesRetailerB2C E-Commerce Platforms
Tags: Coastal, Off-grid, Rivers, Batteries - energy storage, Boats, Turbines, Marine & Oceans, Solar photovoltaic, Vehicles
Sectors: Infrastructures, Mobility, Power and fuel generation, Power and fuel distribution
The environmental benefits: This solution can be applicable in different cities of the globe such as in Bordeaux for pleasure cruises, in Abidjan for its lagoon passenger transport system or even for the public transportation network in Geneva;In production, no CO2 are emitted in the atmosphere and no water is used;
The Financial benefits: The payback time is about 8 years;Savings of minimum 30% on the fossils energies consumption ;
Complementary solutions: Sion: An eco-friendly and low-cost electric car with integrated photovoltaic cells (Mobility);City Boats Lisbon: An alternative city river and lake transportation for touristic activities (Mobility);Cryonod: Recovering energy from natural gas networks by liquidizing industrial gases (Energy,Infrastructures);Atawheel: Zero emission mobility based on hydrogen energy storage and water electrolysis technology (Infrastructures,Mobility);
Organization short description: Recovering sustainable and low cost electricity from the Hydrokinetic energy of river, estuaries and tides.
About:
Our hydrokinetic river and tidal turbine technology has been developed with the objective of making this electricity production cost-effective and economically viable. Our first production units are already competitive compared to Genset for non-interconnected areas. The  two products available now are  a 2 kW and a 20 kW device.

We provide also hybrid electricity production system (photovoltaics, batteries, hydrokinetic turbines, etc.) for isolated territories and thus ensure the socio-economic development of these areas. Guinard Energies is targeting larger production units as shown in the demonstrator project for a 250 kW  MegaWattBlue® P400 turbine in French Brittany.

In addition, they provide hydrokinetic potential study and in-situ measurements.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: Using the circular economy to create sustainable and low-cost offices
Identification: Rype Office remanufactures high-quality unwanted furniture to as-new condition using quality controlled engineering processes. The resulting items are less than half of the list price with an 80% reduced environmental footprint. This solution also creates sustainable new furniture from waste materials, such as a range of board room tables made from post-consumer waste plastic. Rype Office's free award-winning design service integrates all furniture along with a wide range of fantastic circular products into beautiful, productive and healthy offices.
Looking For: Introductions to organisations looking for a new beautiful, low cost and sustainable office; Opportunities for brand promotion and marketing; Connections with organisations looking to clear high quality office furniture and want to reduce their costs. Operational ease and quality of furniture depending, we help organisation find a good home for unwanted furniture; Introductions to potential advocates and referrers.
Tags: Furniture, Corporate & Employees, Waste-to-materials, Recycle waste, Consumer-goods
The environmental benefits: Rype Office can deliver circular economy furniture and furnishings which have an 80% reduced environmental footprint (CO2, water etc).;The Rype Office solution is applicable for any organisation looking to create a beautiful, low cost and sustainable workspace;
The Financial benefits: Remanufacturing delivers furniture and finishings that are less than half of the list price of new ones.;
Complementary solutions: WOODOO: A bio-based translucent wood material for sustainable construction applications (Industry & Consumer Goods);LACTIPS: A 100% biobased material for a sustainable packaging alternative (Industry & Consumer Goods);RT7000: A machine to chemically recycle plastic waste back into oil (Industry & Consumer Goods,Waste & Pollution);BIO DISPERSIS LC: Recycle vinasse, a polluting residue from the alcohol industry, into organic additives for concrete (Waste & Pollution,Industry & Consumer Goods);
Organization short description: Rype Office uses the Circular Economy to help clients create offices, which are beautiful, sustainable and cost less
About:
Rype Office has developed the processes and technologies to cost-effectively remanufacture office furniture to as-new condition. We take the long-life elements of a furniture item (such as steel bases), check and resurface them, and then rebuild the item around these pieces, for example with 100% recycled fabrics.  The resulting piece of furniture is half the list price, with an environmental footprint 80% lower than new and doesn’t compromise on style or ergonomic support.



We work with companies to remanufacture their existing furniture and also source used furniture for remanufacturing from wholesale used furniture traders. This is high quality furniture from brand name manufacturers like Herman Miller and Vitra. 



We have an award-winning team of designers and interior architects who help clients create wonderful workspaces at no charge.  We are also developing a range of products manufactured from post-consumer waste plastic, including an elegant board room.We perform the fit out, including flooring, ourselves and, for large projects, employ as many long term unemployed or disabled people as possible.

We work with companies to remanufacture their existing furniture and unwanted stocks and also source used furniture for remanufacturing from wholesale used furniture traders. This is high quality furniture from brand name manufacturers like Herman Miller and Vitra. 



We have an award-winning team of designers and interior architects who help clients create wonderful workspaces at no charge, combining furniture remanufactured from the client’s existing stock or sourced externally.  We are also developing a range of products manufactured from post-consumer waste plastic, including an elegant board room table. We perform the fit out, including flooring, ourselves and, for large projects, employ as many long term unemployed or disabled people as possible.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A data-inspired, open platform for the management of construction products and materials
Identification: Construction information (digital twin) containing asset, product and material data can be stored, enriched and managed. Madaster processes IFC/BIM files and enriches them with data from public and non-public sources. The platform provides a trusted data source for an ecosystem of marketplaces, designers, financers, valuators and regulators. These third-party services are accessible on request of the users. Data security, privacy and availability is supervised by an independent entity. Through its data, Madaster stimulates reuse of materials and decrease of CO2 emissions. Madaster's impact could result in the yearly demolition of 1,38 million buildings and the construction of 1,56 million new ones (EU only) and a global CO2 emission reduction estimated to 38% or 2.0Bln tonnes CO2 by 2050.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Reuse waste, Construction & demolition waste, Software
Sectors: Waste/Pollution, Materials and chemicals, Sell and trade, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Reuse of products and materials can save up to 38% or 2.0Bln tonnes CO2 emission by 2050, avoiding the production of new products;
The Financial benefits: Construction passport delivery costs at least 70% lower compared to alternative consulting approach;SME data storage costs at least 80% lower compared to individual company storage solutions;

Organization short description: The global online register for materials and products in the built environment that facilitates a circular economy.
About:
Madaster is the global online register for real estate data on materials and products. 

It is our mission to facilitate a circular economy where waste can be eliminated by providing materials with an identity via Material Passports. Through data services for building owners, constructors, financiers and designers, it brings transparency in the circular and financial value of buildings. Madaster carefully focuses on governance, privacy, security and continuity.
SDG’s of application: SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Capturing large scale quantities of co2 from industrial emissions with a negative carbon footprint
Identification: A negative carbon footprint is essential in order to capture effectively the CO2 coming from industrial processes. In order to do so and to respect Suez circular economy engagement, this solution is based on the revalorisation of the captured carbon under the form of micro algae biomass. The device relies on a new technology of artificial light diffusion that homogenize better the photons flow, which is key for a good algae growth, resulting in bests growth/energy ratio to obtain a carbon credit assessment and rate of performance. This Solution allows revalorizing the produced biomass in either energy or a bio-product, both to be used as an avoidance of fossil fuel made products with carbonaceous gray energy.
