Organization short description: With an active presence on five continents, SUEZ and its 90,000 employees strive to preserve our environment’s natural capital: water, soil, and air.
About:
Since the end of the 19th century, SUEZ has built expertise aimed at helping people to constantly improve their quality of life by protecting their health and supporting economic growth. With an active presence on five continents, SUEZ and its 90,000 employees strive to preserve our environment’s natural capital: water, soil, and air. SUEZ provides innovative and resilient solutions in water management, waste recovery, site remediation and air treatment, optimizing municipalities’ and industries’ resource management through “smart” cities and improving their environmental and economic performance. The Group delivers sanitation services to 64 million people and produces 7.1 billion m3 of drinking water. SUEZ is also a contributor to economic growth, with more than 200,000 jobs created directly and indirectly on an annual basis, and a provider of new resources, with 4.2 million tons of secondary raw materials produced. 

By 2030, the Group is targeting 100% sustainable solutions, with a positive impact on our environment, health and climate. SUEZ generated total revenue of €18.0 billion in 2019.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Web-based residential building energy efficiency compliance software
Identification: This product is a response to the environmental efficiency regulations popping up everywhere around the world and causing a revolution in the building industry. As a consequence, the residential builders are being pushed to make high-performance homes, but the existing physics-based energy modeling tools do not have the scale nor the thoroughness to assess all possibilities, making the current process costly and risky. StepWin is powered by our, first of its kind, proprietary Rapid Building Energy Simulation Tool (R-BEST) which is 1,000,000 times faster than the traditional physics-based simulation tools. It also incorporates construction costs into this process, which has been another key missing piece. With these technologies, StepWin can tell homebuilders where to invest their budget to maximize the value of their build for themselves and their customers.simulation tools.
Looking For: New clients; Visibility; Funding; Partners
Tags: Construction, Software, Smart-buildings
The environmental benefits: StepWin can reduce the operational GHG emissions of a typical design by 3 tonnes per year;
The Financial benefits: StepWin can realize up to 18.5% construction energy-related cost savings on the typical project, while the cost analysis component alone is 30%-70% cheaper than conventional alternatives.;

 (Buildings & Shelters);

Solution on-sentence summary: Smart and easy financing and management solutions for accelerating the global shift to solar power
Identification: Their solution intents to remove the obstacles corporations face in their transition to solar energy. In this sense, it helps businesses transition to solar power without having to carry the costs in terms of financial and time investments. Skysun takes care of every aspect of the project (from feasibility studies to permits), investing in the solar power modules and overseeing their installation. In the long run, operation and maintenance are also taken care of. Thus, the client benefits from a free PV installation and, at the end of the contract, the client becomes the owner of the solar panels. Skysun’s Solar Finance’s success is tied to the success of its customers as the more green energy is produced, the better the return on investment for Skysun, enabling the company to invest in new projects – thereby increasing its positive impact on the environment.

In technical terms : Skysun is a solar power third party investment company. In English : We help businesses and individuals benefit from the countless advantages of solar power without having to carry the costs in terms of financial and time investments. 



The biggest advantage is the alignment of objectives, as our income is directly linked to the day-to-day production of the panels, our partner companies are guaranteed to have the best and most functional installation. The more green energy is produced, the more money they save and the better our investment. Our success is linked to theirs. Solution on-sentence summary: A bio-based technology for the production of single-use wheat bran tableware and other products
Identification: Biotrem products are created exclusively from natural raw materials of plant origin, already available in large quantities, which are by-products or leftovers of the agricultural and food industries. Main product line is fully biodegradable disposable tableware produced from the compressed wheat bran. 1 ton of wheat bran can be transformed into over 10.000 plates, bowls or cups. Wheat bran-based disposable products are environmentally friendly and fully compostable (no industrial composting required) within just 30 days. Biotrem products are an important and effective response to the problem of plastic waste threatening the natural environment.

Solution on-sentence summary: A carbon-free electric generator matching diesel
Identification: Classical gensets are very noisy, require frequent maintenance, present a very bad energy efficiency (about 15% to 20% from tank to electric output) and can only be operated outdoor due to their pollutant emissions. BOXHy solution solves all these drawbacks, considering hydrogen as a fuel, and a hybridization between fuel cell and batteries, monitored by artificial intelligence, for a tailored electric power supply. As the only “pollutant” emission is water, BOXHy solution can be operated indoor & outdoor. As it is also noiseless, it is very suitable for operation is the close environment of the workers. As there are less moving parts, maintenance is dramatically reduced. Finally, energy efficiency is reaching about 55% from tank to output. In a nutshell, BOXHy solutions are the first Carbon-free Electric generators that can match fossil fuel Total Cost of Ownership, with high energy efficiency, no pollutant emissions and noise hazards.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners.
Tags: Electric, Off-grid, Motors, Algorithms & AI, Hydrogen
The environmental benefits: 100% less emissions of CO2 (when hydrogen is produced from renewables);45% less energy consumption over the entire life cycle;20% less quantity of resources used without recycling;
The Financial benefits: Payback time 7 years today (2020) and expected 3 years in 2025;42% reduction of ownership costs;

Solution on-sentence summary: A sensor enabling online measurement of cip station
Identification: CIP (Clean In Place) stations have no proper physical measurement to adjust the set time for each phase of the cleaning process. This means a large waste of time first, water, and energy. Elodys international has created an innovative optical sensor called OptiClean sensor which optimizes set time and control of CIP stations in the industry. OptiClean comes with productivity gains as well as CAPEX (CIP station capacity) and OPEX/environmental effects (water, energy). Another significant benefit comes from a strong improvement of CIP Quality management, which is key for a number of industrial activities.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility,
Tags: Cleaning, Sensors & monitoring, Software
The environmental benefits: Reduction of 15 to 25% of CIP water consumption;Reduction of 15% of CIP Energy consumption;
The Financial benefits: Customers save between 15% and 80% of cleaning time;Payback under two years;

About: Elodys International is a French company founded 10 years ago to develop new technologies related to industrial cleaning processes. In many industrial activities cleaning processes represent a key step in terms of quality, operating costs (energy, water, chemicals, time) but as well in terms of environmental impacts due to resources consumption and of pollution impact (BOD load). Our approach and solutions bring simultaneously economic profitability and very positive environmental effects.

Solution on-sentence summary: A fuel and emissions management tool for road freight carriers
Identification: Road freight carriers are under strong economic pressure, operating at profit margins of roughly 3%. Fuel is a major cost factor, accounting for about 30% of operating costs. The importance of reducing fuel increases with rising fuel prices, climate change and the need for shippers to reduce the environmental impact of supply chains. Yet, fuel management today often only happens at the end of the month for reporting purposes. Measures to increase fuel efficiency are missed out as they are dispersed across different fleet activities. Tracks provides road freight carriers a fuel and emissions management tool to centrally measure, reduce and report the fuel consumption and CO2 emissions of their truck fleet. With Tracks' solution, fuel efficiency measures are identified through AI-based digital twins of every truck. In a fuel efficiency hub, fleets can implement recommendations to reduce fuel consumption across fleet activities.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding opportunities, Partnership opportunities
Tags: Trucks, Algorithms & AI, Software, Fuel efficiency, Vehicles
The environmental benefits: Tracks first product version has the potential to save beyond 27 megatons (Mt) of CO2 in road freight transport globally by reducing the fuel consumption of road freight carriers by up to 15%;Tracks is hardware-free and uses existing telematics data;
The Financial benefits: Allows an immediate payback with an ROI of up to 1600%;

Organization short description: We use AI for the road freight industry to reduce its environmental footprint, gain transparency and increase efficiency
About:
The road freight industry is the backbone of our economy with continuously growing volumes of goods transported by trucks. But it is also responsible for 6% of the European CO2 emissions. Despite the fact that fuel consumption accounts for more than 30% of the costs of a truck fleet operator, fuel management and optimization is often neglected because of missing transparency.



Tracks is a Berlin-based startup founded in 2018 aiming to make road freight more efficient, safer, cleaner and fairer. After starting off with the advances of platooning, our team now leverages the power of artificial intelligence and big data to help the industry reduce their environmental footprint and increase efficiency. Thereby we are getting closer to our vision of a future powered by sustainable freight transport.



We use artificial intelligence to analyze fleet performance to provide fleet owners of any size with real-time performance analytics to empower road freight companies to increase fuel efficiency to reduce their energy consumption and ecological footprint. This includes advanced performance analysis of single vehicles, transparent efficiency comparison between vehicles and recommendations tools with actionable insights to increase efficiency of their fleets and help them make better decisions, all in a single-view dashboard. This significantly improves the customers’ bottom line and strengthens their competitive advantage in the market.



Furthermore, Tracks enables effective CO2 emissions management to increase transparency and sustainability for shippers. This includes automated carrier emissions reporting, transparent overview of their performance and advanced performance analysis of single vehicles. A win-win for shippers and their road freight carriers.



Series A Fundraising

We are raising €6m in Series A to strengthen our position in DACH and to expand sales and operations throughout Europe in 2022/23.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution name: Zero Emission Energy Recovery Brake System
Solution on-sentence summary: Eliminating the impact of brake wear dust on motor vehicles
Identification: Car manufacturers have been focused on exhaust emissions for decades, but the engine isn't the only thing creating air pollution on a vehicle. As they wear out, brake pads and tires, as well as the road surface itself, release particles of dust in the ambient air. Several studies in Science of The Total Environment or in the ACS journal Environmental Science & Technology have shown that automotive brake wear particles are a major source of Fine Particulate Matter (PM10) originating from motor vehicles. Specifically, brake wear dust is estimated to contribute 16-55% of non-exhaust traffic-related emissions. The impact of this pollution is catastrophic as it can cause cardio-respiratory problems or lung cancer to those who are exposed. According to EEA (European Environment Agency), air pollution kills over 500,000 Europeans a year. Based on innovative technology, it is possible to eliminate polluting conventional braking systems. To replace them, Mazap offers a solution that combines the safety of mechanics and the cleanliness of electricity, without compromising performance or safety. The result is economical and environmentally responsible.
Looking For: New clients, Visibility, Partners,
Tags: Cars, Heavy duty vehicles, Vehicles
Sectors: Freight, Mobility, Industry/Goods, Vehicles and vessels
The environmental benefits: Zero Emission : electromagnetic technology instead of mechanical friction;Energy Recovery : from kinetic to electrical, instead of turning it into heat; Long lifetime : Maintenance free of wear parts as pads;Fully eradicate Particulate Matter (PM) generation during braking phase;
The Financial benefits: Optimisation of car consumption;Final user average economy of $400 a year;

Solution on-sentence summary: A novel lubricant oil additive to reduce friction and lowers fuel consumption
Identification: Nanol is a two-component additive where the second part is protecting and working against wear solving many issues around WEC (White Etching Cracks) a growing problem for among other metal fatigue such as bearings. To address the WEC we need new innovations and Nanol is one of them prolonging life time tenfold times. This anti-wear lubricant additive reduces fuel and oil consumption, extendes the working life of key engines and machine components. With Nanol, there is llless friction which means less wear and tear and lower emissions
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Partners, Credibility
Target client profile: Individual, BusinessEnergy Utility, BusinessServicesTransportersTrucks & Other Road Vehicles
Tags: Lubricants, Combustion engine
Sectors: Freight, Industry/Goods, Mobility, Energy, Materials and chemicals, Energy and fuel efficiency
The environmental benefits: Nanol reduces fuel consumption by 2-5%;The environmental impact of the production process and related logistics combined for one ton of Nanol (1000 kg) is 840-1550 kg CO2;
The Financial benefits: 30X trucks(fleet) 1,169 160 L/year; saving 4%; 46 766 L/Year = ca 44 400 Euro per year; The payback is immediate;

Organization short description: Nanol Technologies is a manufacturer of high-performance lube oil additives based on a unique patented technology. The new technologies, based on nanotechnology are already represented in a wide range of products and applications. Products produced by Nanol Technologies have made inroads in the lubricant oil and grease market with a variety of applications providing significant cost savings for customers and lowering emissions footprints for its customer and the world.
About: Nanol Technologies is a developer of lubricant additives designed to among other reduce global transport fuel consumption annually. Nanol is an innovative lubricant additive that protects against wear (WEC) and reduces friction in engines and other mechanical equipment. It is reducing fuel consumption and leaves less carbon footprints. It utilises advanced nanotechnology and contains active copper dispersed in reversed micelles as a stable colloid. The additive forms nano-thin protective copper layer on friction surfaces. This results in reduced wear, increased energy efficiency, decreased fuel consumption, lower operating and maintenance costs and longer equipment life as well as important environmental benefits. Nanol is designed for use in both high performance oil and grease-based lubricants. The technology is based on more than 30 years of fundamental research work and patent applications have been filed to cover the novel technology. Nanol does not contain any isolated particles and therefore does not have any of the health, safety or environmental concerns associated with conventional nanotechnology.

Solution on-sentence summary: Cloud-based software for the design and engineering of utility-scale solar photovoltaic plants
Identification: RatedPower offers pvDesign, a cloud-based global SaaS that optimizes and shortens the design and engineering process of utility-scale PV plants from an average time of 4-6 weeks to seconds. The customers use pvDesign by simply uploading the project’s location, selecting the main equipment and criteria (topography, civil, electrical, meteorological, etc.) and download all the engineering documentation required for a given project. pvDesign, by using heuristic functions, finds the smartest site configuration in terms of cost and efficiency, often not so obvious for an engineer, enabling comparisons to secure the selection of the optimum one. They are able to better manage their resources, better understand the whole project environment and getting more accurate and optimized results. By using pvDesign clients saw a decrease of 5% in the LCOE of their plants, which translates to a 20% higher solar plant profitability.

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution for optimizing energy consumption and air quality in aquatic centres
Identification: The technical operation of aquatic centres encompasses important technical and economic issues. The municipal swimming pool is the most energy-consuming building in a local community. To tackle this challenge, ELENA Piscines developed an HVAC solution for swimming pools with immediate and significant gains, thanks to the installation of a controller, compatible with the existing Air Handling Unit (AHU) and a few sensors placed in the pool hall (temperature, hygrometry, condensation). The principle is simple: The right amount of fresh air at the right time to guarantee excellent air quality (chloramine-free), optimal hygrothermal comfort, preservation of the equipment and building (humidity control), reduction of energy consumption due to air treatment (reduction of the electrical power of the air fans).

Solution on-sentence summary: An automated solution to ease natural aeration of homes & buildings for a better health
Identification: Air quality is the first cause of human deaths in the world. Interior air quality is 2 to 8 times more polluted than outside air. It is recommended by the World Health Organization to aerate 10 minutes in the morning and the evening. But very few people are doing this for various and multiple reasons. To ease the renewal of interior air in homes and buildings, the Somfy Air solution provides an automated solution which open and close windows, in a secure mode, even if you're not here. The solution has three different levels of natural aeration depending on people's wishes. The first one will open or close the window according to a manual control, the second one with sensors, and the last one can manage the interior air quality & secured aeration. The windows are at all-time secured, as a sensor detects any intrusion attempt; and of course, the opening/closure of the window is made on a secured mode.
Tags: Windows & glass, Air quality monitors & filters, Automation, Sensors & monitoring, Wiring & connecting, Ventilation, Smart-buildings
Sectors: Buildings, Waste/Pollution, Heating, cooling and ventilation
The environmental benefits: Debit of natural aeration reach 7477 m3/h, where mechanical reach at the maxixum 250m3/h;Timing to renew interior air is reduce and less calories are lost;
The Financial benefits: 1€ spent in renovation brings 0.42€ decrease in public health costs;The solution increase interior air quality and increase health (headaches, chronicle respiratory diseases);

Solution on-sentence summary: Reducing the amount of virgin wood used in the construction industry
Identification: ReWood aims at reducing the amount of virgin wood, which is being used in the construction industry, one of the top consumer of raw materials. By taking wood from recycling factories and impregnating it to make it last longer, ReWood innovative process make it possible to transform it into facades and acoustic panels. By burning the wood slightly, it becomes resistant to humidity and can last for more than 50 years. Highly versatile, ReWood delivers a solution to architects interested in making new buildings with a nordic look while using local and sustainable materials.

Solution on-sentence summary: A unique turbine technology for the floating wind energy sector
Identification: Seawind has developed an offshore wind energy system (wind turbine and foundation) and a procedure to install the system economically offshore. Seawind assembles those systems not at sea as it is done today with the use of expensive crane vessels or jackups. The Seawind systems are assembled at a pier or at a dry dock and brought to the installation site completely assembled. In the case of floating systems, installation means simply anchoring. In the case of bottom fixed systems, installation means lowering the complete system to the seabed and actuate suction buckets. The time of installation is drastically reduced, complete systems can be stored in sheltered waters for installation during calm weather windows. The overall time for the realization of a complete offshore wind farm (500+ MW) goes down to less than one year. Foundations are made of UHPC, the lifetime of the wind farm is 50+ years, hence the system can run for many years at marginal costs, like large hydropower plants.

Organization short description: Seawind is a technology company in the floating offshore wind and floating offshore hydrogen industries.
About:
To meet global decarbonization targets, the world needs to reduce its reliance on fossil fuels and invest in renewable energy infrastructure. The future energy mix will have to drastically shift towards utility-scale offshore wind power generation. The current offshore wind industry, especially floating, still faces significant technical and economic challenges. We have the answer to these challenges: the Seawind floating wind turbines.



The potential of the offshore market is huge, 80% of which is floating, with over 1500 GW projected to be installed by 2050. Seawind’s technology has a solid pedigree starting with R&D delivered by NASA and United Technology Company. Our operational 1.5 MW wind turbine prototype in Italy proved the effectiveness of our technology. It has been improved over the years to achieve Technology Qualification in December 2019 with DNV for our 6.2 and 12.2 MW turbines. We have also developed our own floating structure which raises the benefits of our integrated floating wind turbine system even further.



Seawind’s DNA is to develop affordable green energy solutions. At the heart of our wind turbine technology, there is a flexible joint between the rotor and the shaft, which makes the system simpler, flexible, and more robust compared to the state-of-the-art 3-bladed technology. With our 25-35% energy cost advantage compared to our competitors, Seawind is the ideal solution for floating configurations and will contribute to unlocking the green hydrogen value chain. 



Today, investors have the unique opportunity to invest in Seawind and make a difference for our planet. The funds will be used to demonstrate our scaled-up technology by building and operating our demonstrator Seawind 6 and pre-series Seawind 12. The commercial deployment will start in 2024-2025.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy

Organization short description: Imagine cooling bitcoin farms and data centers more efficiently at a lower cost while removing CO2 from the atmosphere.
About:
We began having a simple goal and a simple idea, one that would shift the paradigm of air cooled data centers and Bitcoin farms. That goal, which we have already achieved technically, was to not only reduce a Bitcoin Farms and Data Centers energy consumption but to do so while maintaining a lower overall cost in comparison with all other alternatives including the incumbent, air-cooling.



In brief summary, we provide miners and servers with the power of liquid cooling without the risk. It increases cooling efficiency massively while reducing energy use and risk. Yet this is achieved without ever exposing electronic systems to the risk of a liquid coolant.



Our mission has since shifted as we realized that with access to a large source of unused waste-heat we could easily bring it at the level of quality and quantity to capture CO2 from the atmosphere directly. This also applies to all bitcoin farms and data centers' waste heat regardless of their cooling technologies.



Put simply,blockchains, web and other online services currently contribute negatively to climate change. With our solution, those same blockchains and online services will instead remove significant amounts of carbon from the atmosphere!
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A biomass cookstove giving electricity access to rural communities
Identification: About 2.6 billion people in the world do not have access to modern and clean energy which is driving a range of issues across the world including poverty, respiratory illnesses, and deforestation. The technology and know-how needed to enable energy access exists, but is currently applied in two siloed sectors: thermal energy (cookstoves) and electricity. This disparate approach has resulted in a market gap that can have serious environmental repercussions and pressure on local natural resources. The ACE One is a solution that addresses this very gap by using a solar-charged LiFePO4 battery to power the ventilator needed to create a truly clean biomass combustion while also giving users access to lighting and phone charging. Built with durable materials (8-12 years life cycle), using 50-85% less fuel, burning any type of solid biomass it is sold on a 6-9 month micro-loan. With this model, ACE is likely the only company that can give $2-a-day people access to a $100+ product.
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Partners, Credibility,
Tags: Off-grid, Developing countries, Cooker & cookstove, Solid biomass, Biofuel
The environmental benefits: Reduce personal exposure to toxic compounds by 28%;Reduce kitchen air pollution by 39%;Fuel savings in the range of 50-85%;
The Financial benefits: Payback time under 1 year;83% savings on energy expenses;

Organization short description: ACE is a social enterprise enabling clean energy access for rural households in Sub-Saharan Africa and South-East Asia.
About:
At African Clean Energy (ACE), we specialise in manufacturing and distributing the ACE One Energy System, a high quality solar-biomass hybrid enabling users to cook using significantly less fuel and offering access to electricity for mobile charging and lighting. We distribute by employing in-house sales teams and building last-mile distribution channels in the developing world which can facilitate remote households to gain access not only to the ACE One, but also to maintenance services, financial support and clean fuels. ACE is headquartered in Amsterdam, our flagship factory is in Lesotho, and we have ground operations selling B2C in Lesotho, Cambodia and Uganda. 



The ACE One provides a solution that addresses the full spectrum of Base-of-Pyramid energy needs. The device symbiotically pairs thermal and electric generation by using a solar-charged LiFePO4 battery to not only give users access to electricity, but also to power the ventilator needed to create a truly clean biomass combustion. This enables the product to have the cross-sectoral positive impact of a cookstove, with the business model of a solar home system. The ACE 1 is built with durable materials (8-12 years life cycle), uses 50-85% less fuel, burns any type of solid biomass (wood, charcoal, corn cobs, cow dung), and minimises smoke emissions to a negligible level to protect users' health. It is sold on a 6-9 month micro-loan and customers use the energy savings achieved with the product to pay back the investment. With this model, ACE is likely the only company that can give $2-a-day people access to a $100+ product.
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: A solution to oxidize and disinfect industrial wastewater and reduce treatment costs
Identification: The Plasma Vortex is a state-of-the-art plasma disinfection and oxidation system that provides robust and cost-effective wastewater decontamination. This non-chemical "directed energy" system oxidizes grey and black water, destroys organic compounds, disinfects and significantly reduces the treatment costs of other industrial effluents. Thanks to its modular and highly scalable technology, Plasma Vortex reduces existing chemical treatments, offering an environmentally friendly and cost-effective alternative to incineration. Plasma is an ionized gas ("arc lightning") and non-chemical (physics-based) treatment approach. This solution reduces the energy and cost of industrial wastewater treatment. Ultimately, Vortex Plasma allows the treatment of the most contaminated streams - including aqueous effluent and sludge streams. In addition, Plasma Vortex offers significant energy, water and environmental savings compared to the existing AOP process.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

Organization short description: Onvector sells proprietary technologies to destroy PFAS,  clean hazardous industrial water and reduce treatment costs
About:
Onvector develops and commercializes innovative, patented, leading-edge, directed-energy non-chemical systems for treatment of water and wastewater. 



Our product, Plasma Vortex, state-of-the-art plasma disinfection and oxidation, decontaminates wastewater robustly and cost-effectively. This non-chemical "directed energy" system oxidizes grey and black water, destroys organic compounds, disinfects, and significantly reduces costs of treating other industrial effluents. Our technology is modular, highly scalable, and reduces incumbent chemical-based treatments.



Plasma Vortex significantly reduces cost of water treatment by simultaneously delivering multiple oxidants and disinfectants directly into water; provides more robust oxidation and disinfection of water contaminants, microorganisms, volatile organics, solvents, BOD, COD, hydrocarbons, ammonia, odor, and a wide range of other constituents; and increases energy efficiency and compliance.

Solution on-sentence summary: Robotic mass-production of solar concentrator solutions
Identification: Industries such as food & beverages, textiles and chemicals must switch to renewable sources of fuel in the near future to reduce emissions. However, producing reliable high temperatures continues to be a barrier. However, solar thermal heat concentrators such as those produced by Absolicon now enable the production of steam and heat up to 160c from renewable sources. Absolicon's regional Robotic Production Line will mass-produce 100,000 m2 (50 MW) of the T160 parabolic solar concentrating collector every year. Thanks to the local production, the solar collectors can be locally built and installed and locally financed. This will result in solar thermal being cheaper than heat from oil and gas and in some sunny places even cheaper than coal and waste.

Organization short description: We offer the best concentrating solar collector in the world and sell robotized production lines to mass produce them.
About:
20 years ago, Joakim Byström, who then was CEO of a small investment company, funded a research project to make the best solar concentrator in the world. The results were impressive and Absolicon was founded to commercialize the results.

Today, the goals have been achieved. The Absolicon T160 solar collector has the highest ever measured optical efficiency for a small parabolic trough giving outstanding heat production for many applications. The T160 is also the only concentrating solar collector with the Solar Keymark quality mark in the world.

Absolicon Solar Collector AB is a Swedish limited company, listed on the Spotlight Stock Exchange with more than 3000 owners where the largest is the Byström family, owning ca 30% of the shares.

The board of directors has senior management experience in sales, engineering, finance and research. It consists of three members representing the mayor shareholders and two independent members. The management consist of the four head of departments and the CEO, all with academic degree in their respective profession.

Total staff count is 30 including five more or less permanent consultants. Subcontractors to produce solar collector material and production line components are located both in Sweden and around the world. 

To protect the immaterial rights of the solar thermal system, Absolicon has an internal patent attorney managing the 9 patent families pending. The patents are ranging from collector design to production line systems.

Absolicon has world-class research in solar thermal materials and a research budget of above €1M. Research partners include SPF in Switzerland, DTU in Denmark and Umeå Universitet in Sweden. Several large research projects are continuous ongoing.

Absolicon offer solar collectors and integration of solar heat and steam in industry and district heating networks on the Swedish market. 

Globally, the product Absolicon is offering is the robotized production line for the T160. Already one production line has been built in Sweden, one is sold to the Sichuan province and one was recently ordered from South Africa. Each production line has the capacity to produce 50 MW (100 000 m2) of solar concentrators annually and is operated on a licence basis.

Absolicon also supply key material and components, service and project planning services to the production line buyers.

For industrial heat, the main markets beside South Africa and China are countries with high solar radiation and high energy costs like India, Mexico, Chile, Jordan. There is also a market for soar district heating in countries like Denmark, Germany and France. Clients for the production lines are envisioned to be manufacturing industries interested in starting production and getting into the market of solar thermal.

From Sweden, Absolicon sales staff reach out to industrial companies and potential buyers of production lines. Currently there are agreements signed with interested parties in 12 countries. Competition is weak in the market for small parabolic troughs with a 5-10 companies around the world. The main competition is from “business-as-usually” and a continued burning of oil, gas and coal.

In Sweden there is a fully operational production line with two six-axis ABB-robots for domestic production and as demonstration plant for buyers. It is residing in the 3500 m2 workshop that Absolicon is renting and that also house a solar lab for quasi-dynamic collector testing, a full CNC workshop, logistic area and offices.

Absolicon has a long history of sales of solar thermal systems in many different applications. The technology concept is proven with installations in several countries, several peer-previewed scientific papers and performance assessments from certified solar thermal testing institutes.

In 2019/2020 Absolicon is launch a marketing and sales campaign “Replace burning of oil, gas and coal with solar thermal energy” towards energy and environmental middle-management in multinational companies. As several of these companies have ambitious climate targets, solar thermal will be very attractive to the management, solving CO2 emissions and increasing energy security and profitability simultaneously.

Building this interest from the multinational companies on selected markets will ensure that Absolicon also find buyers of the production lines, can establish regional production of the best solar collector in the world and quickly change the energy situation in that region – from fossil fuel to solar energy!
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: Co2 waste mineralization as a new standard for sustainable concrete production
Identification: Cement, the main ingredient of concrete, is responsible for approximately 7% of global man-made greenhouse emissions, making it the world's second-largest industrial source of carbon dioxide. To tackle this challenge, CarbonCure Technologies developed and commercialized a scalable technology that utilizes post-industrial carbon dioxide to increase the strength of concrete, allowing for less cement in concrete mixes. Its retrofit technology chemically mineralizes waste carbon dioxide during the concrete production process, making greener and stronger concrete. The CarbonCure Technology is being used at hundreds of concrete plants today to reduce concrete’s carbon footprint (17 kilograms GHGsper cubic metre), create new production cost savings and gain a competitive advantage. CarbonCure’s vision is to make the utilization of carbon dioxide in concrete production the new standard across the globe.
Looking For: Network, New clients, Visibility, Funding, Partners, Credibility
Tags: Industrial additives, Carbon emissions waste, Cement, Concrete, Manufacturing, Industrial Waste, Construction materials, Waste-to-materials, Gaseous waste capture
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Waste/Pollution, Materials and chemicals, Manufacturing and construction processes, Fumes and waste-heat management
The environmental benefits: Reduces CO2 by an average of 17 kilograms per m³ thanks to a cement reduction of 5% in concrete mixes;In a typical high-rise building, savings can reach up to approximately 250,000 pounds/125 tons (120,000 kg) of CO2;
The Financial benefits: Requires no upfront capital investment;ROI within months;Since the cement is the most expensive ingredient in concrete, a reduction of 5% in the mix allows for operational efficiencies/ cost savings;

Solution on-sentence summary: Recycled insulation for the energy efficiency and circular economy of buildings
Identification: Buildings are the main contributors to greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions in Europe, generating about 36% of the EU’s total CO2 emissions throughout their entire life cycle. They account for 40% of the total energy consumption in Europe and around 461 million tons of construction and demolition waste, excluding excavation materials, are yearly generated. SICLA solution targets two of the main issues in the building sector, which are energy efficiency and recycling of construction material. SICLA meets the challenge of energy efficiency by guaranteeing at least 40% reduction in energy consumption and 34% reduction in overall construction weight. Compared with available alternatives, only 33% of the insulation thickness is required with SICLA solutions for the same thermal performance. By using more than 75 wt.% of recycled siliceous material from the demolition industry, SICLA is a smart solution to build efficiently insulated houses and at a lower environmental cost.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Network, Visibility, Funding opportunities, Partnership opportunities
Tags: Waste-to-materials, Thermal insulation, Construction & demolition waste, Recycle waste, Construction materials
Sectors: Buildings, Waste/Pollution, Materials and chemicals, Solid waste management

The Financial benefits: More than 60% reduction on final aerogel price;Up to 15% installation cost reduction in retrofitting application;

About: KEEY Aerogel proposes the creation of new value chains by expanding the size and attractiveness of silica-based waste sources by their transformation to highly added-value aerogel material: a nanoporous material with the best thermal insulation performance in ambient conditions. Compared with available materials, only the 15% of the thickness is required for the same thermal insulation factor. This product “SIlica Closed Loop Aerogel” - SICLA is made to significantly contribute to achieve the reduction of both energy consumption and CO2 emission. It can moreover achieve higher resource efficiency thanks to a significantly high share of C&DW recycled secondary raw materials in the final product (more than 75% of the total product weight). This technology is made available for strategic companies in the insulation market.

Solution on-sentence summary: Connecting small scale cocoa and coffee producers with large corporate brands
Identification:
The climate crisis puts farming communities at risk, especially in tropical regions. This will have an impact on the quality and quantity of key commodities, such as coffee, cocoa, rice, medicine plants, flower, fruits, cereals, fibers. If nothing is done these crops will be difficult to produce and millions of small scale farmers' livelihoods will be deteriorated. The PUR Projet Insetting approach consists of implementing Nature Based Solutions like agroforestry within agricultural supply chains to improve the farmers' resilience to climate change while restoring degraded land. By reconnecting companies and farmers' interests, Insetting creates shared value for the planet, people and companies. The technology is provided by Nature: the tree and its multiple benefits (carbon, soil, water, biodiversity). It is enhanced with agroforestry and regenerative agriculture techniques to combine crops and tree species effectively, as well as providing carbon monitoring expertise to value carbon removed from the atmosphere by the Insetting project.

In short from a company perspective, Insetting means evaluating, reducing and offsetting its climate and environmental footprint by developing impactful socio-environmental projects within its value chain, and using them to build a sustainable society. Insetting is about harmonizing companies with Nature from within.
Looking For: New clients, visibility, partners
Target client profile: BusinessManufacturingFood Products, BusinessServicesB2B Traders of Bulk Goods
Tags: Corporate & Employees, Trees & Forests, Investment, Carbon footprint
Sectors: Food/Agri, Waste/Pollution, Finance and Impact offsettingEcosystems management

The Financial benefits: Potential economic value of 11 USD / year;Zero costs during Solution lifetime (after initial costs);

Organization short description: One With Nature
About:
PUR Projet is a pioneer in the development of Nature Based Solutions, in particular Insetting. This breakthrough approach generates multiple benefits for a company and the ecosystems it depends on. It works to transform climate action from a niche activity to an industry standard. Insetting means evaluating, reducing and offsetting the climate and environmental footprint of a company by developing impactful socio-environmental projects within its value chain, and using them to build a sustainable society. In short, Insetting is about harmonizing companies with Nature from within.  





We are a cost-efficient organization, optimizing our resources to maximize impacts. Founded in 2008 with the goal to fight climate change and deforestation, we now have projects in over 40 countries representing a large variety of plant and animal-based supply chains. Across the globe, PUR Projet is working with a growing number of partners and local communities to drive a more sustainable future.

Solution on-sentence summary: Easy-to-install toilet structure with on-site faecal waste treatment using a bio-digester tank
Identification: Bioloos treat human waste using bacterial culture, which eliminates the need for excreta disposal, transport and treatment. The system obviates the need for external sewage infrastructure. This solution addresses the need for basic, easy-to-install and hygienic human waste disposal mechanism in areas with no infrastructural facilities, such as sewage treatment plants. In addition, it tackles the lack of cheap and easy-to-operate alternatives to traditional waste disposal systems. The bioloo reduces pathogens by 99% and reduces organic matter by 90%. For a family of 4, the bioloo recycles up to 100 litres of water, and treats 1 kg of faecal waste per day. The bioloo saves the user family/entity up to INR 2,500 (34 USD) per year as the evacuation of faecal matter is not required, and up to INR 5,000 (67USD) in operations and maintenance cost.

Organization short description: Banka Bio provides sustainable sanitation solutions for rural and urban areas, alike.
About:
Banka Bio provides environmentally-friendly and sustainable solutions for sanitation in rural, urban and peri-urban areas. Our bio-toilets (or bioloos) treat human waste using bacterial culture, which eliminates the need for excreta disposal, transport and treatment. The system obviates the need for external sewage infrastructure.



The system treats/disposes human waste:

•	in 100% eco-friendly manner

•	saves energy

•	conserves water

•	produces biogas in minor quantities



Our solutions address the following customer needs/pain points:

Solution on-sentence summary: Providing solutions for vehicle sharing and fleet management
Identification: Mobility has become one of the main challenges of the 21st century. Owning a car is getting more expensive over time and these are idle 95% of the time. In order to improve this, 10 private cars can be substituted by 1 shared car, by keeping high accessibility to the car, the experience of renting a car is equal (or better) than having it in ownership (same service, less maintenance and management time). Car Sharing reduces the number of cars and fosters electric mobility. Eccocar empowers share mobility solutions for fleet management in corporate fleets, car rental agencies and car dealers.

This gives consumers plenty of opportunity to not only rent multiple types of transportation but have quick efficient service.

Solution on-sentence summary: Conversion of agricultural wastes to new material as a wood alternative
Identification: Waste harvests like agricultural straws, close to 700 million tons/year, are often burnt away if not used. Open-field burning of agricultural straws and deforestation reinforce the greenhouse effect causing global warming and climate change. XSTRAWDINARY is a simple natural fiber strawboard made from waste agricultural straws.  Fibers are bonded together under extreme heat and pressure to make a high density (as high as 1200 kg/m3) material. There is no waste and water pollution during the entire manufacturing process. 1m3 of strawboard helps cutting down 1.63 tons of CO2 emission. The material can be molded into various shapes and sizes and can be customized for different textures and colors, making it ideal for furniture, flooring, wall panels, and virtually everything from ceiling to floor, from wall to wall! One of the applications is to replace exiting wooden and plastics pallets to strawboard pallets.

Solution on-sentence summary: Business to consumer platform aiming to fight food waste
Identification: For a myriad of reasons, it’s near-impossible for food businesses to know how much surplus they will have at the end of the day, and which items they will be. All the while the issue of food waste is a great challenge in solving the climate crisis. Too Good To Go's innovative and scalable smartphone app acts as a marketplace for this surplus food and connects food suppliers with consumers willing to purchase the food in advance and collect at a specified time. This can range from bakeries that need to bake fresh every day to supermarkets that have groceries that weren’t sold and restaurants that didn’t sell all the food they had catered for that day. Since launching the app in 2016, more than 37.5M meals have been saved, representing up to 77,000 tons of CO2.
Looking For: Network; New clients; Visibility; Partnership opportunities
Target client profile: Individual, BusinessServicesHotels & Resorts, BusinessServicesRestaurants & Canteens, BusinessServicesRetailerFood & Supermaket
Tags: Restaurants, Reuse waste, Food waste, Municipal Solid Waste, Software
Sectors: Food/Agri, Waste/Pollution, Sell and trade, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: From the moment the first meal was saved through the app, 77,000 tons of CO2e emissions have been saved;
The Financial benefits: Offers an alternative B2C marketplace for food, allowing for additional revenue and reaching new customers instead of paying for the removal of the food.;Can help to recover between 30-40% or the retail value of final products which would have been declared as lost;

Organization short description: Too Good To Go fights food waste by connecting customers with suppliers that have unsold, surplus food.
About:
Too Good To Go is a social impact company that brings people together to fight food waste by connecting customers with suppliers that have unsold, surplus food. The app was launched in Copenhagen, Denmark, in 2016 and has been downloaded more than 18 million times. Together, its users have saved more than 27 million meals in 14 different countries across the company's 36,000+ partners that include Carrefour, Paul, Costa, Accor, Yo! Sushi, Morrisons and Scandic.



The company’s core mission is to inspire and empower everyone to take action against food waste. Through its B2C food waste application, it creates direct impact against climate change by preventing edible food from being wasted. To drive for further impact, it is building 'The Movement Against Food Waste' at four levels: Households, Businesses, Schools, and Public Affairs. Through this it works to create further impact against food waste by raising awareness of the issue in households, empowering businesses to take action, educating younger generations, and driving for policies that will push food waste further up the agenda for all levels of government.
SDG’s of application: SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Production of disposable single-use products from agri-food waste
Identification: In 2015, global plastic production was 448 million tonnes, including more than 161 million tonnes of disposable packaging, takeaway containers, plates, cutlery and cups. Only 3% of disposable tableware and takeaway food packaging is recycled, while the rest is burned and landfilled, polluting both soil and water. The Biotrem technology uses the chemical composition and physical properties of organic raw materials, waste or by-products such as wheat bran, corn bran, cassava by-products or algae to produce plates, bowls, cups, without plasticizers or other chemical compounds. By using Biotrem technology, BRANBOX goes further and offers ecological, compostable, watertight and disposable food containers. Highly scalable and customizable, the BRANBOX solution can be rapidly deployed to meet the global challenge of plastic pollution.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world

About:
Biotrem is a Polish technology company focusing on the development of innovative technology enabling the manufacturing of single-use products based on commonly available organic raw materials - side products and leftovers of agri-food industry.



Products manufactured through the innovative Biotrem technology are a viable and environmentally friendly alternative to single-use products, among others for tableware and food packaging, made from petroleum-derived raw materials, cellulose pulp or chemically treated organic materials.



Biotrem's mission is to provide innovative, pro-ecological and economically balanced industrial solutions – possible to be implemented on a global scale – supporting responsible management of natural resources and minimizing negative environmental impact.

Solution on-sentence summary: An ozone-friendly alternative to methyl bromide
Identification: The market needs viable alternatives to conventional fumigation gases such as methyl bromide, which is being phased out globally due to its ozone-depleting substances. EDN® is an ozone-friendly alternative to methyl bromide. The advantages of EDN® include better penetration characteristics, higher efficacy and shorter application time. This Solution can be used to disinfect soil and control insects, diseases, nematodes, weeds and other parasites in a targeted manner before planting fruit, vegetables, turf and ornamental crops. It can also be used to fumigate harvested timber and logs to eliminated wood-boring insects in timber, as well as pathogens and nematodes, which present a major bio-security risk to many importing countries.
Tags: Pest control, Chemicals alternatives
The environmental benefits: Completely non ozone depleting agent compared to methyl bromide;No Global Warming Potential (GWP), unlike large GWP of mainstream alternative;
The Financial benefits: Can save around $10,000 per farm compared to alternative treatments;Price competitive with methyl bromide with no impact on the ozone layer;
Activity Region - Countries: Russia,Netherlands,Germany,Czechia,Turkey,South Korea,India,Hong Kong SAR,South Africa,United States,Australia,New Zealand

Organization short description: Draslovka Services provides regulatory and sales support for distributors and customers of The Draslovka Group
About:
The Draslovka Services Group directly fills a gap in industry between the manufacturer and the end-user, enabling a direct link to ensure seamless custom application development and field trial support.



The Draslovka Services Group are aware of the dominant threat that historic fumigants represent to the fragile eco-systems in which we live. The most common applied fumigant, methyl bromide,  is a potent ozone-depleting agent and has been already phased out from several countries all over the world. Its potential replacement, sulfuryl fluoride,is considered as one of the  most potent greenhouse gases ever known. Therefore, Draslovka Services is  dedicated to commercialise their range of next generation alternatives for these fumigants. 



The fumigants developed by Draslovka are effective, safe and environmentally-friendly. 

Draslovka Services strategy is to support the full product development cycle including:

 -providing global trial support

 -application and product development consulting

- providing regulatory support

-business development support for suppliers, distributors, and customers.

Draslovka Services has grown to become a leader in innovative crop science technologies, environmental stewardship, sustainability and safety.  It supports agricultural pre-planting and post-harvest phytosanitary and disinfestation industry by providing innovative dynamic purposeful professional services and sustainable chemicals.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Giving new life to waste products for construction and infrastructure
Identification: Vast quantities of waste are being generated across the world, and all too often no solutions are in place to reuse or recycle this waste. Rhino Machines' Solution addresses two key sources of waste: Foundry dust (an industrial waste by-product), and plastic. These two waste products are combined, mixed and processed to produce a high quality, durable and affordable brick structure, providing an alternative to the traditional 'red brick' used in construction and infrastructure. The Waste to Wealth Plastic Brick offers double the strength of a traditional brick at a lower weight and a competitive price, all whilst reducing waste.

Organization short description: Our vision is to provide Optimized & Appropriate Solutions with a mission of addressing Energy Efficiency and Waste Recovery Solutions as a Social Responsibility
About:
Our core business is in Foundry Industry as Projects & Machine Suppliers, collaborated into Women's Ethnic Wear, Swiss Vocational School, Innovation Ecosystem, Internet of Things, Business Consulting, Entrepreneurship Development, Social Engineering, BioGas-AgriEngineering Ecosystem



Founded by R C Kothari in 1983, Rhino had humble beginnings as a Project Engineering Firm, ventured into wholesome manufacturing firm Rhino Machines after the joining of Manish Kothari in 1991. Became a Pvt Ltd in 1996, and established its own workshop in Vitthal Udyognagar. 



With innovation  - looking to find ways of doing things better, faster & cheaper as part of its ethos, Rhino kept growing in the Indian Ecosystem and in 2015 got selected in the GCIP 2015 as an Innovator in Energy Efficiency Category reaching Top 6 - the first time a MSME manufacturer and that too from the core manufacturing space found its way to this niche innovation ecosystem, and continued to be in the Top 6 again in GCIP 2016, and Manish Kothari was invited as a mentor in GCIP 2017.



Rhino has been instrumental in changing the process and technology landscape in India bringing Affordable and Appropriate High Pressure Moulding Solutions and Energy Efficient Sand Handling Solutions to the Industry.



Rhino diversified into Green Sand Reclamation - an area connecting to Resource Efficiency & Sustainability. As an offshoot of making the Reclamation solution 100% zero discharge, Rhino invested in developing a solution for the waste dust, and currently has developed the solution for Waste Dust & Waste Plastic - forming Blocks of different shapes and purposes. The project known as SPB (Silica Plastic Blocks) has become a front runner for Solid Waste Management Solutions.



Rhino also ventured into partnering Meemansa in Garment Sector, ACE Foundation in Vocational Skill, Ecolibrium in IOT, Composite Solutions in Business Consulting, MSA BioEnergy for Renewable Energy and continues to partner for causes connected to mission waste recovery & energy efficiency



Rhino is part of the Institute of Indian Foundrymen, and the first MSME to have adopted UNCTAD's Empretec Program to build sustainability in the organization. The Empretec Personal Entrepreneurial Competencies have been able to accelerate the transformation of Rhino into a Sustainable Organisation and each member being able to relate and connect to the Mission of Rhino Machines.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Distributed, low-cost, energy efficient technology to enrich and store biogas
Identification: More than ever there is a need for reliable, local and renewable energy solutions for agriculture. In many cases, waste from agricultural activities can be processed into biomethane or 'BioCNG' (enriched from Biogas), a high-quality clean fuel that can be used for cooking, transportation and agricultural machinery to improve the energy access. Grassroots Energy's Solution processes farm and agri waste into a low cost and sustainable biogas fuel. The Solution offers an energy efficient and modular biomethane system which can solve diverse challenges in agriculture. The Solution offers a decentralised, modular CO2 scrubbing system operating at atmospheric pressure and is three times more energy efficient than the mainstream alternative. In addition, the innovative adsorption-based cylinder storage can reduce storage pressure by three times for the same storage mass. This approach leads to reduced investments and operational challenges.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Validity, partnerships, networking, investors
Tags: Biobased, Biogas & biomethane, Bran & husk waste, Straw waste, Biofuel, Agricultural Waste
Sectors: Energy, Food/Agri, Waste/Pollution, Power and fuel generation, Fumes and waste-heat management
The environmental benefits: Each module generating biomethane displaces 4500kg CO2 per year;No non-renewable resources consumed or used in production;Water used in production is recycled;
The Financial benefits: Payback period in under 4 years;Cost savings of 25-35% compared to mainstream alternative;
Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);PowerCorner: Mini-grids for affordable, reliable, sustainable energy-services for rural and off-grid populations (Energy);
Organization short description: Grassroots Energy has developed a low-cost energy efficient technology to purify biogas in a cost-effective way.
About:
There are millions of people globally with limited or unreliable access to clean fuel. The vast majorities are engaged in dairy or agriculture, their primary income generating activities. These farming activities have significant under-utilized agri or farm waste output. This waste can be processed into Renewable Natural Gas (RNG, enriched from Biogas), a high-quality clean fuel that can be used for cooking, transportation and agricultural machinery to improve the energy access. In rural areas, if high quality fuel like RNG is made available, it can provide access to clean energy for diverse applications to catalyze economic development.

 

Grassroots Energy’s inclusive and integrated approach involves working directly with the communities to procure waste and generate value at the local level. Each installation can positively impact 750 families. At scale of 5000 installations, our solution can touch 3.75million families. The innovative small-scale system allows for distributed model, wide-scale adoption of RNG, only commercial clean fuel solution, economical over fossil fuels, is developed using low-cost biogas enrichment and compression technology. Requisite amounts of waste in rural areas across farm or agri feedstocks are widely available. 



A distributed energy model addresses all three issues providing value, economic opportunity and ancillary benefits in terms of organic fertilizer and remediated waste. The model creates greater economic value for farmers from waste, removes carbon emissions from decomposing waste, generates organic fertilizer and provides incentives for local farmers to participate that increase their incomes and farm productivity:

 

Waste to Energy (Biogas):

The approach processes farm and agri waste into low cost fuel, biogas. Untreated waste releases methane into the atmosphere, as GHG 25X harmful over CO2. Furthermore, waste attracts pathogens that spreads disease in the vicinity. The approach to convert to Biogas, solves a range of issues for local communities.



Economical and nutrient rich organic fertilizer:

The farmers use chemical fertilizer which erodes the top soil and yields of the farms. The short-term and quick-fix approach forces the farmers to depend on the fertilizers from the retailer. Grassroots Energy aims to process the residue from Biogas digesters into high quality compost available in solid and liquid forms.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Energy storage for ultra-fast EV charging and micro-grid retrofitting
Identification: Energy storage can help to avoid the need for expensive infrastructure upgrades needed to charge electric vehicles. Lithium batteries are a prime candidate as a solution in this market, however they are limited in their cycling ability, and will reach end of life rapidly when used for this purpose. Teraloop's flywheel technology (a mechanical structure used to store rotational energy) complements existing flexibility solutions to manage power and energy. Flywheels have demonstrated advantages such as high energy efficiency, high durability and high power density, making them ideal for applications requiring heavy cycling. Teraloop goes beyond the state of the art with its novel topology, enabling higher scalability to MW scale with a single device, and 5-7 times higher energy density. Teraloop's flywheel technology is ideally designed for applications such as electric vehicle ultra-fast charging, as well as micro-grid retrofitting. It further complements existing battery technologies, extending their lifetime and their sustainability.
Looking For: Corporate partners, investors
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesInfrastructureRoads & Road Traffic Infrastructure
Tags: EV charging, Smart-grid
Sectors: Infrastructures, Freight, Mobility, Energy, Energy storage

The Financial benefits: Payback in 1-8 years through avoidance of infrastructure upgrades and grid charge costs;25% lifetime increase for lithium batteries;

Complementary solutions: EP Tender: A range extending service for electric vehicles (Mobility);AEROPAK G: Ultralight fuel cells and hydrogen energy storage for electric-powered aircraft (Industry & Consumer Goods,Mobility);Storage GEM®: Smart energy management system in containerized storage units for rapid deployment (Energy);Atawheel: Zero emission mobility based on hydrogen energy storage and water electrolysis technology (Infrastructures,Mobility);
Organization short description: Scalable flywheel energy storage for EV ultra-fast charging, renewable integration and DERMS.
About:
The energy transition relies on high levels of energy generation from renewable sources. This will require a substantial increase in effective energy storage, to ensure availability of supply, grid flexibility and reliability.



Teraloop addresses that demand with scalable and sustainable solutions based on our patented kinetic energy storage, offering a low cost of ownership for applications requiring heavy cycling.



Our solutions distinguish themselves first in the hubless configuration of our rotor topology, which enables us to scale efficiently to higher power and energy than competing flywheel solutions, as well as a higher energy density. 



We further innovate with sustainable material innovations, such as bio-based and recycled carbon fibre, magnetically loaded composites, and bio-based epoxy resins. 



Our focus is related to electric vehicle ultra-fast charging (150+kW), renewable energy integration, and support for DERMS.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities

Solution on-sentence summary: A waste-to-energy solution to produce hydrogen from organic waste products
Identification: Climate change and waste are two of the greatest challenges we face. Vast quantities of municipal waste are generated every year, creating greenhouse gas emissions in the process, particularly from decaying organic waste in landfills. EEI has developed a technology that can help reduce emissions from waste and at the same time produce clean, renewable hydrogen. EEI's Eco H2® process converts organic waste into hydrogen, in doing so both reducing emissions from landfill and producing clean energy. With demand for hydrogen as a fuel source increasing, Eco H2® provides a solution to two key challenges.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Investors, partners, clients
Tags: Hydrogen, Waste-to-energy & fuels, Agricultural Waste, Green waste, Paper & pulp waste, Food waste, Staged or bio reforming, Recycle waste, Municipal Solid Waste, Waste treatment
Sectors: Energy, Waste/Pollution, Power and fuel generation, Manufacturing and construction processes, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: An Eco H2® site could reduce emissions by 400,000 tonnes CO2/year compared to the average Steam Methane Reforming H2 facility (assuming 100,000 kg/day);Eco H2® at an average waste facility could produce over 8 million kg of hydrogen per year;
The Financial benefits: Payback in under three years with the sale of hydrogen produced;Further economic savings through 50% reduction in truck deliveries to landfill;

Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);Pellenc ST: Optical sorting machines to recycle large amounts of waste quickly and accurately (Waste & Pollution);
Organization short description: Eco H2® is pure renewable hydrogen produced directly from any organic material such as municipal waste with no emissions
About:
Eco Energy International, LLC (EEI) is a spinoff of Energy Technologies, Inc (ETI). ETI has been supplying energy systems products to the defense, petrochemical and communications industries for the last 30 years. As part of their R&D, they have developed fuel cell and hydrogen production technologies covered by 52 US and International Patents. The technology can convert any biogenic (organic) or carbon based (i.e. coal) material directly into pure hydrogen while sequestering the carbon. When applied to waste streams such as municipal solid waste (MSW), agricultural solid wastes (ASW) and many other waste sources, there is the added benefit of converting waste to energy without any greenhouse gas emissions, directly or indirectly.  The process itself sequesters all carbon in the feedstock. Further by eliminating organic wastes going into landfills, methane and carbon dioxide emissions are no longer produced in the landfill.



Energy Technologies Inc.(ETI) is combining our technologies with those of Bio Carbon Fuels (BCF) to eliminate landfills with near zero carbon emissions while producing clean renewable hydrogen and renewable diesel. The combined entity is called Eco Energy International, LLC (EEI) whose goal is to commercialize these technologies worldwide..
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Increasing solar installed power on existing urban areas and protected architecture
Identification: The existing building stock represents 99% of a city. Integrating renewable energy sources in existing buildings can pose challenges due to technical and regulatory restrictions. SOLARBOX proposes a new renewable energy solution for existing buildings to address this challenge. SOLARBOX utilises PV technology in laminated glass to produce power from the sun whilst respecting visual regulatory requirements for old buildings. SOLARBOX is highly customisable (e.g. size, colours), making it suitable for protected buildings such as old city centres, castles, and churches to generate clean renewable energy.
Tags: Solar photovoltaic, Rooftop
Sectors: Buildings, Energy, Power and fuel generation

The Financial benefits: Return on investment in 7 to 10 years;Potential to sell energy produced back to the grid;2.5 times greater installed power on a rooftop compare to normal rooftop PV installation;

Solution on-sentence summary: A sustainable grass surface for amateur and high performance sports pitches
Identification: On the large market of outdoor sport pitches, there is often no alternative to synthetic turf due to the high intensity of use of these surfaces. However, synthetic turfs often are expensive, uncomfortable, and damaging for the environment. Airfibr offers an opportunity to replace  artificial pitches with natural reinforced grass. AirFibr's technology is inspired by natural soil which is stabilised and softened by the densification of lateral roots. This concept is replicated in the Airfibr technology protected by two patents. This substrate is a very fine intermixing of cork granules, silica sand and synthetic microfibers coming from recycling activities. It has numerous properties which drastically improve the resistance of natural pitches to intensive use. Airfibr helps to provide an affordable, effective and sustainable solution for sports facilities.
Looking For: Visibility, credibility, networks, new partners
Target client profile: Public Authorities, BusinessServicesEntertainment, Leisure & Art Company, BusinessServicesHotels & Resorts
Tags: Soil and land, Design, Construction materials
The environmental benefits: 72% lower energy consumption in production compared to synthetic alternative;81% lower photochemical ozone generation compared to synthetic alternative;
The Financial benefits: 30% lower investment required over a 30 year period;30% lower annual maintenance costs compared to synthetic alternative;

Organization short description: Natural Grass is a specialist of conception, construction and maintenance of urban and sports vegetalized surfaces.
About: Natural Grass have developed the most advanced reinforcement technologies for football pitches and urban multifunctionnal lawns. Natural Grass products are designed to reduce the carbon footprint, the use of water and bring back nature benefits in cities (water storage, urban heat island effect, air quality..), . We aim at increasing user utilisation rate and players safety. Today those hybrid grass technologies equip the most demanding sports clubs across the world. The company is recognized for its innovative vision, sustainable commitment and forward-thinking technologies.

Solution on-sentence summary: A high-perfoming solar thermal technology for the production of hot water and steam
Identification: There is a growing demand for renewable sources of energy to replace fossil fuels for industrial processes. TVP's innovative solar thermal panel integrate patented high-vacuum technology to produce the levels of heat required for industrial processes or district heating at the same cost as natural gas and at a lower cost than liquid fossil fuels. The high-vacuum technology allows TVP's flat panels to exhibit minimal thermal losses and no degradation over time, delivering exceptional efficiency. Without the need for cleaning and only minimal maintenance, TVP’s 100% recyclable solar collectors can operate for 25 years to deliver emission free thermal energy.

Solution on-sentence summary: A reusable, refillable solution for plastic bottles and vessels
Identification: Billions of plastic bottles are used every year, creating plastic pollution on land and in water. To tackle this problem, B-CAP has created a new patented packaging solution which reduces plastic pollution and cuts carbon emissions: a filled cap with a concentrated product that can be diluted within refillable bottles. The B-CAP refill cap could replace standard products in bottles on the market. The product is simple to use for both B2B and consumers and is suitable for all kind of plastic bottle markets. By reducing the need for plastic and encouraging easy re-use, B-CAP's refillable cap can enable lower waste generation and reduced emissions.
Tags: Consumer-goods, Reusable, Packaging, Plastic alternatives

B-CAP is an innovative  patented solution that meets the challenges in reducing the quantity of plastic bottle, C02 and water dedicated for all kind of product on the market. Solution on-sentence summary: Generating electricity from the power of the ocean
Identification: Coastal and island communities are often dependent on diesel generators for power, which are a polluting and inefficient energy source. CalWave's patent-pending Wave Energy Converter (WEC) aims to address this challenge by harnessing the vastly available, predictable and stable energy from waves to provide communities with reliable, affordable and sustainable electricity and freshwater. The high performing WEC operates fully submerged, allowing it to survive stormy seas without visual impact. CalWave’s mission is to install 500 units of baseload ocean wave power by 2030 for island communities. By harnessing the power of the ocean, wave energy can provide affordable, predictable and sustainable energy for communities across the world.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Partners (public and private), early adopter clients
Tags: Coastal, Wave & Tidal power, Marine & Oceans, Hydropower
The environmental benefits: 50% emission reduction for island communities by replacing diesel generators;Zero emissions from operation;
The Financial benefits: Can deliver payback in 1.5 years;Can deliver 30% cost reduction compared to diesel generators;

Organization short description: Ocean Waves to Watts and Water.
About:
CalWave Power Technologies Inc. provides a solution to harness the renewable power of ocean waves to produce electricity and freshwater. CalWave’s patented Wave Energy Converter (WEC) is moored offshore, simple and scalable. Solution on-sentence summary: A lightweight, recyclable packaging solution for multi-usage handling and logistics
Identification: Komebac® is a lightweight, 100 % recyclable packaging solution designed for multiple uses in logistics. The box is made of expanded polypropylene, offering the same functionality as a standard plastic box used for rotation packaging application but with a longer life time and a significantly lower weight (-60%). This weight reduction results in less raw material use, lower emissions and costs for transport, and benefits for operator health (less weight load resulting in less risk of injury). Extending product lifetime reduces material waste, and at the end of the product's life the material can be fully recycled. Komebac® can be used for B2B packaging used in rotation, with a lifetime of more than 10 years.
