Solution on-sentence summary: The solution for clean, quiet and safe facility management operations
Identification: The Cobrane A1 solution addresses four key challenges for facility management technicians. Firstly, it provides 100% electric mobility, reducing on-site emissions. Secondly, it provides safe and secure transport, with a speed restricted to 15 km / h. Thirdly, it delivers increased productivity through more efficient outdoor / indoor mobility. Finally, this Solution allows less arduous work for technicians while carrying their tools and equipment for them. The Cobrane A1 solution has 30 km of autonomy, can carry 100 kg on its platform, tow 200 kg on a trailer and can pass through all the doors with its width of 65 cm. All this is achieved without emitting any harmful particles, without making noise and in great safety of use.

Organization short description:
Cobrane Design is a french manufacturer specialized in conception and production of LEV Light Electric Vehicle. Our 2 markets are:

- the Facility Management for mobility of technicians on big plants (maintenance, security and cleanliness) 

- the last mile delivery for Post opération and Parcels delivery.
About:
Cobrane thinks that we don't need a 1,5 tons véhicule for bringing a man and his toolcase. We manufacture electric carrier for bringing less than 200 kg with a range of 30 km. We call that micro-handling and micro-mobility. It looks like a tricycle with a hub motor in the front wheel. We manage différent platforms (short and long), with the same main parts.

Our clients are the big factories with large facilities to manage, we propose an Ecological solution instead of diesel car with non noise and no emissions, very Safe because limited at 15 kph with a balancing sytem for turning, it increases Productivity because technicians are more efficient and avoids Penibility at work.

The other part of our business is postal opérations in the center of big cities and the last mile delivery, very parcel centric with the explosion of the online market and the home delivery. Also the new market of little urban merchant merging on the web from the containment. 

Cobrane has an hydrogen program with the french laboratory CEA. The idea is to increase the range of the Cobrane XL for last mile opérations in town. We expect having this solution ready for the end of 2020. 

Cobrane is looking for raising money for the end of 2020.
SDG’s of application: SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure

Complementary solutions: Renewable gas for industrial burners: Decentralized renewable solutions for process heat in industrial processes (Industry & Consumer Goods,Energy);Stirling Engine: Stirling engine modules to generate clean electricity from waste heat locally (Energy,Industry & Consumer Goods);SEAB Energy - Flexibuster: A small-scale modular container for transforming organic waste into energy (Energy,Waste & Pollution,Food & Agriculture);PowerCorner: Mini-grids for affordable, reliable, sustainable energy-services for rural and off-grid populations (Energy);
Organization short description: Tocardo, as a part of the tripartite cooperation with QED Naval and HydroWing, offers power generating solutions. Tocardo is the independent tidal turbine developer with a focus on bringing down the Life Cycle Cost (LCC) of tidal turbines, de-risking the design (RAMS/FMEA) and increasing the power output at the same time (LCOE). We deliver medium size turbines up to 0.5 MW which can be installed in larger numbers enabling projects from community up to utility scale.
About:
It is our mission to bring clean and reliable power to people and organisations all over the world, by harnessing hydro power driven by the gravitational pull between the earth and moon.



The driver for tidal stream power generation is combatting climate change by reducing the CO2 emissions with a 100% renewable, 100% reliable and 100% predictable energy source. Because of the geographical limitations and specific local characteristics for successful tidal power (micro)plants the highest value can be generated on specific locations for specific type of customers. Tidal stream power is the missing renewable energy source to create a local balanced power generation mix. 



In 1999, technology development started with a floating venturi system, after several technology changes the company moved towards the centre-based generator concept, with two blades. This is a concept showing a lot of similarities with the technology used in the wind turbine industry. With the on‐going experience the company gathered from the first full scale turbines, we completely parameterised the design of the turbines and developed the current free flow turbine technology portfolio. Nowadays the company owns 21 patents worldwide.



While tidal energy is well proven, the sector has been slow to industrialise due to high costs of manufacturing, installation, O&M, reliability and scalability that have hindered the commercialisation of the sector as a whole. Most of the companies within the sector develop their own complete solutions; turbines and (floating) foundation structures, leading to a lack of focus and hold of success.



Tocardo wants to become the first independent specialist tidal turbine developer with a focus on pure turbine development and not diverted by, or reliant upon platform development to claim our position in the market.



It is our ambition to make tidal energy ‘top of mind’; on par with solutions such as solar and wind power. Whenever production of clean energy is considered, tidal energy is among the possible solutions. Tocardo is the market and thought leader on tidal energy and systems.
SDG’s of application: SDG 7 - Affordable and clean energy, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 11 - Sustainable cities and communities, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production

Solution on-sentence summary: Converting agricultural waste to plant-based alternatives replacing fossil-based plastics
Identification:
Nearly all of the plastic that has ever been made still exists today, much of it finding its way into nature. PlasticFri is a GreenTech company from Sweden with the vision to end plastic pollution catastrophe. Conventional plastics are made from petroleum and stay in the environment up to 1000 years!

By 2050, the oceans could have more plastic than fish.

PlasticFri is on a mission to change that by transforming renewable resources to bio-based products for replacing disposable plastics. This revolutionary technology is already tested, validated and certified by the toughest certification standards in Europe. For its groundbreaking work, the company was awarded as the “World’s Most Innovative Sustainability Startup” among 1400 companies worldwide!

PlasticFri has also been awarded the prestigious “Startup Company of the Year in Sweden" as well as named “Most promising Impact company in Nordics and Baltics"

Solution on-sentence summary: A range of composite materials for high volume automotive applications
Identification: Traditional composite materials used in the automotive industry require legnthy processing in pressure vessels to create 'cured' structures. The SolvaLite™ range of composite materials overcomes this to allow rapid manufacturing of lightweight structures for the automotive and ground-transport industries. By curing very rapidly, the composites can be used to make components measured in tens - or even hundreds - of thousands of parts per year. This is contrast to traditional composite technologies that are more suited to mere hundreds of parts per year. Through the industrialisation of these composite technologies, car manufacturers can significantly reduce the weight of their vehicles - with a positive effect on emissions of CO2 and particulates. Novel vehicle architectures and concepts are also enabled - increasing the range of choice for end consumers.
Looking For: Looking to promote SolvaLite™ to automotive OEMs as a proven efficient solution for automotive primary and secondary structural applications; Develop the supply chain to present an overall parts-manufacturing capability considered viable for high-volume automotive programs.
Tags: Lightweight, Vehicles, Carbon fiber material, Composites, Industrial materials
The environmental benefits: Enables lightweight structures that can save up to 2000kg of CO2 compared to mainstream alternative over vehicle lifetime;Up to 70% lighter than steel structures;
The Financial benefits: Faster cycle times lead to part-cost reductions of up to 75% compared with those traditional carbon-fiber composites;Enables reduced investment needs for new vehicle structures by over 75% compared with metallic incumbents;Lighter vehicles lead to reduced emissions, helping manufacturers meet vehicle emission standards;

Solution on-sentence summary: Closed-loop rare earths recycling process for hybrid and electric vehicles
Identification: Rare earth elements (REE) are targeted as a crucial component of "green technology" applications. Currently, it is forecasted an increasing demand of REE, mainly for neodymium-based permanent magnets used in highly effective motors for hybrid vehicles and wind turbine generators. The REE supply is however at risk due to the unpredictable trading policies. The REE4EU technology seeks to cover the European demand for REE using secondary REE-containing resources (i.e. from waste) currently available in Europe, thus realising an innovative closed-loop REE recycling process where REE-containing wastes are converted into REE-final products. The REE final products manufactured with recycled material showed the same properties as those made from virgin materials. Not only does REE4EU reduce landfill, but it also has far lower CO2 emissions than extracting and using virgin materials. Moreover, it also highlights competitive costs compared to the conventional scenario of primary REE extraction. The REE4EU technology can secure important value chains in Europe necessary for decarbonisation, resource efficiency and zero waste targets and gives a promising market opportunity for a European REE recycling business.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: Credibility, visibility, investment
Target client profile: BusinessManufacturingBatteries & Battery Parts, BusinessManufacturingComputers & Other Electronics, BusinessManufacturingMachinery & Turbines, BusinessManufacturingMetals & Steel
Tags: Electronic waste, Rare earths, Waste-to-materials, Recycle waste, Industrial Waste, Industrial materials
Sectors: Industry/Goods, Waste/Pollution, Materials and chemicals, Manufacturing and construction processes, Solid waste management
The environmental benefits: Around 50% lower GHG emissions compared to use of virgin REE materials;Around 35% lower primary energy consumption than mainstream alternative;
The Financial benefits: Payback period of under three years;

Organization short description: SINTEF is a broad, multidisciplinary research organization with international top-level expertise.
About:
SINTEF Group provides research and development services. The Company research on technology, medicine, social science, energy, and petroleum. SINTEF Group operates Worldwide.

SINTEF was established in 1950 by the former Norwegian Institute of Technology, which today is a part of NTNU. As a result of its own growth and mergers with other institutes, SINTEF has developed into one of Europe's largest independent research organization. Every year we carry out several thousand projects for customers large and small. We deliver innovation by developing knowledge and technologies that are brought into practical use.

SINTEF is a broad, multidisciplinary research organization with international top-level expertise in the fields of technology, the natural sciences, medicine and the social sciences with a total of 2000 employees. We conduct contract R&D as a partner for the private and public sectors. Our vision is Technology for a better society. In 2018, SINTEF carried out 5700 research projects for 4000 customers. Our multidisciplinary approach enables us to create teams with the broad range of expertise our customers and projects often demand.

SINTEF is an independent, non-profit organization. None of its owners receive any form of dividend. Profits are invested in scientific equipment, skills and expertise. We offer world-leading laboratory and test facilities in a wide range of technological fields. Our advanced laboratories range from microelectronics and nanoscale technologies, to the world's largest laboratory for the multiphase transport of oil and gas, and the world's largest marine laboratory.

SINTEF has a partnership with the Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) in Trondheim. The collaboration between SINTEF and NTNU is a key component of the Norwegian research system, which has produced high levels of innovation for the benefit of Norwegian industry.

Solution on-sentence summary: Empowering renewable energy project developers through the assessment of decentralized energy resources and production systems
Identification: Decentralized energy resources (DER) and renewable energy production installations are much more profitable when coupled to energy storage systems and other flexible loads. These hybrid systems allow revenue stacking on new energy markets whilst reducing emissions and costs and increasing energy security. A challenge however remains in the complexity of the assessment of such systems. Due to their lack of awareness and skills, commercial and industrial energy consumers struggle to find appropriate partners or stuck in an intricate procedure with too many different actors (engineering consultancy, contractors, operators, etc.). This results in losing time and transparency and leads to a less profitable solution as each actor tends to sell their off-the-shelf solution or expertise. Optiwize® is a data-driven AI web solution providing decision makers in commercial and industrial sites autonomous guidance to analyse, implement and control optimal onsite renewable energy generation and storage installations. Assembling global measurement data of site energy consumption, meteorological conditions, GHG emissions, energy prices and other financial information, Optiwize® detects the most suitable investments in new and clean energy technologies and maintains maximum profitability of the achieved installation on real time by calculating optimal setpoints in line with the organisation's ecological and economical targets. In doing so, Optiwize® provides an efficient, profitable and sustainable solution for on-site energy use and storage.
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Tags: Algorithms & AI, Planning tool, Software, Electrical grid
Sectors: Energy, Project planning, Power and fuel distribution
The environmental benefits: Up to 20% CO2 emissions reduction compared to non optimal achieved installations;Up to 30% CO2 emissions reduction compared to no installation;
The Financial benefits: Up to 30% energy cost reduction, up to 20% new revenues on energy markets;Return on Investment in 1-2 years;
Complementary solutions: Cryonod: Recovering energy from natural gas networks by liquidizing industrial gases (Energy,Infrastructures);Efficient smart grid technology: Controlling the energy balance in the isolated grids (Buildings & Shelters,Energy);Biomethane for clean transportation: Production and distribution of biomethane as fuel  (Energy,Freight);VACON® NXP Grid Converter: An alternative source of marine power technology to power ships in ports (Energy,Infrastructures);
Organization short description: Cutting-edge solutions for optimal design, matchmaking and operation of renewable energy systems by non-expert users.
About:
Likewatt believes renewable and decentralized energy resources (DER) play a major role in the energy transition occurring worldwide. However, DER installations are much more profitable when coupled with energy storage and other flexibility systems allowing revenue stacking on new energy markets and achieving multiobjective criteria. 



The challenge remains in the complexity of such installations which disqualifies the main decision makers and complexifies the embodiment of such projects.



Likewatt develops a SaaS solution that allows C&I (commercial and industrial) energy consumers and renewable IPP (independant power producers) to overcome this complexity. By integrating artificial intelligence and data-driven machine learning techniques, it makes optimal design and operation of local energy systems simple and efficient. 



Likewatt is a member of Tenerrdis, labellized Deeptech by Bpifrance (with the French Tech Grant), accelerated by Pulsalys and 1kubator and hosted by H7 in Lyon. The project was founded in april 2019 by two experienced entrepreneurs : Chady Kharrat, former CTO and founder of EDF Store and Forecast, and Gaetan Depaepe, former Director and founder of ABBD.

Solution on-sentence summary: An efficient air filtration solution to ensure good air quality while reducing waste
Identification: Many companies and consumers use low cost air filtration systems reliant on disposable filters. This not only creates large quantities of waste, but also creates more work and costs for companies, with staff having to order and manage stock and frequently replace and dispose of air filters. The washable PRP3 Interfiltre air filter seeks to solve this problem by providing a long-life product which delivers clean air without the waste. The PRP3 filter can be rewashed and has a 10 year life span. The filter is easy to clean and can be washed as frequently as necessary. All that is required is a small quantity of water to wash the filter, leaving no waste. The PRP3 filter offers an economical and efficient solution for buildings and factories to reduce waste and deliver clean air.

Solution on-sentence summary: A platform to help private gardeners to create bio-inspired landscapes
Identification: Whereas people want to buy and eat bioproducts, more than 6000 tons per year of pesticides are still used in private gardens in Switzerland and France. The COP21 and the transition law of 2018 banned the use of pesticides by private garden owners. However, no strategy has been suggested to replace the use of these pesticides so far. To meet this challenge, Greenastic aims to help people grow pesticide free’s gardens. Greenastic is a platform offering tools and services. With the GreenApp, an application based on algorithms reproducing natural associations, customers will be able to create a personalized and pesticide-free garden in less than 10 minutes. In addition, the landscaper’s service uses pictures to create personalized architectural’s plans based on customer's needs and wishes. Thanks to Greenastic, private garden owners can reduce their water consumption related to gardening by 60%, while optimizing their production thanks to plant synergies suggestions. Highly versatile, Greenastic is a solution for any gardener who wants to grows his/her own bio garden. From beginner to professional, each gardener will find a suitable solution on the Greenastic platform.

Solution on-sentence summary: Scalable waste water treatment for the oil and gas industry
Identification: Industry accounts for almost the 30% of global water demand. Improper treatment of this water can lead to environmental and human health problems. MagnetoSponges aims to provide a competitive, environmentally sustainable and scalable waste water treatment solution. MagnetoSponges are micron-aggregates of magnetic functionalised nanoparticles between 10 and 50 nm. This gives to the technology advantages both in terms of extremely high surface area of nanomaterial (high efficiency), and in terms of easy removal of micro-material. The use of this technology enables water to be recycled directly on site; sharply reduces the amount of space needed for purification infrastructure; and is suitable for use on-site, as a turn-key service, or even in mobile water-treatment plants. This delivers clear environmental and financial benefits for industrial companies. MagnetoSponges can also be used for gas stream treatment and purification to reduce the presence of volatile organic compounds (VOCs).
Maturity stage: Prototype testing in the real world
Looking For: End users that can be partners to develop pilot tests. This will help to validate the technology in different sectors and to obtain a series of successful case studies to enhance the Solution's credibility.
Target client profile: BusinessManufacturingFood Products, BusinessManufacturingTextiles & Clothes, BusinessWater Utility, BusinessManufacturingMetals & Steel
Tags: Nanotechnologies
The environmental benefits: Up to 30% reduction in energy consumption compared to mainstream alternative;Presents opportunity to re-use water in factories without internal waste water treatment plants;
The Financial benefits: Up to 40% cost saving for treatment on-site compared to disposing the waste through external providers;Up to 30% saving for gas stream treatment by reducing volatile organic compounds (VOCs);

Organization short description: MagnetoSponges the innovative technology for wastewater and gas stream treatment based of tailored magnetic particles
About:
Captive Systems has developed MagnetoSponges, a breakthrough technology for water and gas treatment and recovery in order to make the waste process competitive, environmentally sustainable and scalable. This is an innovative technology of based on magnetic micro-sponges (aggregates of nanoparticles) for the removal of fuels, oils, organic compounds, metals and anionic pollutants in water and gas stream air. The introduction of MagnetoSponges for the management of wastewater and processing water of industry will promote an easy way treatment to nullify the environmental impact of processes water, both favoring the reuse of it to achieve a real closed cycle in a plant but also to produce second water for applications in other fields. Due to the magnetic properties of the fluids, a new purification process based on the use of electromagnetic filter will be introduced. Moreover, the possibility to regenerate the micro-sponges recovering the substances captured suggests a treatment with low economic impact both for the possibility to re-use the micro-sponges and to obtain secondary raw materials. 

The technology lies in magnetic nanoparticles with an amphiphilic nature; therefore able to be dispersed in aqueous solutions while preserving an affinity with lipophilic phases. The nanoparticles are dispersed in water and through lipophilic interactions, they aggregate leading to micro-sponges with an extremely high surface area, formed by individual nanoparticles with diameters between 10 and 50 nm. This joint gives to the technology both the advantages in terms of extremely high surface area of nanomaterial (high efficiency) and in terms of easy removal of micro-material. The capability to control and modify the functional groups of the outer coating makes the micro-sponges customizable to different industries (Oil & Gas, Food Production, and Metallurgy for example)
SDG’s of application: SDG 6 - Clean water and sanitation, SDG 9 - Industry, innovation and infrastructure, SDG 12 - Responsible consumption and production
